title: Good hotel
text: I enjoyed my stay at 11 Howard. The hotel staff were very friendly. There was a lack of outlets in our room we felt like. Our room was clean and nice and the location is great. Is it extremely luxurious no. But it is a great hotel and had everything we needed.

title: I’m confused
text:
This is a glorified 3* hotel and in no way shape or form deserves 5 stars. I was fooled by photos and the 5*. 

- Cheaply made and decorated. Don’t let the photos fool you it’s not high end or even mid level. Not even a photo on the wall or a touch of decor.  Just slapped the cheapest paint on the walls and called it a hotel. 
- Shower flooded the bathroom with water bcs of how bad the design is and there is no way to avoid it
- Toilet paper is worse and harder than Scott (I didn’t know that was possible) 
- Hair dryer is  $20 hair dryer from CVS 
- Walls and ceilings are falling apart. 
- LOUD! You hear everything from your neighbors and hallway. I was down the hall from elevator but heard the bell every time. 
- AC is loud and rattles and bcs rooms are so small it blows right on top of you
- plastic cups in the bathroom. At a 5* hotel! Plastic wrapped in plastic! Like you get at a cheap airport hotel!
- If you order food to your room and ask for fork and knife they bring you plastic utensils!  
- No coffee maker or tea kettle in room. 
- NO mini fridge
- The rooms even deluxe and suits are TINY with no view and the smallest window imaginable and window doesn’t open. 
- not enough umbrellas for people if it rains
-packed tiny lobby with people makes it impossible to actually get to the desk if you need help. 
- the ceiling where the curtains are isn’t filled in. There’s no ceiling it’s the inner part of the stone of the building with dust and dirt and who knows what else in it. So gross. 

I don’t understand what about this hotel is hip besides maybe the location? 

The one plus is they use grown alchemist soaps but that isn’t enough to do this hotel any justice. This is soooooo overpriced for what it is. There are way better hotels for this money in SoHo.

title: No Bonvoy perks, no amenities, no point
text: I stayed at this hotel only because it was a Bonvoy - or so I thought. I am titanium, but I did not receive an upgrade (suite upgrade or otherwise), I was told no free breakfast, no free items in room, and no additional points to compensate for the lack of well, everything. I don't see why I would stay at this unremarkable hotel with mediocre reviews and no amenities ever again.

title: Dingiest hotel in NYC
text: Welcome to the darkest and dingiest hotel in NYC, honestly, take a torch as the public areas, corridors and lift areas are all so badly lit. No coffee machine or kettle in the room, absolutely nothing extra is provided, it's bare minimum.   The number of towels left each day varied, it was all just so random and disappointing. Shan't stay again, such poor value for money.

title: Coolest kid in town
text:
Passei muitos dias neste maravilhoso hotel no Soho, cercado dos meus restaurantes e cafés preferidos na cidade! Dentro dele está localizado o The Blonde, bar descoladissimo! O staff é muito gentil, solicito…chegamos super cedo, e ao notarem meu extremo cansaço, concederam um early check in sem hesitações - e sem custos extras! Tudo isso foi muito apreciado! Check in e Check out rápidos! 
O quarto é belamente decorado, minimal…chic! Amenities muito bons, quarto com tamanho bastante decente…extremamente limpos! Se você procura por hoteis trendy, descolados, discretos…pensou no 11 Howard com certeza.

title: Quiet SoHo Hotel
text: I had a great stay at 11 Howard. It's in a great neighborhood, quiet part of SoHo, close to some great restaurants like Tyger and Le Cou Cou. I was on the 6th floor, had no spectacular view, and it was quiet. Staff were very nice. Someone was at the door to help me with my luggage and, upon request, staff always provided me with bottled water at the reception. The room was nice and clean. The TV does not have Chromecast, but did have basic cable tv channels and on-demand movies. I'm a fan of Chromecast and the ability to watch Netflix or other apps on the tv.  They also did not offer slippers or a vanity set. For the price, I was expecting, at least, make-up remover wipes, cotton balls/pads and/or q-tips. However, they had lotion, conditioner and shampoo and soap, of course. I did order room service once and it was very good and delivered in a reasonable amount of time. Overall, I would stay here again.

title: Do not recommend
text: Not worth anything.  Tiny dark rooms.  I was there in sept of 22.  For a biz trip for few days.  Very uneventful experience. Going again few weeks & it popped up as a deal and honestly I stayed there because it was suppose to be a luxury boutique hotel in soho.  And it’s not and I would never stay again even with a deal.   Do not recommend.

title: 11 Howard for a fun Couples Weekend
text:
Great boutique hotel in the heart of SoHo. We went for a quick Anniversary overnight. Fabulously kind and helpful at the front desk and valet were Keylani & Stevenson. 
Hotel was very clean, cute little bar restaurant right next door & another bar/dining on the 2nd floor. We highly recommend!

title: Dark, unfriendly and disappointing plus expensive
text:
This is not a 5* hotel. We were upgraded on arrival and the room we got was very small so I dread to think what size the original room was. The hotel is clean as are the rooms. It’s very dark and for 4 nights felt oppressive. Prob ok for single person on business but not for couple/family at all. 
Staff were polite but not friendly. You feel faceless. Just one more person on conveyor belt. Coffee on second floor is terrible. No coffee machine in rooms or towelling robe. Everything is extra - even cotton pads and ear buds to take make up off = $15!!! 
So definitely not a 5*. Disappointing to be honest.

title: Buen Hotel y buena ubicación !!
text:
Muy buen hotel, todo impecable!! la habitación con 2 camas era espaciosa, las camas muy confortables, la limpieza excelente.
Lo que no me gusto es que no había personal que hablara en español.
Y otra cosa es que tuve que quedarme una noche mas por reprogramacion del vuelo y me cobraron el precio mas caro de la habitación.
Yo lo saque por Booking y me cobraron mas del lo que figuraba en booking. No me pareció lógico !! Caro

title: Great NYC Boutique Hotel
text: I love the location and well appointed rooms at 11Howard. Their desk staff is very knowledgeable and always friendly. The little cafe on the main floor has one of the best breakfast sandwiches I've ever had in my life. Also their rooms are well appointed and modern. Love the art in the lobby and throughout the public spaces.

title: no words to say :(
text:
Don’t stay there!
Over priced, not clean enough - not 5 stars at all. 
The building and elevators are old, the staff is rude, the room is tiny, towels weren’t clean all the time.
They have charged me for the whole stay four days before check out without  even telling me (on top of the amount of 3000 authorization) and other payments I didn’t recognized. They say it’s because my stay was very long (wtf?). The manger was rude and wasn’t whiling to help, the worst hotel I have ever visited.

title: Good to great? That’s up to the staff.
text: This hotel is a nicely designed, functional downtown NYC hotel very well located for SOHO Shopping and downtown specific focused trips. The rooms are small but nicely designed and utilize space well. A single traveler or an urban couple used to tight quarters can make it work. The hotel bills itself a five star property, which it is most definitely not. Having stayed in many NYC hotels over the years, this is a nice, but unremarkable spot in the mold of many other boutique properties that have come and gone over a three to five year cycle, that will work for the right guest but actually could be great if only the management and staff wanted it to be. Service is unenthusiastic and without the five star polish you’d want for premium pricing. Dining is serviceable but not great, though the library workspace is a nice setup for travelers, especially since it will be hard to work from your room with such tight quarters. The hotel does not have a gym onsite which is a huge, and curious miss for a Marriott managed property of this size and profile. Overall I would give four stars, except for the lack of a gym, which knocks it down to three, and is such a foolish miss making it hard to envision personally booking there again until that changes. But I would happily recommend this hotel for single travelers who do not need many services, provided the rates are reasonable at the time and the guest had business or leisure plans in SOHO, NOLITA, or TRIBECA.

title: Howard you?  You are a gem!
text: Howard you! I love this boutique hotel, quaint neighbourhood.  Instantly when you walk in, the hotel envelopes you in a friendly undercurrent, and hushed atmosphere.  I had a room on the 14th floor, with a view of the Empire State Building.  Rooms are small, but well appointed.  Little details are mostly thought through, missed a bath robe, and thought I was going to miss my in-room morning coffee, but complementary delicious (!) brewed coffee awaits in the lounge on the 2nd floor.  Plush comfortable seating, cozy atmosphere to enjoy your morning java.  I was only there for a night, but I will be back!

title: Overcharged, Terrible Experience, Poor Customer Service, Loud & Noisy Rooms
text:
I had an extremely disappointing experience at 11 Howard Hotel. After losing my apartment keys, I checked their online rates for a standard king room, which were $200-$300 for that night. I called to hold a room, there was no mention of a price difference from what I saw online.

Shockingly, I was hit with a charge of $823 on my credit card the next day. This amount was WAY higher than the advertised rate for the standard room I booked, and no I did not order anything or touch the minibar, this was just for the room. I've been overcharged of more than $500 from their listed rates. (Screenshots attached)

The room itself was far from satisfactory, with a smell of mildew, noisy neighbors, and thin walls that failed to insulate from the loud street noise.

This unjust charge, the substandard room, and the hotel's dishonesty have seriously undermined my trust. I question this hotel's integrity and demand that the General Manager contact me to rectify these issues. This incident emphasizes the importance of honesty, transparency, and quality service in the hospitality industry.

title: Bonvoy Elites Beware
text: Bonvoy elites from Ambassador on down beware of limited benefits. No breakfast/credit option. Staff are professional and friendly, but firm that the main beenfit is the ability to book on Marriott.com. Nonetheless, I appreciated that they waived the early check in fee and gave me a late check out. Upgrades consist of an upper floor room. Rooms are small and tight. Bathrooms are tiny but well appointed. Location is excellent.

title: High touch personalised hospitality
text:
This is my third visit back at the 11Howard. Linda is the main reason why we are back — she is the epitome of service excellence and attention to detail. She greeted us on our first visit and continue to be of great service and professionalism on every trip back. 

Michael at the front desk is a true culture carrier at 11 Howard as well. 

Soraida and Lizbeth at the library, truly made a lasting impact on our stays. Their warmth, customised attention to guests truly makes the ultimate experience here at 11Howard. 

Kudos to Dorina, the asst front office manager for leading with example and building a great team.

title: Fantastic customer service
text: Unbelievable place with over-the-top customer service. Jonathan at the concierge desk bent over backwards for me. I highly recommend enjoying NYC with 11 Howard as your home base away from home. 10 out of 10!

title: Great Stay in SoHo!
text: Excellent staff, comfortable, updated rooms with wonderful amenities. Linda at Reception made us feel valued and right at home. Our room was upgraded and had a nice view and a very comfortable king size bed. The hotel is located steps away from China Town and Little Italy. There are many retail shops, restaurants, bars  and tea houses. Wonderful stay!!!

title: Excellent business hotel in a central location
text: Very much liked the 11 Howard hotel. The rooms were spacious considering it is New York. More importantly the hotel was quiet. The breakfast is a little weird, but ok. The connected restaurants were very nice. The vibe is understated and cool. Finishes were wonderful. Very much appreciated the well appointed bathroom. This will be on my list of hotels to visit again in New York. Located near several subway lines. Neighborhood is a little up and down, but worth it for the excellent hotel.

title: 11Howard library experience 10/10
text: I stayed at 11Howard for 3 days and decided to go down to the library to have lunch. The server was Sorayada, she was very attentive and extremely polite. Great service and the meal was delicious! Definitely would recommend.

title: Friendly and helpful team, great location but the room was tiny
text:
I stayed at this hotel for 1 week for a business trip.   The hotel is in a great location close to shopping and Tribeca restaurants, as well as near the Canal St subway spot.

I'm giving a very good rating primarily for the hotel staff and its location.   The front desk team was always friendly and helpful, as were housekeeping, concierge and bell staff.   One previous review complained that the staff are too young and casual, but I actually love that they're not pretentious like in other NY hotels (I've stayed at many!).

I liked the library where I had breakfast and lunch on some days and which can be used to work from.  Le Coucou downstairs is great for dinner.

The only downside of the hotel is that the room was miniscule.  Upon check-in I was told that we have been upgraded and I can see that the room is bigger than the one originally booked; however, even the "upgraded" room has no space to even open 1 large suitcase in and very little closet space.  The bathroom was beautiful but tiny.

Despite the tiny room, I had a great stay at 11 Howard.

title: Lovely
text: Lovely everything! Great staff, we had a fabulous room with a breathtaking balcony and the location can’t be beat (quiet street with nearby galleries, shopping, and restaurants) This boutique stay had a very calming atmosphere and I would definitely stay here again.

title: NYC's Best Hotel
text: If you are looking for a wonderful stay in Manhattan, look no further than 11 Howard. I just finished my third stay here over the past six months and I have found my new home away from home in NYC. Once I walk into that beautiful yet quaint boutique lobby, check-in agents are ready to greet, friendly and hospitable. All of the staff make it evident that they are available for anything you might need during your stay. I even love the aroma of the hotel, which puts me into total relaxation and is an amazing escape from the hustle and bustle of the city. The common areas are extremely clean and well-maintained, and yet so quiet too! The rooms I have stayed in are spectacular and extremely clean, with the amazingly comfortable beds, blackout curtains and my absolute favorite spa shower. It's almost crazy how quiet the rooms are, given the prime downtown location. The hotel is so close to NYC's best restaurants, nightlife and shopping, and conveniently located near all subway lines if you need to travel to any part of the city.  If you need a hotel in NYC, look no further!

title: Rude staff, thin walls, stay away
text:
This property is awful. I have stayed at 11 Howard twice now and it's been consistently bad. The rooms are OK but the attitude of staff that work at the hotel is a disgrace. I've given two stars and not one, only because the rooms are half decent and seemed clean. 

When I checked in, they said the hotel was full and so they were going to put me in a suite and would I like to wait for it. I waited three hours and finally got an email my room was ready. When I went to get my key, I was then told that I was in a regular room. I asked about the suite and they said there was an issue with it, but would I like to wait. I then waited another hour and a half, only to be told that the whole thing was a mistake and here’s your room key, for an Ok’ish room on the 8th floor RIGHT next to the elevator. Between the poorly soundproofed windows, thin walls and elevator proximity getting a decent nights sleep was near impossible. 

There is a club inside the property called The Blond. They essentially shut down part of the 2nd floor when it is open and do not give any access to hotel guests. Good luck trying to go there for a quick drink after work as the bouncers seem to be actively trying to stop people coming in, whether you're a guest or not. Need to use the restroom next to the lounge on the 2nd floor while the club is open?
Nope! You're going to have to take an elevator and go to your room as there are bouncers there too that will only give access to the few people they actually let into da-club. It's my life mission to ensure people know how bad this hotel is and stay far, far away from this location. Marriott should be ashamed that they have this property in their portfolio.

title: Not what it used to be...
text:
We've stayed at 11 Howard several times, but sadly its best days are behind them. We got in after 11 pm and found that our room didn't have toiletries for a shower, a minibar menu, or a do not disturb sign. When we called down to the front desk for these things, they never came. Maybe because it was late? We eventually got what we needed the next day. We stayed in Room 608 and our closet door would not shut, blocking the door. As a result, we literally could not open the door to our room. When we tried to force it shut, we noticed that the closet door was coming off its hinges and the paint had been chipped where others had tried to do the same thing. The next day we asked the front desk and they said this was a problem with every room in this floor plan (I guess any room that ends in 8?) and that nothing could be done. Seems like something they should address? It is showing its age now and just not worth the price tag for a hotel that bills itself as 5-star.

TL;DR: Used to be a cool hotel, but when you have Sixty Soho and Modernhaus, 11 Howard isn't worth the price. Rooms are small and well-worn. Service is lacking. Kinda sad to see.

title: Stay Away Bonvoy Members
text: If you area Marriott Bonvoy member who finds this hotel on the Marriott website or app, do NOT book the hotel. You will find out that Design Hotels has abrogated for itself the right not to recognize many features of the Marriott Bonvoy program. They merely pay for play on the Marriott website. And they appear to be pleased to let you know that when you are checking in at the front desk. So you are stuck with extremely mediocre expensive rooms (this was a Holiday Inn previously), lousy Wi-Fi and front desk customer service that can be characterized as “mean girl college student.”  Beware.

title: So Comfy & Quiet
text: Everything about my stay was perfect at 11 Howard. The location is absolutely perfect and where I needed to be for my work. The bed was so comfortable, I slept like a rock. My room was super quiet, too. This is tough to come by in NYC! I love the citrus smell of the bath products and the shower pressure and water temperature was perfect. No robe and slippers in the room but I asked and received! Staff at the front desk were friendly, quick and helpful. Sadly, I did not have the time to try the restaurants but got some coffee to go from upstairs in the lovely Library area.

title: Amazing
text: If you are in search of a luxurious and comfortable stay, look no further than the 11 Howard Hotel. The hotel offers a tranquil atmosphere that guarantees to transport you into a world of relaxation. From the impeccably designed lobby to the elegantly styled rooms, every aspect of the hotel is aesthetically pleasing. The amenities available throughout the hotel were top-notch, with fitness facilities as well as spa treatments for those in need of some pampering. The service from the hotel staff was outstanding and the location was great, with easy access to public transportation. Overall, I had an exceptional stay at this hotel and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a refined and comforting stay in the city.

title: Chic and great location
text: My recent stay at the 11 Howard Hotel was an absolute pleasure. The hotel has a chic and modern interior that exudes luxuriousness at every corner. The staff went above and beyond to make me feel welcome and catered to my every need. The room was decorated with high-quality furnishings and boasted breathtaking views of the city. I enjoyed the breakfast every morning which provided a great start to my day. The hotel’s location was also very convenient for exploring the surrounding areas. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a refined hotel experience.

title: Thin walls and noise
text: Walls are paper thin, could hear people doing all sorts of stuff. It’s an old building the floor is creaky and you can hear EVERYTHING. Lost a lot of sleep. Do not recommend staying here. Room is tiny too

title: A bit overhyped.
text: A bit overhyped, the hotel has a nice vibe in the lobby but the rooms are tiny and the bed wasn’t particularly comfortable. But it’s in a great area (between little Italy and China town) so it gets some points for location. And the staff were helpful.

title: Disgusting, filthy, overpriced even for NYC.
text: Extremely disappointed. Advertised as a chic boutique hotel. First, we walked in (no doorman) and the lobby was so strangely informal I was shocked to see people in sweatshirts at an ikea desk with laptops. I get you’re trying to be hip- but at what cost? If you’re charging a luxury rate, provide a luxury experience! This hotel needs a serious design makeover. The hallways are dark to hide the disgusting layers of dirt and filth on the walls and carpet. I took my flashlight to the walls and rug and was appalled. Now to our room. Mind you - I am a platinum elite Marriott bonboy member. We were assigned room 920. We walked and were overcome with the stuffiness and poor circulation. Next we immediately notices trash on the floor, a layer of dust on the tables and lighting fixtures, a sticky substance on the desk chair, and many hairs in the bathroom sink. I’ve never seen such sanitary negligence at a hotel. We actually passed the housekeeping staff cleaning another room on our way downstairs and they were sitting in the hallway laughing. Clearly, not cleaning. Terrible. Especially with COVID still lingering about, I would expect stricter sanitation measures, let alone basic cleanliness and room turnover! We were changed to a different room, room 711, but they didn’t even bother to make sure this one was clean!! There was a cookie wrapper on the floor! The gross negligence and disregard for sanitation was unreal. This entire hotel concept needs changing. Please don’t waste your money here.

title: A bad experience. Two stars less please.
text: Unfortunately a bad experience.. I have been there in 2019 before Covid with my husband and it has been a really good and comfortable stay. We came back in NYC last Xmas but unfortunately we found a worn out property. The paint of the furniture was peeled, the carpet in the room was dirty… after Xmas days we moved in Miami but we had booked in advance a night in January before our flying from NYC to Rome. The room has been worst than the first one. Before entering in the room on the floor in front of the door and all along the hallway there was a cable covered by tape and some different Wi-Fi router, maybe a sudden problem solved as possible (but 11H is a five stars hotel not a motel). When we entered in the room we found a sorprese in the bathroom. It was used, with some paper in the wc and a terrible smell of marijuana. We called the reception to solve the problem and after a quarter we received the visit of an housekeeper who asked again about the problem and then cleaned the bathroom. Before she gone my husband asked kindly to have a bottle of water and chocolate (usually complementary in this hotel) and the housekeeper with a derisive laugh said ‘…so you wanted chocolate…’ I don’t know what upset me more,  if this bad situation or the housekeeper behavior. In any case I slept the last night in nyc wrapped in the smell of marijuana that I hate.  I don’t think I will go back at 11 Howard.

title: Lovely
text: So glad I stayed here. All the staff I interacted with were friendly and helpful (AM/PM/Overnight desk team, housekeeping, bellmen). Room features and design were as advertised. Shower pressure and bed were fantastic. Black out curtains and the comfy bed are a dangerous combo, be careful not to lose a day sleeping in. No noise issues. The location is convenient to everything. Never got to check out the bar unfortunately but it looked cool from a glimpse. The Library was a relaxing reprieve. Le Coucou next door is divine.

title: Great place to stay in the heart of the city
text: Amazing location, part of the Bonvoy program which is great - helps to use my points here, room is cozy, tastefully minimal Scandinavian style.  Nice library that acts as a lounge area with space to work and mingle.

title: room not as promised.   not even close!
text:
tried booking a suite at the 11 howard but was confused by the bonvoy/11 howard websites as to exact size and configuration of the room i was booking.   bonvoys site lacks some of the specifics but after a call to the hotel i was told by the reservationist that the room i was looking at could easily hold 50 of my friends if i wanted to, and that it was almost 1900 sq feet with a giant terrace.  Sold!!  the room we got was probably 300 sq feet with an nice terrace for a room that size.  turns out that there is a terrace suite and a terrace king.    the reservationist gave me the details to the suite but i ended up with the king.   i even pointed out to the reservationist that the photo online shows a hallway down to a living room and he confirmed it's huge.   
upon arrival i at about 130p i was told room not ready and they'd call me when it was.
we came back only to be told room wasn't really ready and they would move us to a corner room or suite.  i'm not sure which, frankly, as i told the front desk i really want the room i booked with the giant terrace.   upon seeing the room we were given i was far less than happy, and the efforts to relieve the situation were lacking.
a similar conversation with the manager on duty the next morning yielded only more frustration.  
the cost of the room for one night with taxes and fees exceeded $900 just fyi.
upon checkout i presented a bonvoy gift card i bought at a charity auction and was told sorry we don't accept that.  me pointing out that i found the hotel on the bonvoy site in the first place held no sway.
this is an easy pass for me next time.

title: So many nicer hotels than this one
text:
Stayed here for two nights in Marriott points. If I had paid, I would have gone to a different hotel. On the plus side, the desk staff were  very pleasant and helpful. The number one issue is the lack of light in the elevators and hallways. What are they trying to hide? You don't have to use your room key to activate the elevator. That, combined with the dark corridors, can really make a woman feel unsafe. The doorman was occasional.

The room was miniscule and painted prison grey. The closet has no space for coats or dresses and there is no where to put shoes. It was an uncomfortable space and one I wanted to spend as little time as possible in.

title: Who gave this place 5 Stars? WOW
text: Where are the 5 Stars? The room was tiny and noisy , no better than your average £30 a night motel room. No facilities in the hotel of any interest to use. Charged a $40 resort fee  for god knows what. 100% won’t be coming back to this very very basic hotel.

title: Absolutely Lovely
text: I had a great experience last spring at 11 Howard! The location is fantastic and the restaurant (Le Cou Cou) is absolutely wonderful. The design of the hotel is beautiful and staff very friendly / accomodating.

title: Dishonest housekeeper
text:
I stayed at this boutique hotel and was very pleased with the location and friendly staff, but unfortunately, I can not recommend it to others because of its dishonest housekeeping.
On September 3rd, my boyfriend and I stayed at the hotel, and I left my $300 Aritzia blazer in the closet. The staff only sent me the standard death tone cooperative email response to inform me that it is impossible to retrace it because the housekeeper never returns it. It is sad because it is a gift from my loved one and holds great sentimental value to me. I am extremely disappointed and wish no one else ever feel the way I did, so I do not recommend this hotel to anyone else.

title: For great service, ask for Joe!
text:
Ask for Joe, he’s a true New Yorker! Had suggestions for the best restaurants and places to go that were gems! Great at his job, he knows how to talk and treat people, which I appreciate. He really takes pride in his work, you can tell by how he handles each guest and carries himself with his level of professionalism. Thank you Joe for your hospitality, it made all the difference in my experience there! Other staff who works front reception offered little to no assistance (they like to “hang” at the front door and chit chat instead of being helpful to anybody, let alone opening a door for anybody with hands full of luggage. Not a very productive crew out there if anyone was watching, and I was. I work in the hospitality industry as well, so I notice things the average consumer might not. I thought this place was high-end, and was disappointed at the service at first until thankfully Joe stepped in and made all the difference! Someone give him a raise! 
p.s. @11Howard management - first impressions are key, maybe you’re just lazy to but should check your remaining staff because it’s not a good look at the prices you charge. Definitely put a damper on your reputation in my eyes as I was looking forward to this stay. And give a high-five to Joe, he’s your only saving grace… other than the popularity your facility has gained from that Anna Delvey story…. I would’ve much rather stayed around the corner with a crew that understands what high-end means, because that is the level of service I was expecting. Thank you Joe,
your hospitality really made all the difference,
I can’t say it enough! I never write reviews, it made that much of an impact….

title: Adequate
text:
This hotel was fine but I think it was overpriced.

Pro: Good Location. Responsive Staff. Comfortable bed.

Con: Hall smelled of vomit and air-freshener, room was musty and pretty small even by NYC standards. Could hear neighbors and a lot of street noise.  Did not feel very clean. No recognition on Bonvoy Ambassador status.

title: HORRIBLE ROOMS BUT good customer service!
text:
I am scheduled to check in today, 8/19. I will provide an update as my stay carries out. I am booked for 3 nights. As of now, I think I may like it here. I am big on customer service and their customer service here started off well.
I called at 3am in the morning of my reservation date and spoke to KEVIN, whom offered a warm and welcoming energy in the wee hours of the morning. That was a pleasant beginning. I explained to him I was celebrating my husband's surprise birthday extravaganza and our hotel stay here started the journey that would lead to his surprise party on 8/21 at the Giando on the Water and end with his surprise trip to Aruba, staying at the Aruba Marriott Resort and Stellaris Casino ( You can see I love lodging with the Marriott domestic and international). I requested early check in for 12 noon in order to personalize the room, possible upgrade and asked for a complimentary birthday item from the hotel and KEVIN was eager to assist. He noted the account and agreed to inform the staff of the request approvals. THANKS KEVIN! As a platinum elite member, these little gestures of kindness not only awarded for the level but provided by the staff is what keeps me lodging with Bonvoy, along with superior customer service. My experience with Marriott has always included the accommodating gestures and to date, at 11 Howard, it continues to be the same thus far. So, my experience, because of KEVIN, is going great. I will keep you posted!

Update 1: My journey with 11 Howard Hotel Designs continues to be awesome! So, after following the instruction of KEVIN to give the hotel a call after 9am, I encountered MICHAEL. I guess they may be identical twins, lol, because MICHAEL was just as accommodating as KEVIN with a splash of "follow up". After speaking to MICHAEL, not only was the notes Kevin left in the system but MICHAEL made sure to apply the touch of surprise I really needed to make the surprise birthday extravaganza a "hit"! I was officially granted the upgraded room,the top floor and the complimentary birthday amenity sent to the room. MICHAEL called me back to make sure to inform me everything was taken care and to double check details for a perfect setup. Has your Hotel done that?? Lol....
So far, my journey is flowing in excellence...Thank you MICHAEL!!!

Update 2: I must add another member to the great service, JONATHAN.  He assisted me with settling my surprise birthday in the room. Thank you JONATHAN!

Update 3: THE ROOMS ARE HORRIBLE! THIS PLACE IS VERY MUCH OVER PRICED...MARRIOTT, IM DISAPPOINTED! My first room, because changes were unfortunately necessary, was ROOM 1508. It should be placed in the equipment room of the airport, it was ridiculously loud. It sound like the air conditioner was landing planes and the toilet refilling sound like it was a water hydrant after the water spout was busted. Not to mention, the shower water was not draining properly so it was filling up over my feet, DISGUSTING!! Needless to say, I was moved to ROOM 1115. This room was just as small and had no logically accessible outlets. However, it had an extension cord for guest usage? Not for $400+ a night!!! The staff tried to accommodate me with a bottle of white wine and seltzer water, although nice, definitely not a compensation for a $2000+ stay.

title: Great stay!
text: Loved this place! Amazing location and staff makes you feel at home! We were checked in immediately. Stayed in a room (2 couples) and still had plenty of space for nyc! Great walking distance to other bars and restaurants. Staff even offered to call a cab and have umbrellas to take when leaving.

title: Great Hotel, but not a 5 star..
text:
We stayed in two rooms during the second week of July 2022. First off, we had a great stay and have no complains about the hotel or the hotel staff. However, this property is simply not a 5 star hotel. It is a solid 4 star property. There is no bellman to assist with luggage or doorman. Multiple times, I returned to the hotel with my arms full and, without help from staff (doorman) I had to struggle with opening the door. Personally, I did not mind, however, if it was a 5 star, that would not have happened.
The rooms were very clean and were a decent size by NYC standards.

The location is absolutely fantastic! It is close to NYU/Washington Square, Comedy Cellar, Greenwich Village, Katz’s Deli, The Strand, etc. We took a direct subway up to The Met and Central Park. The subway station is less than a block from the hotel so it is very convenient. There is also a shared bike rack across the street. And there are plenty of separated bike lanes throughout the city.

Everyone who worked at the hotel was extremely friendly and very service oriented. We will stay here in the future. Just lower your expectations a bit on the “luxury” angle.

title: 2nd and Last Visit
text:
We came here pre-Covid (late Jan 2020) and had a great stay. Super trendy, rooms were new, staff was great, so we decided to stay again on the Friday of Memorial Day weekend to celebrate our anniversary.

The staff was not welcoming, they actually seemed uninterested in working there Maybe because it was a holiday weekend? Or possibly because the hotel was noted in the Netflix series Inventing Anna they thought they were known and didn't have to care? Either way, it did not start off well.

They sent us to our room, the hallways are super dark (like a nightclub) then we got to our room and it was also dark and so small (compared to the last one we stayed in). There were scratches and nicks on the walls, the iPad to order items/contact the desk didn't work. I tried to upload a video of the bouncing iPad (so you couldn't click anything but TA won't let me upload it). So you had to call for anything you needed.

Overall it just felt eh. I also feel like with 2 years of less visitors, you'd think they would have spruced the place up a bit. It was quite the opposite.

We ordered room service around 11pm, and brought up the wrong items and the person delivering the items was impatient and it wasn't even very late.

Overall I feel like a two is generous, a 1.5 would be more aligned.

title: Schönes Hotel in toller SoHo- Lage
text:
Das Hotel überzeugt durch seinen schönen Stil. Schlicht und geschmackvoll eingerichtete Zimmer in dezenten Farben, tolle Aussicht, helle Zimmer. Die normalen Doppelzimmer sind wirklich klein aber für New York ist das relativ normal. Das Größe des Badezimmers war okay, Dusche ebenerdig. Als Manko würde ich bezeichnen, dass es keinen Schrank gibt. Im Schrank/Regal mit Türen ist der Safe und der Kühlschrank, Minibar-Artikel und ein Bügelbrett etc untergebracht, man kann einige wenige Kleidungsstücke aufhängen aber es gibt wenige Bügel. 3 Mini-Regale (ca. 20 cm breit) müssen für 2 Personen reichen. 
Im Zimmer gab es noch 1 Sessel, 1 kleinen Schreibtisch mit Stuhl und 1 kleines Regalbrett darüber. An der Wand hängt ein 1 großer Flachbildschirm. 
Das Personal ist größtenteils sehr nett und hilfsbereit, es gibt aber 1 Angestellten, der sehr unfreundlich auf Hinweise reagiert. Zum Beispiel gibt es im 1. Stock (Library) vormittags eine Kaffee/Tee-Bar. Meistens hat irgendetwas gefehlt (Kaffee/Tee/Becher/Deckel/Wasser/Milch). Einmal kam ich nach unten und habe mitbekommen, wie ein Angestellter von der Rezeption in der Bibliothek hektisch umhergerannt ist und vor sich hinbeschimpft hat, ob er denn eigentlich der einzige im Haus wäre, der was arbeitet. Auch wenn es offensichtlich nicht seine Zuständigkeit war, hätte man den Hotelgästen gegenüber nicht so reagieren dürfen. 
Der zuständige Mitarbeiter vom Café allerdings fand es auch nicht lustig, wenn man ihn auf fehlende Dinge hinwies 'es trifft wohl immer die gleichen'.
Komisch ist, dass dafür ein Angestellter in einer Ruhe umherläuft und die Stühle akkurat hinstellt, dafür schaut er nicht nach der Kaffee-Bar.
Ein nettes Hotel, wenn man für ein paar Tage nach New York reist und nicht viel Gepäck hat. U-Bahn ist fussläufig schnell zu erreichen, man ist schnell in China-Town und die Soho-Shopping-Möglichkeiten sind auch gut.
Die Lage ist prima, es ist ruhig im Zimmer und wir haben wirklich klasse geschlafen. 
Fazit: wir würden jederzeit gerne wieder kommen.

title: Terrible
text:
This hotel is a joke. 
Terrible/non-existent service both in-room and communal areas. 
Staff is non existent/unfriendly and if you happen to find one wandering around the hotel you are not realy sure if they are staff or guests.
Reception staff not helpful at all - asked them once for help to call a taxi and they said they don’t offer such a service.

title: Absolutely NOT a 5 star Hotel
text:
Call a spade a spade. This hotel is fine. But it is not 5 star. There is literally no service, hidden charges everywhere, no tea or coffee facilities in the rooms, no bath robes, no greeting when you arrive. 
We stayed for 5 nights and were lucky we were far away from the bar area but heard many other guests complaining about the noise at night. The rooms are fine, pretty tired could use a lick of paint and some TLC. 
There are better places to stay in New York!

title: Tyler shines as glowing example for how to greet customers!
text: Tyler shines as a perfect ambassador for 11 Howard!  I was welcomed with a smile and the definition of what hospitality is by Tyler. She was able to check me in immediately and told me everything about the hotel and what to expect. Very appreciative for her kindness and warm greeting. I will be coming back and hold Tyler personally responsible for that!

title: Best hotel in NYC
text:
Im going to say this once: this is the best hotel in nyc for two reasons:
1. The location cannot be beat for restaurants, walking around the city, workouts, restaurants, etc
2. The red infrared sauna located on the 3rd floor, the Higher Dose, I went 3 times in the 5 days I was there and its the perfect way to detox after nights out drinking in the city

I love this place, the ambience, the cool decor, the elegance, the service... the best!

title: The Hilton in Brooklyn makes 11 Howard look like a 1-star hotel
text: We came to the city last minute for a concert. The standard rooms were smaller than most, and not well kept. It’s hard for me to believe this is a 5-star hotel. The staff is pretentious, patronizing, and unaccommodating if they think you don’t belong there.

title: Very good overall experience
text:
À bit noisy, but great overall experience. We were upgraded to the top floor (« PH ») as we complained about the noise. Quite large room and great view. Good breakfast. We ate at the « Blond » once and it was ok. 
Overall very good value for money (at the price that we paid).

title: Tiny rooms, broken beds and poor Marriott member recognition
text:
I decided to try this property this week for a 3 night stay while on my monthly trip to NYC. Unlike what many other posters have mentioned above, I did not have a good experience at all. Clearly things have changed since they first opened in 2016.

I arrived a few hours early for check in as I had a meeting moved up. I was told that they would wave the early check in fee for me this time..... My Queen room was apparently not ready yet, but the good news is they were going to give me an "upgrade" to a King sized bed room - what a joke. The room they assigned me on the 10th floor was the smallest room I have had in NYC (and I have had some small ones). You could not even walk around the bed it was so tight to the wall. The tiny desk was right below the TV and if you wanted to plug in your laptop to do any work, you had to unplug the TV as there were no other outlets ?? I noticed the floor map on the door and my room was 1/2 the size (or smaller) than every other room on the floor.

Went down to the reception and asked if I could just wait for my Queen room to be ready. They then agreed to move me to another room on the floor, which was a normal size, but had a King bed. I asked if they had my Titanium Elite number of file and was told they were a Design Hotel and Marriott status did not matter here - that is very clearly the case. Went to the new room and sat down on the bed only to hear a crack. Looked under the bed and 2 of the slats from the frame had come loose (one had duct tape which they had clearly used before to try and repair). I did not have the energy to go back down again and ask for a room without a broken bed. It turned out to be a poor judgement call on my part as the bed was not comfortable at all.

Upon checking out I asked them what the $35 daily fee included, as they offered no complimentary breakfast options (just coffee). It included Wifi (which Bonvoy guests should get for free) + access to a UFC gym around the corner (for those looking to fight in the Octagon) and a $10 a day minibar credit (which was not mentioned at check in). Had I known, I would have used it on some bottled water (which also was not included in the room).

To add insult to injury, they charged me $9.00 for a Kit Kat bar that I did not have. Good thing I had that $10 a day credit to offset that one....

Caveat Emptor. Looking for a better Marriott alternative in the area - the Sheraton on Canal has rooms with views, free lounge for Elites and at a fraction of what 11 Howard charges. Never Again.

title: Small rooms, zero amenities, no good views
text:
I've stayed here a half-dozen times for work; it's pretty convenient for the office, the gym partnership is nice, but at some point I have to just say that it's overall kinda crap, and being part of the Mariott/SPG group just isn't a good enough reason to subject myself to this anymore. 

Almost every room is tiny (I think 1/5 has been "kind of okay). Exactly ZERO have had any kind of non-depressing view, and there are zero in-hotel amenities:
 -  there's a cool bar that closes pretty early
 - no restaurant, and the 3rd-party room service has the most ridiculous delivery fees I've ever seen (seriously, just use a delivery app), 
 - they have a partnership with a UFC gym around the block - this actually makes them the hotel with the best gym downtown, and if this is what you care about - come here. But if you just want some kind of workout, and you're not keen to walk around the block, in shorts, in January, this is also a minus.

The service is fine. The 1-2 staff on-duty at any given time are (generally) pretty nice, and (some) are quite helpful, but no one is making efforts that push the mediocrity of this place into its " 5 star" (lol) status, and the consistency just isn't there.

Management just doesn't run a tight ship. Service quality fluctuates. Some rooms have complimentary water bottles; others don't.  My last room had a welcome present of a bottle of wine (yay!)...and SUPER moldy fruit! Like someone had laid out some nice fruit in the room last week, but no one showed up, and a week later I got fruit that looked like it had been in a snowstorm. 

Like, seriously? At a 5-star hotel? Come on guys...

title: this could be a great hotel, but its too noisy
text:
the hotel is very central and quaint, however there is a night club in the premises and the noise at the late hours is unbearable...we complained to the managemnet, but they didnt seem to bother with us.
the restaurant LE COUCOU is another story, part of the hotel..it is perhaps the best in NY

title: Ett dåligt hotell som inte borde ha 5-stjärnor
text:
11 Howard NYC är det sämsta 5-stjärniga hotell jag någonsin bott på. Det förtjänar absolut inte att ha 5-stjärnor. Små och dåligt planerade rum utan skåp och riktigt dålig service. ACn låter som ett kärnkraftverk och slås av och på under natten. Många saker i rummet är trasiga och minibaren fylls inte på. Fitnessrummet var stängt pga Covid, men allt som kostar extra i hotellet som nattklubb, bastu, bar och restaurang var öppet som vanligt. De hänvisar till ett externt gym där de tydligen tycker det är ok att träna. Trots alla brister tar de ut en överraskande och obligatorisk extra  ”facility fee” på $35 per natt.
När vi tar upp alla brister med receptionen säger de att det är upp till ägarna av hotellet och att ägarna inte ens svarar på de anställdas mail kring alla brister.
Trots ett utmärkt läge på hotellet måste vi verkligen avråda alla som funderar över att bo på 11 Howard. Det är definitivt inte värt pengarna.

title: Great location, nice hotel, zero customer service
text: We stayed for one night Thursday 11/18. We had an awful experience. We booked a terrace room which was great. Arrived tired and ready to relax for a few hours before our event that evening. However upon coming into our floor we see that there is a big event happening in two of the suites. With lines of people outside our door in the hall way waiting to be admitted. We asked to be moved rooms. The new room on the other side of the floor was equally nice however the catering staff for the event were hanging outside our room the whole time chatting. I tried to drown out the noise with the TV but it was pointless. We complained on our way out but the front desk staff didn’t seem to care. The following morning there were event staff removing furniture throughout the floor. The main areas of the hotel were also closed off due to a Netflix show being filmed. Basically this is an event space not a hotel. Despite complaining at front desk no effort was made to improve our experience in any way. Very disappointing and not what we expect of a five star property. Stay here for the location and vibe but not if you expect a real five star experience.

title: Nope
text: This hotel is very... not 5-star. Absolutely no amenities, terrible in-room wifi, and even worse (loud) communal working spaces. It's pretty on the inside, but when you look closely: everything is made cheaply. The doors, the fixtures... everything is just not quite there. There's no room service at all, and when I called down for 2 water bottles they told me it would be $30. No coffee in the rooms, no bathrobes, and no gym either. The cleaning staff only ever cleaned half of my room (I would get back and I would either have new towels or my bed made, never both). Service is abysmal, I asked for 2 wake up calls which never happened. It's like, fine... not dirty and comfortable enough. But it's really more on the 3-star tier, which is why the price is sooo confusing to me. Weirdly they also have a private sauna company working out of the 3rd floor, who also take up the communal working spaces, and the bar/nightclub is LOUD. I was woken up at least 5 times during the night by people slamming doors, and when I returned from dinner there were people puking outside of the hotel. Overall, the stay was okay (never bad enough that I wanted to switch hotels) but I really wouldn't recommend especially if you're expecting it to live up to its price point.

title: All I can say is ‘false advertising at its best’
text:
How this hotel has so many good reviews is utterly baffling to me. I literally thought I walked into a back or side entrance when I walked into the lobby which consists of one table and two guys at a long table functioning as a desk. There is no restaurant (they have ‘an affiliate’), the bar had a meeting in it and isn’t available until 5:30. They ‘have an affiliate gym’ somewhere nearby. No bellman (although there was a random guy opening the door for people for a short time when we were leaving). They have skirted (I’m putting this mildly in an attempt to not call them liars) most every criteria for a 5-star hotel. 

Linens were subpar. The rug looked like it came from Home Depot. The room was TINY. There was some caramel colored gunk on the small chunk of wood between the beds that served as a nightstand. The hallway walls (what you could see of them as it was literally a dark tunnel you almost needed a flashlight for) were horribly scuffed and the carpet was fraying. The small chair was disgustingly dirty (pics don’t do it justice). 

Kudos to the photographer who made this look like a nice place. Shame on them for holding themselves out as a 5-star hotel. HUGE HUGE disappointment.

title: Hotel molto caratteristico in SOHO
text:
Sono stato in questo hotel per lavoro, la stanza era piccola, come avviene in molti hotel di new york, ma gradevole nel design.

Mi è molto piaciuto lo spazio living dove leggere un libro, lavorare al computer in compagnia di altre persone.

Molto triste la sala fitness, piccola stanzetta senza nemmeno una finestra.

Non so se ci tornerò

title: Perfect base for exploring NYC but room was a little small
text: Decent co-working space. If you’re taking a long weekend and plan to work for a short period while you’re away the library is a great spot to do this. We had a basic room that was a little small but was perfect as a base for exploring New York. The hotel had everything we needed and was in a convenient location. We also booked through Amex and got $100 credit for use at the blond or in the hotel which was handy.

title: YIKES! Ripped Linens and Dirty Rooms
text:
Yikes! This hotel is in a serious state of disrepair and disarray.

My bed linens were ripped, the floors were visibly dirty and scuffed, and the bathroom was disgusting. There was still hair on the wall of the shower, and some brown/orange gunk on the wall.

I checked out after one night. I ended up having to pay quite a bit to find another hotel in NYC last minute, but it was worth it.

title: How many times do you need to call? Couldn't even book a simple reservation for tomorrow!
text:
I've been calling around to use my Marriot Elite suite rewards. I've called four times at different points of the day, been transferred multiple times, and no one has been able to take even a regular reservation. Waste of half an hour of elevator music and dial tones. 

Can't imagine their customer service gets better once they've already made the sale....disappointed.

title: 11 Howard disappoints
text:
After paying almost $500 USD for a last minute room at 11 Howard, I was very disappointed for multiple reasons- 1st, hoteltonight.com claims they had valet parking for $75… steep, but even worse when there was no such thing. Our room, the “Howard Delux” was directly across from the elevators- so we were woken up multiple X by drunk ppl btwn the hrs of 2-5am. The attached club was pumping heavy bass till 4am and the HVAC was ridiculously loud. 
The room was clean and the location is great- but service is non-existent and the only parking was a 20min trip to find. 
Won’t do that again.

title: Not a 5 Star Hotel (just 3)
text: This is an "OK" hotel but it's not a 5-star hotel.  I'm not sure how they can call themselves that.  This is very much a roadside holiday-inn.  I've stayed at many 5-star hotels in the city including the Ritz, Four Seasons, Mandarin Oriental and even Mr. C's on the SeaPort (4 star hotel) and all were MUCH nicer.  To be a 5 star hotel they need larger rooms, showers that are walk-in (not bathtubs), a bar that's open 7 days a week, room service (they have none), a spa and much more.  They claim to have room service but it's just a take out order from a nearby restaurant and it's served in cardboard with plastic-wear.  We tried it once for the kids and it was horrible (soggy fries, cold food, etc).  Even if they offered room service there wouldn't be enough space in the room to comfortably eat it.  The kids had to eat on their bed.  Decent place but not 5 stars, not by a long shot.

title: Minimalist feel, friendly service, sparking clean
text: You need to walk a couple of blocks for shopping or dining (unlike some Manhattan hotels) but it is a nice hotel. I didn't love the surrounding location but the staff were 5-star all the way. Rooms are small but very clean. Hopefully the restaurants will reopen soon. We were there on a weekend and it was very quiet too - huge plus!

title: Go- to NYC hotel in Soho
text: For 2 years before the pandemic hit, I traveled to NYC almost every week for work and 11 Howard was my favorite hotel. we got to the point where they knew my likes and dislikes and room preferences. I knew some of the staff by name (Jan is the Absolute best) and it felt like a swanky home away from home. I hope they survive these crazy times. I can't wait to stay with them again

title: "Stylish" but lacks any serious substance
text:
I stayed at 11 Howard right around the time they opened in 2016 in a Howard Sr. King Room. I felt that the check-in process and lobby staff service was aloof and thought it was probably because it was still a young hotel. I went back this past week and stayed for four days, checking in on the day that COVID-19 was announced as a pandemic. Since my first visit, 11 Howard's service seems to have progressively gotten worse.

The Good:
* A gentleman dressed like one of the porters (he didn't wear the 11 Howard sweatshirt or the all-navy suit) checked my fiancé and me into the hotel. He was welcoming, clearly explained the benefits of our Amex benefits, and highlighted other hotel benefits like the complimentary water bottles.
*  Housekeeping staff did a great job tidying our Howard Deluxe Room, especially because of the COVID-19 outbreak.
* Room service delivery team was lovely every time we saw them (we ordered frequently as part of 'social distancing')

Everything else:
- I asked for a detailed breakdown of all of our food and beverage charges during our stay. Upon check-out, I was told that they couldn't do it at that time but would email me the information. I didn't get anything. After four days, I called the hotel to request the information again. They emailed me the folio but not the itemized receipts. I responded back to the email to ask for the correct information and didn't hear back. I sent a follow-up email the next day and still haven't heard back.
- There were some questionable design choices made with our room. For example, the closet was in a small hallway that made it perfect for getting ready or ironing clothes. But I quickly realized that there were no outlet plugs in the hallway, and the only available outlet plugs were in a small cramped area by the bed. Also, the toilet was installed so close to the sink so that when washing your hands, the toilet seat was right behind your calves. You're SOL if you happen to be a bigger person!

Don't fall for the gimmicks here -- it's sleek and still somewhat buzzy, but that's it. Spend the money and go elsewhere. 11 Howard isn't worth the headache or annoyance that comes with staying at this property.

title: Nice rooms and good location but still could do a bit more
text:
11 Howard is a good location in the midst of SoHo offering a kind of boutique feeling.
Reception is scaled down limiting itself to a small walk around desk instead of the standard reception. Up the stairs you find the bar and a very small lounge area. No breakfast restaurant as far as I could see. 
Rooms are slightly minimalist with comfy beds and nice bathroom.
All in all a rather scaled down feeling. Check-was smooth although room was not ready at 14:00 my luggage was taken care of. 
Check out was not as smooth as I was first presented the bill for another room and then was supposed to have a copy mailed to me but this didn't work so I had to ask twice to get it. Room for improvement here.
No VIP treatment although we were a group booking in total 30 person-nights.
Two in our group changed rooms due to noise level 1 at top floor due to ventilation fans, 2 at street

title: Boutique hotel in Soho
text: 11 Howard is perfectly located in the heart of Soho, close to a bunch of bars, restaurants, and shops. I was in love with the minimalist and modern danish design of the hotel, although the room is a bit tiny. The price is reasonable and location is great.

title: Best Hotel Ever
text: 11 Howard is awesome.  The Hotel is super nice and clean and I have never ever stayed at a hotel with better service and a nice, more efficient staff.  I definitely recommend staying at 11 Howard when you’re in NYC.

title: Bad experience
text: Stayed here on the Amex program and it's been a major disappointment. The room "upgrade" is laughable...I couldn't imagine what kind of shoebox I'd be in had I not been granted this supposed benefit. Rooms are getting worn and dated too. The $100 credit doesn't apply to anything you'd want it to (bar, restaurant, spa) but, hey I guess being able to write off 3 chicken tenders from room service for $35 counts for something. The doorman, when present, doesn't open the door for you or welcome you. Don't even think about requesting minor conveniences like late check out because "they're fully booked today" despite rooms going for under $200 on every major online booking site. Absolutly terrible in every respect. Will not be staying here again. There are too many better options in New York.

title: Disappointing in every way
text:
We stayed at 11 Howard after a whole bunch of people who’d never stayed there told us it was “meant to be great”. Well, it ain’t.

Our room was small (yes, it is New York, but, wow) and in a poor state. The mini bar was actually hot. One ice machine across 4 floors worked. The super cool staff are just that - and only that. And the place is DARK.

The hotel did book us a car from JFK into Manhattan for the princely sum of $250 Australian dollars (an Uber black - $150), so that’s something. 😕

Our stay was incredibly disappointing. I would not recommend to anyone who likes (a) space (b) personal service (c) cold drinks.

Worth mentioning that Elle MacPherson was staying at the hotel when we were there and her room (the penthouse) looked awesome. The lesson: be a supermodel with 5 million Instagram followers. If you’re not that - stay elsewhere.

title: Not really a hotel
text: The lobby is truly bare bones. It's almost like a hotel that someone decided to open on the weekend and just threw something together.  There aren't even chairs in the lobby -- standing only.  The junior staff -- all 1 or 2 that you can see  -- are nice but really present just to take your payment and facilitate getting to your room..  The rooms themselves aren't bad but they are very small. 1 or 2 people max.  Go if the location suits you but don't expect much beyond a small place to sleep and a fairly nice (again small) bathroom.

title: Nice overnight stay
text:
We came here for a quick overnight stay for a change of scenery. They have a the new concept of no real lobby, just guys with iPads checking in.

We went up to our corner room which was very large by NYC standards. It would be a wonderful studio apt if it had a kitchen. The decor was really nice, the bed was comfortable. They did not need 2 TVs in the room. One would have been more than enough for the small space.

One of the towels and robes we were given has holes in them so that didn't really scream luxury to us. 

I did like the very quick room service that you ordered on the iPad. Nice touch.

The bar/club that is part of the hotel isn't really part of it. You had to make a reservation through them not the hotel. It would have been nicer if you could have gotten some sort of priority. It was $1500 minimum for a table of two on a Saturday so we decided to skip it. 

Location is great as well.

title: Fab place in Soho
text:
Really enjoying our stay at the 11 Howard. 

My colleague and I are in Bew York for business meetings and some TV stuff in a studio in Soho. Our clients booked us into 11 Howard as it’s a great hotel and really close to where we need to be. 

It is the first time that I have stayed here and it will not be the last. 

Really pleasant, good sized rooms with fabulous views over Soho and Chinatown. Very easy to get to from JFK. Situated in the middle of Soho. 

A bit boutiquey in a very nice way. 

Very helpful staff. Great feel to the whole place. 

I will stay here again. If you are incoming to New York and want to be in this area you should look this place up.

title: Perfect, over and over again
text:
I've lost count of the times I've stayed here.
My trips to 11 Howard are never short. Each stay is at least a week, which gives me the perfect amount of time to enjoy this beautiful space.
I never hesitate when booking my stays in New York City. 11 Howard is clean, safe, boutique and beautiful. You can check my past reviews of 11 Howard on here too.
This was my first stay here with my Husband in tow, and he was equally impressed. He kept saying he understands why I always select to stay here.
It's not even near to my office in New York, but that doesn't worry me, it's worth the extra travel time just to be able to return here each night.
This trip I upgraded to a corner suite which was great for the extra space for the two of us. The only trouble I had was finding enough power points. I ended up charging my laptop at the bathroom vanity. But that really wasn't an issue at all.
I honestly can't think of anything bad about 11 Howard. It's perfect!

title: Not what I expected
text: We decided to stay at 11 Howard due to location and price. As a couple with a family who are spending a weekend together in the city without kids, we expected to have pre and post dinner drinks at the hotel lounge, The Blond. The lounge was closed for a private event all evening. Therefore we could not get a drink or enjoy any of the hotel’s atmosphere. All there were were random chairs set up in a room. I feel that this hotel does not make their customers satisfaction a priority. I have stayed at many hotels in the city and this one was probably my least favorite. If you are looking for a place to just crash for the night, this would be a good spot for you because there is nothing else to this place.

title: Great boutique hotel in Soho
text:
Great location in Soho with friendly staff. 
Good bar, with a great atmosphere and apparently turns into a club after 10 but we didn’t get the chance to experience it. 
Tiny rooms as expected but well designed. 
Would definitely stay again.

title: Disappointing
text: This hotel experience has been disappointing.  Going for a very minimalistic approach (it so it seems). The same guy that checks you in takes your luggage to the room. It’s almost as though everyone on the floor is in one room as you can hear everything, even foot steps (the walls are so thin). The rooms are tiny and so is the bathroom. There is no recognition for platinum bonvoy guests at all.  From all my travels at bonvoy properties worldwide, this has been the only property where I have received this experience. Disappointed to say the least.

title: 11 Howard terrible hotel
text:
Terrible hotel. Check in begins with a 30 min wait, at a weird non existent counter. Then crowded small elevators. Terribly small and dirty rooms.
Then all night you hear noise. Stay far away from
This gross terrible hotel.

title: Terrace KING
text:
I booked 11 Howard instead of the Public or Gramercy Park based on rating.   I debated between 2 or 3 stars for 11 Howard - I give Public 3 or 4 and Gramercy 4 for reference.  A Peninsula property is 5 star .  
First we booked a king with terrace.  The room was so small my daughter could touch one wall with out stretched arms and me the far wall, and it reached across. I called down after realizing that between the small room and no closets, loud party on the terrace two down from us, it wasn’t going to work. I was told the Terrace bedrooms are much smaller than the other rooms.   Nothing else was available.   The non existent closet is half height so you cannot hang any coats, long pants, dresses, etc unless you want them wrinkled.  (See photo).  And on the upper half tiny closet they have the safe installed so no use for anything but stacking shoes.   We used the desk area for a dresser to stack clothes.  There is a small dresser with three 6” drawers.   
No coffee Nespresso in the room so you have to get dressed to go for coffee.  Which disappears between 0930 and 10 on weekends.  Hey, this is NYC I’m staying on west coast time so I don’t know why coffee can’t be there all day like other properties.  Bathroom has no counter space so plan on putting your makeup or hair supplies on the toilet seat as you get ready.    We used the app to order extra towels and wash clothes - got extra towels and toilet paper and Kleenex.  Not even sure how that got translated. Not a 3 star so thus my debate with the rating.  The rooms are danish modern and minimalist, but that should not mean minimum service and rooms.   Same complaint as others with breakfast - couldn’t get service.  The F&B manager happen to be at the desk area and I complained to him, he was able to get us a clothing rack in the room, which helped, but blocked the terrace door and still no breakfast.  He said they had a waiter call out that morning so were short staff.  You think ?!  The day after Halloween - I could have predicted short staff.  In hindsight I should have checked out in the morning and moved hotels.   

Positive is the terraces are a good size for 4 people.   The checkout person apologized for all the problems with room size, noise, etc. said maybe next time I could try another type of room.  😂.  Polite, but missing the point thinking I would come back.

title: Tyler M went above and beyond....
text: I've always been impressed by the quality of the staff at 11 Howard.  But I was blown away this past Monday. I needed to get to Penn Station and didn't realize my timing coincided with the shift change for cab drivers. I can usually find one myself, but couldn't at this particular time and place. In addition, I'm a geezer and an anxious traveler.  Not only was my Uber App outdated but it also had the wrong credit card number. Tyler M came to my rescue with genuine warmth, attention and patience. The hotel is blessed to have her as one of its ambassadors.

title: Nice but not 5 star
text:
TripAdvisor has categorized 11 Howard as 5-star, so I chose it with the expectation of 
a higher quality room. We were “upgraded”  through Amex to a King deluxe room, which was small (to be expected in nyc) with a little tree stump for a nightstand on one side of the bed and the desk up against the other side of the bed. The room was not in good condition - the outlet on the tree stump side didn’t work which made phone charging difficult, the rug was worn out and the walls were covered in scrapes. No bath robes, which I expect at a 5 star hotel. The bed was comfortable and I liked the overall feel of the hotel and library bar. We had fun at The Blond and the staff were very accommodating. It’s just all about expectations!

title: Based on phone service, I already have a sinking feeling...
text:
The hotel sent me an email touting their "Creators of Guest Experiences" and how wonderful they are at the business of concierging. They went so far as to describe their services as "one of the most unique welcoming services in the industry." 

WELL, if by unique, they meant rude and unaccommodating, then yes, it sure is unique. I called for a simple request -- to ask the desk to arrange a table for us at the hotel bar, the blond. 

Honestly, you would have thought I was asking them to make a reservation at 11 Madison, not 11 Howard -- I was directed to the website and told that the hotel has nothing to do with their own bar. 

Look, I have no problem fending for myself -- but please don't elevate my expectations by sending out an email that brags about a service level that does not actually exist at your establishment.

That's all.

title: Chic hotel in a great location
text:
The bedroom and bathroom were clean, tidy and aesthetically pleasing. It was perfect for solo travellers whether for leisure or business. My only complaint would be that the walls were far from soundproof.

I had a terrible afternoon as I was recuperating from a 18-hour flight but housekeeping staff (together with a delivery guy?) kept making a ruckus outside along the corridor and the thin walls did no favours. They were laughing loudly for a good 15-20 minutes despite me coming out to the corridor, asking them to keep it down. The reception staff on the other hand were pleasant and attentive.

Overall, what I enjoyed most was that it was a good hotel in a good location within SoHo. Walkable distances to the subway, good eateries and good shopping.

title: Good spot.
text:
Near the NYC office that I visit often I decided to give 11 Howard a try. Nice hotel, small but comfortable room. Plus I had a patio with great views of lower NYC. 

Check in is a little weird since there is no front desk, but Friendly staff and all good.

title: Nice enough hotel in a good location
text:
I stayed here for a work trip, and the location was very convenient both for that and for dining/city wandering/etc. The bed was comfortable, and the room was stylish and functional (albeit small, but no more so than comparable NYC hotels). 

A couple downsides to my otherwise pleasant stay:
- It's one of the most cramped, least usable hotel gyms I've seen. Two tiny rooms were converted into a gym, and while it has two Flywheel bikes, it has only two other cardio machines and one bench for weights — and so little room there's nowhere to do any kind of floor exercise.
- The hotel wasn't responsive when I had an issue that needed maintenance. I both called the front desk and submitted a request on the in-room tablet, and while I later got a notification that maintenance had resolved my issue (well after the initial 1-hour window), it definitely hadn't been fixed.

title: Beautiful Hotel--A big thank you Stevenson!
text: We stayed at 11 Howard last weekend to celebrate our anniversary and had an amazing time! The hotel is beautiful, the rooms are chic, cozy and modern, the lounge area relaxing and the The Blond is lively with great music! The location of the hotel is perfect for walking through Soho, grabbing dinner and coffee, shopping and enjoying the downtown vibe of NYC. A big huge thank you to Stevenson who took amazing care of us and was the epitome of hospitality and genuine kindness.  You are a gem and 11 Howard is lucky to have you, You're a star!!!

title: Ottimo hotel a Soho
text:
Ho soggiornato in questo hotel insieme alla mia compagna a fine settembre 2019. La camera era una Deluxe al decimo piano. Avevo precedentemente avvertito dell'arrivo in tarda serata per il check-in e Katherine (la direttrice) mi aveva assicurato che non si sarebbero stati problemi e così è stato. L'addetto al check-in è stato molto carino a consegnarci le chiavi ed a proporsi per recapitare i bagagli in camera.
La hall dell'hotel, di notte, ha delle luci soft molto suggestive che a mio parere ben si addicono allo stile moderno metropolitano della struttura. Negli ascensori e nel corridoio si respira un buonissimo odore, oltre che essere molto pulite. La camera, come detto una Deluxe al decimo piano, è abbastanza grande con la parete esterna interamente finestrata. Letto king size grandissimo, forse un po' morbido per i miei gusti ma è un aspetto assolutamente soggettivo (ad esempio la mia compagna ha gradito questo tipo di materasso). Il bagno è molto grande, con una doccia veramente enorme e ben funzionante. Generalmente le rifiniture dell'hotel sono di buon livello, incluse rubinetterie ed accessori (che noto subito, deformazione professionale). Il tutto completato da un armadio (finalmente, a NY non è facilissimo trovare camere con armadio chiuso) in cui sono inseriti frigo-bar, cassaforte, asse e ferro da stiro.
Contrariamente a quanto letto nelle recensioni precedenti, la camera è sia pulita che silenziosa, per quanto possono essere silenziose le stanze a NY che, ricordo, è la città che non dorme mai (intendo dire che si sentono alcuni rumori esterni quali macchine che sfrecciano a 100 km/h e truck della spazzatura ma onestamente dopo aver esplorato a piedi la città, non mi hanno certo disturbato il sonno).
Il personale dell'hotel è delizioso. I ragazzi della reception molto simpatici, pronti al saluto ed a scambiare due chiacchiere; il personale delle pulizie sempre presente ma svolge il suo lavoro con molta discrezione e non si fa notare (la nostra camera è stata pulita e sistemata ogni giorno, compreso il cambio della biancheria giornaliera). Aggiungo che Katherine (che avevo contattato via mail prima della partenza) ci ha voluto incontrare una mattina per un caffè per essere certa di aver esaudito tutte le mie richieste e per rendersi disponibile per ogni altra informazione sulla città, cosa che onestamente mi ha fatto molto piacere e non mi era mai successa.
Il bar dell'hotel di notte si trasforma in club con musica e diversa (bella) gente che frequenta il locale (credo che sia una gestione esterna visto che le porte di comunicazione con l'hotel vengono chiuse e nascoste). Onestamente il volume della musica non mi è mai sembrato troppo alto tale da disturbare il sonno ma capisco che tra il club e la nostra camera c'erano sette livelli di differenza, magari le camere al terzo piano possono essere un po' più rumorose.
Durante tutto il soggiorno i ragazzi della reception ci hanno offerto ad ogni ora le bottigliette di acqua (gratis) che, per la cronaca, sono personalizzate con logo e foto dell'hotel, un altro particolare interessante (magari inutile ma comunque bella idea).
Al termine del nostro soggiorno, in considerazione che il volo di ritorno sarebbe stato nella tarda serata, ho chiesto se sarebbe stato possibile (pagando) depositare i bagagli e magari utilizzare il bagno di servizio per una rinfrescata. Eccoci accontentati: late check-out (ore 16:00) e deposito bagagli (un paio d'ore) gratuiti. Che dire, questi sono i particolari che fanno la differenza (specifico che due anni fa in altro hotel a NY una cosa simile mi costò sui 40 dollari circa).
In conclusione, 11 Howard Hotel ci ha conquistato e siamo usciti completamente soddisfatti da questa esperienza. Un "GRAZIE" a tutto lo staff.

title: Good hotel but the breakfast set up isn’t good
text:
Stayed here for a week in a party of 12 and we collectively agreed that we wouldn’t stay here again due to the size of the bedrooms and the breakfast set up!!! 

The rooms are very clean however if there are 2 people sharing and have suitcases, it’s cramped.

Breakfast set up ruined it for us all tbh. You walk into the breakfast lounge and it’s not obvious at all that this is where breakfast is served, nobody comes up to assist you and help you with that lost look on your face thinking ‘am I in the right place’! It’s just a coffee lounge with 2 large tables, a sofa and a few small low coffee tables. There was a girl on a reception desk who not once smiled and asked if she could help us. When you finally work out you are in the right place you will find complimentary tea and coffee making facilities which are supposed to be provided until 10.30am every morning however each morning we got earlier and the free drinks were removed earlier also until after 4 days there were none at all at 8.30am! You order your food from a small menu (which is not cheap if you don’t have breakfast included in your room rate). The food was very good to be fair however we only got to sit at a proper table once out of 7 days ..we had it on our lap on a sofa for the other 6 which I don’t think is acceptable for the price we paid!!
 So this is the reason that none of our party of 12 would stay here again ..we felt that the breakfast set up and the size of the rooms were not value for the amount per night we paid. 2 of our party moved to another hotel nearby for the last 2 days at half the price which they said was a lot better. So this is the reason I have only given 3 stars for this hotel. 
Other details:
TIP...I asked for a room on a high floor to avoid noise from the disco after reading a previous trip advisor review ....and it worked, we were on floor 11 and heard no hotel noise...only the outside traffic noise which is expected in NY. 

Taxi from JFK in a ‘yellow cab’ is a flat rate of $52, however I flew back from EWR which is not a flat rate and cost me $89 in the quiet period and took me just over an hour at 2pm on a Friday. I think these rates go up at certain times of the day. Please note all cabs have a standard tip rate of minimum 20%!

title: A great hotel for those that don’t like to sleep
text:
I was working on a project nearby and checked in just after 12am. It was pretty busy outside the hotel so I’m guessing the club just closed.
