Having stayed at numerous design-focused hotels in New York within this category, I think 11 Howard has some homework to do. While spaces are indeed beautiful, I don’t sip the casual, conscious hospitality Kool-aid. 11 Howard is pretty on the outside, but it lacks soul when it comes to the little “conscious” details that matter.

title: Modernt och mycket bra service
text: Vi bodde en vecka på hotellet och är super nöjda. Allting är modernt och det digitala systemet med iPad på rummet funkar jättebra. Du behöver inte någon adapter med dig om du vill ladda din IPhone eller iPad, sådana uttag finns. Fantastiskt  engagerad personal som tar väl hand om dig och ger bra tips på allt som du vill veta. Skulle det regna så lånar de dig ett paraply också. Läget är jättebra i Down Town, nära till mycket så du kan promenera. Finns mycket restauranger och affärer. Vi väljer 11 Howard om vi åker hit igen!!!

title: Excellent stay, super cool hotel
text:
Everything from start to finish went so smoothly with 11 Howard, we were pleasantly surprised by the relaxed atmosphere at this stylish hotel. The beds were super comfortable, the breakfast (avocado toast + açai bowl) delicious and the gym, although very small, had all we needed for our 4-night stay. 
They serve free coffee and tea before 9am in the morning and provide you with a free supply of water bottles when you’re going out. 
This hotel is perfect for couples, friends or solo travellers (I wouldn’t recommend for families since the rooms are pretty small) and for people who enjoy a very casual but attentive service as there’s no formal reception desks or staff offering to take your luggage to the room. You order everything you need on a tablet and they deliver it to your room very swiftly.
The Library is also a perfect place to work or have a drink. The location is convenient for getting around lower Manhattan and all the best restaurants are within minutes away. 
I’d definitely love to come back again!

title: Among worst of the NYC 5-star scene
text:
.....That I have experienced, anyway.  During my 5-day stay 11 Howard failed to live up to a basic standard I would consider the minimum for a five-star rating.  I have stayed in dozens of top NYC hotels and this was by far the worst of them, unless you count the separate restaurant Le Coucou, which is amazing.  

Why is it one of the worst?  Well, let's start with the fact the entire hotel shakes considerably every five minutes when subway trains come through.  Next up, let's look at the place.  It is missing a LOBBY for goodness sake.  All I found at any time in the entry way was a few kids dressed in street clothes only intermittently looking like staff.  The room serving as a lobby is missing any decor, and has a single table with no desk or chairs.  It left me wondering where I even was for 5 minutes after I first walked in and someone showed up after knocking on a back security office door.  

There is no valet either.  It took me 1 hour and 50 minutes to get my car from a service they hire out at one point, which was the last time I left my car with them.  They apologized and offered to comp it, but still no excuse for not having your own valet and calling yourself a five star hotel.  

Now let's talk pets.  They allow them.  A dog was barking loudly and continuously in between subway trains in the room next door while the hotel staff could not reach the owner, who had no doubt left.  

So all in all, I'd say the concierge, valet, rooms, service, view and decor here are sub-par for the area, and the lobby situation just bizarre.  I did not find issue with the food or restaurant, but I'm sure some will find the downstairs dance club to be too loud on weekends as well.  The house was definitely bumping.

title: Great hotel, wonderful location!
text:
We stayed for 7 nights at the 11 Howard, the hotel was just what we were looking for, a young hotel with great location, walking distance from many great restaurants and shopping area, great rooms (I love the Scandinavian style decor). 
We reserved the King deluxe, which was a great choice. A special thank you to Robert who was extremely friendly and helpful, we were celebrating my husband 40th birthday and he made sure that we will get the best room at the penthouse floor (highly recommended).

title: Beautiful Hotel - Awful staff - Hideous Concierge
text:
This is an amazing hotel with the worst staff you could ever imagine.  Each of them has a collosal attitude that they throw at their guests.  
The concierge we dealt with is likely one of the most self absorbed, rude, overindulged employees I have ever met in my travels.  She couldn’t be bothered with a phone request, said “I am the concierge - I don’t do that”.
The phone staff is terrible - I think they are hold overs from when this was a Howard Johnson hotel - actually Howard Johnson understands service better than this staff.
Pretty on the outside but oh so ugly on the inside.  
Pick someplace where they actually understand the word hospitality.  PIck someplace where they actually care about you as a guest.
Disgusting experience.

title: Tolle Lage und cooles Designer Hotel
text: Mit einem coolem Design, toller Bar und gutem Service fallen die einfachen, aber technisch gut eingerichteten Zimmer nicht weiter ins Gewicht. Die "Library" ist gemütlich, lädt zu verweilen ein, kann aber auch zum Frühstück oder einfach Kaffeetrinken genutzt werden.

title: Beyond expectations!
text: Loved every single thing about this hotel.  It was quiet and dark and as such had incredible sleep.  The service was incredible.  No request was too much to ask.  We loved the location ... close to great restaurants and shops and close to the subway for uptown/theatre.  We come to NYC often and we have stayed in many places in this area as well as in other areas ... nothing has come close to this hotel.  We will definitely be back!!

title: Know What You're Getting Into
text:
This place is super "hip," which loosely means that it's a very popular club and restaurant that has hotel rooms, and not the other way around. For most people this place will be overpriced for what you get, but if that's your thing then you'll love this place. It's actually fascinating as the entire system seems to be rigged like a game. Know the rules.
This is the sort of place that rewards you for knowing where you are. Most people expect standard amenities and to get what you booked. Not at this place. Know that whatever you booked, you'll likely get a lesser version. The "trick" is, if you don't ask for what you booked, they won't give it to you. So you have to ask. Sometimes multiple times. Book a room wit a corner view and a king bed? You'll probably get one on the 5th floor, queen bed, and you'll feel the subway.
Cleanlinees? Some rooms are clean and upgraded like you'll see in the photos on the website. They're on the higher floors. Anything lower though and you're likely in a room that hasn't been fully renovated yet, and may be a little dirtier. Just ask to be moved and maybe they'll have a room for you.
Expecting standard hotel treatment? Housekeeping service? A minibar? Good luck. You'll maybe get someone who comes by and makes your bed. Some days. Ask for more towels. That's how you get new towels if you're staying more than 2 days. Minibar? You have to call and order everything up yourself.
Want to actually go to the club or restaurant? Also tough, but if you ask enough maybe the hotel staff will help you get in. That said, if your floor is low enough you'll feel like you're at the Blond, because you'll hear it and the people on line outside. Just as good as being there.
All in all, if you like fighting for what you want in a place that's trendy, this is the place for you. If you want a standard stay where you know you'll get what you intended to book, maybe stay somewhere more established.

title: So Beautiful!
text:
Many pluses to love: A perfect Soho location close to shops and restaurants - train stations steps away, plus walking just a few minutes in any direction takes you some place wonderful. Hotel is hip, and rooms are lovely, bright, and stylish. Beds are wonderful, and I loved the shower. Housekeeping is meticulous. Staff are warm and approachable, excellent service, but not in a "bowing and scraping" kind of way. Le Coucou, the onsite restaurant is amazing. Loved it at night, adored it by day. The Library is a beautiful, restful, inspirational spot. Make sure to drop in for coffee, breakfast, or just relaxing or working. 

The downside: Have to deduct one dot for two significant drawbacks, the fitness rooms and the room layout.

There are two workout rooms "Lift" and "Run", both are very small, have good equipment, but not a lot of it. There is only room for one person to work out comfortably at a time. On both occasions my daughter used the "Lift" room, someone else came in, expressed frustration, and left, putting her in an uncomfortable situation. On the plus side, complimentary day passes to the UFC Gym are available. This was very enjoyable, so do take advantage of that. If an onsite 24/7 fitness room is important to you, you may wish to look elsewhere.

Regarding the room layout: With this being our thirteenth visit to NYC, we are not strangers to smaller hotel rooms. Our two double bedded room was the most frustrating room I have been in (though it was very beautiful). Very awkwardly placed furniture made it difficult to be in the room for periods of time. On the plus side, it helped me see what a wonderful space The Library is.

Plenty to love here, but for the price, those drawbacks are significant, and they dampened our otherwise wonderful stay.

title: Missing Key Steps
text: We were disappointed in this hotel.  Within Soho's hyper-competitive lodging market, this place missed a few key steps.  Our check-in was delayed almost an hour, although we did receive an apology and a credit.  We called housekeeping for an extra blanket, and got a mattress cover instead.  Two of the bathroom towels were badly shredded.   Decor is modern and rooms expectedly small.  Staff is very mixed in terms of true interest in customer concerns: some very helpful, others extremely aloof.  Lots of work to be done!

title: Da muss vieles verbessert werden...
text: Der Empfang war sehr chaotisch, da es kein eigentlicher Empfang hat sondern nur ein Tisch.. sehr lange Wartezeiten.....das Hotel ist sauber und zweckmässig eingerichtet, obwohl in den Zimmern vieles fehlt wie vanitykid., Morgenmäntel etc. Die Klimaanlage geht im halbstündigen Takt sehr laut  an und hält die Gäste die ganze Nacht wach. Das Frühstück beinhaltet nur eine Karte mit einer sehr spärlichen Auswahl. Dann sind in der kleinen Karte von 5 Gepressten Säften nur zwei erhältlich. Concierge sehr arrogant und wirklich nicht hilfsbereit. Wenn hier unbedingt übernachtet werden soll, dann höher als der 8 Stock, sonst hört man die ganze Nacht die Subway. Die Bar war cool und die Bedienung dort sehr hilfsbereit. Hotel ist für die Preise über 550 die Nacht auch für New York nicht ok.... schade, nächstes mal in anderer Lokalität.. das Gebotene stimmt mit Preis nicht überein..

title: Sehr schönes Design hotel aber das Personal sehr unfreundlich und arrogant
text:
Für 500 USD die Nacht:

Consierge sehr arrogant und unfreundlich. 

Empfang chaotisch und unpersönlich.  

Wir haben Frühstück gehabt und Mann muss sogar 10 UDS extra  Zahlen wenn man “ Avocado 🥑 Toast “ bestellt und dazu 2 Ei 🥚 will .... 

Zimmer sind sogar nicht mit das nötigste ausgestattet... keine Vanity Kitt oder so... 

Zimmer werden nicht richtig geputzt.

Die Mädels und Jungs an der Bar waren sehr nett 👍🏼.

title: Hipster kids in town
text:
About the hippest hotel we could’ve booked. Located right in the centre of Soho, all of the best shops, nightlife and some great restaurants were on our doorstep. The metro is also just around the corner.
The standout highlight of this hotel was its staff. They were welcoming and friendly, they took a genuine interest in us, and they skipped the scripted corporate speeches you hear at other hotels. We loved the staff!!!
Full warning, the rooms are small, you can hear the nightclub and sometimes the metro from your room. Honestly, these weren’t such a big issue. I would happily stay here again, and just try to book the biggest room that we can afford (a on a high floor).

title: I felt like they all had something better to do than to help me
text: The room and space was beautiful. But, I was placed on the 4th floor and their bar/club is on the 2nd. I returned to my room at 3AM looking to sleep but the club was so loud I could feel the bass vibrating in my room and the music was so loud I couldn't sleep, I called the night manager who was very polite and offered to turn down the music but it did not budge until 4AM. The next morning I called to ask for a toothbrush but halfway through my sentence I was hung up on and not called back. Then when I was checking out the concierge offered to email my folio but halfway through giving it she turned to her coworker and started asking about a restaurant for another guest and started dialing the phone! I waited a minute and finally gave the rest of my email and she said okay and turned away without saying anything else. On my way out I was greeted by the manager and he was very kind and apologized and offered to follow up with me but I haven't heard anything back 4 days later. Overall I feel like their slogan of "casual luxury" is just too casual, where I just felt like I was getting in the way of everyone doing something more important

title: A Perfect Stay
text:
We stayed 4 nights at 11Howard and the stay greatly exceeded all of our expectations. We visit frequently due to family living in the area and we have found our new home away from home. It’s called 11Howard.
1) The location is excellent, close to many unique neighborhoods and attractions. We prefer to steer clear of the swarms of people at Times Square and enjoy the neighborhood feel of SoHo.
2) The staff (called Creators) were extremely enthusiastic and kind and worked SO well as a team.... always opening doors, answering questions, offering complimentary bottled water and even umbrellas. And yes, Kenny is every bit a rockstar Creator as previous reviewers have commented! Kudos also to Katherine Woods who answered questions via email prior to our stay.
3) The hotel is new by NYC standards and the rooms are thoughtfully laid out with a Scandinavian feel with no wasted space. Bathrooms are MUCH larger than some other NYC hotels of comparable  price.
4) Highly recommend booking directly with hotel as the best option as the hotel actually gives a percentage of those proceeds to a charity.
5) We read some reviews where people complained of noise. (??) Please understand that NYC is the largest US city, and lots of traffic noise and people noise is part of the experience regardless of where you stay. Possibly purchasing a few good sets of foam ear plugs will do the trick.

title: Hard to beat
text:
Our first visit. Excellent location and 2 minutes from subway.

Contemporary and minimalist.

Great staff!

Spotless.

The much praised CouCou is attached so catch for breakfast or dinner if your wallet can handle it.

Rooms are small (hey this in NYC) but swell. Free WiFi. 

Second floor is the "Library" - folks hang out here and you can order drinks and snacks.

Sleep quality is good. Street noise not apparent (we were on the 10th floor). However, you will get the vibrations from the nearby subway.

Some may not like the very limited lighting in the hallways...

title: Trendy and yet neighborhood-like
text:
Despite the chic facade and the hipster address, the service in the hotel is warm and friendly. The fellows in reception and concierge are all professional and quick to please. 

Be prepared when you arrive, though, as this is one of those hotels with no front desk. When you enter, someone greets you with a small mobile device and checks you in through a pad. The building used to house a Holiday Inn so the room sizes can vary widely and I heard the smallest room is SUPER TINY. I had a nice room apparently with a good view, but there wasn’t enough space to even stretch out if you wanted to do some yoga on your own.

There is free water, a good minibar, safe, and huge tv with basic cable. Wifi works really well. There are also a robe and slippers (Yay! All hotel rooms should provide slippers IMHO). The amenities also smell very nice (unknown boutique brand). The bathroom only had a shower, no tub.

I did not try the gym or the food, but the location is too great to confine yourself to the hotel. There are yoga/Pilates options all over the neighborhood and excellent restaurants/bars. You’re practically in Chinatown as well. (There’s a good hipster-y coffee shop just opposite the entrance if you can’t venture far without a flat white or cortado.

title: Great 30th bday hotel
text:
My husband and I stayed here for 6 nights to celebrate my 30th birthday. We were on a red eye flight from the West Coast, so we arrived at the hotel at around 9am. They checked us in and took our bags for us. Our room wasn’t ready, so we explored a little bit. We got back around noon asking to see if our room was ready. The team was really nice and were able to give us a room since they knew we hadn’t slept much in the past 36 hrs. So thank you for that!!!!

We were on the 9th floor with a nice view of 1 World Trade Center. The room was nice and clean, but was pretty minimal. The bathroom was also nice, though the shower only had glass for half of the shower. Sort of odd. The bed was really comfy and I liked their pillows!! The room was a little noisy since you could hear action on Canal St, but not too bad.

I had to do somethings for work, so I worked in the Library, as they called their lounge. It was a really great work space. It was relaxed and everyone was working so respected everyone’s space. Though I got a pressed juice and it was $13! Eep. Well at least I was being healthy.

They also had umbrellas you can use when it rains which is really nice. 

Overall I had a great experience and would definitely come back in the future!

title: Would never stay here again
text:
I stayed with a friend at 11 Howard for a week and it was one of the most terrible, if not the most terrible hotel experience I’ve had. 

The hotel has zero concpet of service. I can’t even say it was bad service, because it was just no service. It felt like staying at hotel that no one was running or managing. 

Our rooms were never cleaned properly, we complained about this from day one and throughout our stay, nothing was done about it. Further more no one really cared. There was not one single staff memeber with any kind of customer service understanding to speak to. In the end we lost the will to even say anything, because there was no one competent to have a constructive conversation with.  

Zero cooperation or helpfulness in anything. Even something as simple as can we please get a bottle of water. 

We were there for 7 nights and were notably unhappy with our experience. We didn’t get any gesture of compensation or show of any kind of care for the terrible expereince we had. 

I would never stay here again and would never recommend the hotel to anyone.

title: Outstanding Service, Nice Well-located Hotel
text:
The location is excellent, with lots of restaurants around SOHO. The subway is nearby, so it is easy to get around. There were always lots of UBERs nearby to call for pick up at the hotel.

When checking in you will discover that the hotel is "MINIMAL". See the photos of the lobby, there is a single round table and two tablets.

Kenny who checked us in explained the whole thing, the rooms are minimally equipped, but, if you need anything, ask for it. The room had all the basics and we got whatever we asked for.

There were spare towels near the ice machine. They brought extra soap. The air was dry and they brought a humidifier (recommended).

Kenny and Brian at the front desk were exceptional.

The breakfast is good, but, pricey (it is New York after all).

The room was quiet and small, but, totally worked, the bed was very comfortable.WIFI worked well. The desk had two outlets, plus USB ports.

I would recommend this hotel for a nice stay in NYC.

title: Best girls’ getaway location
text:
Had such a lovely time at the 11 Howard. Second time staying there, and again did not disappoint. The staff is beyond friendly and very helpful. The complimentary water bottles are really appreciated! The location is the best ever... we walked everywhere! Shopping, brunch at Sadelle’s and Jack’s wife Freda, as well as to the 9/11 memorial. 

Coming back to the hotel for a nap or a good night’s sleep was such a treat in that big comfy bed.  

We stayed in room 712 and it was wonderful! Can’t wait to go back.

title: Perfect Girls Weekend in SoHo!
text:
We had the most perfect girls weekend in SoHo this weekend, starting with our gorgeous corner room at the 11 Howard. The room was so spacious, bright, and designed beautifully from the gorgeous curtains to the headboard and amazing bathroom. I cannot say enough on how comfortable the bed was - it almost made us want to cancel our dinner reservations and stay in the room to watch movies.
The staff was so friendly, helpful and attentive, always making sure we had a bottle of water when heading back to our room. The location of the Hotel could not be more perfect, right in the heart of Soho and walking distance to everything we wanted to do that weekend: shopping, coffee, brunch, dinners! The 2nd floor library section was perfect for relaxing after a long day of walking around. 
This is definitely my new go-to hotel in New York from now on and I can't wait to plan my next trip here!

title: Kenny is the man!!
text:
Disclaimer: This is the first 5 star hotel we stayed at.

The customer service here is incredible. Right as we arrived, our Lyft driver grabbed our luggages out of the trunk, and before we even got out of the car, our luggages were already on their way inside the hotel!! Yup, that was Kenny, 11 Howard's superstar employer, who was already helping us out. We told Kenny that it was our anniversary, and he made the occasion a memorable one. 

Whenever we had any questions, Kenny was there to answer it, and was overall extremely helpful.

Icing on the cake, was after a night out, we arrived back at the hotel with a bottle of champaign and a note congratulating our 8 year anniversary.

This hotel treated us like royalty (when we really aren't), and that is the lasting image I got of 11 Howard. Really impressed with our first 5 star hotel.

title: A great boutique hotel downtown!
text: I loved the vibe of this hotel in general.  However, I was on the 3rd floor and the room shook with every train that went by all day and all night.  Other than that the staff was very pleasant, the rooms quite comfortable and neatly appointed.  The subway is very close by so that is incredibly helpful.  There is also a Starbucks around the corner.

title: Great location but style over substance
text:
I took a 4 day trip to Howard Hotel last week with my partner. It was a last minute booking with flights and an average deal in what seemed a modern chic boutique hotel in a great location - which it was. On first impressions the check in was very paid back but perhaps a too laid back after expecting a typical American enthusiastic welcome. This was the vibe I picked up on for the rest of the stay from the staff - everything seemed to be a little bit too much effort. 
The room itself was pretty small but fine for us as we spent most time out. The amenities could probably have been better , no coffee machine and hardly any storage. We ordered room service one night through the app on iPad provided which was efficient but a little unclear on confirmation. The empty containers etc were then not actually picked up despite a room clean which was odd. 

Location wise if you don't want to be full immersed In the chaotic time square feel and love to brunch in independent restaurants, mooch around designer boutiques and bars then this is for you. Right by canal st subway so you can get into town easily or walk like we did. 

All in all the hotel customer service could have been more personal but it didn't negatively affect out trip. The one stand out member of staff helped us with our bags and had a smile whose name I think was Penny (worked Saturday afternoon/evening April 7th) 

We didn't have breakfast or dinner with our stay but I hear the restaurant it great for dinner. 

I recommend the Nickle and Diner around the corner for a great unique breakfast to fuel you before your sight seeing.

title: Location, Service, Amenities - All Amazing
text:
11 Howard is seriously all that it's cracked up to be. The location of the hotel is ideal for experiencing New York the best way possible. This was my second time visiting the city and this honestly beat the first out of the water. The hotel is just beautiful and the amenities and aesthetic makes your heart happy. 

The concierge and service throughout the entire hotel are some of the best that I've come across. Our trip was for my birthday and my friend had actually set up a ton of surprises with the help of Kenneth Butler. He is seriously one of the sweetest and most helpful people I've ever met in the hospitality realm. From giving us boxing passes to scheduling us infrared sauna appointments (which I totally recommend you check out) he was always there to offer a helping hand. 

I agree with the other review saying that he deserves a promotion! He goes above and beyond!

title: Mediocre Accommodations, Terrible Service
text:
I stayed at 11 Howard for a business trip in late March. My stay was relatively uneventful, and I would have considered this a par-for-the-course, if slightly overpriced, minimalist hotel experience for the Manhattan market. The room service is wildly overpriced, and you can feel the subway shake the hotel all night - but these are things that I have come to expect from New York.

What made this experience "Terrible" was that 11 Howard made a duplicate charge for the entire stay on my credit card - despite the fact that I pre-paid for the room and taxes through a 3rd party reservation system - and has made no effort to correct their error. This is apparently my problem now, and I have to continually call and remind them to refund me the $750+ that I am owed. 

I have tried calling their support phone number 5-10 times over the past week to get this charge corrected, to no avail. One team member from the billing team told me that they would handle this, and get back to me within 1-2 hours. Nope. Still waiting.

This is *not* a 5-star experience. If you're looking for great service and a relaxing stay in NY - go elsewhere.

title: Location-great! Service-great! But . . .
text:
My husband and I often travel to New York for a couples getaway. We book through Hotwire and always expect small rooms. Our goal is not to spend too much time in the hotel anyway! So we were not shocked at a the size of the room.. 

Despite booking through Hotwire, the staff was very welcoming and courteous! We certainly received a 5 star welcome and attention, but don't be shocked at the austere quality of the lobby. That said, we were always warmly received, offered complimentary umbrellas due to the rain, etc. 

For more mature travelers, though, you might find that the space is not what we have come to expect from a "5 star" hotel. Younger, silicon valley types may love the library/work space but it's not appealing to older vacationers. The very dimly lit halls give the hotel an edgy moodiness. It's actually a challenge to see room numbers. On the weekends, returning to the hotel at night will mean navigating through the crowd of people waiting outside to get into their very popular bar Blonde. We did not partake.

The room was quiet, though, except for the Friday night a nearby girl began screaming loud obscenities at someone and then again on Saturday night from a party being held in a nearby suite.  The girl stopped before I had a chance to call for some 5 star shut her up service. And the party noise was contained by shutting a hallway door.

It's definitely a place for a young crowd . . . . 

But even young people love their just out of bed, early morning coffee.  Though space was tight, could it have been too much trouble to add a Keurig or Nespresso to the room?

title: Excellent, Friendly Concierge and Service!
text:
I came to New York to celebrate my friend's birthday and I was met with incredibly nice, friendly hotel staff. I had called concierge in advance to organize some balloons, pancakes, and other birthday celebratory things with by Kenneth Butler, he did the best job coordinating things before our arrival. The staff here overall was incredibly friendly, even down to house-keeping. I was definitely satisfied with my stay here, it exceeded my expectations!

When I arrived, I met him for the first time and he was SO nice. Told us about the hotel, the neighborhood, and gave us some passes for the UFC gym to train at during our stay. If you're looking to stay here, I hope you have the pleasure of meeting Kenneth, he will go out of his way to make sure you receive the best experience. 

Kenneth, if you're reading this, I hope you get a promotion!!! You deserve one!!!

title: Bel hôtel bien situé mais prestations un peu justes
text:
Nous avons séjourné 4 nuits au 11 Howard. Localisation idéale au coeur de Manhattan. Les chambres sont petites mais la literie est de qualité et nous avons pu dormir au calme malgré la présence du club au deuxième étage.
Les espaces communs sont un peu limites en terme d’espace d’autant plus que la « library » a été fermée pendant une partie de notre séjour. Le personnel est « laid back » et offre un service sympathique mais minimaliste (les mêmes jeunes gens alternent dans les rôles de réceptionniste, portier et concierge...)
Au total vraiment décevant par rapport a la « one of a kind travel experience » qu’on nous vend sur le site...

title: Amazing
text: Gorgeous hotel - wouldn’t hesitate, understated excellence. Really made a lasting impression and really enjoyed staying here, don’t stay here if OTT lux is your thing, so stay if you appreciate luxurious simplicity and in an extremely tasteful and comfy environment

title: Unique hotel
text: Good location at southeastern edge of Soho - seems to fill a market gap there. Attractive, modern interior design in rooms. Room (deluxe queen) a bit cramped. Common space limited as lobby is transient (no seating). Library was a comfortable space but bar was closed on the Sunday we stayed here. Staff was very friendly. No real SPG benefits here but that was not unexpected.

title: Second visit and will be back again
text: 11 Howard is a great hotel in a fantastic location. Staff is gracious and accommodating. Brian E. was particularly helpful with keen insight into the neighborhood, from gallery exhibits to the best coffee.

title: Disastrous, rude and unapologetically Useless staffs- READ THIS WHOLE REVIEW.
text:
My philosophy on reviewing is simple: If i had a great experience at an establishment, I leave a positive review to encourage people to go experience what I experienced. If it was BAD, i don't write a review simply because it will be unfair to negate the efforts of the business owners who set up establishments to take care of their family and employees.

BUT in this case, i make an exception and I will give a candid review to bring to light the disrespectful, unprofessional, and pathetic concrete and glass disaster that is 11 Howard, and I will focus on Joseph (-)- The Check-in Receptionist that i had the displeasure of meeting and the Night manager who facilitated Joseph's dishonest and rude behaviour.

I arrived New York late at 11:50pm after a 16hour Non Stop flight. Made my way to 11 Howard and the rest has to be the worst 1 hour i ever spent checking into a hotel, and yes, it took 1 hour despite the fact i was the only person checking-in at 12:20AM.

Joseph (-) treated me with extreme apathy and disrespect. Expressing all of it in this review only brings back the experience which i wish to forget. He showed no concern for the fact that i was exhausted, struggling to carry my suitcase- My right hand is broken and in a cast, or even offered to help sort out issues with my card to secure the incidentals because the hotel processed credit cards that don't use Chips which is strange because  technology has migrated to cards with chips. So note: if your card has no chip, 11 Howard Hotel's obsolete system cannot process your card. It is too advanced for them.

After the fiasco, i made it to the room and the climate control wasn't functioning, and there were 2 double beds. So i went back down and informed the receptionist; his name is Joseph (-) and his response was and I quote "Hotwire booked you this room so that's what we have. As for the Climate Control, i'll send engineering so go back to your room". Then he pulled his laptop closer to his face as he sat on his desk and never looked up to my face as i stood there in disbelief. 

That was the last straw. So i called Hotwire and expressed my displeasure. The lady from hotwire was very helpful, and she called the hotel to complain on my behalf. After 5 min, she called me back, and told me that Joseph (-) informed her that I, the guest, declined a room with a single bed, and preferred a room with a double bed. He also said the room with a single bed was on a lower floor and that's why I declined the single bed. The audacity of such a blatant LIE is beyond despicable. 

There and then, I realised that the bad service, the rudeness, the disrespect, and the LIES from Joe (-) directed at me was all on purpose. I couldn't believe it. i was later moved from my room on the 4th floor to the alleged single room on the lower floor and to my surprise, the alleged single room was just next to my previous room on the same 4th floor! NOT on a lower floor. All in All from check-in to calling hotwire to getting the right room to dealing with Joe [--] lies and disrespect took an Hour. To say I'm disappointed is a vast understatement.

WORST HOTEL EXPERIENCE OF MY LIFE and this coming from myself who has lived on 5 Continents, speaks 4 languages, educated in 3 Countries, is a level 2 reviewer and always has 1 positive thing to say EXCEPT IN THIS SITUATION must mean a lot. Such a shame that Joseph (-) official title is "Creator of Guest Experiences". Utterly Shameful.

title: Excellent stay in SoHo
text: Beautiful room, comfortable mattress, European shower. Location provides easy access to Chinatown, Little Italy, Le CouCou Restaurant, Landmark Coffee Shop.  Spiraling stairs to library and bar. If you use Uber or Lyft, they will pick up near Le CouCou Restaurant side of hotel.

title: NYC meets SCANDINAVIA
text: Wow, wow, wow, this hotel is a brilliant find... tooked away in a quiet side street close to Broadway and its hustle and bustle this hotel is unassuming on the outside and a treasure trove of Scandi design at its best inside. It’s a very simple foyer with a smart receptionist armed with an iPad who swiftly checks you in and directs your bags to your room. The rooms are compact but perfectly formed - relaxed decor in calming colours of soft grey and pink. I had total bathroom envy at this hotel and the toiletries were luxe. The bar with free wine in the evenings for an hour is a great meeting spot and is a feast for the eyes - sumptuous fabrics of velvet in a rich deep palette with artwork that blends so well with the space. The cocktails here are first rate too and resulted in many a sore head the next morning. This hotel is a truly excellent base and a must see if you are a fan of the scandi-style.

title: Room is just okay - staff is rude, discourteous, and dishonest.
text:
Room 385 with tax. Tiny room (I got an upgrade too)

Food bill: 285 

Tips to staff 500 (cold heart cash)

Manager during the day shift was great and he upgraded my room, then he told me to go to the bar. 

That night I leave the bar to get my wallet I left in the room to tip some guys that were “unhappy”. I started giving tips to every guy 100 here 50 there. I go back to the bar, guy pretends I don’t exist and won’t let me back upstairs. The staff took over 400 dollars in cash at this point, because they could advantage of me. Why not right? Workers at hotel screw guests, it’s seem like common practice. 

Stay away. There are better hotels.

title: A Light Open Space
text: This hotel is very stylish and seems very nordic in its sensibility. The rooms are light  and relatively spacious (for boutique hotels in NYC).  The second floor lounge is a must visit just to hang out and watch the hyper-active New Yorkers come in to run their business and projects of their laptops.  The staff are great and really helpful.

title: Tiny even for NY
text:
The first thing you notice about 11 Howard is there is no front desk, the bellmen / doormen check you in on tablets.  Staff is friendly , bottled water offered at check in.  The hallways are really dark,, and our room was really small, even by NYC standards.  The bathroom is not a bad size , but living space is cramped.  There’s a small area rug under the bed, otherwise the floors are vinyl.  No bathrobes , no minibar, no in room coffee, and the free coffee in the library cuts off at 9 am, way too early.  Ask for a north or west facing room, east facing morning sunshine rooms are no good as the hotel shades aren’t super effective.

Restaurant Le Coucou is spectacular .  The location next to the QRNW train allows easy access to upper west side, Times Square and Brooklyn.  Soho, tribeca, and Nolita are easy walking distance.  If only those rooms were a little bigger , I’d come back, but I think I’ll pick somewhere else next time.

title: Amazing hotel, questionable location
text:
I love 11 Howard. Perfect rooms, beautiful decor, lux bathrooms and amazingly comfortable beds. The staff were all super friendly and helpful and the fact it’s affiliated with SPG is also a bonus. 

It’s very techie when you check in, no reception desk, all done on a tablet and very efficient. 

Room service was interesting, I get the concept but for $50 I didn’t love my grilled cheese sandwich, soup and Diet Coke being served in a brown paper bag...

Now there’s the location, it’s dodge. In fact, late at night it’s a little shady. Edgy but shady. I’d encourage getting Uber despite the centralish location to soho and TriBeCa. 5 minutes and you’re in soho and all the stores, cafes and galleries you need.

title: Party Weekend
text:
We stayed at the 11 Howard for 3 nites from March 15-18.

It is a new hotel and is in a great area for SoHo at Howard/Lafayette. It is well priced for a NYC hotel.

Our first room was 1112 and when we went to bed we could here the train, the street, and all kinds of noise. At 2:00 AM we demanded to be switched and were switched to a bigger room with less noise but still not quiet. It was a nice room so we stayed despite the noise. Its NYC. There is always noise.

We went to the Blond (Club) one night wher we had a pricate section reserved as we were a big party. Good vibe, soso music. Could use a new DJ

Breakfast was served in the library and was decent and simple.

Hotel is close to West Broadway, Houston, etc so all shopping and dining is pretty close by.

title: Probably the best hotel in SoHo
text:
11 Howard is ideally located, in a quiet street next to Chinatown and Little Italy in the heart of Soho. I usually stay in midtown, staying in Soho was so much better in so many ways. I highly recommend walking around in the neighborhood, there is a very good mix of art, dining and stores. 

The hotel itself is very well maintained, the atmosphere is soothing right from the beginning. Open reception adds a connection to the staff - professional and friendly. The choice of neutral colors makes you feel good, the welcoming sofas and chairs enhance that feeling even more. 

Rooms were very nice, big enough to feel comfortable. The decor is very well though of. The bathroom was clean and very agreable, overall a very good experience. 

I've already recommended 11 Howard to my friends planning to go to New York, it really is a very nice place to stay in the city.

title: Wow
text: Holy cow. This place is fantastic. Right in the center and I mean the center of Soho. And so chic. And home to The Blonde bar on the second floor. So trendy yet wonderful. This place is baller. Staff was TOP SHELF. Friendly, not snobby, helpful immediately, anticipated needs... it's a little pricey as you get what you pay for but my employer was paying so what do I care!

title: Weekend get away in NYC
text:
I’ve stayed at 11 Howard once before and this time was even better! Kenny is awesome, he took extra special care of us, as returning guests (& SPG members)!! He upgraded us and helped make our stay 1st class.  
Breakfast was delicious & the living room has a cool relaxed vibe. 
We love the location of 11 Howard, as we spend time in SoHo, Nolita, LES, TriBeCa, Chinatown (just to dine at Jajaja & drink @ Apotheke) and west village - we can walk to everything! 
Will be back in 2 months & will stay again! 
Thx to the wonderful staff at 11 Howard, see you soon....!!!

title: Excellent hotel and service!
text: Great service, amenities, and beautiful clean rooms with great bath products according to my wife.  Kenny is the man at this property, couldn’t be nicer and more accommodating.  Highly recommended. Great location

title: World Class Hospitality and Cozy Rooms
text:
I've been staying at 11 Howard for well over a year. Over time it has become my exclusive hotel when visiting NYC for both work and personal trips. No other hotel has been able to live up to the one of a kind experience you get at 11 Howard. The "creator" team truly delivers on their promise of "Conscious Hospitality." Every detail of your stay is meticulously thought out and executed. From the moment you arrive, to the time you check out, you can expect everything to be taken care of. 

Pro tips: 
1. Head down to The Blond for one of the best burgers you've ever had. 
2. Start your day with an equally delicious avocado toast.
3. Local Soho shops offer a discount with your room key. Start with Aether, right around the corner.

title: Nice and clean but just ok
text: The hotel was very nice and it was clean but it certainly was not a 5 star hotel.  The room was tiny and had zero thrills.  The people checking you in were young, wearing non matching  sweatshirts and checking you in on iPads.  I don’t mind informal, but this was pushing it.  We tried to go to the bar late one night but it was this loud scene and we could not get in.  The location was great, but the hotel was nothing special.

title: Great service and a good night sleep
text: This is our second time at the 11 Howard. We had some noise issues on our first stay which the hotel has now corrected with noise insulation. We love the Scandinavian design and having breakfast at the library is amazing! Most importantly, the staff is great and always there to help! Location is AAA, right down in Soho.

title: Fantastic Hospitality
text:
Absolutely loved my stay!

Room was stylish, clean, quiet, and perfect for my business stay!  Additionally, the staff at 11 Howard are AMAZING.  In fact, most of the team called me by name, started great conversations, and were just AWESOME.  

Can't wait to go back!

title: Tiny Rooms, Plastic Utensils w Room Service. Trying to hard to be trendy.
text: This was my first stay here.  I won't be returning.  As I checked in the guy checking me apologized in advance for my room, so I knew it was not going to be good. An nice welcome for an SPG Platinum member. My room was so small that the desk chair hits the bed when you pull it out to use it.  I had to climb around the bed to get in and out from the desk.  It had been a long travel day and I just wanted room service and bed.  I ordered from the all day menu and it was delivered in a brown paper bag, in a to go box with plastic utensils.  Really? My room was 310 and it vibrates every 10 minutes or so with the train underneath the hotel.  I have been traveling to NYC for over 10 years and have never had that happen.  All this to say if you are looking for creature comforts you should choose another hotel.

title: Sanctuary in the city
text: I loved this hotel! The decor is charming and soothing, the beds are comfortable and the toiletries smell wonderful. Space is hard to find in the city, so I loved the Library room for meetings, meals and working. The Blond is a fun bar for drinks (although it has its own scene at night with a line out the door, so don't count on that).

title: 0 Star Hotel
text:
Booked this hotel for one evening and arrived at 5:00PM to check-in after a very long day of traveling to celebrate my husbands birthday.  Upon arrival, I was told that our room was not yet ready, but would be in just a few minutes and was promised a room far from the noise of the club.  Went for a walk and came back shortly after to find that the room was STILL not ready. Time began to go by with absolutely no employee at the front desk to the point of us having to call the hotel from the lobby in order to get in touch with someone for an update. Finally, at 7:00PM, after two hours of waiting and three hours after the check-in time listed on their website, we were given a room.  To top it off, it was the room we were absolutely promised we would not have right above the club.  The waiting and confusion caused us to miss my husbands birthday dinner reservation, a reservation that was made months in advance. 

I would absolutely never stay here again and would never recommend it to someone else.  If you aren't able to check-in your guests until 7:00PM at night after they've been traveling all day, please do not advertise a 4:00PM check-in time

title: Excellent Service.  Personal Touches abound.  Superb Location.  And SPG points!
text:
Recently stayed here for business.   It was reasonably priced and equally importantly, is part of the SPG Design Hotel group = points eligible!

I wasn't sure what to expect  - but from the moment I checked in, the service and overall friendliness of the staff was superb!  You never know what you're going to get in NY (and Soho is a bit snooty) - so the level of attentiveness and the personal touches really stood out (from the bottle of water at the check in, to the Email from Anis, the general manager - upon departure).  Everyone was so genuinely nice.

The room was impeccable - clean, modern, well thought out and sizable.  It's a newer hotel - and it really feels fresh, in a lovely way vs. the typical high traffic Manhattan properties I typically stay at.

Lastly - the location is amazing.  Right in the heart of Soho - but tucked away on a side street, so away from the bustle.

I rarely write reviews - which says a lot about my experience here.  Highly recommend.

title: Superb vibe and can't wait to stay here in April
text:
I regularly travel to NYC on business and on my last visit I stayed at Hotel 50 Bowery (which is great btw) but went to 11 Howard for drinks with some friends. 

Awesome place, love the decor, and a great vibe. I'm coming back to NYC for a week in April so I'll probably book this hotel as my wife is joining me for a weekend (rare for a work trip) and it's close to our Soho office!

Can't wait!

title: Nice option if you need SoHo location
text: Stayed here for a work trip because was near where I needed to be.  There is no check-in deck, just a hipster with an ipad.  Was a Saturday night and then line to the club was long, I was told proactively at check-in that just because I was staying there did NOT mean I could skip the line.  Restaurant is more like a lobby lounge, food was very good, drinks were of course super expensive.  Room was fine, small as are all rooms in NYC.  Floor seemed to be caving in in a couple places and desk chair was flimsy and broken.  Bed was comfy, toiletries were nice.  Service was friendly.  Cool tablet by bed lets you schedule room cleaning, room service, etc.  Great SoHo location just one block from 2 of the main train lines.  I would stay again if I have business in the area.

title: No way is this 5 star hotel
text:
It was fine. Clean. But the fitness room when you finally find it is miniscule, there is no coffee in the room, the elevator is very slow, the room is small, the windows were dirty, and the design was nothing special.

Neither amenities nor design make this hotel more than a 3 star hotel. For a 3 star, it is perfectly acceptable.

title: Le design ne fait pas tout
text:
Quand je réserve un hôtel, c'est pour y dormir. L'hôtel a de manière intelligente ouvert un club au 2eme étage, ouvert tous les jours jusqu'à 3h du matin. J'étais au 5eme étage, les murs tremblaient, les basses raisonnaient, impossible de dormir. On m'a dit que j'étais "du mauvais côté de l'hôtel" et on m'a proposé de changer de chambre (en pleine nuit). 

Dommage car l'hôtel en lui même est super, la décoration est parfaite, c'est hype, bien placé, les chambres sont agréables et bien équipées. 

J'ai trouvé le personnel un peu trop laid-back, rien contre la volonté de casser les codes de l'hôtellerie classique, mais ça manquait de professionnalisme. 

Bref, j'y retournerai peut être pour danser mais pas pour dormir.

title: My Go-To SoHo NY Hotel!
text:
I stay here regularly for work and have become familar with the great staff. 

Staff: Everyone takes great care of me and makes every service aspect fast and easy... checking in, room service, getting my room preferences. 

Rooms: Classic NYC porportions but designed so well you never feel cramped. The clean, Scandinavian design is beatiful. The in room tablet is great for automating room service, requesting a toothbrush and more. 

Hotel: As an SPG member this place is hard to beat for value.The attention to detail and art is amazing, so many stunning scenes as you explore the property. The lobby is so unique and the “library” cafe is truly serene. Very soho-chic - fashionable guest vibe, good mix of business, pleasure and family travelers. 

Food: Menu is simple but with several amazing staples - the burger, tuna tartare are both fantastic. Room service is pretty fast. Blonde Bar is a hip scene at all hours, staff is friendly. The bar turns over into a night club after 10 and if you aren’t already there by then you have to deal with the typical NYC club entry experience where you are not guaranteed to get in even if you are a hotel guest... I never had a problem but would be nice to not have to hassle with the uncertainty.

LeCou Cou Restaurant: Amazing and beautiful French restaurant housed on the property... one of the toughest tables in NY so book weeks in advance!

Gym: Consists of 2 repurposed rooms, not a ton of space but rarely busy and gets the basics done. Also provides free passes to the UFC gym around the corner.

Overal excellent experience and a top hotel in my 15 years of biz travel.

title: Great boutique hotel
text: This hotel was amazing, beautiful, minimalist! We had a great stay at 11 Howard in the first week of January and absolutely loved the location in Soho. It was within walking distance to the best restaurants, Little Italy and the boutique stores in Soho! I will definitely stay there when I'm in Soho again.

title: Perfect stay in NYC
text: Modern and minimal hotel perfectly located in SOHO. Very friendly and welcoming staff. Amazing reception area. Stunning library where to have breakfast or drink a glass or simply relaxing. Rooms are small as the average in NYC. Amazing restaurant at the ground floor.

title: Best Stay in NYC
text:
I was super impressed with 11 Howard. For a hotel in NYC the rooms were a reasonable size and the beds were comfy. I thought the technology they use in the experience was impressive and generally helpful. During the check in process it's transparent how your room is selected and the person helping me was great in making sure I got the best room for what I wanted. There's a well functioning tablet that has all the hotel information on it in the room. I had breakfast in the Library (which is a bit of an odd space, but I think I could come to appreciate it) and had an Acai bowl which was ridiculously tasty if a bit expensive. 

Overall I was really happy with my stay. I've been bouncing around different SPG properties in NYC without finding any that I would strongly recommend. 11 Howard is the first one I'd look to book first on my next trip to NYC.

title: Amazing Hotel & Experience
text: Recently stayed at the hotel for 3 nights.  Everything from check-in to check-out was absolutely amazing.  The hotel sends a pre-check-in email that helps to expedite the onsite check-in process, which made everything super easy.  Had a fantastic king room with a great view of lower manhattan.  Would highly recommend this hotel!

title: First stay - will return
text: I had a great experience at 11 Howard. I stayed for business and found the room well appointed and beautiful.  The toiletries, water, etc are all lovely touches.  I made a housekeeping request (more washcloths, robe) via the ipad and they were delivered to my room within five minutes. The concierges in the entrance were attentive, pleasant, and on top of things. The location is fabulous and there are two subway stations right there. SPG Platinum and 11 Howard made a great first impression!

title: Moderno y tranquilo hotel en pleno Soho
text: Hotel con ambiente tranquilo en una ubicación fabulosa.La atención del concierge excelente.Habitaciones tranquilas y amplias.Nivel descanso supremo.El desayuno no está incluido (si lo realizas en el hotel es caro pero te lo recomiendo ,vale la pena).El hotel no cuenta con recepción,el check in lo realiza una persona en el lobby de forma rapidísima!

title: Nice design but lacking in lots of areas
text:
Stayed here for 2 nights last week and was pretty disappointed and I have stayed in many hotels in NY for around the same price. I chose it based on the design and the beautiful common areas. Firstly the hotel is by no means a 5 star hotel, much more like 3*. The room was tiny, particularly the shower room. We couldn't even fit our suitcases in the wardrobe as they aren't full size. The minibar is empty, and you are meant to order things to fill it which seems a bit of a faff. Every time I needed something I had to order it (no dressing gown/slipper etc in room) Just felt very basic for the price. 
The reception is also extremely uninviting and we found the staff a bit stand-offish. One guy tried to have a go at us as we hadn't told them the wrong name was displayed on the iPad in the room! I also left an item in the room and when I called to arrange to collect it they said housekeeping hadn't handed it in...?
Its certainly beautifully designed and in a great location but everything else is pretty lackluster sadly.

title: Excellent hotel & location
text: Very well located in a not so busy street in the heart of Soho. This is a fantastic hotel to stay for business of pleasure. The rooms are modern and confortable and the service a 10. Will definitely repeat in my next visit.

title: understated cool
text: I stayed on the 12th floor in a terrace room with a spectacular view up to the empire state building.   The place is beautiful- understated, simple lines, clean, functional design, and totally kitsch free.   The amenities are good, the bed comfortable, linens crisp.   The library is a great place to relax, hold meetings, work on your laptop, have a coffee.  And the location is brilliant- it is at the bottom corner of Soho, around the corner from subway lines that will take you to midtown in 20 minutes, and a few minutes walk from chinatown, little italy, and tribeca.   The lobby team are also great, friendly, cheery and helpful.   If you like generic, full service luxury hotels dont stay here.   If you like distinction and understated cool, do stay here.

title: Bad Street, Bad Sleep...Just Bad
text: I booked a night at the 11 Howard after trying to book at the Gramercy Park hotel and being informed that they had no space. The reservation assistant mentioned that they could book me at their “sister hotel” - 11 Howard. After having had many good stays at the Gramercy, I (mistakenly) assumed that their 11 Howard location would be just as great.  Well, it wasn’t. First, the location: 11 Howard is on an alley-like street just north of Canal Street. For those unfamiliar with the location - it’s dirty with bags of garbage lining the street. Second, the hotel: 11 Howard has no lobby, just a dark vacant room, no check-in desk, no obvious security - just a girl in a sweatshirt, an empty table (hidden by a large pillar). Once “checked-in” the elevator (which has no security feature) takes anyone to any floor. Third, the club: Yes, that’s right - the hotel is attached to a Club. A thumping, ‘ungst-ungst’ raging Club. Noise.All.Night.Long. The worst part, is that the club noise doesn’t start until a little after 11pm...just about the time you close your eyes and just in time for you to be jarred awake and kept awake - all - night - long. Finally, the rooms and hallways are dark - creepy and basically dimmed just enough for you not be to able to see the grit. Let’s just say - I will never go back and I am so disappointed in the Gramercy Park Management for having recommended the 11 Howard Property. In fact, it was such a bad experience, I would never go back and I would think twice before going back to the Gramercy Park.

title: So many reasons to stay here....
text: 11 Howard is a wonderful, welcoming design hotel that I choose to stay at each time I come to NY.  The rooms are well designed in a simple clean style. The hosts/welcoming crew could not be more friendly and helpful.  And, if you come more than once, don't be surprised if they remember your name. The 2nd floor Library is a great area to relax, grab a light bite, socialize with a few friends and or get some work/ reading done.  I love that you are not confined to your room here. As a bonus...there is a 3rd floor infrared sauna spa that books up fast in the evening because of the incredible restorative benefits of infrared sauna sessions. I go each time I am in NY.  The in room services are conveniently managed through your in room tablet. The SOHO location is central to so many great cafe's, unique boutiques, galleries and other popular stores.  In the summer, I borrowed one of the bicycles to tour around Brooklyn.  If it rains, they'll make sure you are covered with one of their umbrella's.  And, if you are an SPG member, you can collect points for your stay as they have an affiliation.

title: Loving the fresh simplicity
text:
Had a wonderful stay at 11 Howard. Reception was in over drive and a different experience, the staff was super friendly and helpful. Room was true to images, great space, very clean and fresh, comfortable.
Was offered an umbrella when headed into the rain. 
Reservations and concierge team both very helpful and proactive, prior to check in and through stay. 
Thank you for a lovely retreat!

title: スタッフ最高、ローケション良し、部屋は狭し
text:
NYC滞在中、5泊中後半2泊11Howardホテルに滞在しました。Canal St駅から1ブロック。このブティックホテルはとてもおしゃれでスタッフのカジュアルな私服？に驚きました。フロント階のドアを開けてもらいたい、用事があるとき等他ゲストと見分けがつかないので若干戸惑いました。
部屋は１番安いレートのものだったのでこんなもんかなと。ビューもなく、とても狭く、エアコンがうるさく、ブティックホテルにありがちな全体的に使いにくい部屋ですが清潔感があります。ランクをあげればもっと快適な部屋になるのでしょう。スタッフはとてもヘルプフルで雰囲気は良いです。2階のライブラリーというスペースでは毎朝コーヒー、土曜日の夜にはワインをサービスしていました。朝、無料のコーヒーと共に有料の朝食をオーダー。アボカドトーストを2人でシェア。硬めのリーンなパンを半分にそれぞれオーバーイージーの卵をのせてチップ込みで30ドル。さすが、NYC。Soho、Tribeca等ロウアーマンハッタンが好きな方に。

title: Classy and chic hotel
text:
We stayed here for 10 nights over Christmas and New Year and absolutely loved it. There were two of us in a Double Double room - it was cozy but not cramped at all. There is lots of space to hang clothes, the bathroom is a good size with a lot of bench space and lovely toiletries. Very comfortable beds and good pillow selection too. We were on the 9th floor and it was relatively quiet. 11 Howard is in such a great location, close to lots of cool boutiques, restaurants and bars. After experiencing the madness of Midtown during Christmas it was so good to come back to our neighborhood and hotel at the end of the day, and relax in The Library with a glass of wine. 

Above all, the entire guest relations team ensured it was a seamless stay from check in through to advice on where to eat, go, and the best way to get there. They were always ready to help with a big smile and excellent local knowledge and I'd like to send them all a big thank you!  We can't wait to return.

title: Ideal location
text:
Great location, nice place, great people. 
The room we had in the first place wasn't satisfying and the staff quickly changed it.
Too bad it's so noisy! And bad constructed too: every time the guy next door was closing his door, my bed was quaking.

title: GREAT TECH
text: I stayed here for work and enjoyed the simplistic design of the rooms and service. Not so simplistic was the tech in the rooms though. There are great tablets that allow you to order everything you need. So easy and makes for someone traveling for work with little time to order room service, toiletries etc quickly and efficiently. Love that!

title: Home Away From Home
text: I've stayed at this hotel a number of times and it just feels more and more like home each time. The staff is absolutely wonderful and super helpful. The rooms are nicely sized and very cozy. I love ordering room service simply by using the iPad - no hassle and arrives shortly thereafter. Also, I am obsessed with the toiletries they offer. Lastly, the location is ideal - nearby a ton of shopping, eating, and subways. Highly recommend and can't wait to return.

title: Love this hotel!!
text:
We visited New York in October for a family holiday, and chose to stay at 11 Howard. When you arrive the staff greet you at the door and escorts you to a table to check in on an iPad, instead of a typical front desk. The hotel has a trendy and modern vibe but also very welcoming. 

We booked two rooms, both of which clean and comfortable. I especially liked the marble and gold in the bathroom, very aesthetically pleasing! The rooms also had an iPad each, instead of the tradition telephone to order room service, or call down to reception. 

The hotel is in the perfect location for shopping in Soho, and staff were very helpful in giving directions and tips on the best shops! Hotel is also only a short taxi ride from main touristy landmarks. 

On our last day, we made use of the Library on the second floor, and had some lovely food, while relaxing after a busy day.

Overall, the staff were very helpful and made our stay very enjoyable! Would definitely return again!

title: Love this hotel!
text:
Loved the hotel and the people. Highly recommend it.
Everything was designed so well, and kept up to very high standards. I really liked the location and check in was the fastest I’ve ever had. Also got a larger room then booked !

title: Very enjoyable stay
text:
This is an excellent hotel. Check in quick and easy if you understand that the traditional check in experience is old fashioned and unnecessary. 

Pros 
- Great location. Close to subway, downtown short walk, Brooklyn easily accessible. 
- Nice decor throughout 
- Cool library and bar 
- Friendly staff

Cons
- Don’t get wow factor of other NYC hotels in the lobby eg no Christmas tree. 
- Rooms are small - think this is the case throughout NYC but it’s very difficult to store your clothes and room ends up becoming messy
- watch your shins on the corner of the bed frame - very painful if you forget 

Overall we loved it and would def come again but would say it suits the under 40 generation a bit better. I don’t think my parents would love it here.

title: Classy but small
text: The bed was super comfy! Bathroom incredibly small not much room to move. I was a solo traveller and couldn't imagine fitting another person (two suitcases) in the room that I had (1 Queen Bed). The room itself was lovely (although air con was slightly difficult to get right). I had a really good price (via Qantas) so in terms of value I got what I paid for (location is pretty good). I wouldn't of wanted to pay anymore for what I got. You can hear the subway but it's nothing too bad. I would stay here again but would try others first. The reception is very minimal but the staff were mostly great. Housekeeping didn't clean my bathroom that well some days.

title: Night in the city
text:
Had a night in the city to meet up w old college friends. Found this hotel on orbitz. I searched for Vip and 5 Star. Booked this one.
Problem was the expectations. It is not 5 Star and not Vip (though not sure what that means exactly). 
When I checked in they said we have an upgrade but the upgrade room will be lower and will be much noisier. Seems like an offer nobody would accept and thus seemed odd to even offer. I rejected as a larger bed or room would be useless if I couldn’t sleep. I stayed w initial room which was quiet.
Valet is 75 and they use third party so they when leaving they recommend calling for car 40 minutes before u need it.
Tv was good
Room clean
Bathroom......small....not 5 Star. Towels abrasive. 
I guess in total the bathroom was the most out of line w the expectations. Water pressure was good in shower. 

Location was good. 
They offered me bottled water water when I checked in. That was nice. 
Staff was nice.

title: lovely setting - small rooms
text: Great location in lower Manhattan only steps away from the comercial district and Soho. The hotel is beautiful set - with an amazing gift shop - and a great Restaurant, love the muruals (reservation absolutely required) the rooms however are rather small. Front desk staff very friendly and helpful, Management staff a bit uneasy. Despite lots of technical gadgets  somehow slow.

title: Style over substance
text: This hotel is in an excellent location.  We booked it largely on the strength of reviews but were disappointed in the room.  We booked a Howard Deluxe room - a superior room category - and while we did avoid the noise issues mentioned by other reviewers, the room still seemed small even by New York standards.  We wondered about the sizes of the rooms in lower categories - they must be extremely small.  The furnishings were Scandinavian-influenced but there were noticeable scrapes on the walls and the upkeep of the room left something to be desired.  The staff were friendly but unfortunately their local knowledge was somewhat lacking - they couldn't recommend a doctor when my partner became ill.  In our view this hotel relies disproportionately on its location in order to charge the high room fees that it does.  In a nutshell it was stylish but lacked substance.

title: Loved 11 Howard. THE place to stay in Soho.
text:
I enjoyed so much about my family's two-night, two-room stay at 11 Howard: the super comfortable beds, great downtown location, complimentary bottled water (much needed and appreciated when traveling), mellow vibe of The Library (the second floor lounge), excellent complimentary morning coffee available in The Library, to name a few. 

My highest compliments go to the staff (door/bell/concierge/front desk), also known as Guest Experience Creators. These energetic gals and guys have great personalities and made me feel at home. No snooty, aloof attitude here. Just friendly, excellent service.

Ask for a room on a higher floor if you're concerned about  the subway noise mentioned in other reviews. My room was on the sixth floor in a section of the building said to be further away from subway disturbance. I was only vaguely aware of an occasional subway rumble. Not a problem whatsoever.

title: It was OKAY
text:
We decided to make a last minute trip to see The Tree in December and soon realized the prices of the rooms this time of year are quite high. We decided to try Hotwire for the first time to bid on a room and see what we got, it was just one night so why not? 
Anyway, this hotel was listed as a 5 star property in the description. Well we knew we would mostly likely get this room when we were looking by the description given by Hotwire. We saved almost $200 going through Hotwire instead of booking ourselves. The room itself was fine, small but that was ok. It was a clean room with a nice comfy bed. The only problem was the subway, you heard and felt the trains every 5-10 minutes in the room. I knew we were given this room because we booked through Hotwire and saved money. They must save these room just for Hotwire customers. We were on the 4th floor, probably higher rooms aren't bothered by the trains. So for me this is not a 5 star hotel and should not be listed as one because of the subway noise. The staff was friendly and helpful, gave us a couple bottles of water and told us to feel free to ask for more if we wanted. We loved the location of the hotel, its just a shame about the subway noise. We are coming back to NYC for 8 nights next month and are staying in a suite in another hotel( that is truly a 5 star) for less than we paid for this tiny room, what a difference a month makes.

title: Nice stay conveniently located in Soho neighbourhood...
text: Connected with Le Coucou Restaurant (see my review) this hotel is pricey but well situated in Soho. The staff are hipster cool and rooms are smallish for NYC sizes. Try for King or Suite upgrade. Concierge okay and wine/coffee at 2nd floor library. Good luck and enjoy!

title: Don't believe all the Hype and 5 star ratings
text:
As per Sylvie M this property is a farce.
I stayed here 4 months ago to check out the property for our group to stay for a friends celebration. 
During this stay I had all the issues and more of Sylvie M. 
What needs attention is the standard lines of management response "we welcome another chance to convince you of a 5* rating not a 2*.
Well here I am back in the hotel this time with my wife, assigned the same room I had 4 months ago with AC I can't turn on as it's so noisy. On check in they whisked my credit card away but I signed no registration form so hotel probably charging everything they can to my card inc the $150 a night accidentally that I haven't agreed to.
Add to that street noise and the ability to hear people shagging in the room next door what more can be said. 
Interaction with the hotel was as per my last visit "we will try and fix it and if you'd like to move to another room at extra cost that might have quieter AC we can help you" well it's now 4 nights into our stay and no follow up, AC still noisy as ever so we never use it.
Don't buy managements line of we'd like to change your mind on a return visit it isn't going to happen and I've experienced this first hand.
And to think I am also a platinum member with the awards program affiliated with the hotel and it seems to mean nothing apart from some points.
At no property in my travel life have I ever felt more unwelcome, ignored and annoyed especially when paying circa 500usd a night as I and our whole group is paying.
Avoid this property like the plague if you're after a restful nights sleep. If it's hanging with the "too cool for school" crowd and you don't value a good nights sleep then this property is for you.

title: Amazing space, even better staff.
text: Being greeted by Keylani and Kenny is truly a privilege. They make you feel like old friends in the chic “lobby” at 11 Howard. A hotel and experience far ahead of its time. Thanks again Keylani and Kenny for the best customer service in a while. We will be back!

title: Very comfy bed
text:
This hotel is uber cool with that kind of cool, dark vibe you get from your local Hollister shop.  I couldn't fault the front of house staff on the ground floor but on the first floor, the staff were too cool for school and I couldn't help feeling I was party to a guessing game about what was going on.  Couldn't be bothered to play the game so just winged it in blissful ignorance.  The room was small, but not by NYC standards.  The decor looked better than in the photographs (never happened before).  Really this is a really good 4 star hotel but I paid a 4 star price so shouldn't grumble.  The hotel is in a good place if exploring downtown is what you want to do.  It is between Lafayette and Broadway so good shops and restaurants abound.  One block South and you are on Canal Street, though, so beware!  

The bed was extremely comfortable with lovely linen.  Wax on the third (second) floor where you can feel the occasional rumble of the subway and the distant "boom-boom" of the nightclub.  I slept extremely well.

Proper, modern air con and a shower that worked well was a bonus.

title: PLEASANT SURPRISE
text:
For the first time in 15 years of NYC visits i have finally decided to stay in another hotel other than my beloved Hudson Hotel. The main reason for this switch in locations was to see the interior work Anda Andrei in person. As i had hoped the design lived up to my expectations. The contemporary and fresh spaces are simple, sophisticated and timeless. I really felt as if i was experiencing another layer of the new NYC.

The staff is professional and very welcoming. I appreciated the daily greetings (how everyone knew my name - i have no idea) and assistance inquiries which actually made me feel like the staff was genuinely concerned about my stay at the hotel. 

The initial check in to the hotel is a little different, but nothing to be alarmed by. Instead of the traditional receptionist/desk check in......guests gather around the large round table in the small lobby for check in. Any member of the hotel staff will check you in rather than a specific receptionist. 

The charming rooms are nicely sized,  smartly designed and very comfortable. I really cannot identify why.........but the rooms feel very private. 

Overall, i was pleasantly surprised with how much I enjoyed my stay at 11 HOWARD. I strongly recommend this hotel and will be back.

title: Amazing Hotel
text:
For my daughter’s 16th birthday we decided to celebrate in NY and chose to stay at 11 Howard. From the moment you arrive you realize what a special place this is. The staff greets you at the door and escorts you to a table to check in, rather than your typical front desk. Check in takes place on an iPad. The vibe of the hotel is contemporary and trendy, yet you are made to feel completely at home and welcomed. We were made to feel like VIPs even though it was our first time at the hotel.
We had 2 Deluxe King rooms that were incredible. They were very spacious and the bed was super comfy. You can tell that every design detail was well thought out from the sculpture-like cactus in the bathroom, to the mini bar built into the credenza, to the iPad instead of a conventional telephone to order room service or get information.
The hotel is in the perfect location for walking around and shopping in Soho. After a long day, we came back and relaxed in the Library on the second floor. This was a perfect spot to unwind and as an extra bonus, they were offering complimentary wine. Every staff member you come across makes you feel welcomed and are extremely friendly and accommodating.
We are so happy we chose 11 Howard for our celebration and can’t wait to return.

title: Chic hotel in fabulous location
text: My husband and I were lucky enough to spend eight nights at 11 Howard in June on our honeymoon. We honestly couldn't think of a better place to stay whilst visiting NYC. The staff are super cool, helpful and friendly and the location is second to none. Don't be put off by there being no 'front desk' - this doesn't take away from the experience at all - it actually makes it feel quicker and more modern. We stayed on the top floor after reading reviews about the lower floors being a bit noisy - highly recommend this. We both slept so well (amazing bed) and the room, although small, was just perfect for us. When we finally get back to NYC, we know where we're staying!

title: 11 Howard
text: Enjoyed our stay, the staff was lovely and Kenny went out of his way to inquire about our day and help out in any possible. There are no bell hops - the staff member does it all  and it starts when greeted outside. You quickly go  through the check in process at a cement table in the concrete lobby. Tablets are efficiently used and you are on your way to your room. It would have been helpful to have "learned more details about Library, night club, restaurant" on arrival.  The restaurant was quite good for breakfast. Room comfortable/smallish side. Bedding & pillows very nice. Black out curtains great and bath good size. You could hear/feel rumble of subway at times.  Upper floor should be requested if possible. Would return.

title: 11 Howard
text: We really enjoyed our too quick stay at 11 Howard. The staff is friendly and ready to offer any assistance needed. We stayed on a Tuesday and were offered complimentary wine in the “Library”. The room was clean and comfortable with a lovely view. Check in and check out was quick and easy. We also enjoyed breakfast in the Library. A little pricey but worth it for the ambiance and delicious coffee. Treat yourself!! Shout out to Rob, thanks for all of your help.

title: Confortable et idéalement situé
text:
Nous avons passé 4 nuits au 11 Howard. Nous l'avions choisi pour son style moderne et aussi pour sa localisation, côté Soho. Aucun regret.
L'hôtel est parfaitement situé comme nous le souhaitions, dans le quartier de Soho, proche de Little Italy, West et East Village .tout est faisable à pieds sans problème.
La déco de l'hôtel est moderne et design, la chambre même la supérieure reste petite mais correcte.
Le petit dejeuner est excellent. Il est à la carte et honnêtement c'est l'un des meilleurs que nous ayons pris durant notre séjour.

title: Magnifique décoration mais hôtel surcôté par des prestations moyennes!!! Super Bruyant!!
text:
Magnifique hôtel avec décoration hyper branché!!! Mais  le service offert n'est pas à la hauteur du tarif. Chambres minuscules, climatisation hyper hyper bruyante (genre moteur d'avion), zéro kit de salle de bain, même pas de tapis de salle de bain, lits tout petits.
Mais surtout au 5ème étage on entend une bonne partie de la nuit le bruit du bar qui est dans l'hôtel, insupportable. 
Enfin, prévoir du temps pour le service du petit déjeuner: désorganisation totale et attente impossible.

title: Nice rooms, good location
text: My wife and 16 year old son stayed here 3 nights. It was clean, quite and staffed with helpful people. NIce beds. Good location for shopping, and we walked down to the 9-11 memorial and Brooklyn Bridge. The hotel room was kinda small, but this is NYC. They have a nice "library" with a variety of comfy chairs and tables if you need some away time from your family. Free wine for happy hour is a nice touch, and popular too. We heard the train several times, but honestly that would be hard to describe as noisy. I'd stay there again and recommend it to friends.

title: Great location but small room for the price
text: Clean room,great location,attentive staff,400.00 a night plus 75.00 fee for parking per night,for the price i would expect a larger room ( I know its NY) common area was nice and offered free wine at certain hours,the bar "Blonde" had great drinks, again $$$

title: Spare me
text:
