If achingly hip boutique hotels are your thing, then get yourself a room here. If turned up trousers, waxed beards & dogs on string being walked by models makes you quiver with joy, book it.

The rooms are small even for NYC. Took me 10 minutes to find the cupboard and then there was no ironing board. It’s probably unacceptable to iron a shirt on the lower east side or you have to do it with a rolling pin on a length of sandpaper but I’m more traditional I guess? They have Marriotts for that stuff right? Using the in room tablet I was able to order a direct ironing board delivery to the room in minutes, which was nice. The tablets are a plus point by the way. 

The air con was broken in the room but I wasn’t there long enough to care. There is a really big TV if you fancy watching adverts interspersed with TV shows. The bed was very good indeed.

Reception is a round table and some tablets to check you in. They still have to take your credit card to another room to do something, which I’m assuming isn’t to clone it. This shouldn’t be necessary anymore. Cards should stay in sight.

The staff are excellent though. Really helpful & friendly despite having to dress like clones from Star Trek. 

Lots of the cliches are covered here. There was a pushbike parked in reception for example. The bar is on point but not always open. Yes, it’s expensive but it would be.

The location is great if you like the boutique scene & you’re not too far from anywhere with the transport system.

There will be a place like this in Hoxton in a year or so for sure.

There’s nothing too wrong with it but then it’s competing with equally pretentious establishments nearby, desperately trying to be cool as & they get it right from that perspective. I’d go back but this weeks hip is next weeks dated around here so they will just have to stay on trend. They have the staff and the location to do that for sure. 

Maybe I’m just getting cynical in my old age. Basically I’m in one of the greatest cities in the world and I’m bothered about an ironing board.

title: Hope you ❤️ trains!
text: Interesting hotel.  Great Soho location.  What I was not prepared for was that the #6 train runs directly under the hotel, so the hotel rumbles and is noisy seemingly 24/7 (not sure if the #6 runs 24/7 but train was running when I went to sleep and when I awakened!).  No frills here.  No minibar, but you do get a mini frig.  Bedside iPad-like device with limited capacity for requests...does not interact with TV.  Speaking of TV’s, I had a corner room with a TV on each side of the King bed, which was such a bizarre layout.  The large screen TV was opposite (~5’ !!!!) the crammed in table & 2 chairs, very uncomfortable seating.  The tiny TV screen was mounted adjacent to the bed—-weird!  See my photos.  I would have preferred to have the second TV in the bathroom.  No toiletries but the basic shampoo, conditioner, lotion and bath gel. No Q-tips or cotton balls for this eco-friendly hotel.  The closet lighting was so energy efficient you cannot see a thing!  There is a single ~10” strip light for the entire closet in the entry hall, even with the entry lights on, I had to use my phone flashlight to find my clothes and use the safe.  Staff was super free friendly and helpful.

title: Fun Boutique Hotel
text: 11 Howard's location is perfect!  The hotel is small and boutique, as are their rooms... but the beds and comfort levels are amazing.  I was skeptical at first, but after sleeping the first night in that amazing bed, I was sold.  The bath products are amazing too.  I travel all the time and I am very fussy when it comes to hotels.  For the price point, this is top notch.

title: Perfect Bachelorette Celebration!
text: We stayed in the Terrace Suite for 2 nights. All the staff were extremely friendly and accommodating with all our special requests ie. late check-out, having deliveries made to the hotel, extra help in the suite. The hotel design is super chic and beds are extremely comfy! Perfect location in downtown Manhattan - quiet block and walking distance to everything you need. We had the best time and we'll definitely be back again!

title: Exceptional staff, great location, clean & modern hotel.
text:
For context: I've stayed 26+ nights at 11Howard in the past 2 months (work travel).

I switched to the hotel looking for a better location over the usual financial district hotel I had been staying at previously, and 11Howard did not disappoint. Conveniently located near several metro stops, Chinatown, and SoHo-- there are many great restaurants, shops, and more within walking distance.

The rooms are not enormous (I stay primarily in the King/King Deluxe rooms), but they are perfect for my needs. The beds are very comfortable (they lean more on the soft side), the showers are great, and the amenities are very nice-- I especially love the soap. Best of all, the rooms are impeccably clean. In the 10+ stays I've had, I've never found as much as a stray hair. 

Most importantly for me, the staff is phenomenal. They are all extremely friendly and go out of their way to make life easy on everyone that comes in the lobby. 

One word of caution: like all hotels in NYC, 11 Howard is not immune to street/subway/etc. noise. As I understand it, they are installing more soundproofing by the week, so some floors are quieter than others. Don't expect to stay in such a vibrant area without a bit of noise. 

Overall, I'm very pleased with the hotel and staff and will continue to stay at 11 Howard, as well as, recommend to friends and coworkers.

title: Visit to family member - great location and fun ambience
text: Never stayed in Lower East side, so this hotel was a good option. 1 block to subway, on edge of shopping areas. Room quiet and comfortable, and staff were very friendly and helpful. Great spot for breakfast ( and I learned later for dinner also ) and the bar is cozy, the bar tender prepared a great manhattan and good to chat with. I would stay here again.

title: Perfect Staycation!
text: Needing a quick getaway from our two children, two cats and endless responsibilities, my wife and I hopped on the subway from the Upper West Side to find refuge at 11 Howard. We had spg points and were hoping to find something more interesting than — well — another Westin. 11 Howard delivered in spades. The location is unbeatable, the service (like the overall vibe) is minimal but warm, and the room is gorgeous in its chic Nordic design. A large bathroom with sleek, sexy furnishings is a delight for anyone who’s tried squeezing into most New York City bathrooms. The lounge is moody and hip without being pretentious. Bottom line: if you want to be fussed over in an obsequious way, 11 Howard is not for you. But, if you appreciate being located in THE coolest area of New York City, and want both form and function, book now!

title: Perfect location, friendliest staff and probably the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in! Loved it!
text: We had an amazing experience at 11 Howard! The staff was always very kind and ready to help, it was an absolute pleasant environment to be in and arrive at the end of an exhausting day. The beds in the room were extremely comfortable, probably one of the best we ever slept in!

title: Stylish hotel with excellent service.
text:
We decided to stay at 11Howard as the reviews were good and the photos looked great and it did not disappoint! In a nutshell, good location ( a short walk to all the funky restaurants, bars and shops of Soho and around the corner from Canal Street Station), very clean and stylish rooms and, most importantly, SUPERB service! The concierge team could not have been more helpful and the general manager was super attentive and charming. 
The Library provides a comfortable and stylish place to eat delicious food, catch up on emails and plan the day and an in house bar and restaurant look fabulous, we just didn't have time to check them out. We would definitely stay again.

title: 3 nuits en couple
text: Nous avons passé trois nuits dans l'hôtel en chambre Deluxe. Bon accueil dans le hall avec bouteille d'eau offerte. Check in très rapide. La chambre était magnifique, vue dégagée sur les rues de NY, grande salle de bains avec produits de douche hauts de gamme. Suffisamment de rangements. Pas bruyant. Nous avons pris 2 petits déjeuners à l’extérieur avant de nous rendre compte de ceux servis à l’hôtel étaient délicieux, de l'avocado toast aux pancakes, rien à redire. Pein de restaurants/magasins a proximité de l'hotel. Nous reviendrons avec plaisir.

title: Fabulous Location & Atmosphere
text: We stayed at 11 Howard in early September this year. The hotel was fantastic; beautiful design elements, considered room layouts, great staff and a fabulous atmosphere. It was the midst of New York Fashion Week, so there were several great events on open to all hotel guests, which was fun. This added to the atmosphere - all round, a great stay. We hope to get back soon.

title: Room Rattle, Shake and Roll
text:
Extremely disappointed and makes me reconsider the value of trip advisor.
2 star Hotel at best. Wouldn't pay over $150.00 a night at most.
Severe room rattle from the subway, every 3-5 minutes, thumping from the 2nd floor disco most of the night. Room so small, couldn't even open suitcase all the way. They put a table in the bathroom to put things on since the counter is so small. The table blocks the bathroom so it is difficult to either get to the toilet or sit on it. Take your choice.
The GM refused request to discount room based on experience.  I feel totally false advertising....As stated 1 or 2 stars at best. Oh, it was getting close to 9am and the staff bought out a small pot of coffee telling everyone that since it was getting close to 9, they did not have to accommodate everyone who were waiting 5-10 minutes for coffee. The staff simply told everyone that they would have to order coffee to their room.  Yes, 1 star service to go along with the 1 star property.  Incidentally,  we just got back from staying at one of the nicest properties in Venice and paid the same per night. 
My advice....STAY AWAY FROM 11 HOWARD!!
(unless you pay what it is worth, say $150/night.

title: Chic, fun hotel matched with a staff that is accommodating, affable and anticipatory, all in an unbeatable location.
text: Bringing our teenage daughter and her new Chinese friend to New York City, we originally booked in Times Square -- until we came to our senses!  We first found the perfect neighborhood, with easy walking access to the East Village, Lower East Side, SOHO, NOHO, Chinatown, The Village.  Endless hotel research kept turning up 11 Howard -- and the commentary turned out to be accurate.  Comfortable, relaxed chic, indefinable energetic vibe, nice rooms and amenities, and the secret ingredient of staff that is without exception friendly, helpful, accommodating and professionally unobtrusive.  Hotel website has excellent recommendations for restaurants and other diversions, the first of which earned rave reviews from our Chinese guest for the quality of its Shanghai food.  We admired the hotel bikes, but never found the time to borrow a set of them.  Next time!  We came for pleasure, but  it would be an equally welcoming and comfortable business hotel destination.  Looking forward to our next visit.

title: Fantastic library!
text: My wife and I stayed at the 11 Howard in September and were very impressed! From the quick and simple checkin process, to the elegantly furnished rooms, we couldn’t have been more satisfied with our stay. Our most favorite part was the beautiful lounge (aka “the library”)... such a classy spot for an evening cocktail and comfortable for our morning coffee!

title: cooles Hotel
text: Nagelneu kommt es daher. Wir kannten noch das alte abgewohnte Holiday Inn - das ist jetzt aber ein Unterschied wie Tag und Nacht. Sehr zu empfehlen. Bar vor Anreise buchen, da die 11Howard Bar zu den Scene Bars in NewYork zählt.

title: 10th visit
text: I recently visited 11 Howard for my 10th stay. I trained into NYC with no reservation. The staff hustled me into a room with little to no hassle with a great rate for a Fall room anywhere in the northeast. I love the architecture, the staff, the beds, the cleanliness. Can’t wait to get back.

title: Not Excellent but Fine
text:
Great hotel just not an Excellent hotel. 
Room was certainly teeny tiny but again, as to be expected in NYC.
Great location in SoHo, corner of Lafayette and Howard.
Check in was confusing. There is absolutely no reception desk. Definitely going for the minimalist vibe but they took it too far. Finally we had one of the valet dudes type in some info on a tablet and we managed to get a key card. 
Not much going on in the hotel in terms of amenities. no restaurant, rooftop bar, lounge to speak of. hotel is attached to some trendy manhattan club, the Blonde but I never got a chance to venture over. Loud, pumping music coming from there until 3 or 4 am with beautiful people standing out front, that type of thing. Couldn't hear any of the noise from the room though. 
Room was nice, bed was comfy just everything was compacted. Stayed for 2 nights with my bff and we were crammed. Not enough space for even one person to move around the bathroom. 
Can't comment on any staff members because I never saw any aside from valet dudes who checked us in.

title: bem localizado e confortavel
text:
o hotel fica no Soho bem localizado, perto do metro. Ele é moderno, com quartos bem confortáveis, silenciosos. Serviço foi ótimo, sempre que precisamos. 
Fizemos late check out sem problemas (avisamos com antecedência).

title: Excellent, hip hotel in great location
text:
I've stayed here multiple times now, and I really love it—it's my go-to spot for staying in Lower Manhattan. The minimalist aesthetic is very chic, but what I really like is that, unlike some other design-focussed hotels, they don't skimp on the service. To the contrary: the service from everyone I've interacted with at the front and throughout the hotel has been friendly, helpful, and professional.

Among my favorite little touches of this hotel: you can schedule the time when they will clean your room on the in-room tablet, so that cleaning doesn't interfere with your day; excellent, fast, free wi-fi that only takes one quick login per stay; terrific showers and bath amenities for a Manhattan hotel; and the second-floor library, which is a great space for having breakfast or doing some work. Combine those with their participation in the SPG program, nice rooms, and comfortable beds, and you've really got a great property.

Overall, this is really the perfect version of a hip, boutique design hotel. If you want huge rooms, a full-service spa, and five restaurants in the hotel, go elsewhere. But if you want a quintessential SoHo experience, stay here.

title: All about the details
text: Stayed for a night on business. Great location, and the room was gorgeous. Chic styling done with an understated, peaceful vibe. For a small room it had what I needed, including a nice table/workspace. Bathroom was stunning - loved the brass fittings! Comfy bed.

title: Nice hotel; great location for business travelers.
text: I stayed here during a recent business trip to NYC. The hotel is well located for business travelers to Manhattan, with easy access to both Penn Station or LGA, as well as close to the financial district in lower manhattan. The hotel itself is nice. Quite modern decor. Wasn't particularly thrilled about the lobby but it works. My favorite thing was the size of the rooms. Definitely on the high end of size for hotels in manhattan within this price range.

title: Nice New York Room, Excellent Location!
text: The rooms and hotel are nice and clean. The room size is to be expected for NYC, but it's not terribly tiny. The location is definitely the highlight of this hotel for me. You're steps to everything in Soho. The customer service is not always A+, which is why I gave the hotel 4 stars. During our stay, I needed to book a 4th room, and I had to uber someone on my team back to the hotel to pay for it because they couldn't take my card over the phone. Ummmmmm, can we say stone age?! Additionally, I needed late checkout on 3 of the 4 rooms I had booked and it was a 30 minute debate with the manager.  Even though the hotel wasn't sold out, he needed those rooms and 1 hour was just more than he could do. He finally conceded when i told him i needed the delay due to the hurricane in Houston. It just shouldn't have been this difficult. They were very accommodating in holding my shipments and making sure they got shipped back to me, so their customer service did have some redeeming qualities. Overall, would i stay again? Yes.

title: 纽约文艺SOHO区的时尚简约风酒店
text:
优点: 楼下法式西餐厅le coucou非常好吃，酒店对面的smile to go简餐店也强烈推荐。酒店入住客人都是潮人，酒店所在soho区，周边3公里内全部是潮店。离中国城，小意大利也很近。

缺点: 双人房太小，也就能放下两张床。衣柜和桌面都有灰尘，毛巾都脱线了还不换新。地理位置离纽约上东区和中心花园都30分钟车程，比较远。楼下是地铁，轰隆轰隆，要住一定选高楼层。

title: Beautiful room
text:
The room style is very nice and cosy, plenty of room (Queen bed room). The staff is super and recommended nice place for diner
A good location near little Italy and the shopping street broadway, where you can find all the main stores and other pop up stores. Canal street métro station is at the corner of the block. 

I would just point out one thing, the bar of the hotel becomes a club, which caused some bass sounds. But didn’t disturb me that much. 

Would definitely recommend this place

title: The Ultimate New York Hotel
text:
I've been traveling to New York City for many years and have found myself there about once a month recently.  As an SPG Preferred Guest, I usually just find the best deal across the many Starwood options and rotate around the different neighborhoods.  But I recently gave 11 Howard (part of Design Hotels, participates in the SPG program) a try and realized what I've been missing everywhere else.  

Don't get me wrong - most Starwood hotels are perfectly adequate and often very, very nice.  But this place was different.  It has a special level of sophistication in its sleek lobby and 2nd floor Library.  The SoHo location is straight out of the idyllic version of New York you see in the movies.  Rooms are sparingly decorated without any clutter, hardwood floors are more like an apartment versus a hotel room, and the beds are cushy and ultra-comfortable.  The bathrooms are good-sized for a New York hotel and very well appointed.  The shower has great water pressure and the toiletries all smell and feel fantastic.

But I have to say one of the most significant differences here is the service.  Everyone is so incredibly friendly, but not in an overzealous way that can sometimes be uncomfortable.  More like a friend would treat you - just really caring and warm.  During my two visits so far, the staff in the lobby addressed me by my name each time they saw me.  Again, like they've known me for years.  It's a really nice intangible that I've found to be so meaningful.

11 Howard is not an inexpensive option, but I am a believer in value.  Sometimes you get a lot when you spend a little more.  New York is a magical place, and that experience is deserving of a hotel on this level.

title: Long weekend
text:
Our stay at 11Howard was quite nice.
Charming hotel~ helpful attendants~ good location.  Rooms well appointed~ clean~ quiet.
No information on the bar as we did not use it and we did not eat in the hotel.

title: Below expectations, but a stylish option.
text:
Hotel style, lobby, lounge, bar and staff were great, but it does have some structural problems and our room was very small.

The hotel has a very good location, but too close to Canal street - not a very pleasant street...

When checking in, they offered us a room on the west side of the building (final 17) which should be quitter as it was not above the subway line (famous negative point as it does make the hotel vibrate)... The room was just beside the housekeeping room and it had a very loud noise! They changed us to an east side room (final 9), which had a quitter neighborhood, but with the famous subway vibration...

The checkin time was guaranteed at 3pm, but we had to wait more 25’... The front desk person said the time was guaranteed, but as we had chosen a specific room the 3pm guarantee was not possible... But we hadn’t chose a room - it was offered and said that 3pm was guaranteed! Very annoying! Nothing was offered to compensate the delay.

Hard to know if the allocated room had the same category as booked... We had a Howard Senior King, but it looked much like the Howard King assuming the hotel website pictures... Bed was comfortable! Almost inexistent closet space and with an empty room fridge. No complimentary water was offered daily. Bathroom was VERY small, but shower and toiletries were very good. Their ‘in room gadget’ was useful, mainly to schedule housekeeping time (btw, housekeeping was very efficient). Air conditioning was VERY noisy and didn’t have an air flow speed control - or it was on or off... Room had bad acoustic, and it was possible to hear our neighbors alarm clock and phone calls... TV didn’t have some of US key entertainment channels.

Restaurant downstairs was great, but as it is not managed by the hotel it was easier to book directly with them. Hotel lounge and bar on 2nd floor were GREAT! There is not a decent gym inside the hotel, but they offer you a complimentary voucher to a very good gym nearby!

We were disappointed with room size and structure and with checkin staff attitude, but we liked very much our stay. We thought of giving a 3 out of 5 rate, but we because of the hotel style we decided for a 4.

title: Awesome Hotel ❤️
text:
Like being taken care of by your own loving family! 

I have stayed in hotels large and small all over the world. The 11 Howard is top value. The best "boutique" hotel in NYC. 

From the moment you walk through the door Joe, Adan, Kenny and everyone else is going to take the best care of you!!! The rooms are immaculate and the maids (and "maidos" - my name for male room attendants) go beyond the call to make sure you are comfortable and have everything you need. Every encounter with the staff feels good and all done with smiles and kindness. 

The entire staff is very knowledgeable and experienced. They take the time to ensure you have an excellent stay. Even the doorman functions with the knowledge of a great concierge! The team are honestly good people who love their hotel, their jobs, and they show great respect for all the clients as well as each other.

The hotel rooms also have good views, lots of light and very comfortable furniture. Superb beds and the best showers I've ever had in a hotel.

Finally, the lounge on the second floor will rock your world with comfort. 💗🍷🎉

title: Chic and Minimalist
text: 11 Howard is the perfect hotel for those who appreciate a chic atmosphere, modern design and a minimalist aesthetic. Hotel guest services are 100% accommodating and respectful making your stay feel special and your needs important. The location could not be better with The Smile across the street and access to the best of SoHo shopping the moment you step out the door. With all the top tier amenities and both healthy and indulgent options at a touch of button it's perfect for on the go, business and leisure. Mr. England is your man for knowledge and access, make sure to connect with him when building your itinerary. Simply puy: If you want a hip, chic, high design and cool kid staff experience - this is the place.

title: Minimalismo modernità
text: Struttura molto curata e pensata nei dettagli, nel contempo elegante semplice e moderna. Materiali belli e colori caldi. I locali sono molto alti. Le camere non sono enormi, il bagno spazioso. Personale giovane, gentile. Il bar e il ristorante (esterno) sono molto belli, ottimo ambiente e piatti eccellenti. L'albergo è al bordo Soho/little Italy. Si raggiunge bene a piedi il Financial District e tutta Lower Manhattan.

title: A Very Comfortable Stay
text: I stayed at the 11 Howard with a friend for a weekend get-a-away. The location is excellent right in the heart of Soho and we were within walking to our favourite restaurant (Jack's Wife Freida) and exercise classes (The Class by Taryn Toomey and S10). There is a nice relaxing "library" where you can get work done or have a meal and the service there is very good. The rooms are not spacious nor are the bathrooms but they were on par with other hotels in this class in New York. Overall a comfortable and convenient place to stay.

title: Luxury Hotel in Chinatown
text: The hotel smell great and everything was very stylish. Room was located on the 5th floor on the east side of the building and could hear and feel the subway train underneath. Later noticed extra charges on my credit card with no explanation.

title: Friendly Hotel in a cool Location
text:
Me and my wife stayed at this hotel during my recent visit to New York. The hotel was very stylish and it is not your traditional hotel. There is no reception desk instead there is a lounging area where the staff stand with tablets to do a quick check in (it literally took us 5 minutes from entering until we were inside our room).

The rooms are very stylish and the layout is good for two people to move around without any problem.

The best thing about the hotel were the staff, they are all young energetic, We got a lot of fantastic recommendations from the concierge for things to do they know the area very well so I highly recommend you ask for recommendation for places to go, not only the concierge but even the staff on the ground told us about a couple of coffee places to try.

One thing to note! the hotel is on top of a subway lane and every now and then you will feel a vibration in the whole hotel due to the subway passing (I was on the 5th floor and I can feel it) we got used to it by our second day and honestly I enjoy it as it gave a certain new york-esque feeling to the hotel.

title: Terrific, modern hotel
text: Great staff with very nice, modern rooms. The rooms are also maintained very often and are always perfect. I love the little perks that we get, like mini-chocolate bars. Of course, can't be the location is Soho.

title: Great Hotel in Soho
text: This hotel was in a great location.  The staff and service was exceptional.  Very peaceful and calming place.  We stayed there to get away from the path of Irma.  Although a bit pricey I would strongly recommend this hotel.

title: Stylish hotel in cool location
text:
I stayed nine nights last month - the hotel is round the corner (a two-minute walk) from Canal Street subway and great shopping on Broadway and adjacent streets. 11 Howard is stylish with beautiful rooms (immaculately made up by housekeeping each day). The staff were friendly and helpful too, always willing to offer tips and advice.
I thought it may be too hip upon arrival - they don't have a 'traditional' style check-in desk and everything is arranged on tablet computers - but as soon as you get your head around that it works well.
Admittedly, that may not be to everyone's taste, so take that into consideration if you're looking for a stay somewhere less design-led. For example, the corridors are very dark with minimal lighting and that may make some people less comfortable.
Soho itself is a fantastic part of the city - a great mix of high street retailers, designer names and so many cool little independent boutiques. It's also easy walking distance to Little Italy/East Village/Chinatown so perfect for exploring and only a couple of Subway stops from the World Trade Centre site and Brooklyn Bridge.

title: This is a review of the Blond Bar
text:
This is a newish boutique hotel bar very convenient to the Canal St.6 subway. 

You access it off Howard St., just down Lafayette and ascend via a spiral staircase. Much easier than coming down after a few adult beverages. ;-)

We were celebrating so didn't mind the outrageous price of Dom Perignon at $75.00 per glass, but the bottles were just too expensive.

Once we settled in with some late summer suited crisp rose. we kicked back and enjoyed the beautiful people dressed for NYC action. Our server was very attentive.

We had bar snacks that were very substantial. They make a mean medium rare hamburger, high quality meat and big enough to share.The chicken tenders were especially good as they were fried in a minimum of oil.

title: lacked comfort and far too noisy
text:
The Howard 11 has tried too hard to be minimalist and sleek taking away much comfort you would want in a hotel for a pleasure stay .  Our room on the third floor rattled continuously from the subway and was so loud from the night club (could sing along to the lyrics ) til 4am on Sunday morning . The rooms were also too small making it hard for two people to put away anything or even walk around .
Lounge area was unfortunately lacking in enough setting for all their guests .  Three different groups came in Sunday morning and nowhere to sit.  " i Guess we have to go to Starbucks" is not what your guests should be saying.  Seemed to work well for the business crowd where they could hold meetings, talk on cell phones and be on their computers .  Not a relaxing environment you want in a hotel.  The gym is ridiculously small and i suggest you move it to 310 due to your noise problem.  
Staff where helpful and friendly.

title: Favorite hotel in NYC
text: Beautiful hotel in a great location. The rooms are spotless, the staff are professional and friendly. The hotel is very comfortable and well equipped.  It even has a signature scent that is so relaxing and welcoming. Highly recommended.

title: 11 Howard, a find!
text: A well situated modern, elegant and stylish hotel. Small, cozy and well designed rooms with a friendly staff. 24 hour room service with tasty options. Nice common area for breakfast, drinks, check your emails or meetings. Also an elegant bar

title: Spot on!  I had high expectations; and they were met.
text:
11 Howard is a chic boutique hotel.  The space is minimalist modern with a real intimate calming feel.  The front door greeters were refreshingly pleasant- providing an efficient check-in; a friendly 'hello' or 'goodbye' each time we entered or exited the foyer; and they were always asking if everything was satisfactory, did we need any guidance, an update on the weather, etc., etc.  Whoever chose this front of house team got it right!  The smiles and genuine care were hard to go unnoticed and a nice touch.

The common spaces of the hotel are quite nice- the Living Room (where the concierge sits) is a very friendly/comfortable area with individual sitting areas as well as a large communal table.  This was a great space to relax in the morning with a complimentary cup of coffee; and in the evening for their wine hour which happens several days during the week.  The Blond Bar immediately off of the Living Room is one of the hottest bars in town...  the space is absolutely gorgeous.  If you like fine craft cocktails and art, this place is a must! Be sure to take a look at all the cool animal/mask sculptures by artist Charming Baker.  The Blond has a very big collection of his work.  

Our room was comfortably cozy.  We were in a Howard King.  The bed slept well, the large screen TV was appreciated, and the bathroom had excellent toiletries. An A+ goes to the housekeeping staff. They did an excellent job servicing our room.

While all of the staff we encountered were great; there were two particular standouts:  Bryan, Concierge; and Dillon, Blond Bar.  Bryan and Dillon both took an interest in ensuring we had everything we needed in order to have the best stay possible.  Thank you to Bryan and Dillon for your excellent customer focus!

When we return to NYC, 11 Howard is where we'll be!

title: Too minimalist in service and access
text:
11 Howard hotel not worthy of high reviews. If you want to be a top rated hotel you cannot have it both ways. You can't be a minimalist hotel trusting on service to make the lack of luxury irrelevant if you sell out your bar at night, understaffed check in and have a terrible gym. 

Rooms are nice if small, but challenges were rampant:

1)15 minutes to check into a lobby with concrete floors and almost no furniture. 
2) Hotel sublets its bar out at night so no bar for guests after 10:00
3) restaurant doesn't have a full menu, and ran out of coffee in the am. 
 
For me 11 Howard wasn't a great stay.

title: Perfect location, best service
text: Always love the 11 Howard hotel - I stay for business often. The staff are fantastic, the rooms are clean, and it's located right in downtown Soho. The hotel is quite modern and beautifully designed. The staff at the hotel (who all know me by name now) always offer to go the extra mile for their guests.

title: MY FAV HOTEL İN NYC
text: I stayed here with my family in Aug and I liked this hotel too much! First of all, the location is awesome, in the middle of Soho. on the same street there are many fancy young brands like reformation, opening ceremony,super retro. My fav place for breakfast which is Jacks Wife Freda is just 5 min away by walking! Rooms are so clean, the bed was the best for me, so comfortable! Check in is so quick, lobby is so cozy. What else does a guest expect. Thank you 11 Howard team! Secil Erdogan

title: insomniacs rule ok
text:
We booked through BA as part of a package and I hadn't researched the hotel assuming a BA recommendation would be good enough. How wrong can you be. 
Howard street is a scruffy street on the bottom edge of Soho and far removed from the cool and trendy core Soho streets like Mercer. 
The hotel is on a busy junction of roads including Lafayette and Canal which are noisy and full of poor quality shops like 7 11 and other low level food stores. 
The traffic noise was loud in our room and also in the communal library and bar areas. In fact that's an understatement, the noise level kept us awake or woke us early each morning. The windows are double glazed and closed but the noise level is so loud you could convince yourself they are wide open. In addition the hotel is close to Canal subway station which is very convenient but every few minutes you hear rumbling and feel vibrations as a train goes by.
To make things worse the air conditioning in the room was affective in controlling the temperature but sounded like a jet was taking off when the fan started. The walls between the rooms must be paper thin as we heard the tv in the adjacent room and even the alarm ringing on a mobile phone. 
The corridors are narrow and dark with numerous rooms leading off them meaning you hear other guests coming and going and the noise of doors slamming shut. 
This hotel has a noise issue which no amount of background music is going to cure. I know this city never sleeps but I need to and didn't. 
Our room was very small best described as tiny and really not big enough to accommodate two people. As a result the double bed is small ,there is also a desk and a chair but nothing else would fit in.  The decor is plain,simple ,somewhat boring and more like a budget hotel rather than a well designed Scandinavian concept. 
The room has a small bathroom which is functional but one at a time please as the space is very tight. Both the room and bathroom were clean and well maintained. 
I initially didn't like the thought of using the iPad in the room to order room service, housekeeping, laundry etc but the system is intuitive and easy to use and the hotel staff reacted quickly and efficiently to requests. 
The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful and many of them went beyond what I might expect to help us. We went to the US open by subway and one of the guys on reception helped me plan the trip and printed off copies of the route. 
Noise is the big problem with this hotel but the staff and service go some way to compensate. 
I raised my noise complaint with a manager who listened politely and offered compensation. However, there is little he can do as the noise is a structural issue he can't resolve.

title: Great service
text:
We had a great stay. The hotel is modern, beautifully designed and perfectly located in Soho. The one thing I would add is to have turndown service. It is so great to come back from a night out and have your room refreshed. 

Also, the cleaning service was a bit off a couple days, when the cleaners forgot to empty the trash cans and wash the glasses we used. Again, this is fine tuning. 

The staff is very helpful and eager for you to enjoy your stay. Special thanks to Adam who was very pleasant at check-in and got us a nice room.

title: Très bon séjour
text:
Bon hôtel, très bien équipé avec une literie confortable et une chambre assez spacieuse (king) sobre et jolie. Aucun problème d'insonorisation ; chambre très calme. Wi-Fi gratuit. 
La commande du petit déjeuner avec la tablette est très simple et la livraison en chambre toujours parfaitement dans les créneaux horaires choisis. Bon petit déjeuner et bon pancakes !! 
Seuls petits bémols : la salle de bain est petite même dans la chambre king mais elle reste agréable et très bien éclairée ; la climatisation fait beaucoup de bruit et il est difficile de dormir en la laissant tourner ; pas beaucoup de prises pour recharger ces appareils mais c'est souvent le pb dans les hôtels. 
J'y retournerai sans hésiter !

title: Sad place
text:
If you seek for comfort, and trustful place - in terms of your payments and card transactions, never come here. Rooms have nothing to offer except the bed and shower. Nobody tried to make it cosy. I could accept it, if the price would be twice less. The worst experience I had with payments, I spent two days after leaving the hotel, to get my deposit back. I made about 10-15 calls and spent hours to talk to différent managers every time. 
I can point out the bar downstairs, which is so popular, and provide the traffic to this hotel. If you want to be in crowd and noise, this is the place.

title: I loved staying at 11 Howard and perfect soho spot!
text: Most friendly and helpful staff ever, so lovely and great first impression. Couldn't have been more sweet. Everything about the hotel was exceptional. It was super clean, stylish, cozy with excellent service. Room itself was well equipped and comfortable. We also had a delicious dinner at the restaurant of the hotel.  I was very pleased with my stay and I hope to be back for a longer visit in the future.

title: Superficial and weak
text:
I stayed at 11 Howard for 14 nights and what a disappointment it has been. 

After this trip, I am left with the understanding that this establishment and the majority of its team are superficial and weak. 

Prior to arriving, I was refused a price match for my stay (a price match which was AUD$2,300 less than the original rate) which lead me to book outside of the hotel. Evidently the Global Poverty Project isn't that important. A bonus for me was earning 28,250 miles on my stay which I would not have earned if the hotel had matched the rate booking direct. Had I not been earning these miles on my stay, I would have checked out early due to the plethora of failures during my stay. 

Due to my poor booking experience, the GM promised to upgrade my room to at least a King Room. The director of revenue promised to send up an amenity when I arrived for the trouble throughout my booking experience. On arrival, my room was not upgraded and I was not provided an amenity. Great start. 

I was put into a tiny Queen room above the subway. Upon discovering that there was no tub in the room I went down to concierge to see whether there was a room with a tub available (a tub is not the biggest deal breaker, but it is certainly nice to have after a day out in the city. I wouldn't consider my request unreasonable), I was then put into another room, with no tub... went to see concierge again and then after a lengthy wait was then given keys to an occupied room full of another guests belongings - WTF? Major security concern. How can a hotel give a guest access to another guests room?

Then was put into the 4th room for the evening, which was said to have a tub... and did not have a tub. By this stage I was over it and could not be bothered dealing with a team who evidently did not know what they were doing. All this after travelling 24 hours? Thanks. That's conscious hospitality at its best. 

The following day, I called the front desk to have my AppleTV set up as there are no streaming services in this hotel and was flatly told NO, that it was not possible. Then I had a call back from someone else on the front desk advising that they were finding a work around for this. In the end it was possible, so why tell me no in the first place? 

The food and beverage manager promised to send up a couple of juices for my trouble, as he became involved in getting my AppleTV set up. The juices never arrived. 

Having had so much trouble, I contacted the GM to express my disappointment with the service received. The GM tried to make it up to me by providing a $100 voucher to a nearby store and advised me that he would have juices sent up daily for the duration of my stay. He also offered a session at HigherDose which I did not use. The GM also arranged for me to be moved to a 5th room for the stay, which finally had a tub and a view uptown. 

Unsuprisingly, the juices stopped coming, more emails were exchanged with further disappointment. While I appreciate his efforts to look after me and reach out multiple times, it was disappointing that my experience continued to decline. 

I don't understand how there can be so many elements of failure in this hotel. The hotel claims to be 'conscious hospitality' however the team in the lobby are hard pressed to speak to you when you come and go... too busy engaged in personal conversations with each other. Too cool to speak to guests... in a hotel... conscious hospitality?

There are maybe 2 team members who actually make the effort to engage with guests.

Overall, 11 Howard has been a complete disappointment on my 3rd stay here. After my second stay in December 2016, I was sure that I had found a place to call home in New York City but unfortunately that has been totally and utterly shattered by this experience.

This hotel fails to deliver on so many levels. 11 Howard is cheaper than the other 'go to' hotels around the area... but unfortunately the service matches. 

I may stay here again, for an ordinary experience if I am in the city for a short time, as I do enjoy the space, but I would not recommend anyone to this hotel who values service.

title: Fantastic hotel in SoHo
text: Trendy hotel in a good location in SoHo. Subway stop is two blocks away. When mentioned that I had arrived in a redeye I was offered early check in. Great breakfast. Free happy hour at 5:00 pm. Will definitely try to visit it again.

title: 11 Howard Rocks !!
text: I am really bad writing reviews but i"ll do this one any way, this hotel is fantastic, we really enjoyed our stay and  specially the staff, Ben, Joanne, Robert, Adan were super nice and helpful and great people to talk to everyday before heading out to walk the streets of  New York for the day and night, their suggestions where to go and how to get there were right on. As if that wasn't enough,the location of the hotel is perfect for walking everywhere, with plenty of restaurants to go to in china town as well as little Italy among others, this is one place i would recomend with no doubt and the next time we are in New York, we definitely know where to stay , thanks guys !!

title: Great Soho location, this austere, hipster haven; room 1204 was quiet, comfy and small.
text:
Soho has wonderful shopping and some very fun restaurants, the Museum of the Chinese in America, and Tenement Museusm,and is close to Chinatown, Little Italy.

Hotel lobby is austere and cold but 2nd floor has a lounge where coffee is served until 9 am.  This was a secret to us for the first day.

Ask about breakfast, services and use the Ipad in the room which has lots of options, music, newspapers, etc.  I only discovered this after lots of fiddling with it.  But use it - it is essential.

Restaurant, Le Coucou is impossible to get into - one of the newer and most popular in town.  At night the upstairs has a private club.  Looked like a 'scene' but not designed for the comfort of the hotel guests.

I do not recommend this for families with kids.

title: We Love 11 Howard
text: My wife and I stayed at 11 Howard on our last trip to NYC and absolutely lovedddd it. The staff was extremely professional and accommodating. The space and rooms are beautiful and provide lots of opportunities to relax, unwind, and even work if needed ;). The location is great and we could walk to tons of great restaurants and stores to shop at. We will definitely come stay at 11 Howard again on our next trip and highly recommend it to anyone coming to the city!

title: Gorgeous hotel but it's noisy
text:
First-this hotel is modern and beautiful.
The understated lobby with no formal desk, just super helpful ,cute guys that get your bags and check you in right at street level is cool and novel. You stand at a round table, they have iPads, and they just get you setup there.No line.

Up the quiet elevator to the room, and open the door to a super luxe modern space.
Wood floor. Mod furniture, art books in room, You get an iPad device to do everything with, so its all electronic. Phone is conventional rings to front desk.

Bed is super comfy with fab wool Italian throw on top.

BUT - wait- whats that noise?
Is it an earthquake? Is it the elevator?
No- the strong rumble, vibration and noise every 20 minutes is the subway directly under the hotel.
We were on 9th floor., High up and really felt it.

It was tough to bear, coming from Calfornia, we're used to earthquakes, so it was like earthquake panic every 20 minutes. Finally put earplugs in and had a drink to calm down.

Not sure if its better higher up or on other side of hotel, but even if I love this hotel, AND I DO, its impossible to go back because of this.

I know there;s no way to fix this, and perhaps they should have considered this before buying this property. 
SO 5 stars, amazing hotel, just be a heavy sleeper and you should be fine.

title: Fabulous hotel, room service could use a boost.
text:
11 Howard is a beautiful hotel, and a lot of thought went into the design. It's also right next to my company's HQ office, so the location couldn't be better for me. For those not working nearby, it is very convenient to SoHo and great restaurants. 

Pros: 
- Service: top notch, especially this last time. Seku (sorry if I misspelled) was extremely professional and on top of it. His sense of calm urgency is something that is often lacking in young service workers (I know because I was in service until about 2 years ago). Others were very friendly as well. When I was running late to get back to check-out, I was able to have the hotel kindly grabbed my bag from my room and check me out so I didn't have to worry about anything.
- Water bottles provided when checking in and returning to hotel. As much as I hate waste, it's a nice touch for when it's hot and you are walking around all day.  
-Bed: very comfortable with perfect pillows.
-Bath: luxurious and clean.

Cons: 
- Room service could be stepped up a bit. Would love some actual plates and glassware/flatware. It may not be possible for them, but would be appreciated when you just don't want to be out. But the menu looked more full than last time, so I think it's getting better. 
- Beware of some corner room floor plans, which can be a little tight for claustrophobic people.

Definitely worth the stay!

title: Incredible Stay
text: From the moment we walked in the doors to the time we left, we felt so taken care of at the 11Howard. The staff was friendly, helpful and consistently going above and beyond! They made my fiancee's birthday stay one for the books. The space is beautiful and rooms are impeccably styled. Will definitely be going back on our next trip to the city.

title: Great Stay!
text: I stayed at 11 Howard in April for a work trip. The hotel was beautiful and in a great location. The staff was very helpful and welcoming upon my arrival and throughout my stay. I am constantly traveling for work and I will never stay at any other hotel than 11 Howard, such an enjoyable experience!

title: Don't bother
text:
I wouldn't bother going here it's a mainly soulless place with no character  . Service was quite bad the model looks check in staff not very good . Lobby is like a dentists waiting room . Room service to expensive and delivered in a paper bag ! ? This is progress I guess ? Hahahaha    No mini bar ? Took 20 mins to bring me a bottle opener . Rooms small ( we had a large double)
Crappy design etc for the expensive price you could try harder ? 
Don't go ..

title: Confort, ubicación y diseño
text: Excelente ubicación en una calle tranquila con muchas posibilidades a pocos pasos (restaurantes, tiendas, metro, etc.); si volviera a Manhattan se me ocurren pocos sitios como este. Estuvimos en una habitación Howard Deluxe, tiene un diseño y tamaño buenos, merecen especial mención la cama y la ducha, geniales para recobrar energías despues de un largo día de turismo por la ciudad. Limpieza excelente.

title: Amazing experience and hotel!
text:
Wow! I am still thinking about this place and have told countless people about this wonderful experience I had there. Everything from the booking to the check-in, the stay, and the check-out was extraordinary, and memorable. My only regret is that I couldn't stay more than one night, I didn't want to leave! 
The hotel is close 
A fantastic breakfast at Le CouCou the next morning rounded up a truly outstanding night. I highly recommend to stay at this gem of a hotel but be warned, you will be spoiled and likely have a hard time staying somewhere else the next time you come to New York.

title: The place to stay in Soho! Great place, amazing service and close to everything!!
text:
One great week was enjoyed there! Close to many great bars and restaurants, you are in the middle of the action, but at the same time the hotel is quite and private.
Amazing and interesting people.....
I will be back for sure soon!

title: My new go-to hotel in NY
text: The staff is amazing from the moment you pull up to the property. The rooms are clean, quiet and very well appointed. And while they do not have mini-bars you can get water at check-in and the service is super fast. The library and bar on the second floor are also amazing, although I hope they bring back the grilled cheese and tomato soup! Overall a great hotel so if you are staying downtown don't look anywhere else, trust me I have stayed at them at all and for the money 11Howard is by far the best.

title: Great night but the bar is way overpriced
text:
My husband has a business in the area so we decided to spend a night in the city.  The doorman was extremely friendly and the room was beautiful with a nice balcony with great views. We had dinner in little Italy and bought a bottle of wine to enjoy on the balcony.  Mother Nature had other plans and it started to rain so we headed down to the bar.  We have stayed in several nice hotels in the area but $24 for a glass of Pinot noir just hurts. The bar is just way overpriced. I had a Vodka with Rose water for $18 that was very good.  But I was looking for a glass of red and looking at the crazy prices I just couldn't do it .

We ordered room service off the iPad which was cool but annoying - I wanted a pot of coffee and it was only by cup - then they forgot the sugar.  We still had an awesome time and the place is very nice.

title: Sexy, fun weekend.
text: I loved everything about this hotel. The location is right by great restaurants and shops. The staff is friendly and will accommodate you with any questions you may have. Their decor is chic and clean. I fell in love with their dark sexy lounges, great music, for all genres. It's perfect for a couples getaway or friends enjoying the city. Dress up, it's a stylish hotel!

title: IT DOESN'T GET ANY BETTER
text:
I'm sorry - but this hotel is FANTASTIC. 

Yes...the rooms are small. If your budget allows for it, book the suite. 

The service - truly wonderful. Everyone goes above and beyond to make sure you're happy. 

The aesthetics / design - clean, simple and calming. New York City - specifically Soho, is chaotic, loud and crowded. Entering this oasis of a hotel is a great way to calm down and unwind after a busy day in the city.

The area - the best. Across the street you have Rick Owens, down the block is Balthazar...need I say more? If you crave nightlife, The Blonde (housed within the hotel) is fantastic. Rose Bar is wonderful too. 

I highly highly recommend this hotel.

title: Great boutique in SoHo/NoMad
text:
Stayed one night for a weekend visit to NYC.  The location is perfect for downtown, close to SoHo shopping, fabulous restaurants, and cool bars.  The hotel has a great boutique feel.  Instead of a traditional lobby they have the second-floor “library lounge” which was perfect for meeting up with our friends also staying in the hotel.  Rooms are clean, simple and well designed to make the best use of the space.  A walk-in shower instead of a typical tub/shower combo is a nice modern touch.

Check-in/out was easy and efficient.  Our room was not ready early but we were able to leave our bags and when we returned to the hotel later, we were able to pick up our key in the library and our bags were already waiting in our room.

Service at the hotel and before/after are stay was great, responsive to our questions by email and helpful in person with bags and recommendations.  

As others have mentioned there is some vibration/rumbling from the subway and we could hear some hallway noise at night.  Neither was enough to keep us up or warrant a complaint but if you’re sensitive to that sort of thing, check with the hotel about rooms on higher floors or quiet corners.

title: Honeymoon stay
text:
Perfect location, very clean hotel, staff are more than friendly, rooms are great, hyper modern and very classy. i will definitely revisit 11 howard.
Food is great.
High five for the technology in the rooms.

title: Great Hotel in Soho
text: I have now stayed at 11 Howard about half a dozen times and it never disappoints.  The service at this hotel is wonderful!  Everyone at the hotel is welcoming, friendly and always helpful.  The rooms are on the small side, but the beds are super comfy and the bathrooms are lovely and bright.  The hotel is spotless.  Rooms feature iPads to order room service, a car, schedule housekeeping, find restaurants, etc. The common area offers breakfast and food and drink service throughout the day and evening.  I love the location.  Close to all the subway lines and easy to walk all through Soho and surrounding neighborhoods.

title: Wonderful Soho Hotel
text: I've stayed at 11 Howard several times on business.  It's a fantastic hotel.  Very clean, bright, and welcoming.  The service is always on-point.  I've stayed at other hotels in Soho and downtown, but 11 Howard is my first choice.  Great service.  The staff is attentive but not overbearing.  The room are efficient, practical, bright, and well-designed.  Will keep coming back.

title: Great Service
text: If you want to be at a place thats hip and great on service, stay at 11howard. Everytime I go service is AMAZING and most importantly consistent. I highly recommend this hotel if service is important to you.

title: In the words of PHARRELL.."that's why I'm happy"
text:
Family vacation to New York... I was super excited to visit this awesome city. This was my second time here, but the highlight of my stay here was staying at 11 Howard.. From the time we entered the door nothing less than smiles, courtesy and awesome energy. We were treated like royalty. The staff was very friendly. Zina checked us in and without hesitation offered us a cold drink to refresh us on this warm day. When we got to our room I was very impressed with the style and setup of the rooms. And when it came time for rest, I slept like a baby... The bed was so comfortable, The Grown Alchemist products were amazing, and to top it all off.. they even gave me complimentary wine as a nice gesture!!             Special shoutout to Neff ( best concierge advice, she's basically a NYC tour guide) , Rob ( he recommended the best coffee shops), and Adan and Kenny for being PIZZA GURUS! The management is obviously doing something right here. Everyone is happy to be at work.

Needless to say, I WILL BE BACK AT 11 Howard. Thank you for the amazing stay.

title: Awesome soho hotel
text: Amazing modern hotel; great location, perfect room, sweet 2nd floor lounge space, fantastic staff AND connected to Le Coucou one of the top restaurants in NYC. We enjoyed all aspects of our stay....We will be back!

title: Beautiful design hotel in the heart of New York.
text: 11 Howard is a gorgeous design hotel placed in the heart of Soho in New York. The rooms has aestheticly beautiful, minimalistic and bright Danish design interior. There is a very warm atmosphere at the hotel and the hotel staff is very helpful. The hotel serves a delicious and healthy breakfast in a cozy space with lovely design interior. I can warm recommend you to stay at this amazing hotel where I'm also going to stay during my next trip to New York.

title: Favorite SoHo Hotel
text: I stayed here for 5 nights and had a wonderful experience. It was the 2nd time me and my girlfriend chose this hotel and I can only recommend a stay here when you visit Manhattan. Very nice staff, the location is perfect, very close to all the SoHo stores and everything you need! Already looking forward to our next stay!

title: Perfect downtown retreat
text:
11 Howard has everything  going for it.  Great, smart, helpful people, beautiful small lobby with an industrial vibe skewing elegant, no reception desk but a round table with caring employees standing ready to get to yes for you.  A second floor space designated "Library" has soothing decor, fabulous art books, comfortable chairs and small tables if you want intimacy or a large communal table all available for work or a drink or quick meal ordered off a small menu that is available most of the time.  Le Coucou is the one of the hottest dinner reservations in NYC right now and a discreet entrance door to the restaurant is right in the lobby.  Breakfast and lunch are also served in the restaurant and can be charged to your room.  Take advantage of this opportunity!
Upstairs, the rooms and hallways are quiet.  Rooms are small like every hotel in the city but beautifully designed and appointed, with dimmers on the lights, hardwood floors, and fabulous bed linens.  The bathrooms alone are worth the price of admission -  limestone and marble with marvelous amenities.  Housekeepers are gracious enough to provide handwritten thank-you notes for gratuities you leave. From your window you can see a typical downtown NY skyline with interesting old buildings, some with water towers on the roofs and usually a fashion shoot happening.   Hotel sits over 2 subway lines so getting uptown or to Brooklyn is a breeze, plus there are 5 Shinola bicycles available for your use free of charge.

title: Pretty good but...
text:
SO, over all, pretty nice. The room is small, but comfortable as hell. Do not come with a lot of luggage.
We checked in late last  night. Our neighbors TV was BLARING all night and these are not thin doors. OK, so, we slept. Then at 5 A.M., our phone rang asking if there was an emergency. 5 A? It was some sort of a prank call, but really unreasonable.
SO, in the morning, I told one of the two ladies in the lobby about what happened, and she offered to send up a bottle of wine or champagne. She insisted. WELL, I certainly do not need anything for nothing, but the reality is, nothing was in my room when I got in at 11 P.M.
That left a bad taste in my mouth....
OH, the housekeeper was lovely. I am in room 420. Here now, in bed.

title: Great hotel for a great price
text:
We are foodies who come into the city for the night hit the hot spot for dining ( this time was Le Cou Cou) and then head home in the morning . Our dinners are usually very pricey and as you know most nice hotels are as well. It was a mid week night and we were looking for a hotel in soho close to Le Cou Cou and my first choice were places I have stayed previously. Soho sixty had a room available for $1275.00 a night , and trump jet $1125.00, wow these are not over water bungalows in Bora Bora!!! 
I jumped on Expedia and found 11 Howard and Le Cou Cou was inside the same building!! As soon as we pull up a young lady was out the door like magic and asks are we checking in . We say yes she calls out at luggage cart gets us inside and a young man checks us in and gives a run down of the hotel amenities and hands us keys and says luggage will be right up! The room was neat and clean , there is a safe and a fridge but you have to order in drinks and snacks.  The view we had was the only draw back. There is a bar on second floor called The Blond which served us excellent drinks!  I would definitely stay here again as it was clean , safe and less than half of the other major hotels.

title: A discerning business traveler's fave
text: Love, love, love this hotel. The restaurant, bar, workspace, internet connection, amenities, interior design, staff, service, and the location are pitch perfect. And reasonably priced relative to alternative hotels of this caliber. As a massively discerning business traveler, I couldn't be more comfortable here. Breakfast at Le Coucou is a special treat. And don't miss Smile cafe across the steet. My only caution — if you happen to be in the market for home furnishings, the hotel's close proximity to Studio Oliver Gustav, BDDW, and M. Crow are dangerous. My new fave. So long to The Mercer, The Bowery, and The NoMad.

title: Soho Getaway Weekend
text: We come to New York once or twice a year for theater, food, and fun.  The price, quality, location, staff, rooms at 11 Howard were all GREAT.  Simple enough, yet peaceful.  Clean simple styling with a wonderfully relaxing library if you need to focus on work or enjoy a lounge and tabletops while getting things done.  I called the staff for simple things and EVERYONE was happy, engaging, and effective at their jobs.  The location lets you walk into Chinatown or Little Italy or to the Brooklyn Bridge.  Safe neighborhoods!  We walked to Chinatown to a popular noodle spot and a convenience store at 1:00am and all was good.

title: Business and pleasure
text: Great hotel! Stayed for 9 nights for business and pleasure. Great working space and great service. Much more friendly and attentive compared to other Soho hotels have stayed in before. Room was a bit small but typical New York style. Close to everything. What made this hotel stand apart from others was definitely the service. Will be back just for that. Highly recommend

title: Modern gem in Soho
text: This is a very minimalist, sleek hotel with terrific service.  The neutral colors in the rooms is relaxing and the bathroom has a great shower with both rain head and hand held. Nice social room on the 2nd floor where coffee is served each morning & it is a great set up for a chat, some work, a snack (waiter service available).  It is close to the Canal Street subway, so very convenient.  Will definitely stay here again.

title: Quick work stay
text: Nice, stylish NYC hotel. Nice to have small fridge in room. My only complaint is the hallways are very dark, which makes it difficult to locate the room initially and gives a low sense of security. Staff were friendly.

title: ELEVATED NYC EXPERIENCE
text:
Me and my girlfriend stayed at 11 howard for our anniversary weekend. Firstly the location of the hotel is conveniently located in soho around all the good shopping areas. 

Staff was very friendly and helpful from start to finish.

The interior & over-all aesthetic of the hotel is unique & well designed - offering an elevated experience. 

We stayed in the 'King Terrace' room and it was super cozy and the terrace added a very special element to our stay, allowing us to drink wine and enjoy the views of the city.

Will definitely stay there again.

title: Funky five-star luxury hotel in outstanding Lower Manhattan location
text:
For a SoHo building that has housed a post office and Holiday Inn over the years, its recent transformation into a modern, minimalist upscale boutique hotel makes for an excellent base to explore nearby Chinatown, Lower East Side, East Village and Little Italy.

My two-night stay at 11 Howard was on a Starwood Preferred Guest award and came at the end of a longer New York stay so was changing hotels. There are a pair of subway stops within two blocks of the hotel so finding it wasn't a problem especially since the hotel's name is it's address on Howard Street. 

Stepping in to the hotel's little lobby I wasn't sure at first glance who was a guest and who was staff as there isn't a traditional front desk but I was warmly greeted within a moment or two by a staff member who checked me in by tablet. The staff uniforms are very casual with high pant cuffs and leather loafers so are suitably hip to match the whole hotel's cool vibe. 

My reservation had been for a Howard Queen room but was informed upon check-in I'd been upgraded to an accessible King room on a higher floor. Room #618 has a cool colour scheme, light brown oak floors, a high ceiling and modern Danish design that provided an oasis from the heat wave New York was experiencing during my mid-June stay. The furnishing work well together and the king bed doesn't feel outsized in the room as is sometimes the case with smaller boutique hotel rooms. The desk isn't large but had a handy shelf above it for books and maps and smartphone while recharging. The night stand is a recued square chunk of a large beam with a crack running from top to bottom standing about 2 foot high and holds a phone and tablet for ordering hotel services or surfing the web. I very much appreciated the tablet and used several times a day to check subway routes, weather reports or stay in touch with friends, family and work while on holiday. The accessible bathroom is larger than in other rooms and with handles on all walls but lacked room a vanity for toiletries. There is a small stand for towels and complimentary shampoo, conditioner and body wash next to the tub with shower and hooks on the back of the bathroom door so some useful bathroom space. Instead of modern the brass tub & shower knobs had a more retro feel and it took some time to figure out the way to work the controls but should you be unable to manager there's an instructional video on the tablet. The closet just opposite the bathroom was enough for a few clothes to hang up but guests with large wardrobes may find it too small. The mini-fridge comes empty but worked to cool the free water bottles provided and you may order other items through the tablet. A laptop size safe, large window with Howard Street roof top view and easy chair round out what is a bright, airy feeling space.

The hotel's location is an easy amble to so many neighborhoods such as Little Italy and Chinatown and a bit further to the East Village or Tribeca. Make sure to try local food landmarks Katz's Deli and Lombardi's pizza both of which are over a century in business. I loved the location as luxury New York hotels have traditionally been clustered further uptown between Times Square and Central Park so having upscale alternative accommodations downtown earns high marks from me. 

I looked in on The Library, the second floor space that felt to me more like a living room with comfy couches and chairs to relax over a cocktail or catch up on some work but as it was fairly full and didn't spot any seats for solos. The adjacent "the blond" (written in lowercase on purpose) is more of a traditional bar and lounge with winding plush velour seats and long bar with high bar stools to perch for cocktails. 

 On the last day I ran short of time before packing and leaving for the airport so asked the lobby staff where the closest post office was to mail some postcards I'd addressed but hadn't bought stamps and happily learned the hotel would mail them for me and charge the few dollars postage to my room account. This service was greatly appreciated and was in keeping with the overall accommodating and friendly service I encountered from all staff. 

If there are some nitpicky things I would share about 11 Howard it would be a few things like the dim hallway corridors, small room closet, lack of a vanity, and low tub although the last two are likely due to the room being accessible for wheelchair guests. The room upgrade to a higher floor likely helped minimize the sound from subways running underneath the hotel others have reported as the sleep quality was good for this very light sleeper. Noise from adjoining rooms also wasn't an issue.

While I would've liked to have stayed longer I very much enjoyed my short stay and hope to return as 11 Howard offers a chic retreat in an amazing location.

title: Cool, superbly staffed, wonderfully designed and decorated boutique hotel!
text:
We spent three nights here recently and absolutely loved it!  I come to Manhattan a lot for work and pleasure and 11 Howard will absolutely be a hotel I return to often.  The feel of the hotel is wonderful - like the coolest, most welcoming oasis -- and the staff are among the best I've experienced.  The value for price is also among the best in Manhattan and I've tried many dozens of places over the decades!

The location in SoHo is away from the tourist mobs around Times Square in a fun neighborhood only a couple of blocks from Little Italy and China Town.  You enter through two large swinging glass doors which an alert staffer opens for you.  Check in is right in the main lobby at a sleek round table with bright, friendly staff.  Rob was our guy and for the next three days and nights, he took the best care of us along with all the rest of the staff.   

A massive beautifully designed spiral staircase takes you up to sitting area lobby and bar on the 2nd floor.  Lots of folks make calls, work laptops, have drinks or just relax in this chic area designed just so.  The bar is fabulous after dark with plush couches, music dialed in perfectly, and good cocktails.  Make sure you spend time on this 2nd floor during your stay.  It's fun and relaxing and the hotel concierge is here as well.

We were given a corner room on the 8th floor with views of Howard Street and also down Lafayette.  The King bed was exceedingly comfortable.  The sitting area was spacious and included an inviting couch and chairs with table.  The bathroom was marble and the large shower had great water pressure.  The design was cool, fun - felt Scandinanvian.  Each room has a tablet\Ipad for ordering food or asking for literally anything.  It was a fun touch and every easy to use.  

Yes, there is a subway train tunnel below and you can occasionally hear\feel it but we barely noticed and the hotel more than makes up for it.  My wife is a light sleeper but she had no trouble at all from the train.  Many hotels in Manhattan (especially in the busiest tourist areas) are much louder because of car and truck traffic and this hotel has little of that.  

This hotel is affiliated with SPG\Starwood and that's how I found it though it's an actual member of the worldwide Design Hotel Network which is top flight.

title: Great stay!
text: Finding a room in New York is tough. I've stayed at pretty much all the different SPG properties in New York City, and I think 11 Howard is my new favorite. Anis and the rest of the team were very accomodating, and the hotel furnishings are simply beautiful. You won't get some of the normal SPG upgrades as 11 Howard is part of the SPG "Design Hotel" brand - so no free breakfast or suite upgrades for Platinum members. Nevertheless it's a beautiful hotel and is, despite this, my new favorite SPG property to stay in Manhattan.

title: Cute boutique hotel and very nice staff BUT...
text: 1- Hotel stands above a metro line so it shakes everytime a metro passes.  2- the rooms are fairly small but the issue is that there is very limited space to hang or store stuff; we had to ask for an extra cloth hanger on wheels and I was not able to undo my suitcase (my wife did). 3- the hotel is one street away from Canal street which at several times of the day gets blocked because drivers stop in the middle of the crossings which prompt other drivers to honk loudly. 4- the gym is small, just space for 3 machines side by side and a weight room. 5- one evening, the hotel called us twice at 10:40pm and 10:50pm to deliver our laundry and they woke us up while we had the No disturb sign on and our laundry was due the next morning. Not great as you can imagine.

title: 11 Howard – no awards !!!
text:
Nous avions choisi l'hôtel pour son emplacement proche du centre et pour la proximité du restaurant "Le Coucou", néanmoins la première chambre "king size de luxe!" était décevante, salle de bain à l'agencement improbable. 
Nous avons obtenu une chambre de même standard avec une vraie salle de bain dès le lendemain. Le ménage est superficiel, si vous êtes allergique à la poussière: Courage ! Cependant la literie est très confortable !!!
Le personnel est très agréable et à l'écoute pour répondre à vos besoins, ce qui relève le niveau global de l'hôtel !!
Ne soyez pas surpris de recevoir votre petit-déjeuner en version pique-nique, car il le récupère au café Howard en face de l'immeuble ! How what?
Le petit déjeuner est correct sur le plan gustatif, la présentation on aime ou on aime pas, mais pour un repas en chambre on a connu plus pratique ! 
On cherche les étoiles, elles sont surtout dans le ciel ! 
Le room service est rapide (30 minutes comme prévu), vérifiez votre commande car il nous manquait les fruits. 
Nous sommes un peu déçus compte tenu de la réputation de l'hôtel... peut-être une marque de fabrique, mais nous ne sommes pas conquis ! 
Un hôtel correct pour un court séjour sans dépenser trop !

title: Loved this place
text: Stayed at 11 Howard for two nights a day ago. Don't often write reviews. This place is exceptional in both design and service. And the room size was surprising large for Soho. Much better than the Soho Grand. Hope to return in the future. The tablet is also a nice touch on service and very handy.

title: Pretty decor but that's about all
text:
The decor is nice. Minimalist. Fresh. Good products in the bathroom. Nice sheets. So from a design standpoint I give it 4 out of 5 stars. I would give it a 5 but the paint in the room needs a refresh - full of dings and scratches.

I arrived at 3pm and my room wasn't ready. I had to wait 20 minutes. Check in is at 3pm so you would thing they would have it together. I was late to an appointment.

The front desk was a little moody with me. I prefer a more polished greeting than a Soho hipster with a bad attitude.

The fridge is empty (which is kind of nice) and there is no mini bar.

The very worst part is the subway underneath shakes my whole room and the fixtures clank when it goes by. I am worried I might not get that much sleep tonight. 

Overall, it's pretty. Don't stay here for business. Stock up on water and snacks before you come. Bring earplugs.

title: High design and amazing customer service!
text: I stay here every time I visit New York City, which is almost once a month.  This hotel is beautiful, if you appreciate design.  The rooms are well proportioned and clean.  The design is quite minimal, but the pallet is warm and inviting.  I love the rooms.  More importantly however, the staff at 11 Howard is profession, capable and unbelievably affable.  They remember names and go out of their way to ensure you're not in need of anything.  I love the people here as much as the rooms!  They have a gem here in Soho!!

title: A truly excellent hotel of exceptionally high quality
text: I found the staff incredibly courteous and helpful. The food was delicious and I very much enjoyed the cocktails. Also, the interior design is of a very high standard and although the look is minimalist, the rooms were very comfortable and welcoming.

title: One of the best hotel experiences I've had
text:
Easily some of the best service I have encountered in a hotel. I never once met an employee who was rude or seemed like they didn't want to be there. They were all extremely nice and accommodating. I have herniated discs that I soak in a hot tub and then ice every day and they graciously upgraded me to a room on an upper floor with a tub and brought be bags of ice!

The room itself was very nice. I originally picked this hotel for the decor (among other things), but I value good design and nice spaces. Often rooms do not end up looking as nice in real life, but in this case they DID! No wobbly fixtures or scuffed up desks. The bed was very comfortable and was very clean. I was impressed with the quality of the shower fixtures.

The 24 hour room service (though perhaps a little limited) was still great. The tablet system to order it was very cool.

My only real complaint would perhaps be the door leading to an adjoining room could have had a little more sound barrier along the bottom. I could hear someone walking around the floor, so I put a towel in front of the door.

Aside from that one point, the location was great, the staff were excellent, I loved the room and I will definitely be back!

title: The best place to stay in New York City!
text:
I was stranded at the airport with no options. I got in touch with the manager of 11 Howard, Anis, and he IMMEDIATELY made accommodations for me to stay. The staff was in touch with me within minutes and I was saved! 

When I arrived at the hotel, it was a torrential downpour of rain. The friendly staff greeted me and were able to check me in right away. Every staff member I came in contact with was so helpful and friendly. 

When I arrived at my room, I could not have been happier. It was immaculately clean and comfortable. The entire hotel has a beautiful, sexy aesthetic and the room was no exception. The huge, clean king bed was so inviting and comfortable. The bathroom was also immaculately clean with the best products and ample fluffy white towels. 

The hotel is located in the coolest part of the city close to everything. Shopping, bars, parks, restaurants... you cannot ask for more. 11 Howard is gorgeous and ideal for any traveler to NYC. I will certainly be back ASAP.

title: Good, but
text:
This is a well located hotel. It is stylish and contemporary with good service. The room is of reasonable size, not large but adequate. 
The concept appears to be minimalist which is some areas was great but others too limiting. If you was items for the bathroom such as makeup stuff, cotton buds etc you have to call down for them. The room service menu is so so so limited. Unfortunately the hotel is built over the subway. The room didn't shake as I was on an upper floor but you sure could hear the rumble of the trains.

title: Not a fan
text:
Cons:
No one to take our bags in to the hotel upon arrival. 
Had to go in to the " lobby" to get someone to valet the car 
The "receptionist "pointed to the luggage rack so we could put the bags down while we were checked in- that took about 20 min.
No water was offered
