Lack of front desk was odd.  They take your credit card and walk off to who knows where and come back 5 min later . 
After getting the room cards ( we had 3 rooms) again no one to get the bags so we carried our own. Not a huge deal , but ...5 stars???
Getting in to the hotel bar is up to the bouncer at the door ...Being a guest doesn't mean you are cool enough to get in . At 11:00 when we returned to the hotel for the night there was a line to get in to the bar. The thought of standing in the line with a chance of being refused entry left us feeling awkward . Definitely not like a valued guest.
Pros:
Room was really clean .
The Bed was really comfortable. 
Unfortunately getting in the bed was 
Not easy for the person nearest the wall and table -4" space between the furniture, and that was a deluxe room. 
Maybe I'm just not the boutique type of client .

title: Amazing stay at amazing hotel
text: Love this hotel. Booked it for one night for a mini stay cation. Stayed in a King Senior room which was perfect sized for my girlfriend and I. The bed was super comfy, and loved the love seat and table area. We both loved the minimalist furnishing, and the quality of the bath robes and bath products

title: No tan bueno
text: Muy bien ubicado, hermoso bar. Muy lindo hotel. Mal servicio de atención  al cliente. Para lograr conseguir un set de aseo reclame durante horas y en varias oportunidades. Una pena porque con buen servicio sería un hotel muy recomendable.

title: Second Time Awesome!
text: This was my second time staying at 11 Howard and it was as great an experience as the first time. Not only is the location fantastic and the rooms very well designed and comfortable, the best thing about the property is the staff. Each staff member I dealt with was more accommodating than the previous one! From housekeeping to concierge to the individuals checking us in, all were very pleasant to deal with. I have travelled extensively and on countless occasions over the years to NYC. I have found my home way from home. It is a great place to stay.

title: Love it!!
text: I always stay there when I'm in town. The service is great and the staff is always friendly and helpful. The lounge in "The Library" is great for working and business meetings. Overall just a really unique and cool hotel with a great location! Looking forward to coming back soon.

title: Cool, chic and friendly.  Great location.
text: Great service. We stayed for 3 nights and couldn't ask for more.  Walking distance from great restaurants and shops. Staff were friendly and helpful.  Will definitely stay here again. Breakfast at the French restaurant was surprisingly good.

title: Modern Boutique Hotel with Clean and Calm Sophistication
text:
I had a fantastic experience at this hotel.  I have seen a few reviews expressing concerns on service - and I just can't see ANY of that.

The staff was constantly helpful and in a very calm and sincere manner.  In fact, I was impressed with the fact that the staff saw me on a few occasions stop and pause to look around or at my phone and they would approach me and ask if I needed help with anything.  I didn't need help, but I really appreciated that they asked.

This was the same in "The Library" (the common area).  The staff was attentive without seeming 'scripted'.  There was just a sense of calmness in how the staff worked, which really made being there actually feel relaxing (which to me is important in a place such as New York where it can be quite hectic almost anywhere you go).  

Then there's the food.... I had the Bahn Mi, and the next morning, the Avocado Toast.  Both fantastic.

I did not take advantage of the Open Wine Bar Happy Hour, but it was very well presented (and the wines offered looked good (and not the cheap stuff!)).

As for the rooms... the bed was FANTASTIC: great sheets and a comfortable, cozy bed.  The AC was crazy good (and it was a really hot day so strong AC felt good).

Overall, I loved this place.  I could see how it's not for everyone as it's not a traditional big-box convention hotel.  It's a boutique hotel with a unique approach to creating an experience around the stay for their guests.  For me, I recommend and love it.

Great bed / sleep, great food, great service.  Thumbs up!

title: Bad Service, Bad Rooms, Management with attitude
text:
I have stayed in hotels globally. 2-5 star ones. 
The stay @11 Howard was a really bad experience. Some (but not all) specific reasons:
*******************
When I called prior to arriving, the folks on the phone said, no guarantees but there will be a good chance for early check-in. Then while I was there, they played games, Instead of telling me straight-up no room was available before 3, kept me waiting. Games like, the maid is cleaning right now to oh no we never said that. A power thing?

Worse, they emailed the next day,  saying my room was ready. The day after I checked in.  

I asked multiple times for service related things. And they came late or never. After multiple asks. Always with a snooty attitude.

On the day of checkout, even though late checkout had been confirmed twice, the keys were turned off around 1 PM. And the young woman who was rekeying, threatened to lock me out of the room
In general, the attitude was rude. "We are hip, you aren't". Is this what you want for your brand?

The rooms have no dressers or closets. Minimalist is one thing. Absurd is another. Haha

Then I contacted the manager. He didn't bother to call me back. Didn't unconditionally apologize, or take personal responsibility or offer to make it right

title: Try It, You'll Be Glad You Did
text: Decided to try in a different hotel in Soho - 11 Howard.  I was very pleased as it was still convenient to shopping and dining in the area but not congested with people.  The room was comfortable and a nice size and housekeeping did a good job on keeping it clean.  Security was great as the elevator required a card key and there was usually staff at the front door to greet you so I always felt safe.  And the staff was very accommodating and friendly - we asked for bottles and bottles of water because it was hot outdoors and they always welcomed us back when we returned to the hotel.  They charge must less than the other three hotels that we have stayed at in the area too.  I'd definitely return.  Oh and it was never difficult to get a taxi there.

title: Great service in the heart of Soho
text:
Stayed overnight for a business trip. Staff was extremely attentive. The restaurant upstairs is a great place for a quiet lunch meeting or catching up on some work. 
Great toiletries too.  
Late night room service came in handy

title: Really Loved It!
text: The entire experience was exceptional. From the person who greeted me outside and walked me into check-in, to the food and lounge space, to the room itself. The design is beautiful, the staff is helpful, the food is good, and the experience lives up to its reviews. I would not hesitate to stay here again, plus it's in a great neighborhood. Do yourself a favor and stay here next time you come to Manhattan!

title: Its like a beautiful girl, with a bad personality.
text:
11 Howard came recommended from friends that live in New York, and after reading multiple TripAdvisor reviews, it seemed like a very good option. I was wrong.

- Room #1: small, albeit functional. The bathroom however was a disaster; two people could not be in there at the same time.  Our room on the top floor was excessively loud (underneath ventilation ducts). We had two separate visits from their maintenance team that finally acknowledged there was a problem. We changed rooms at 3:30am. No one helped us move.

- Room #2: bigger bathroom, smaller room. There seem to be clear issues with spatial proportions. There was half eaten tic tacs in our bed (under the sheets); housekeeping not only didn't clean it, they tried to hide it. WTF?? Also, the running water was milky / murky in colour on the shower and sink faucets. After contacting the duty manager we were told "well that is New York water, what do you want me to do?" Ummm... no.

- Complimentary water is rationed at the hotel. We called the front desk to ask for more and were met with a "we don't deliver. If you want water, come down to the lobby and get it yourself"

This hotel is perfect for Instagram. Definitely not to stay in.

title: Location, location, location
text: Perfect location to explore Soho, Tribeca, Chinatown and Lower East Side plus subway access literally around the corner, so you can be anywhere in minutes.  The staff is friendly, very helpful and accommodating.

title: Great hotel
text:
We stayed here on our honeymoon the hotel decor is really cool.
The staff are really friendly, it's in a great location and would highly recommend anyone heading to New York wanting to stay in the area to stay at this hotel

title: Quality Rooms with A Successful Service Twist!
text:
11 Howard has excellent rooms, with all the amenities, and is a non-risk quality choice for a short visit to NYC. But it had an interesting surprise for us: The service is unusual : top-notch, but emphasizing "casual" carried out by friendly, respectful pro-active young people, who took care of us, from the moment that we pulled up with our car ( they had it parked)-- they quickly ( very quickly and seamlessly) accomplished our checking-in, without a reception desk. And they were particularly helpful with all our needs -- information, and special requests ( ice for our picnic basket when we left.)
     We highly recommend the 11 Howard -- we will certainly come back again. Cynthia and Ilan Rubin, Jerusalem

title: Modern Comfort
text:
Great location if your plans in NYC keep you South of Houston. Easy access to subway at Canal street. Howard street provided reprieve from the bustling city; you'll find the rooms provide peace and quiet. 

Pros - 
Rooms are well appointment 
Size of rooms are nice, considering it's NYC
Modern furnishings
Extremely comfortable bed (A+) 
Windows provide great sunlight/ blackout curtains 
Complimentary Happy Hour (A+) 
In-room tablet - great source for all services from housekeeping, in-room dining, concierge services 
In-room shower = superb

Cons - 
Elevators are finicky
Check-in or out can be a cluster, lots of people gather in lobby (no official check in counter) 
Starwood/ SPG = late check out could be enhanced or more perks for SPG Platinum 
Lack of in-room mini bar 
1 bottle of in-room water = silly (not refreshed daily, either)

title: A Holiday Inn is still a holiday Inn
text: This hotel is a converted Holiday Inn in an increasingly fashionable part of town (Soho).  They've done their best to transform hotel chain ordinary into minimalist chic.  Good marketing, but the rooms are still small, and the fixtures and appointments no more than functional.

title: シンプルで落ち着いた雰囲気の良いホテル
text:
こじんまりとして、シンプルで雰囲気の良いホテル。
バスタブ付きのツインをリクエストしてましたがツインにバスタブは付いてないそうで、ダブルでも良ければ、と部屋を変えてくれました。ダブルかーと思いましたが大きいベッドはフカフカで寝心地良く結果オーライでした。

クラブの音は下の方の階（7F）だったからか、薄っすらとズンドコ聞こえてきた点で星-1です。
疲れてすぐ眠れたので大丈夫でしたが、音に敏感で眠りにつきにくい方は厳しいかも。
ロケーションは周りに行きたかったお店も多く、地下鉄の駅もすぐそばにあり便利でミッドタウンと違った雰囲気が味わえて最高でした。
スタッフの方も感じが良く、チェーン系では無い、ニューヨークらしい、でも見掛け倒しじゃないホテルをお探しの方にはピッタリかと思います。

title: I love Boutique Hotels and this is now one of my favorites!
text: I went to NY for business and had to stay close to SoHo.  What an awesome experience.  I seriously have no complaints or recommendations for my stay.  They stay we're all AMAZING!!  Super courteous, personable, and helpful.  The hotel was stylish, very unique simplistic design - but still elegant.  We order a very late room service on one night and it was delicious!!!  The room was perfect; quaint; and quite!!  There was the scent in the hallway??  Very odd I know but it was like something you'd smell in a spa??  So very relaxing.  Just a great experience!  I would recommend it and make sure you eat dinner at Le CouCou (oh my!!!!)

title: The most stylish and aesthetic hotel in the best part  of New York
text:
The location is outstanding in the heart of Soho but  on a completely  quiet corner . It's a concept hotel . Unique, beautifully designed but still highly comfortable and user friendly. 
Very high standard of service. The only shortcoming is that they charge you up front  300 $ "for potential expenses" on top of the room cost and refund only few day after you departure" .  Unbecoming...

title: Best management ever
text: Atiba was the greatest management. Very diligent and assertive.  I would stay here again no questions asked. Thank you so much Atiba. Beds were amazing and very comfortable. So close to quality shopping in Manhattan

title: disappointing to say the least
text:
The hotel corridors have very dim lighting. There is no actual lobby. That was a real shock. There was only a circular table and 2 tablets. Nothing fancy. Our room had not been properly vacuumed when we checked in. But the worst part of our stay was the jewellery that was stolen from my luggage. I had bought some jewellery on our last day and had packed in our luggage thinking that it would be safe. We re-packed again at night and to our horror, found the jewellery missing. Despite reporting to management, nothing came out of it as we were checking out early the next morning.
Avoid this hotel if you can.

title: Fantastic stay!!
text: We stayed one night over easter weekend.  Great hotel!  The lounge area is nice, complimentary wine!  The room is a good size and very comfortable bed.  We were close to everything!  The staff could not have been nicer.  The hotel is clean and we loved the shampoo and conditioner provided.  The room my daughter stayed in had a bathtub and she was thrilled!  Very quiet room.

title: 3star at best
text:
I have stayed in many 5star hotels in every continent and this one is a joke.
No actual lobby and after 10pm not even a bathroom for use outside of your room. Both restaurant and bar "adjacent" to the hotel are independent so no access if not on the guest list. Nightcap option is a room service. Rooms are IKEA style remodeled closets. Property is clean and new. The only positive thing. A lot of  better options in NYC. Shame that it shows up as 5 stars on Expedia.

title: Fabulous Stay!
text: We stayed the weekend and had a wonderful time.  The staff was fabulous, the design GORGEOUS, and the location couldn't be better.  Le Cou Cou even squeezed us in for a last minute dinner which was equally fantastic.  Getting breakfast in the library was easy and delicious. This will be my new go-to hotel when we visit the city.

title: Friendly cool in New York / SoHo
text: Spent 5 nights at the hotel for a dad & teenager trip to NYC. Great atmosphere, cool location & super team looking after us. Our trip was made better by tips and ideas ranging from the cool sneaker places to the restaurants around the corner. Will definitely come back even when going on a business trip which usually leads me to stay in midtown.

title: Hyper-trendy
text:
I think the loss of one star is more a reflection of my 54 years, and not the hotel particularly - cos I am going to sound like a right old f*rt!
No check-in desk - just two tables staffed by, not a concierge, but staff referred to as facilitators (I think, or 'enablers'??) - anyway, something just a tad pretentious.
Ordered some room service, which arrived in a brown bag. This will sound really picky, but I kind of expected it to arrive on a tray, with a bit of table linen, as in the pictures on the in-room tablet you use to order it. I've since been informed that there is a little disclaimer on the ordering page telling you this, but I missed it.
'Personally curated minibar experience' - still not sure what that was.
Anyway, everybody very friendly and efficient. Breakfast in the hotel very good too. Just so, SO trendy that you felt at times as if you'd wandered in to the set of an Ab Fab remake. But what else would you expect from a new hotel in SoHo, NYC!

title: Loved it!!!
text:
I loved this hotel. It's a sleek boutique hotel. The lobby is contemporary with check-in handled at a large round table by any of the staffers in the lobby. The hallways (just a bit too dark for my middle-aged eyes) are elegant in dark gray awash with interesting lighting. 

Our check-in was delayed but we were offered a free drink in the bar or library. We found the staff to be extremely friendly and not at all stuffy or snobby as you often get in these types of hotels. 

Our room, while small, was big enough for our needs with contemporary Danish-style furniture and plenty of closet space, mini-bar you can have custom-stocked from their list of pre-order items, and a safe. The room's design is sleek but warm. There's a tablet you can order services or items from and look up information. There was free Wifi. 

The bathroom also a bit small was elegant, sleek, and well appointed with the best toiletries I've ever used in a hotel. We even Googled the products which turned out to be Australian and very expensive.

The room and bathroom were spotless.  

We did have an adjoining door to the room next door. Beware that you can hear the occupants if you have this type of room. Next time, I'll ask for a non-adjoining room!

We can't wait to stay here again!

title: Quirky yet classic
text:
This hotel has an awesome trendy feel with classic touches and as such appeals to a wide crowd.  The staff are brilliant and make you feel very welcome.
We stayed in a queen room, apparently upgraded although the room was still quite cosy but it is New York so got to be expected. However rooms are perfectly formed and the toiletries are amazing.
The wine hour on certain nights is a fabulous touch, even though I can't help get frustrated at those that take advantage of such a nice feature. 

The one downside was the numerous knocks from the chambermaids on the morning of our check out repetitively asking when we were leaving. We left an hour before check out time so were not late by any means. Not great form when you want to enjoy your last morning in a nice hotel. 

Otherwise great place and would recommend.

title: Minimal and Chic
text: My husband and I used Hotel Tonight to book this hotel last fall. We were in town for a last minute event and the hotel was extremely accommodating with a late check in. The rooms were a bit on the smaller side from what we are even used to with NYC but they were clean, neat and the bed was comfortable. I wish I could have the pink throw on the beds!

title: Très bel hôtel dans un quartier très sympa
text:
Bel hôtel, jolie déco contemporaine, notre chambre était petite mais confortable (literie +++) ainsi que la salle de bains; en revanche, peu de place pour ranger ses affaires... 
Petit déjeuner dans un salon - salle à manger avec des petites tables, des grandes tables, des chaises, des canapés, des fauteuils, un cadre très sympathique; le petit déjeuner est excellent mais un peu cher, le choix est  la carte et le moindre morceau de pain ou autre supplémentaire est payant...
Et essayez de réserver avant de venir, mais à l'avance, le restaurant de l'hôtel, le coucou (très bon parait-il); restés trois nuits dans cet hôtel, impossible d'avoir une table, et quand vous appelez la réception ou le restaurant directement, on vous dit que les réservations sont faites plus de 20 jours à l'avance et qu'ils ne prennent pas les réservations de dernière minute... Dommage... 
Quartier très vivant de Soho avec beaucoup de choses à faire.
Un bon séjour, un bel endroit à découvrir

title: Bien ubicado pero ruidosa la habitación
text: Muy lindo el hotel, moderno y bien ubicado. Nos quedamos en una habitación doble. Muy chica sin lugar para guardar la ropa. Éramos dos. Estábamos en el piso 6 y se escuchaba el subte, se sentía en la cama cuando pasaba. Sin embargo es un lindo hotel, muy amables todos. Aunque no volvería por lo chicas y ruidosas las habitaciones.

title: Ferias
text:
Fomos desrespeitados estando no hotel.O bar funciona das 5 às 9 da noite aberto diretamente 
No hotel,a partir daí administração independente.Fomos ao bar logo cedo e nos informamos se podíamos ir ao bar mais tarde,e fomos informados que sim.Quando voltamos do jantar para ir ao bar,fomos barrados na porta do
Bar,o porteiro alegou se tratar de uma festa privada,o que era mentira ,inclusive confirmado pelos funcionários do hotel.Disseram que não podem interferir na administração do bar.Passamos uma vergonha ao sermos barrados no
Bar do
Hotel.Péssimo,acabou com todo conceito que eu tinha do hotel ,diferenciado ,caro e elegante,restou a decepção

title: Great hotel
text: What a great hotel!  As soon as I walked in to the lobby I was greeted right away.  Really loved the Scandinavian decor, the unique architecture and artwork.  The room was very comfortable.  I stayed in a double room and it was a bit crowded but worked fine.

title: Contemporary style in good SoHo location
text:
Great location for cruising around Soho (lots of shops/restaurants) and just one block from a subway station makes it a solid choice if your want to stay in this neighborhood. Super friendly doormen is a nice way to arrive/leave. The reception area itself is basically one big room with tall ceilings and a big round table. You're checked in by someone using a tablet. It worked fine for us, but does feel a bit awkward. In particular, if there's more than one party waiting to check in (or just wanting to ask something) there's no way to queue up so it gets a bit frustrating. Don't care for it. 

The room is nice (some reviewers have called it scandinavian in style with plenty of blond wood and that seems about right). It all feels new which is nice, but the rooms are .... a bit tight. We had a Howard deluxe room and although we didnt feel claustrophobic we did both react to the diminutive size (although the bathroom, hallway and closet were nicely sized!). Minor quibbles would be that the big closet only held maybe 4 hangers and no iron (tho staff were very prompt in bringing it to us on request). There's a really nice sitting area (the library) with light service (dont need to buy anything) where you can hang out and read/work. It's one floor up which seems to help it stay less busy (i.e. you can get somewhere to sit easily).

So, would we stay here again? We didnt find much else that we liked when searching for a place in this area, however I think we'd look around to see if there's anything else we could try. With that said, overall it's a nice place to stay and partly dependent on what the going rate is (NYC can get quite pricey).

title: Super Service
text: We were incredibly impressed with the service and friendliness at 11 Howard. The staff made everything easy and comfortable-in a city that can sometimes be anything but.  The hotel was clean and quiet, in the middle of hustle and bustle.  Location is accessible to subway and within walking distance of anything we wanted.  We would book it again in a heartbeat!

title: Cool Stay
text: I don't do very many reviews, but I want to start giving ones when it's deserved.  I haven't stayed in a ton of hotels in NYC, but regardless, I had a great stay this past week.  From check-in through check-out, I felt the staff were always available and eager to help and make my visit smooth and comfortable.  Yes, the hotel is hip and minimalist, but beyond that it is a place I would want to stay because I felt at home yet catered to.  If you want modernity, quality, and convenience, please stay here.  I can't wait to go back.

title: Great location, small closets
text: The location of this hotel is very good. In downtown, right at the bottom of Soho and walking distance to Tribeca, Lower east side and Wall street. Canal st station is next to the hotel so if you need to go uptown is super easy.  The rooms are very nicely done, albeit small (but  this is NY so is expected), beds were super confortable  and the bathrooms are really well appointed. The only thing that is odd is the closet which is very very small. I stayed for 6 days and had to rotate clothing from my suitcase into the closet... The staff is very friendly and helpful. They do try do their best to accommodate your requests. There is a very small "fitness" centre, but they also give you a pass if you really need to use a real gym.  The Blond bar is ok, but nothing really to be desperate to go in.  The mezzanine area is also nicely done, but it can get crowed. The walls of the rooms are thin, but I did not had a problem and did not hear anything. You can sometimes feel the subway (I was on the 7th floor) but nothing that will keep you awake. Overall a very nice hotel, not crazy expensive and with a great location.

title: Great Stay
text:
I've spent one week at 11Howard.
An innovative hotel concept where customer's care is the top priority. 
Élégance, comfort, attention from the very professional and welcoming staff. Ingrédients which made me feel like at home. 
The library is a great place where you can  have your breakfast, relax, study or work. Fantastic music compilation.
Nice room larger than I have ever found in NY.
Bravi bravissimi hope to stay at 11Howard again !

title: Quiet access to lively Soho
text: I stayed here with my fiancé for two nights; the staff was professional and handled all our needs quickly, we had great walking  access to Soho; thoroughly enjoyed being in the quieter section of the neighborhood; decor is pleasant and on trend, breakfast was excellent; great coffee and avocado toast; excellent library/lounge area for any time of day.

title: Minimalist Approach with Maximum Service
text:
Thanks to a random Expedia choice, my wife and I had the pleasure of staying at 11 Howard, a what I suppose is considered a 'boutique' hotel that borders Chinatown, Little Italy and Soho.  Guests are greeted at the door by helpful staff members.  The front 'desk' is a round table with a small computer for check-in.    Rooms were quiet and nicely appointed with modernist furniture.  Low light throughout the hotel and the minimalist approach is a soothing respite from the wonderful overload that is NYC.

The Canal St. subway station is a block away.  It was an easy walk to Greenwich Village, the East Village,  the 9/11 Memorial and other Lower Manhattan sites. The surrounding Chinatown and Little Italy neighborhoods are just out the front door.  And Balthazar's fantastic coffee and homemade doughnuts were a mere three blocks away.  

Most impressive was the service.  There is an electronic tablet on the nightstand that guests can use to order room service or ask for the usual things one needs in a room, which was a new thing to we Midwestern oldsters.  An extra pillow or room service at the touch of a button.  The staff was helpful and pleasant and each very good at their job.  When it was time to go, a cab was waiting, our luggage was loaded for us, and we vowed to come back as soon as were able.

title: Very nice hotel in a great location
text: I booked this hotel because it was one of the few I could find in the area that had two beds. I also was interested in staying near Soho, as I was tired of Midtown. The rooms were nice, the beds very comfortable, and the location quite well situated. I would stay here again.

title: Fantastic Hotel
text:
I stayed at 11 Howard with my 13 year old daughter for 4 nights and we both loved it. 

It has a very cool, laid back vibe which is reflected in the anatomy of the communal spaces; the reception area is more akin to the lobby of a block of upscale apartments, which makes you feel more like a resident of the city rather than just a visitor; the Library and Blond feel more exclusive and not at all like a thoroughfare being situated on the second floor. It's a great size if, like me, you're not a fan of large hotels.

We stayed in a double room on the eighth floor and didn't hear any of the subway noise reported by some reviews, The only time I noticed it was whilst sitting in the Library but it wasn't disruptive in any way, nor did it spoil the enjoyment of the space. 

Our room was spotlessly clean, beautifully furnished and very comfortable if a little on the snug side, but this is NYC and we didn't visit to sit in our hotel room for large parts of the day. 

The staff from the doormen to the security man, who introduced himself to us whilst on a walk round, couldn't have been more helpful or friendly.

The hotel is situated in my favourite location and it's easy to explore every part of the city from the front door. 

Would stay at 11 Howard on my next visit without hesitation. Just hope it's not too long a wait!

title: Nice location but small, claustrophobic rooms (even by NYC standards)
text: 11 Howard is in a great area and to be sure, this is what you're paying for. Nice bar area.The rooms are small and cheaply furnished. There are better options in the neighborhood. I've stayed at a few of the Design Hotel branded hotels and this is the least impressive.

title: wonderful hotel, wonderful stay, wonderdul team
text:
Everything was excellent, great location, great decoration very good service
I had a corner room, very bright with a living area, nice bathroom with large walking shower
library is nice to have a break, a rest and to drink a coffee or a glass or wine
tks for everything

title: Great location. Wonderful friendly and helpful staff. Laid back approach without sacrificing service.
text:
I've started to travel fairly frequently to New York for work and have been staying mostly in mid-town Manhattan, so the opportunity to try a hotel slightly further down the city was something I looked forward to.
For me, the location is absolutely perfect. There's definitely a more chilled out vibe in this area, whilst you are still only 10 minutes walk from the Hudson (where I like to run), and 25 minutes walk to the hustle and bustle of the main Manhattan shopping and office district.
The walk up to Washington Square and up 5th is lovely, and you can really enjoy and wonder how the single street can morph from an urban residential street into such a shopping and business mecca, in just a few block. Anyway I digress....
The hotel itself is large and minimalist. The fact that you haven;t got a traditional "reception desk" but rather a round table, with the staff with tablets ready to check you in in seconds, not only takes the rigmarole of checking in right away, but also stets you up for how this hotel is run.
It's very informal. It's very casual. But in no way does that mean you don;t get wonderful service and with a genuine smile. The staff, every one of them, were super helpful whether it was just giving directions, putting water in your hands (even if you didn't ask for it), through to enquiring about your day. It's classy and honest as opposed to stiff and fake, and it makes your stay more welcoming for that.
I got a room on the 8th floor, and whilst my view wasn't the best, the room was very comfortable and was well laid out. 
Everything you needed to know was on the tablet next to the bed which was really handy.
The bar is really a very nice place to have a drink and on certain nights turns in to a nightclub which can be lively, so make sure you ask for a higher floor room if you are a light sleeper.
Overall 11 Howard will become my stay of choice when I visit New York. I am that impressed and delighted with it.

title: Fantastiskt hotel med ett perfekt läge.
text: Jag tycker att 11 Howard erbjuder det där extra som gör att helgen eller veckan i NY blir lyckad. Personalen är otroligt trevliga och hjälpsamma, inredningen är väldigt tilltalande, The Library och The Blond är två ställen som gör att man bara vill stanna kvar på hotellet även om NY väntar utanför dörren. Tillgången till UFC gymmet runt hörnet adderar det där lilla extra som gör att du kan träna ordentligt på semestern eller affärsresan.

title: Great staff, perfect location
text: Very nice modern, clean design. Super helpful and friendly staff. Big bonus having Le Coucou downstairs for New York's premier breakfast, plus the cocktails are super in The Blond. A nice touch is the free bottles of water in the lobby.

title: Didn't want to leave!
text:
11 Howard! 

The hotel is in a perfect location in soho right night next to canal st subway station. It's in the cutest little area with gorgeous little boutiques and restaurants around every corner. 

The staff are extremely helpful and very nice. We arrived at 7am hoping we could just leave our bags at reception until check in but instead they got us into a room straight away which was ideal for us to have a nap before venturing into the city. 

The decor was modern and simply beautiful throughout the hotel and they have the comfiest beds I have ever laid on! If it wasn't for my limited baggage allowance on the plane I would have bought the pillows which are on offer to purchase. 

We had an amazing time and will definitely stay here again when we return!

title: Great hotel
text: Excellent service from reservation to check-out.  We needed a restaurant booking before we'd checked in and the concierge was super efficient and helpful.  Our room was great, as were the bar and breakfast.

title: Wonderful staff, beautiful trendy hotel in great location
text: Check in was easy and we were provided bottled waters throughout our stay with no extra fee. The staff was friendly and helpful and there was even a free happy hour one night. The location was great and easy to walk to a lot of great shopping and dining locations. Would recommend this to anyone who is looking to stay in Soho!

title: Great stay
text:
Everyone at the hotel was helpful and prompt, I was happy with the service and the location of the property. I would recommend 11 Howard for this area of NYC. The library and restaurant were nice chill spots too.

-Mason Plumlee

title: Memorable for the bruises and noise
text:
To put this review in context, I've flown over 2 million actual miles and stayed many thousands of nights in hotels. This in only the second review I have ever written

In NY, i usually use hoteltonight as I book whatever location is closest to my first meeting.  As I usually only stay one night, almost anything is acceptable.  Given that I am paying a relatively low rate, I assume that I will be in one of the worst rooms.  But you can tell a lot about a hotel from one of the worst rooms.

11 Howard is quite simply lipstick on a pig.  The issues cannot be fixed as they are environmental or built in from the core.

1) You can't change the subway.  Other reviews have mentioned, but you do really hear every subway every few minutes.  The entire room shakes.  The glasses clink, the furniture vibrates.  If you are a heavy sleeper, you probably wont mind.  But it is definitely there and not going anywhere.  Now, in the room, they place the drinking glasses on a marble slab on the desk.  This is not a good idea.  I found that placing one of the washcloths below the glasses minimized the rattle of the glasses quite significantly.  Hint to management: try coasters.

2) The room is small.  Small is often ok, but the arrangement is poor, at least in the room I had.  I took a picture which I will try to upload.  The distance between the end of the bed and the chair for the desk (which only protrudes about 2 inches from the desk is less than 12 inches.  Therefore in order to get to the bed you have to walk a path that is less than 12 inches wide.  You WILL stub your toe, bang your shin on the back of the chair etc.  Hence the bruises.  

3) The walls are very badly insulated.  You can hear a light sneeze easily from the next room along with everything else.

4) The bathroom is a strong point.  well appointed.  The size precludes a bath, which is good for those who hate bath/showers as I do.  One small peeve is that it is a poor shower design.  You have to reach/step in to turn the water on.  i.e. You will get cold water on at least some part of you in order to turn the water on.  Well designed showers in good hotels do not do this.  

5) When checking in I asked if there were rooms that were quieter than others.  They checked availability and told me that because I was checking in so late, this was the only room available. It was 6:30 pm.  Usually not considered late to check in at a NY hotel.  Other small issues like forgetting to write down the wifi password, one staff member in casual conversation referred to the person who checked me in as "not very good," etc.  small things but signs of not generally well run hotels.

title: Possibly the worst hotel in the World
text:
I've stayed in the full range of hotels that NY offers from the grande dames (St Regis, Plaza, Carlyle, The Mark, Plaza Athenee, Ritz Carlton) to the more "cool" establishments such as Gramercy Park, Crosby, Soho Grand and Soho House.  All these hotels have their strengths and weaknesses but all provide acceptable, and in some cases exceptional levels of accommodation and service. I can unequivocally say this 11 Howard fails in every respect:
-it is located on top of the subway line so rooms even on higher floors vibrate to the rhythm of the trains
-it is said in some NY bathrooms you can't swing a cat: at 11 Howard you can't swing a mouse
-the closets are tiny (with 5 hangers) and no gowns
-the mini bar is bizarrely empty: its only purpose is to fry the contents of your safe
-the hotel is in Chinatown; and not the "center of Soho" as some reviews suggest
-potential visitors may be seduced by the idea of dining in Le Coucou (Stephen Starr's highly rated new eatery) which is located on the ground floor of the hotel. Well you can forget this: the only link with the hotel is the rent they pay to occupy what should be a prime part of the hotel. The same applies to the bar at weekends (the Blond) : hotel guests are invited to queue up outside to gain access to the hotel bar!!!
IN SUMMARY this hotel struck me as one designed by a private equity firm that masquerades behind the idea of an eco-friendly and cool proposition but in fact has cut costs at every opportunity which results in an appalling offering to customers
PS the staff are unfailingly friendly but mostly hopelessly inexperienced

title: Super Cool
text:
Easy check-in, helpful staff. 

Rooms really well appointed, tablet in room for all guest needs (room service, turn down, maps etc). Free bottled water any time of day.

Gym was small but nobody used it so it was like a private gym - really cool.

Room service is great. All ordered via tablet, the breakfast sandwich was great and came with breakfast potatoes, juice and coffee for $16. Grilled cheese sandwich and tomato soup was some of the best food I've had in New York (not kidding).

Staff were very professional and there was no sense of ownership over who did what (i.e. check in, cab hailing, concierge) - all wanted to help.

I had a discrepancy on my bill when I returned home but after a few emails it was rectified. Will be staying here again for sure.

title: Awesome hotel!
text:
We spent our 5 year anniversary in NY, our first time being there.
11 Howard was rated well, and we are so glad to have stayed there!

They actually upgraded my reservation to a Corner Studio, and it was fantastic!  Lots of space, windows, and amenities.  Friendly staff, and just the perfect location for us, since we wanted to just be able to walk around to great food areas.

We will definitely stay there again if we ever visit NY again!

title: FANTASTIC SURPRISE
text:
Was in NYC for meetings for a couple of days and landed on 11 Howard by chance and was wonderfully surprised.  Beyond the obvious details about the rooms, lounge, restaurant, etc. the most important point was the service - it was impeccable: warm, friendly but not overly familiar, helpful at every turn, and completely responsive and reliable.
From the moment I arrived and had a bunch of requests for extra towels and pillows, to the next morning when I missed breakfast, there was always an 11 Howard teammate around who would appear with what I needed or find a solution to my problem at hand.
The second floor lounge and bar are a perfect relaxing place for a meeting or a solo laptop session during the day...and for some fun at night ("the blond" - the club).
I've stayed all over from the Plaza Athenée to the BHH to the Oberois across India...and the staff here is right up there with them.  Bravo.

title: A bit overrated
text: Very nice design. Half of the staff was very kind. Room was very loud even though we were on the 8th floor. There was a train passing by so the whole room was vibrating. Walls were extremely thin like in cheap motel, one night we were woken up because our bed was shaking because our neighbors were having sex. I don't mind people having sex, I just don't expect that in hotel I'm paying 530$ per night I will be suffering from that. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to any of my friends.

title: excelente
text: Perfecto para una semana en Nyc, locación perfecta para salidas diurnas y nocturnas, calidad, camas increibles, el restaurante es simple pero de excelente calidad, ambiente y una atención divina, uno no siente que está en un hotel.

title: Perfect spot in the middle of SoHo
text: We checked in and were pleasantly surprised with a complimentary upgrade to the 12th floor with a huge balcony! Great start to the stay. The lobby is modern and sleek, and the check-in desk is nothing more than a round table and an iPad. The room was large for NYC standards and walking distance from almost everything - Brooklyn, One World Trade Center, SoHo/LES etc. What's more, there's a complimentary happy hour on the second floor which was an added bonus that really complimented the great experience.

title: Wanna be cool hotel / unfriendly stuff / loud
text:
For New York standards the hotel is ok...

...but:
- Rooms are so tiny that it is impossible to open a Rimowa suitcase (really it is not possible!)
- Beneath the hotel runs the subway and whenever a subway comes through the whole hotel room rattles!!!
- On the second floor is the hotel bar. Normally you would expect that hotel guests can enter the bar at any time. But from 10pm on you have to go outside the hotel to a different entrance where a bouncer decides whether you can enter the bar or not (and the hotel stuff does not care at all about the decision!) Besides: prices at the bar are ridiculous...a bottle of normal gin costs 525$ (really?)
- The bar becomes a Club after 10pm: you can hear and feel every beat in your room (good luck to find some sleep) 
- It is not really clean: when you drop something in your closet it is covered in dust...
- The staff feels too cool to be friendly - basically you can be happy when they say hello

So decide yourself if you want to stay in such a wanna be cool hotel.

title: Nice Hotel and Excellent Service
text:
A group of us recently went to NY to visit NYU.  11Howard was pretty close by and unlike a lot of hotels in NYC I was looking at, offered rooms with two double beds. We found the hotel to be in a good location and the room to be clean, comfortable, and a decent size for New York City.  We really liked the in room IPADs that we used to request anything we needed, including extra towels as well as robes and slippers.  I have to say, though, what really stood out was the absolutely exceptional service provided by the hotel staff.  I wish I would have written down a few more names, but I can say anyone at 11Howard who was working Easter weekend when I was there provided impeccable service.  

The hotel itself is a quiet boutique hotel on a quieter street, so getting dropped off and picked up was easier with no traffic to impede us.  We were greeted and assisted on the sidewalk the day we arrived with staff handling our luggage and offering us bottled water.  Hotel staff recognized us during the weekend when we came back to the hotel, coming out to greet us, open the door and offer us bottled water.  11Howard had a second floor library with comfortable furniture, complementary coffee and tea in the morning hours and cold lemon water all day.  The concierge desk was also staffed in the library throughout the day where they assisted in our airline check in and printed out boarding passes, offered assistance with places to see, providing maps and directions as well as helped with restaurant suggestions and reservations.  We never had to wait long for service from the concierge, often walking up and getting what we needed immediately.

I did manage to get a few names of the phenomenal staff.  Nef was working the concierge desk and called around for us to find a place that sold canes to help out one of our group who was having difficulty getting around.  She even had the place set aside what we needed so we could get it quickly.  Rodriguez was on security detail and was very friendly and welcoming to us.  Michael handled my check out on the last day and suggested he take my suitcase down the stairs for me after directing me to take the elevator, so my hands could be free to carry a cup of coffee.  Small details can really make the customer feel important.

title: Just ok
text: We recently stayed here to celebrate my husbands bday. It's a great location the beds are comfy but the room was somewhat depressing in its simplicity. The walls were dirty and you can hear the tv next door. The bathroom was large and the shower good. They have the European type toilets that everything sticks to, if you know what I mean. During our stay we had one day of torrential rain so we ate in. I am celiac and there was hardly any choices for me on their small menu. Needless to say I was very hangry later in the day. The staff were very nice but I don't think we'll be back. It's really hard to find a reasonably priced good hotel in that part of Manhattan.

title: Great location and staff
text:
Every staff member I encountered greeted me with a smile.  When I asked about Korean restaurant recommendations, I received this under my door.  Love the personal touch!  

The location is perfect.  Getting around the city was easy using the subways and the neighbourhood one of our favourites.  

The corner room was perfect for getting work done and resting.

title: Very boutique-y, but are they trying too hard?
text: Upon entry, you are greeted by very charming "front desk hosts" who are really roving staffers with an iPad.  It's sure neat to get checked in all by iPad w/o standing at a front desk.  If the staffers are busy, you might miss where you are supposed to go in the lobby.  Rooms are of the functional/utilitarian variety - modern and sparsely decorated.  Walls are thin which was surprising and you can hear hallway conversations like they are in your room.  There's a nice restaurant adjoining the hotel that's more traditional - good service/food there.  There's an "interesting" 2nd floor library/bar where you can get drinks, light food and just hang out on your laptop. It's like stumbling into an Internet cafe or WeWork during the day.  At night, it's a little different as it's all about the beats and bass pumping, club-like.  The location is excellent and the streets nearby are full of neat boutiques, restaurants, etc.  The integration w/ Starwood is not quite there - you can book via SPG but they didn't have my Platinum # upon check in and despite me giving it to them, I still haven't seen credit for this stay a week later.  Looks like I will have to call it in - drag.

title: Fantastic location; great hotel
text: My son (24) and I spent 4 nights at 11 Howard and shared a room. We were quite comfortable. The hotel was perfect really - we were in town to visit NYU and we went to jazz clubs in the Village and Harlem every night. Canal St. subway station right around the corner. Lyft was never more than 2 minutes away. Coffee in The Library every morning was relaxing. Loved the "custom" mini bar. Nice mid-priced hotel. Request room on upper floors - very quiet. Sorry not to eat at Le Cou Cou - will make sure to do so next visit.

title: Good time
text: I really enjoyed my stay here. The location is fantastic. The staff were really friendly and welcoming upon arrival. The check in was really efficient and I appreciated all the complimentary water (I must have looked dehydrated!!). My room was ready early, a decent size, nicely appointed and with a comfortable bed.  There were free drinks, the lounge/club attached to the hotel was super fun and there is a small gym. My only suggestion would be to make it clearer that there is a small gym with a few pics because it kind of appeared on the website that you needed to get passes for the gym nearby. Would definitely stay here again!

title: Nettes Hotel in Soho mit hervorragendem Frühstück
text: Das Hotel hat erst 2016 nach Komplettrenovierung neu eröffnet. Saubere, aber kleine Zimmer. Vor allem das Bad ist winzig. Die Zimmerausstattung (mit eigenem Tablet) ist hochwertig. Leider sind die amerikanischen Fenster nicht sehr schallschluckend, so dass man Nachts des öfteren vom Martinshorn der Polizeiwagen geweckt wird. Das Frühstück ist hervorragend, wenn auch nicht billig.

title: Pleasantly Surprised!
text:
I can honestly say that this was by far the best hotel experience I have had in a very long time. It started from the minute we were let in through the front doors into your super cool "reception" area. 
I believe the gentleman's name was Mike - and he made us feel very welcome and was incredibly accommodating. He ensured that we would not be above the night club - as we were there to shop hard....not party hard!
Your staff were all really top quality- and they all seem to be having fun on top of it.  Even the cleaning/ maintenance staff were super polite and greeted us in the halls and on the elevator. 
Keep up this rapport and vibe and you will have guaranteed success.
The hotel overall - great location, beautifully decorated- and the low key hip vibe of the lobby area - awesome. With free wine on select nights to boot!

I would stay at your hotel again without hesitation- and I have already told several friends and work colleagues about my visit.

Keep up the good work

title: PRIME CHOICE IN NYC, THE COOLEST
text:
I've stayed at 11H about 5 times.

Things I love: Lobby, Doormen, Reception, cool minimalist but trendy guest rooms, bathroom design is so simple yet luxurious, 
GROWN ALCHEMIST TOILETRIES, clean, consistent, speedy service. Ahh effect. 

Things that need improvement:
Pillows are too soft for me, but they send extras immediately.

title: Horrible
text:
The closet was so small I couldn't find it.  I had to call the desk for information. When I did find the closet, the lower part had a safe, so forget hanging slacks. No drawers. I mean no place to put your underwear. 
The room smelled funny.  Don't bother.

title: excellent séjour
text:
Superbe séjour dans cet hotel très raffiné et décoré avec beaucoup de gout. L'ambiance générale est vraiment très agréable et on s'y sent vraiment très  bien. Le personnel est vraiment extra et très serviable ( Thank you Robert ;). Toujours souriant, et à votre service.
Les lieux de vie, tels que la library et le bar sont d'un confort extreme... Les chambres sont agréables, très calmes, et la literie est une merveille !! L'hotel est idealement situé, dans Soho, point de départ vers tous les autres quartiers.

title: Excellent hotel
text:
We stayed 3 nights. The hotel was very accommodating for our breakfast requests. Always polite, available,  quick to please. Excellent service. 

Room was clean. Water pressure very good. Would definitely stay again

title: Really nice!
text: In a neighborhood which has changed dramatically to the good side over the last couple of years, 11 Howard is real jewel. Transformed what used to be the former Holiday Inn, it is a (big) boutique hotel, nicely designed, with a nice bar and top restaurant as well. Try rooms high up as New York is a noisy place... the 12th floor offered privacy, quietness and a nice area to retreat. Friendly and efficient, helpful staff - a really positive surprise in the NY hotel scene!

title: Great design -- for your eyes
text: If you like your hotel design elegant and modern versus colorful and trendy, this could be the hotel for you.  The service is very friendly and efficient.  The second floor lounge is enormous.  It is on all four sides of the hotel around the center utilities (elevators, kitchen, stairs, etc.)  Wonderful bar.  Comfortable seating for eating, working, or relaxing.  The food looked very good although I did not try it. The bed was very comfortable. The rooms are quiet.  There are some rather strange design decisions in the rooms however.  Our corner room had two large flat screen televisions but neither was particularly comfortable to watch.  One was on a wall parallel to the bed.  It could be adjusted to stick away about three inches from the wall on one end so was not comfortable for watching from the bed.  The other television could only be watched by turning the desk chairs 90 degrees but could not really be seen from the sofa.  The closet contains a storage chest so that there is not really room to hang a long jacket without it hitting the top of the chest of drawers.  There is a small amount of space to the side but it is filled by a ironing board.  The storage drawers are designed so that each drawer has the side facing out forming a perfect square -- very lovely to look at.  But this results in a narrow drawer that isn't very useful unless you are only putting rolled or small items into it.  Folded shirts do not fit without a lot of refolding.  Watch out for the lovely hanging lamp over the desk lest you hit your head on it -- it swings easily so you will not be hurt but it is a strange design.  And the bathrooms, as mentioned by others, are reminiscent of those on a very upscale first class airplane.

title: One of my favorites in NYC
text:
I spent nearly a month at the 11 Howard, staying in a few rooms over the course of that time. It's a beautiful hotel right in SoHo and because a home away from home. 

The lobby and in-room dining staff all came to know me and were personal and cheery (although the staff in the bar / breakfast room were slow and inattentive - that's my one real criticism of the hotel). The food is good. There's a beautiful breakfast room and lounge on the second floor, where I'd often work (it was such a great space that even when I moved to a different hotel closer to my client I would sometimes come back here to work for an afternoon). 

Finally, the rooms are super cozy and relaxing - three highlights here were (1) the natural light (2) the great bathtub (3) a desk and desk chair that looked more "modern design" than functional but turned out to be one of the most comfortable and productive office setups I've ever encountered (maybe I need one of those chairs at home...)

This and the Gramercy Park Hotel are hands down my favorite two hotels in NYC and this is probably about half the price of the other. I hope to be back soon!

title: 3 nights in Manhatten
text: My son and I spent three nights at 11 Howard last week. The staff were very attentive, and the service , food and amenities were excellent.  The location was convenient to activities and food in lower Manhattan . We look forward to returning with the whole family.

title: Great new hotel
text: No complaints, the rooms in my experience are bigger than the average in New York City, the staff is very helpful and it's a breeze to check in and out. Great location as well for shopping in Soho and great restaurants.

title: Sleep Some More
text: I loved staying at this hotel for so many reasons. First, the location is on a quiet street, but in the heart of SoHo. The team managing the hotel are perfect: fun, engaging (in a good way) and accommodating.   The ground level is a world class restaurant, Le Coucou, where the concierge can assist in snagging you a couple seats.  The room and beds are crisp, super comfortable; best of all is the 12 noon check out (not like the inhumane 11 am like so many other hotels) so you can catch a few extra minutes of zzzzzzzzs.  Will definitely stay here during my next visit to NYC!

title: Quite the change from the Holiday Inn Express
text: I love the location, design, and service in general at this hotel.  Super efficient use of space, amazing common areas (love Le CouCou, the library, and Le Blond), but not great additional amenities.  Gym is garbage and little to no recognition of SPG status.  Understand that it is the hot place to be, but would love a chocolate or something :)

title: Luxury Hotel with a Personal Vibe
text: As someone who travels to NYC frequently for business, I have to say that 11 Howard is my go-to spot. At this point 11 Howard has become a home away from home. And the staff is like a second family. Always willing to go above and beyond to accommodate, it's no wonder they are able to bring such a personal touch to my stay each time. I've even made their 3 bedroom suite the go-to for trips into the city with the family. Their great location adds to the cool neighborhood feel and is within walking distance to fantastic food and shopping on Broadway. Their hotel bar The Blond makes for a fun night out, followed by a delicious meal the next day at Le Coucou! I highly recommend booking your stay at 11 Howard STAT!!

title: Excellent hotel - highly recommended
text: Visited over Easter Weekend. Great location, smoothest check in / check out experience ever, superb rooms in size, amenities and scandi deco, best tablet coordination for room service etc. and last but not least, great adjacent bar, The Blond. Try it and love it.

title: New York new favourite.
text:
Booked here (via Expedia) for Easter break - very wary of boutique hotels and decided to stay here on the strength of the other positive reviews. Room under my rate was the smallest in the hotel - too small for 2 people - but they switched us to a Howard King Deluxe after the first night for a nominal fee.  COMPLETELY WORTH IT. The room was just right - clean lines, uncluttered, good day light, ample space. What's more, we had to stay an extra night and the concierge was kind enough to let us keep our existing room, despite it being a second, different booking.

The concierge and front desk were impeccably mannered without being stuffy or pompous. Very friendly and welcoming.  Le Coucou (restaurant) was very nice, but I preferred it for the breakfast than for the dinner. (For art fans, there are three Sugimotos on display in the Library).

Hotel location may be counterintuitive (right above Canal Street) but actually super-convenient for Soho, Nolita, Tribeca and downtown.  

Highly, highly recommend this one. Will definitely return.

title: So so la la
text: Die Lage des Hotels ist toll! Architektonisch schaut es gut aus und die Einrichtung ist nordisch-schön. Das Personal ist unfreundlich, die Zimmer klein, zu kleine Schränke, zu kleines Bad, ringhörig....Preis-Leistung stimmt nicht!!!

title: Best staff in NYC!
text:
I just wanted to say that our stay at 11Howard was our first but not our last! It was a wonderful experience and could not find one single thing wrong with our time there. ALL the staff were exceptional and helpful. We liked how everyone seemed to be tasked with doing whatever role they were asked (eg front door staff checked us in!). Great room…clean and well equipped. It was great to have the iPad in the room as the hub of all info and/or requests. Loved the extra touches and mini events in the Library Bar. 
I wanted to especially single out Joanne who we used as both front door reception and then also at the concierge desk at times. She was incredible and went above and beyond on several things that we neither asked nor expected her to do.

Great hotel and we look forward to returning on each of our NYC trips.

title: Not just a bed, an experience
text:
If you plan to stay downtown around SoHo and want to get a true NYC experience, 11 Howard is your place. Walking into the lobby immediately sends notice that this is not your standard, cookie cutting hotel. Fortunately for guests, the minimalist decor is occupied by NYC's friendliest staff who quickly set a tone that is at once professional and homey. 

Staying at 11 Howard is like going to a party at really rich friend's apartment building. The vibe is young, the decor is modern and clean and the location is in the heart of SoHo. I cannot say enough about all the staff. LOVE THIS PLACE!

title: Good, with some tweaking could be great :)
text: The obvious is that this is a great location for a hotel.  Close to many cool neighbourhoods with the train (Canal St) just steps away.  I think there's a lot of positive things, but having stayed in many amazing NYC hotels over the years I do have some comments.  The non-existent front desk is becoming a common theme but it doesn't work that well when you're checking in late at night - no one is around and you walk into an open space with a bit of confusion.  The empty mini bar has its pros and cons - I liked having the fridge empty as I hit WholeFoods and stocked up on my own food.  Would have been nice to have a couple minibar options available in the room however.  When I arrived to check in it was close to midnight and absolutely nothing was explained to me - ie. how to use the tablet in the room, when and where breakfast is served, whether there was a gym on site etc.  The rooms seemed very dark to me and a little too industrial/ minimalist for their own good but I thought the bed was exceptional.  If you don't want to hear the constant rumble of the subway day and night you MUST request a high floor to avoid that.  The bathroom was very, very tiny even for NYC standards (and I had a corner studio which was supposed to be a larger room).  The Library has complimentary coffee (La Colombe) which is a nice touch, but while I was there they had a list of smoothies for breakfast on the menu yet NONE of them were available (??).  My biggest complaint is the way they deliver room service:  in a brown paper bag with plastic forks and knives.  This simply does not work for the calibre of food they are serving. You cannot cut food with a plastic fork, LOL.  Some of the features of this hotel are too cool or too hipster for anyone's good.  If I'm paying $600+ a night for a room don't give me my food in a paper bag with plastic utensils!!!  Also, I called down one day to ask if a couple bottles of water could be brought up to the room and a nice gentleman said no problem.  The next day I called and requested the same thing and a woman told me no and said a "special exception must have been made the day before".  ?????  There are bottles of water sitting in the lobby free for the taking but they can't run a couple up to my room?  Ok.... all in all I think it's a good hotel but there is plenty of room for improvement and they might be trying a little too hard with the whole hipster vibe.  The brown paper bag room service has to go!

title: Efficient, quality and personable
text:
Coming from a background in luxury hotels, I am often sceptical about hotels that claim to be "luxury" and certainly unimpressed by the quality for the money, but clearly can't help myself.  11 Howard shattered all of my preconceived judgements out of the water.  The staff is personable without being being excessive or fake. The rooms are simple, elegant and comfortable.
When I got back to my room after a wedding, I discovered that they also have an apparently quite popular night club.  I couldn't hear ANYTHING from the room.
Unfortunately, I didn't have the time to check out the restaurant or the library, but I will certainly be sure to do so on my next visit.

title: Superbe
text:
Superbe hôtel 
Décoration très raffinée 
L'hôtel est idéalement situé au cœur de Soho - Chinatown, mais n'est pas bruyant du tout pour autant 
Le bar est très agréable 
Les chambres sont un peu petites en revanche.

title: Amazing Experience
text: I booked 11 Howard last minute.  I showed up shortly after booking and I was unbelievably impressed with the ease of check in.  Less than 1 minute with Joe who was so warm and welcoming I was immediately put in a relaxed mood.  The room is well appointed with beautiful finishings and a king bed that was super comfortable and cozy.  I slept extremely well.  The room was very quiet.  The GM Anis was super helpful that evening in making sure that my guest and I also got to enjoy Le Blonde, the fun lounge/bar within the hotel.  The space was beautiful, the crowd chic, and the music was amazing.  I hope to return soon!!

title: Great find!
text: Nice boutique hotel with friendly staff.  Great bar in hotel for early meetings and cocktails. The location was perfect with proximity to everything in soho.  Room are clean and well outfitted with modern technology.  Would definitely stay here again.

title: Wonderful Experience
text: 11 Howard is a lovely boutique hotel in SoHo, with truly outstanding service.  The staff is welcoming and helpful at every turn.  The beds are super comfortable.  I love the lounge area, which is comfortable for anything from business meetings to social gatherings to solo dining.  I have stayed here twice and look forward to visiting again!

title: Great Experience
text: Went on a business trip for 3 nights and the experience was wonderful. The hotel is cool, contemporary, very well decorated and incredibly well located. The restaurant and food options are top notch. There is a lounge that is really great to take meetings or have a drink without feeling like a hotel business lounge. The staff was very helpful.

title: Great
text: Great hotel for business travel. My original reservation was Fri- Sun, and I decided to stay an extra day. The hotel was able to accommodate easily. Also, pre-authorizing my card for the room was an easy process. Shout out to Anis Khoury.

title: Nice SoHo Option
text:
Below the super high end suite level room, the average NYC hotel room is not any nicer than the average comparable hotel room anywhere else.  Except NYC rooms are tiny, loud, and very expensive.  Value in a NYC hotel room is hard to find.

I found 11 Howard in a search through the SPG website for a room for a business trip.  I hadn't stayed there before, but the rate was at least $100 cheaper than any other reasonable SPG room in the city for the night.  It's in a good SoHo location, and there was good taxi presence in the area.  The check in is sort of modern pretentious.  There's no desk, per se.  There's a round table where airily-dressed staff sweep in and check you in via tablet.  They make a big deal about not having food (minibar) in the rooms, so they give you a bottle of water in the lobby.  So, in addition to your bags and your room key, you also have to juggle the bottle of water.  How about stop trying so hard to be chic/different and just put the water in the room.

The place has a warm vibe.  Wood floors in the elevator, and the room.  Earthy tones.  The room was small. I couldn't get the door to the "closet" open at the same time as the door to the bathroom.  It was one of those closets that is so shallow and partitioned that your shirt and pants can't hang without hitting the shelf that's midway down.  Plus, they only have the tiny ironing board with the four-inch legs.  This drives me crazy.  If you're going to go to the trouble to give me a board and an iron, give me a full-size board.  

All that being said, the room was comfortable,had everything I needed (except the full-size board), and was clean.  The bed was very comfortable.  The shower smelled musty, but everything worked.  

They have tablets in the room through which you contact the concierge service and order room service AND....minibar packages.  Whatever.

I liked this hotel.  It is in a good location for access to downtown, without having to stay downtown.  I ended up walking down to World Financial Center.  The staff are nice enough - you can't blame them for the weird check in/water bottle situations.  

And again it was a decent value for NYC.  

The little things were annoying, but not enough to diminish my rating.

title: Great location in Soho. Good vibes. Small rooms
text: This is a relatively new hotel at Howard and Lafayette. Great location, close to all Soho shops and the restaurants on Lafayette. The decor is minimalist as well as the lobby (I liked it very much!). The Library is very cool. The room was fine, but small. For the same price I had larger rooms at other hotels such as The Broome and even the Soho Grand. The staff was very friendly and there is always free bottle of water at the lobby, a very nice detail.

title: Overnight Birthday Stay
text: My wife and I had an overnight stay and thoroughly enjoyed this hotel. Upon our arrival we met Brian at the reception area, who greeted us and was very helpful. We had an issue with our car and he took the time to get us from our room so we could address the situation. We found the hotel to be nicely decorated and the rooms clean. The "Library" area was very nice. They had a complimentary happy hour (wine) in the early evening and complimentary coffee in the morning. The bar and lounge area also was a popular place to be. We would definitely recommend to our friends and stay here again.

title: FROTHFEST.
text: Had heard a lot about this hotel in the rags. Totally lived up to the hype. Interiors perfect. Staff average to good. Ate at LE COUCOU several times and enjoyed it. Close to Canal St Station. Rooms are generous and very clean. No noise heard from other guests. We felt like we were the only ones staying there.

title: Above Expectations!!!
text:
I stayed 5nights in this hotel and highly recommend it.
The perfect location allows you to do everything by feet in the best areas of Manhattan : shopping, restaurants, visits ... . 
Moreover the team is exceptional! I travel more than 50% of my time and always in 5* hotels, I can admit that I'm spoiled by hight standards services. I didn't expect that I will find the same standard in Nyc and actually I found better : friendly staff and very professional! Amazing concierge service and a modern hotel with a touch of luxury without any prétention ! 
Thanks to 11 Howard's team for our stay, we will definitely repeat the experience in our next trip In Nyc. 
A big thanks to Rob, Brian, Mike and Anis who made our holidays very special with their precious tips.

title: Much to appreciate and service that stands out!
text:
This splendidly located hotel was welcome relief from the hotel we had left due to noise problems. We enjoyed a room on the 15th floor which was quite, albeit on the cozy side, but at the price point we expected nothing larger in scale. Furnishings were very much of minimal scandinavian sensibility which added little in the way of luxury but did have a clean and sleek feel. The room was secure and clean, and the bed was excellent and that is always our biggest concerns when getting a room.

What stands out more than anything else in this hotel is the endless efforts of the staff to make their guests feel welcome. I was a little jarred from their break from tradition with a deskless reception but found that their regard for hospital truly traditional. All staff were exceptionally cheery and greeted us all with a smile at every opportunity.

We found this to be great value in a location was well placed to access Little Italy, Tribeca, SOHO, and was only a $15 cab ride from the Theater district. Without question, if you can walk a few blocks, a solid NYC experience is there for the taking, all in walking distance.

Also great is their free wine in the excellent lounge room on the second floor on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays.

No place is flawless. I suppose if I were to point out any things that could have been slightly more satisfying it is the following. 1)  The bar is terrific but is leased to a nightclub after 10PM and guests have no guaranteed access 2) No coffee makers/machines in the rooms 3) Breakfast was served in paper bags and cups. I got what they were going for but on a vacation and in a hotel, this just doesn't work. The food is not worth ordering unless you really can't get out. Better is available across the street. 4) Their bathrooms are clean but the glass shower guard in the rooms with traditional bathtubs (this used to be a Holiday Inn) is hopelessly undersized and it is virtually impossible to take a shower without leaving the bathroom floor dangerously soaked in a film of water. WATCH YOUR STEP.

With the exception of this point, which in my view should be properly addressed or they will find themselves with a lawsuit sooner or later, all other 'cons' are minor.

This really was a very satisfying visit. I would happily recommend it to those looking for a clean, comfortable and welcome place to stay downtown!

title: Outstanding service, convenient location. Loved it!
text:
Recently stayed for 3 nights on a business trip. The staff was the perfect balance of helpful and friendly. I've never seen so many people that seemed to  truly enjoy their jobs. 

The room was clean and comfortable. Food and drinks in the bar delicious. Loved the free happy hours.

Only comment was the late night room service left a little to be desired. 

Look forward to staying again.

title: No bathtubs except for accessible rooms
text: I called and asked if they had bathtubs in rooms because I *loathe* the new trend of shower-only hotels and have bad joint issues. The gal didn't seem to eager to help. Said simply that only *some* King rooms have tubs and accessible. I said I'd go elsewhere and she didn't protest. Next!

title: Best in class service ~ Soho
text: The staff is impressive from the moment you drive up to the hotel. No check in lines, water offered when you walk in the door, quick check in process from iPads. The hotel is charming, clean and environmentally thoughtful. I was most impressed when a coworker and I headed out to dinner and needed a cab. One of the staff members (I wish I remembered his name because he was GREAT) ran down the street found us a cab and drove down in the cab to meet us at the front door telling the driver where we were headed. You don't find service like that these days. I will definitely be back!!

title: Neues Boutique-Hotel in SoHo
text: Das 11 Howard ist ein neues Hotel im beliebten SoHo und mit der Bar The Blonde und dem Gourmet-Restaurant Le Coucou "the place to be" in einer der interessantesten Straßen von SoHo (south of Houston Street). Die Zimmer sind stilsicher, schlicht und modern eingerichtet und wenn die Bar wie jeden Abend ab 22:00 Uhr nur noch von außen zugänglich ist, kann man sich in der "Bibliothek" die Zeit vertreiben. Hier wird auch das Frühstück serviert. Wer es sich besonders gut gehen lassen will, bucht eine Suite mit Terrasse. Gibt es auch Nachteile? Sicher, auch hier kein Licht ohne Schatten. Die unter dem Gebäude verlaufende U-Bahn verursacht Vibrationen, die empfindliche Gemüter stören können. Ich empfehle das Haus dennoch uneingeschränkt.

title: Fantastiskt!
text:
Detta är ett av de bästa hotellen vi har bott på! 
Nytt, fräscht, snyggt! 
Personalen är magiskt bra. Trevliga, vänliga, omtänksamma och håller en hög klass rakt igenom.
God mat, trevlig lounge, bra bar! 
Kommer garanterat tillbaka! 
Kan bara gratulera ledningen som har skapat en så fantastisk stämning med alla dessa fina anställda! Tack!

title: 11Howard
text: We had a great stay at 11 Howard. Excellent modern design, efficient rooms and comfortable rooms.  Great guest lounge and bar on the second floor.  Terrific food and drinks.  The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful.

title: Excellent - Trendy - Unique
text:
One of the trendiest hotel in the most vibrant location of NYC. Clean, modern and nicely decorated rooms (Danish Style) that make you feel like being home. Quite unique reception - like no other - a nice surprise.
Great, friendly  & experienced Staff, always with a smile ready to help and assist in every way.
Surrounded by a good number of nice and well known restaurants - among them the famous French  "Le Coucou" which is practically...next door.
Blonde Bar is one of the trendiest and maybe the coolest  in NYC right now. 
Shopping streets and key subway station in close distance.
Even though we had the misfortune to visit NYC during the exact days that Storm Stella passed through the city, everything worked perfectly and all of the hotel people were alerted and helpful to overcome any of the difficulties we had to face. 
Thanks a lot and we will see you soon.

title: great dose of soho
text: staying at 11 Howard again.  EVERYONE that works here is so friendly and makes you feel welcome immediately upon entering the property.  Located at the base of Soho it is a great place to explore the neighborhood and soak up the vibe.  A must do is a drink at The Blond and a breakfast at The Library.

title: Trendy spot in a convenient location
text: For individuals who love SoHo and all it has to offer, this is a great spot. I wouldn't recommend it for a long stay, but it's ideal for a quick weekend getaway. Accessible to key subway locale and walkable to a lot of desirable shopping. Free wine Tu/Th/Sat from 6-7 in the library is also key. Major complaint is that walls are paper thin. Otherwise, windows blocked out most NYC traffic noise.

title: Amazing SPG option in Soho
text: Finally I've found a great SPG hotel in the Soho area. Great location, nice rooms, and plenty of public space to work and relax. While not a large gym, at least they did have a gym, it was super helpful during a cold snowy week.

title: perfect weekend
text: we went to visit my son and daughters in new York all living in the lower east side which made 11 Howard a great location. I stayed in Soho in  several hotels in the past, but this was one of the best spots. great room, clean, good space, nice shower and very friendly staff. will stay again.

title: Mixed Feelings
text:
I was unsure on giving 3 or 4 stars.. ultimately there are a ton of positive things to say about this hotel- I'm just not sure it's everyone's cup of tea!

The main areas are beautiful- we enjoyed lounging in the library and having a drink before dinner.. the area was beautifully decorated and all of the employees were really kind and helpful! For that reason, I can't dog the place.. I really really loved the staff, location and main areas.

That said.... I was so disappointed in the room. The room was super small- I mean, super small even for NYC. The furnishings were fine, but the walls were so badly scraped and nicked- likely because the room was so small (nowhere to move). The bathroom was also very small and cramped.  I think the SoHo location can't be beat- I just think the hotel's really high rating gave me a different set of expectations.  I think this hotel caters to more of the 35 and younger crowd- not that anyone was less than kind- I just felt I was in more of a Millennial experience. 

I would consider this hotel again if looking to stay in the SoHo area for fun- would not recommend it to a business traveler or anyone looking for some space to spread out!

title: Great boutique hotel!
text: Fantastic new hotel that I found in the SPG family. Very clean and modern design. The staff was very nice. I read other reviews that said the rooms were small, maybe I was staying in a bigger room both times, because I found the rooms to be much bigger than a standard NYC room. The marble and brass bathrooms are very trendy right now and they did a great job of leveraging both.
