The subway is right there, which is convenient, although on the lower floors you can hear the rumble a bit. I also love that they don't have a standard receptionist/check-in desk. Instead they have a very intimate check-in process on the first floor, and a concierge on the 2nd floor in the Library where they serve free coffee in the mornings. Overall, a great experience at a great price. I've stayed twice and will stay again in the future.

title: The Blondes, do have more  fun fun fun.
text:
The place is cool, staff excellent , food great (best grilled cheese and tomato soup ever) rooms are beautiful , and fun fun fun. you can ask for feather or non feather pillows , beds are cozy.

great place to stay , you cant ask for more if you want a great  NYC experience. The Blonde is the coolest club in NYC and its in the Hotel.

I cant wait to go back, they make you feel so welcome.

Kim M

title: The coolest new hotel in New York for those in the know.
text: I stayed at the 11 Howard during February Fashion week this year. It was the perfect location for a downtown New York experience and a work trip. The hotel room was absolutely beautiful and pristine. I loved the decor and all of the toiletries in the bathroom. A really cool and unique feature is that you are able to do everything you want from your personal Ipad- order food, set up a room cleaning, etc... I loved being able to order food the night before and wake up to a knock on the door with a lovely hotel staff member with my coffee and breakfast. Also- the coffee they offer is La Calombe, my favorite in New York. Also- get the Avocado toast. You will not regret it.

title: Avocado Toast!
text: Besides being one of the best looking hotels in NYC's trendy SoHo neighborhood, the 11 Howard has the best avocado toast NYC has to offer. But the excellent rating is not necessarily due to the amazing food, it is mainly because of the overall experience. This hotel really know how to do hospitality. If you were to google search 'define: great hospitality' the 11 Howard would come up as a perfect example. You think I am lying? Go and check it out for yourself! ;)

title: Excelente experiencia, 100% recomendable
text: Hotel muy bonito, diseño moderno, buena ubicación. El servicio del staff fue excelente, la habitación de buen tamaño y muy cómoda. La comida deliciosa. Una gran experiencia, definitivamente volveríamos a repetir.

title: Swank swank and swank
text:
Fantastic new boutique hotel in funky area of NYC. Love everything about it. 

Rooms are gorg but small - very little space to negotiate around the beds. Would be hard for a large person. Bath was a bit roomier. 

Le Coucou is top rated - reserve ahead and don't miss the gougeres. Also available via room service, thanksfully. 

Bar opens to public at 9 ( I think) and was a super trendy / new / lines / celebs / bouncers type scene. 

Self park if you can find a better deal in a local garage (to save $.)

title: Nice boutique hotel!
text: I had a lovely couple of days at the Howard.  The people were incredibly nice and helpful.  That was the best part of my stay.  Bar area and library were very nice too. My room and bathroom were quite small even for NY standards.  Good location if you like the east side of Soho.

title: Definitely stay here!
text: My husband and I stayed at 11 Howard for about six weeks over the summer due to renovations in our apartment and we only have positive things to say about this property. The staff is wonderful, especially Xena and Indigo, and the hotel is just great. It is new, clean, modern, and in a great location. The Library, the Blond, and the conference / meeting rooms are all wonderful venues for eating, drinks or a gathering. I would highly recommend for New Yorkers looking for a staycation or for those visiting New York. We were in two different rooms - one on 10 and one on the PH floor and both were wonderful. We had an especially great view on the higher PH floor facing east.

title: Top Hotel in SOHO!
text: Excellent hotel in the best location in NYC! Overall experience was fantastic thanks to pleasant staff with a great attitude and consistent top service. Rooms are chic and common areas are very cool. Highly recommended!

title: Extraordinary stay at 11 howard
text:
I stayed at 11 Howard last weekend with my husband and had an amazing stay.  
Service was excellent, bed so comfortable, design of the room very nice.
I loved that the curtains create a pitch black atmosphere, colors are soft.
11 Howard is home to the best club: the blond and the best resto: le coucou.
Will definetly stay there again!
Julie

title: Fantastic Hotel
text:
I love coming to this hotel every time I have work or leisure in NY. 

The rooms are great and very chic without being too trendy. The bed and sheets are fantastic. Bath products are nice and the shower is great. 

Check-in is simple and takes no more than a couple minutes. 

11 Howard is just very comfortable and I love coming back to it time and time again. Cannot say a bad thing about it.

title: Hip and Happening in Soho!
text: Had the pleasure of visiting my daughter this past weekend in NY. The 11 Howard offers a brilliant location. Very cool vibe, super staff with a great attitude and effort towards making certain your stay is comfortable. The bar had a very hip atmosphere and loved the lounge area for a bit of chill-time. You will not be disappointed with this spot for a quick weekend getaway...

title: Really nice place, staff is awsome and helpfull. Location is excellent
text:
What can I say, perfect stay at 11 Howard. Stayed 3 nights with my girlfriend. 
First positive impression is the staff  - they come running to your car and are so helpful and genuin friendly. Whatever you need they will try to help you. 
Rooms are modern, clean and quite. It was cold and snowing outside, so it was really nice that the hotel room was warm and cozy. Also like that there is no limit to complementary water. Could maybe be nice to have a minibar, but if you like to purchase stuff yourself you can just put it in the empty fridge. 
Can highly recommend the complementary happy hour of wine and beers. Think it is on Thursdays and Saturdays in the lounge. We also had a nice drink and a snack in the launch. 
Location is great, stuff happening just around the corner. Subway nearby, restaurants, shops etc. 
I turned 40 at this trip and they had a nice gesture and gave me a happy birthday card and some candy. That is good service. 

Will recommend 11 Howard to everyone and will be coming back myself.

title: Great place, great staff, great bar, great rooms.
text: Great place, friendly staff, great bar called The Blond. Really great rooms, nicely decorated. Really a great atmosphere and top location. Its my second time within one year and its still a treat. I will return there the next time around.

title: Comfortable hotel but paper thin walls and aircon that's like a jet engine
text:
11 Howard is a comfortable, modern hotel. There is a cosy lounge for coffee and working, although in the morning this offers a very limited (and pricey) a la carte breakfast menu. Biggest problems with this hotel, however, are:
- Paper thin walls: I could hear EVERYTHING that went on in my neighbour's room. It was shocking how little sound insulation there is.
- Air conditioning that sounds like a jet engine when you switch it on. There's no way to have the air con on during the night.

Overall a nice hotel but big fails on two critical things to get right.

title: My new home away from home.
text: The moment you walk inside the doors of 11 Howard you will begin to feel a special experience. From the beautiful modern and super eclectic decor, to the smiles on the staff that welcomes you. This place feels like a cool sanctuary right in the middle of the city. I have stayed all over NYC and this experience by far blew away everywhere else.  Every single staff member was amazing, and if you are into cool decor or vibe this place will make you want to invite all of your friends to visit. The food was delicious, the rooms were modern and clean, the lounge is the best in the city, and most of all the beds were heaven.

title: Downtown cool
text: The entire experience - from booking, pre comms, the hotel, team and check out were flawless. The design of the hotel and location are first rate. Love the minimal scandi style - super chic and easy walking distance to great bars, restaurants and shopping. Love the link to Global Poverty Project and the conscious hospitality ethos of the hotel - it makes you feel really good about spoiling yourself. Would highly recommend 11 Howard. The team especially make you feel at home in the city.

title: Great weekend in Soho
text: Our room was great. Amenities were very nice, from bathroom products to the Nexus tablet that allows you to communicate with the hotel staff seamlessly. Speaking of which, the staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful. The restaurant, Le CouCou is fantastic. Location is great - everything you want to do in lower Manhattan is no more than a 10 minute walk. The General Manager, Anis Khoury, does a great job. 11 Howard is my "go to" spot in NYC!

title: Friendly & flexible team, and smart spaces!
text: 11 Howard is a fabulous hotel. I first stayed there in January. It looked like a good alternative to large midtown NYC hotels, and was I ever right. I walked in the door and was greeted by Rob, who checked me in in less than 2 minutes with an iPad. I received email messages leading up to my stay, including one asking me how I wanted my minibar configured--different packages or just empty for use as a refrigerator. My room was smartly configured and nicely furnished, and had a great shower. The 2nd floor has a large common space for working with different types of sitting configurations--and waiters to bring food and drink without the spending and timing expectations of a restaurant. The restaurant and bar are great too. But my favorite thing about the hotel was the staff. Many team members play multiple roles, so I didn't get passed off to someone else when I asked a question. For example, Brian helped me find a room for my entire next visit during a busy week at the hotel, and Michael helped me try to ship a package during my second stay when a snowstorm shut down the shipping place around the corner. The staff is truly friendly--Neffatary, Adan and Kenya stand out in addition to Brian, Rob, and Michael. The GM, Anis Khoury, sent me a custom email asking about my stay and offering to visit. I have found a new go-to NYC hotel.

title: Epitome of Cool
text:
11 Howard was great.  I felt like I was in on some little secret and no one else in the city knew about this cool place.  The bathroom was gorgeous. The main room also pretty cool, super comfy bed, and bedding to die for. There was no closet, which does get tough with two people in a NYC room and no where to put anything.

We'd def. stay here again.

title: Top notch
text:
Unbeatable location in SOHO
Reasonably priced 
Very stylish
Loved the furniture and decor 
Excellent bar on the 2nd floor
and probably the best french restaurant in NY on the 1st floor 
I highly recommend 11 Howard if you want to stay in NYC

title: Hotel is a gem
text: Staff could not have been friendlier from start to finish.  Great modern decor, great location, complimentary prosecco at happy hour, very comfortable bed - what more could you want.   I will be back many times.

title: Charming friendly hotel
text: Stayed here for 2 nights this past weekend while in town to see a play on Broadway.  We usually stay in midtown, but this hotel caught our eye and we decided to give it a try.  As a platinum SPG, we have high expectations and our stay was delightful as expected. The hotel is very lovely but the outstanding attribute of the hotel is its staff.  Everyone was exceptionally friendly, helpful and pleasant.  Michael, the concierge, was especially helpful even beyond what one would expect from a concierge.  Roxy, the bartender was also incredibly pleasant and helpful. Very nice bar and an unrelated highly regarded restaurant on site. Literally everyone was a joy to speak with.  Rooms were very clean modest in size as expected but with all amenities.  The Soho area is vibrant with many interesting restaurants, etc. (Try the new Pinch restaurant a short walk from the with the hotel with the chef famous for Shanghai soup dumplings).  There's not much to distinguish one good New York hotel from another but friendly service, accommodating staff and convenient will bring us back here again.

title: Tea time at 11 Howard
text: 11 Howard was a peaceful and relaxing place to stay in busy New York City. A warm cup of tea to end the stay was great. And of course comfy Josefinas shoes to relax a bit more. For sure a hotel to repeat.

title: Fun, Stress Free Stay
text: 11 Howard is super hip, friendly and well located for quick walks to Little Italy, China Town and SOHO. Doormen, front desk and all staff we encountered were very friendly and equally as helpful. Our room was small, but clean, cool and well appointed. If we had a criticism, it would be that the bathroom was too cool for its own good - the eco friendly toilet didn't flush all that well and the super cool floor to ceiling glass shower enclosure tended to leak to the bathroom floor - truly minor first world problems. The bar was very good, drinks were great, but it converts to a club by 10 on a Saturday and you have to be on some special list. The bar isn't open on Sunday night, which was a mild frustration. In sum, this is a really friendly, well located, responsibly priced place and was a great home base for a weekend jaunt to NYC!!!

title: AMAZING HOTEL
text:
I stayed at the 11 Howard for a week and it was by far one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had. They were incredibly accommodating and the staff were amazingly helpful at all times! Loved the rooms - I stayed in a corner Studio, which was great, with plenty of space! The other rooms were a little more tight, but still gorgeous.
If there was one slight grumble, it would be that it was a touch expensive for things likee beverages etc. - but I guess that's just New York! In terms of location, it was perfect for me - easily accessible to a ton of different amenities, parks, shops, bars, restaurants etc. we were situated right by Mercer, Green Street and Broadway which are great for food and SHOPPING! Overall, a gorgeous stay in the perfect location! Thank you 11 HOWARD!

title: I never write reviews but this deserves a review
text: I stay all over the world in various hotels but my last stay at 11 Howard was exceptional. The staff made the ultimate difference. Looking forward to my next visit. The weather was not very pleasant in January but the staff made arrangements to make a difference.

title: Great Hotel / Amazing staff
text:
Stayed here for 12 nights and it was a great stay!
11 Howard is in a great location in Soho which was one of the reasons I chose this hotel, however I was very impressed with the service and attention to detail.
Easy check in via tablets, staff were exceptionally welcoming especially Robert who really did surpass all expectations - nothing was too much trouble and it was his genuine helpfulness that impressed. I noticed staff remembered guests names too... a nice touch!
The Library on the 2nd floor was a great place to eat / work / relax and with coffee on hand at all times. Some nights free wine etc was on offer. 
Food for breakfast / lunch / dinner was really good too, excellent selection.
Small fitness room with free weights / running machines / yoga area - a good plus.
Bathroom products were lovely, Grown Alchemist, and refreshed daily.
All in all a really good experience, will return for sure! Thank you 11 Howard.

title: Great boutique hotel
text:
This is a great boutique hotel in the Soho area. It's very different, you come in and there's a round table with tablets for check in. But then the restaurant and bar area are on the 2nd floor. 
It's very new and modern. The bedroom is very comfortable.
The tablet makes everything easy (room cleans, alarms, laundry).
The staff is very helpful, and the management also does a good job.

title: Fashion week!
text: This stay at 11 Howard was the best !!! At what could have been a very hectic time we had attention at all times. I loved it ! Will definitely stay again! Everyone at the front desk was always so friendly! We were given umbrellas in a rainy day. They were always cheerful with directions as welll.  Loved the lounge area for coffee and they had wonderful pop up stores there each day! They food was delicious! Ten out of ten!

title: Short but Very Sweet
text:
I only had the pleasure of staying with 11 Howard for one night early February. I wish I had had to be in New York longer. The atmosphere of the hotel is clean and beautiful. The service was always with a smile. The hotel overall feels very now.

Upon check in - there is no check in desk (which I loved) - I was upgraded and told my room was ready (before 11am) - two wins! The room was spacious (for New York) and bright and comfortable. The hotel uses Grown Alchemist products in the bathroom - another win! I had coffee in the library - service with a smile. And the next morning I had breakfast at Le Cou Cou - which was wonderful. 

There is not a negative to be had at 11 Howard and I thank GM, Anis Khoury, and her team for a short but very sweet stay. I, and my entire team, will be back.

title: Lovely boutique hotel in SoHo
text:
11 Howard  is a warm, welcoming hotel in the trendy SoHo district. From the initial greeting at a non-traditional reception area to the friendly staff exchanges there was a congenial atmosphere .

The rooms are smallish but offer all amentities. Great selection of products in the bathroom. HVAC was quite loud in the room I was assigned but I was only there for 1 night so I did not request a room change.

title: Trendy boutique hotel in SoHo
text:
I had a delightful stay at 11 Howard Hotel during a business trip to NYC. This boutique style hotel has been open for just a year and offers lovely hospitality. Reception desk is a welcoming table with efficient checkin.

The rooms are smallish but everything needed is available. The HVAC system was quite loud throughout the evening, TV was oversized and the mattress was comfortable.

I used room service which was great.

title: Great location
text:
Yes it's a remodeled Holiday Inn so the room layout is that standard from your family vacations.

The similarities end there, however. The design details are Danish inspired and very cute. Everybody on the staff was delightful (and I suffer from severe RBF so they were truly making the effort.) I also keep odd hours and often don't expect my room to be made up when I begin my day very late. They were able to accommodate that no problem.

The location is great. You've got SoHo, Chinatown and Little Italy all right out your door and you can be in the East Village or Tribeca in no time if you bring your walking shoes.

I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

title: Excellent weekend
text: 11 Howard was a recommended to me by a friend. I absolutely loved the hotel and location. I was treated very well and the rooms were modern and clean. I highly recommend 11 Howard and would definitely stay again on my next trip to NYC.

title: Perfect Lodging Experience in SoHo
text: This place is all about the amazing staff. From the moment you arrive when one of them meets you at the door, takes you to the round table in the lobby (right, there is no front desk), checks you in on an iPad, gives you a key card and sends you to your room... he or she follows with your bags. Every encounter with a host is like greeting an old friend. My wife Kris and I can't remember encountering staff like this. The facilities are great. The rooms are very NY (that means not very roomy), but they are comfortable and well appointed. I counted 6 USB ports. The main lounge is called the Library and it is super comfortable place to hang. The staff again shines... want a drink, something to eat... they accommodate. We'd love to return!

title: One of the best hotel experiences around
text:
11 Howard is definitely one of my favorite hotels, I only wish I'd started staying there earlier whenever I'd have to be in New York for work. 

From the moment I walk in I'm greeted by super friendly staff that really help kick start a wonderful stay. The lobby is really elegant with a wonderful Calder hanging overhead.

The rooms are incredibly nice, and although not super big, they're certainly luxurious and cozy.  It's what I'd hope my own apartment looks/feels like one day.  The bathrooms are beautiful, and the products they provide are fantastic. 

The area is full of great dining options, and the staff is very helpful. The Library and bar on the second floor are also great places to hang out, grab a bite or a drink, etc. 

Highly recommend staying here!!

title: The feeling of home in a boutique hotel
text: No reception desk, just a few perky young people checking you in on their iPads. Up in the room in 3 minutes. The room, small but tastefully decorated in the spirit of the Danish school of design rather than the heavy, crowded wanna be boutique hotels. I liked the feel of the linens and of the pillows. I loved the bathroom, its simplicity and the cosmetics. The body lotion is to die for. I would like a bit more light on the corridors but that's it. Breakfast pastries are as French as they come on this side of the pond. The hidden alcoves and areas where one can actually sit and read undisturbed are a rare thing. An absolute choice when coming to NYC.

title: Fun boutique hotel, great location, check out "the blond."
text: A very nice addition to the SOHO hotel scene. Rooms are large (for NYC), and feature beautiful floor-to-ceiling windows with expansive drapes. Super-convenient location. The "library" is a nice public room, and good for a casual meeting, if not much of an actual library (e.g. few books). But for sure check out 'the blond', a second floor bar/club that can really get fun late at night

title: The only place I stay in New York
text: 11 Howard is my home away from home. The hotel is beautiful and very well done, everyone who works there is very nice and happy to help with anything you might need. I felt like they were my friends by the end of my stay. The rooms are considered, they have everything you could need. And the lighting is great and very instagram-able ;). Definitely spend time in the Library, great place to have coffee or catch up on work.

title: Nice surprise...
text: From the moment I walked in and was greeted at the table...no front desk....by a welcoming young woman I was encouraged that this might be a place where the dying art of customer service may still be alive!! And it appears so; for all the staff we ended up meeting during our stay were personable, engaging and very accommodating. Also the rooms were spotless .....did not matter that we had no view. The bedding was awesome...especially the pillows. Heading to NYC in March and booking my reservation there again...thank you and keep up the good work!

title: Absolutely Loved It
text: The rooms are plain but in a very nice way. Very bright and clean. Love the location. The bellman raced in the pouring rain to get me a cab when the Uber flaked on me. I hope to return again soon. I much prefer to stay there than other places.

title: Viel zu kleine Zimmer im neuen Hotel
text:
Das Hotel hat hochwertige Materialien und ein klasse Design, aber die Zimmer und Badezimmer sind viel zu klein. 
Tolles 70er Design in der Bar, sehr zuvorkommendes Personal an der Rezeption.
Sehr Aufmerksamer Doorman

title: Stylish with great location and fantastic staff
text: Having stayed in various hotels and locations in New York this has been my favourite hotel so far based on its location. Its within walking distance of all the areas downtown that you want to go to. The rooms like most are not huge, but are well designed and the bed was fantastically comfortable. The bathroom was much larger than standard with an excellent shower and nice products. What made the hotel was that although it was very trendy the staff were extremely kind and enthusiastic. They could not do more to be helpful. The concierge service which we used ahead of arrival was excellent and very responsive. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you want to stay downtown and would return.

title: I shouldnt share this hotel
text: As a 15 year resident of NYC, I now live out west but return to New York frequently.  Until recently I couldn't find my ideal downtown hotel that matched both my personality, high-design aspirations and exceptional service.   I am pleased to say that I have my new home at 11 Howard.   No only is the location perfectly situated near my tribeca neighborhood, but it houses both charming and comfortable rooms, and a lounge bar, (The Blonde) lobby and restaurant (Le Cou Cou) to die for.   The staff pays particular attention to guests and is both friendly and insightful.   Special continued shout out to Neff, Rob, Christian front of house and Emma in The Blonde.   I shouldnt be sharing this awesome hotel, but it really is the best of the bunch.   Don't change, stay real.   See ya soon!

title: New age hoteliers meets old fashioned service - in a good way
text: This is a truly special hotel. In a world where you get what you pay for this is really true here - and then some. The staff at the unconventional reception "desk" through to their steadfast refusal to accept tips - and of course remembering your name which is also a little bit special. The rooms are small by US but normal by NYC standards. The lighting is low but the bed is comfortable. You can have whatever kind of bedding you want and they will change it for you. The hotel is by day a hotel and by night a bar and nightclub as well. If you are staying at the hotel you are not automatically on the list with the beautiful people of which I am definitely not in the club! There is a small gym and a small dining area but if you are in NYC it is likely that you are not there to sit in breakfast or in your room. You are there to explore and then have a decent (very decent) shower. Sleep is for the less intrepid. Location wise it is perfect. Next to several metro stations and literally just off Broadway. Loads of restaurants and things to do within reach and of course SHOPPING! So, in summary: great staff, great rooms, comfy and warm beds, breakfast if you want it, a gym if you need it and a friendly face at the beginning and the end of every day!

title: Hip & Comfy NYC Hotel
text: 11 Howard Hotel in SoHo is my new favorite hotel. The rooms are very warm & comfortable, & the service is impeccable. Finally it has one of the best restaurants in NYC in its lobby which kicks out an amazing breakfast.

title: Cozy, Design, well located - Feels like home.
text:
The rooms are nice and cozy.
Some rooms have a superbe view of the new york skyline.
The hotel is design, cool and creative.
Creators of guest experience are friendly and Helpful.
Location is ideal. Right in the hearth of Soho.

title: The perfect blend of comfort and design topped off with second to none service.
text: Hotels in NY can sometimes be too hip for their own good, with cramped rooms and crabby concierges. 11 Howard has figured out how to mix hip style with high-class service and comfort levels. I almost couldn't leave the bed because the pillows and linens were so dreamy. Room service was quick and delicious and the free water, wifi and swedish fish were a nice touch. The room was quiet, which is sometimes hard to find in NY and the floor plan was neat and functional. My favorite part was the subtle scent of the hotel, which is a custom blend created in collaboration with Oliver Gustav Studio the gorgeous gallery situated off the lobby. The library and bar are so cozy you won't want to go home.

title: A very chic, new, convenient hotel but.....
text:
11 Howard Hotel was just opened in 2016. The location is good near China town, Little Italy and SoHo. You could walk around to lots of places. When I got there, the 1st thing it surprised me was that they don't have front desk. The man opened the door for me then he checked me in with an iPad! Very unique experience. The 2nd thing it surprised me is the room service. They put everything in a bag and delivered it to you! (Avocado toast is a must try! ) 

The only down side of this hotel is a very serious one: when I finally got into my room （1017) and try to take a nap, I heard some strange voice like my bed was shaking. Then some female "noises" with that.... You know what it is! I can hear them very loud and clear! Hope it's not the situation in every room. (And they did it again in the morning which I knew perfectly) 

這間飯店的地點非常好。鄰近中國城，小義大利，蘇活區。走路就可以到很多地方，我出差這兩天都這樣用走的很方便，環境也非常安全，吃的、買的也都有。 

飯店去年2016才開幕，很新。一進飯店沒有櫃檯，門口幫你開門的帥哥直接幫你用iPad check in, 1F十分簡潔。 Room Service也都打包在手提袋中給你，食物好吃但種類不多。 

唯一也是一個很大的缺點，我進房正想要休息時，突然覺得床在震動，後來聽到搖動聲，隨後就伴隨著....大家應該不難想像是什麼吧！ 覺得隔音不好這件事有點誇張，但其他時候很安靜就是了。

title: スタイリッシュで女性にも安心
text:
ホテル内にニューヨーカーに人気のクラブがあるデザインホテル。
女性一人でも安心して泊まれます。
騒音も他の口コミにあるよりは気になりませんでした。
客室内にブルートゥース対応の音楽プレーヤーがあり、快適に過ごせました。
アメニティにもこだわっていました。

title: Perfect location, service and price
text:
My husband and I stay in SoHo about once a year for a long weekend getaway from the kids/work.  We usually stay at hotels that are much more expensive, but within just a few blocks of 11 Howard.  

We decided to save some cash and stay here, assuming it would be decent as a SPG affiliated property.  We were incredibly impressed - perfect location, our king room was a great size (particularly by NYC standards) and the room was impeccable.  We were also impressed with the staff who provided great bar and restaurant recommendations, tips on nearby shops, always had a smile and handed out free bottles of water every time we came or left the hotel.  Service was really great!  (Also, offered us early check-in at 10am, which is always a huge benefit after an early morning flight).

I will skip the pricey hotels I've booked in the past and stay here exclusively in the future.

title: NUEVO Y EXCELENTE
text: estuve ya en 2 ocasiones en este hotel muy nuevo. La 1° pensé q era excelente y no le encontré critica alguna. La segunda vez q fui había mejorado ... es increíble. Limpio, sobrio, mas q bien ubicado respecto los subtes ...querria volver a new york y al 11 Howard !!!!

title: Stylisches Hotel und hippe Gäste, aber Serviceversprechen nicht gehalten!
text: Stylisch und cool mit Hippen Publikum und In-Bar im Hotel. Zimmer sind sehr klein, aber chick. Das Hotel wirbt mit dem Versprechen einen besonders individuellen und hochwertigen Concierge Service zu bieten. Die Concierges sind auch super nett, aber der Service ging dennoch die Hose: Restaurantreservierung wurde zwar gemacht, sollte dann auf das iPad im Hotelzimmer gepusht werden, kam aber nie da an: Bemühung gut, Technik versagt. Dann Musical Tickets über Concierge gebucht. Concierge nennt Preiskategorien und wir wählen für 195 Dollar aus. Keine Rede von Servicegebühren oder Aufpreisen. Bei Abholung der Karten sehen wir dann den Kartenpreis: 115 Dollar! 80 Dollar so mal locker dazugelegt und Concierge und Hotel Leitung wissen von nix. Und Hotel Rechnung kommt via e-mail nach Auschecken. Hat bei 3 Leuten von uns nur 1x funktioniert. Warte heute noch auf die Rechnung! Nettes Konzept also aus Persönlicher Betreuung und Technologie, was aber leider nicht funktioniert. Und ausser Sorry kein Interesse beim Manager was zu machen.

title: Un 5 stelle non tradizionale
text:
Ho soggiornato in questa nuova struttura - membro di Design Hotels - per 3 notti. Avendo notato qualche recensione non entusiasmante ero curioso di verificare di persona visto che l'albergo ha aperto da poco e fa parte di una nota catena (Starwood). La zona di SoHo è senz'altro meno caotica e autentica rispetto ad uptown e l'albergo ha quindi una location invidiabile. La mia stanza era decisamente spaziosa per gli standard di New York. Lenzuola di ottima qualità e duvet di vera piuma nel letto. Il frigobar è vuoto di default e può essere riempito a piacimento con una lista di prodotti ordinabili attraverso un tablet.  Bottigliette d'acqua vengono offerte gratuitamente alla reception ogni giorno. 
Ho trovato invece un po' triste per un 5 stelle la modalità con la quale viene servita la colazione in camera: si tratta infatti di una sorta di "packed breakfast" consegnato in camera in una busta di carta.
Per chi è ossessionato dai rumori, è d'uopo segnalare la presenza di vibrazioni quando passa la sottostante metropolitana. Le vibrazioni sono avvertibili anche ai piani alti. Ottima invece l'insonorizzazione tra le camere.
Il personale con cui ho interagito è sempre stato molto cortese e disponibile. La pulizia delle camere è ottima e degno di nota è il pavimento delle camere in simil-legno.
Molto carino ed alla moda è l'annesso cocktail bar "the Blonde".
Onestamente mi sento pertanto di consigliare questo hotel soprattutto se la tariffa continua ad essere così vantaggiosa.
-Wheresnik-

title: Top Notch Hospitality and Lovely Design
text:
A one of a kind experience. Everything from the soft, simple design elements to the truly remarkable staff our stay is one we will never forget. We will definitely be staying here whenever we return to NYC. 

The staff made us feel right at home, and went to the extremes to be helpful. Shout out to Kenny and Amaan - they truly have a passion for hospitality and it shows!

title: Noisy and tiny
text:
I'm amazed by the great reviews people are writing about this place.
For the price, the rooms are tiny and uncomfortable. Shower hardly allows you to move inside.
I've spent 2 sleepless nights in there mainly  due to the noise.
The rooms are not isolated from each other , you an hear every conversation or other noise from your neighbors. But the worst has to be the subway noise. Every 5-10 minutes along the. Ought the entire building shakes and a huge humming noise is heard.

Would never even consider this hotel again.

As for the service, mainly pretentious and makes you feel very uncomfortable.

title: Lovely boutique hotel in SoHo
text:
I stayed at 11 Howard for eight days around Christmas time. The hotel is far removed, thankfully, from the hustle and bustle of Midtown and is located perfectly in a great area of SoHo, steps away from the Canal St subway. It is surrounded by great shopping and restaurants and keeps a bit of a village vibe still.
The hotel is very modern with great furnishings (think Scandinavian Hay or Muuto chic) and has a distinctive perfume through the rooms (which I bought from the Atelier next door so my home smells the same now) - it is very calm and zen whilst being super modern at the same time. The linens and bed are one of the most comfortable I have slept in (think W or Four Seasons with better starch).
The staff was very helpful and always there to give a helping hand and had very hipster uniforms to boot. Room service and house keeping were a breeze with the tablet in each room.
I loved staying here and the 11 Howard has become my favourite hotel in NY. Why would you stay in the Waldorf or Westin, when this is so much better and is cheaper by NY standards?

title: Loved it
text:
My sister and I had the most wonderful experience staying at 11 Howard over three days/nights, for both business and pleasure. The accommodations themselves were so lovely and well-appointed; every facet of the experience has been thoughtfully considered. The careful design is apparent in both grand aesthetic statements, such as the Calder mobile suspended in the entrance, to the smallest details - like the tiny potted air plant in the bathroom.

The staff impressed us most at every level, making our stay so enjoyable with their warmth, humor, and energy. Their friendliness and generosity left such an impression on us - each individual so approachable and capable. 

We travel to New York regularly, but this was our first stay at 11 Howard. I am certain we will be back to stay again for future travel.

title: Great stay at 11 Howard
text: We stayed at 11 Howard for 3 nights in one of the corner suites. The design of the hotel is really fabulous and the staff is absolutely great. These people really know how to treat their guests. You feel so welcome here. Their concierge service is excellent too. The hotel has the hottest restaurant in town, Le CouCou. Make sure you get a reservation. The food is absolutely amazing. Also the area around the hotel is nice. You're close to all the good places. We'll be back soon we hope!

title: Noisy Tower of Trendiness
text:
When you arrive at this converted Holiday Inn you are met by I-Pad/Tablet wielding check in staff.
For those used to traditional check -in desks, you should not stay here. Lack of privacy when checking in is a major fault of this initial  experience. Once you are checked in you will be taken to your noisy room. Beautifully appointed rooms with very comfortable bedding, soft towels, high quality bath products and a generous selection of magazines. Minibar is well stocked with interesting drinks and food products. Digital tablet for light controls is easy to operate.
The big flaw of this hotel is the noise from the train that runs all night and the nightclub that opens after 9pm.
If you are in NYC for a party weekend and don't care about sleep then you will enjoy this hotel. If you are on business and need rest and sleep better not to stay here. Great neighborhood with many shops and restaurants and very close to Canal Street and Chinatown/Little Italy. Location is really a plus but the hotel needs to invest in some double glazing in order to attract business and higher end travelers. Bring ear plugs!!

title: My favorite hotel in New York City
text:
This is the only hotel that I seek out/ want to stay at in NYC.  I'd stay here every time if money was no object.  Realistically, it's quite affordably priced compared to other options in SoHo.  Down the street from La Duree, and walkable to many restaurants.  Awesome bar and the best avacado toast in town. 

I love the cozy shrug/ throw on the beds and the minimalistic design of the rooms.  My only ask is that as part of SPG that they switch over to the same toiletries used in the luxury collection and the St. Regis.  

Have stayed twice (April 2016, Sept 2016) and will stay again in Jan 2017

title: Perfect Engagement
text: I came to 11 Howard to plan a surprise engagement and the entire staff couldn't have been any better. Every person I interacted with was so incredibly helpful, accommodating and lovely. They made it a special experience for the both of us, we will never forget it. This hotel is beautiful, clean and welcoming. All the way worth it. You'll love it, if you're getting hitched or not.

title: Stylish stay
text:
My daughter and I stayed here over Thanksgiving break in a double room. The room was small with lots of natural light. Beds were comfortable. We had a view across to the Hudson River. 

The hotel has been beautifully done in a minimalist Danish style with lots of interesting finishes and touches. Think blonde furniture, muted colours, quirky art work. Very well put together. The Library space is a lovely area for breakfast, coffee or working and the bar is very cool. The restaurant LeCoucou   is amazing but book well in advance. 

The hotel is well located on the boarder of SoHo, Chinatown and Little Italy and on firing of TriBeCa. Subways conveniently located. 

Staff very helpful with restaurant recommendations. 

My only hesitation in giving this hotel a 5 star is that the walls appear to be paper thin! This may not be the case with all rooms but the problem was exacerbated by our room being located at the end of the hall next to a hotel linen/amenities cupboard which was constantly being accessed by staff. 

I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for something that embodies NYC style but check your room location if you're bothered by adjoining room noise.

title: Home sweet home...
text:
11Howard is definitely conscious hospitality...once those big doors are opened for you and you step into this world of sensory delight you will understand exactly what this means. It was on my last trip to New York that I was walking through Soho and I was drawn to 11Howard by the scent captivating my senses as I walked past...I knew I had to go inside.  

This hotel is the future of hospitality and has definitely got the mix right. The rooms are beautiful - I was lucky enough this time to get a view of the Empire State on this visit but every room I have stayed in is simply beautiful it would not matter what your outlook was...you are encased in a world of beauty. 

The rooms are of the highest design pedigree with a heavy use of natural timbers and brass...taking the luxe up a notch. The hotel amenities are by Grown Alchemist which is a sensory delight in itself. There is nothing better at the end of the day on foot in New York City to soak it out in a tub with beautiful products to match. 

Added to this the library space on the second floor allowing you an extra somewhat private space to relax and unwind out of your room makes this more than just a hotel room. There is ample space to set up and do some work or simply have a drink and a bite to eat. 

Next time I look forward to taking a Boosted Board out! A genius partnership to make those New York City streets a little more forgiving on the feet!  

Having stayed at a number of hotels in New York City, I can definitely say that I have found my home away from home. Thank you 11Howard.

title: Perfect
text: Booked a room for New Year's Eve and had one of the best experiences ever. Being a native New Yorker I'm easily jaded. 11 Howard was a pleasant surprise. It's low key exterior and minimalist interior starts from the easy check in to easy on the eye fixtures ,furnishings and simply elegant rooms. Everything you can possibly need in a room is there and it seemed practically sound proof . Staff was attentive ,available and polite. Something you rarely find in New York. Location is great ,the bar was the perfect diversion as well as the library. I highly recommend this hotel and hope to return soon.

title: A New Years Dream
text:
I spent New Years Eve here and was absolutely blown away by the concept. Upon arrival we were immediately greeted by Kenny. Offering to grab all of our bags & still opening the doors! The foyer is very open concept and airy. There is no "front desk" per se, just a round table with a couple of tablets that staff uses to check you in. This really made it feel less like a typical hotel and more like a home away from home, which I loved! 

We stayed on the 4th floor in what they call the Night Owl because the sound from The Blond (the club connected to the hotel) goes through the walls. Kenny informed us of their policy with these rooms and made sure that we were going to be happy with that & to tell the truth I was up in the room through many different points in the night & I could only sometimes make out a little background noise from the club. It wasn't bothersome one bit.

Walking into the room was an absolute dream. Light wood flooring, Beautiful navy blue black out curtains complimenting the creme colored walls. We had a corner room with an entire two walls that were windows. such. an amazing view (even from the 4th floor) and lighting.

The space was perfect. It was everything that i never even knew i wanted.

It had two large convenient mirrors one in the entry way, and one in the bathroom across from the shower. the bathroom was a whole other dream itself with a glass and gold vibe. very sleek, classic and beautiful. 

My favorite touch to the stay was the tablet on the bedside table. When we walked in the first I saw on the tablet was the home screen with a big banner greeting me with "welcome Avie Acosta." I mean what a touch.

To reiterate in case the rest of this review didn't convey my message enough. . . I  absolutely adored this place. 

A Big thank you to The Blond, 11 Howard and especially Kenny who made my stay here so amazing, and my first New Years here in New York City such a dream. 

I can not wait till I have the pleasure of staying here again!

title: Great stay
text: We very much enjoyed our 4-day stay at 11 Howard. The staff was extremely friendly and very helpful to us on our first trip to New York City. The accommodations were very good and reasonably priced. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

title: Minimalistisk lyx
text: Ett mycket trevligt hotell beläget i SoHo på Manhattan. Hotellet är väldigt fint och minimalistiskt inrett. Rummen är förhållandevis rymliga och mitt rum hade plats med både en stor soffa och en 180 cm bred säng. Badrummet var större än jag hade förväntat mig och det fanns gott om handdukar och andra toalettartiklar. Läget är fantastiskt bra, nära till både restauranger och kollektivtrafik. Vill man arbeta i lugn och ro så finns det en arbetsyta som de har valt att kalla “The Library” som även den är smakfullt inredd med flertalet stolar och bord. Hotellet har även en bar som heter “The Blond” på den andra våningen som är otroligt häftigt inredd och serverar goda drinkar. Baren blir även en nattklubb vissa kvällar vilket kan vara viktigt att tänka på om man reser med barn. Överlag finns det inte mycket negativt att skriva om 11 Howard, jag tycker de har lyckats pricka väldigt rätt i många avseenden.

title: Fabulous!
text: We stayed for 3 days in December and we wished that we lived there. The hotel is perfectly located downtown within walking distance of great shops and restaurants. The room was well appointed and the staff were the best I have ever encountered. The 2nd floor lounge is spacious and beautiful and the bar/club that is attached to the hotel was a blast!

title: Perfection
text: Absolutely loved this hotel! Gorgeous room with very modern and trendy style! Would stay again in a heartbeat! Great experience! Views from our room! Staff was super friendly and professional. Provided a cab immediately on day of departure. Complimentary Happy Hour was a nice added bonus!

title: Great Hotel Stay
text:
Our stay was simply wonderful.  The entire hospitality crew was amazing.  A special thank you to Neffatari, Kenny, and Tyler. They made our stay most enjoyable. Neffatari was especially helpful with food options and dinner reservations.  Amy's and Bubby's was DELICIOUS!

Our room was small but comfortable. The beds were a dream. The complimentary bottled water was a nice convenience. Initially we had trouble deciding between a few hotels for our holiday visit.  We made the right decision and are happy that we chose 11 Howard.  The lobby smells so good and the service was great.   

Thank you to the staff who made our stay extra special.

title: Great Hotel, Great Location, Great service
text: I stayed at the 11 Howard during a business trip in November and absolutely loved the place.  The Hotel is very modern with a great choice of furniture, the rooms are very clean and neat and the staff cool and very helpful.  The restaurant is a must (book in advance as its always full).

title: hip, trendy, minimalist hotel in cool neighborhood
text:
Hi,

I stayed here for just one night and had such an amazing time. There is an amazing restaurant in the hotel and a very fun bar that turns into a club (not loud for hotel guests) after 10:00 pm. Super trendy hotel and very trendy people.

title: Amazing experience all around
text: Beautiful casually elegant decor, friendliest staff all around the hotel from Creators at check in to concierge to housekeeping, great bar and Library space and a GM who really cares and goes out of his way to make your stay special = 5 star hotel. Thank you again Anis!

title: Poor Customer Recognition and Service
text: I was disappointed with the lack of focus on customer, which unhappily is common with "design" hotels. At check in, the iPad didn't work, so they had to go to the back room. Waited 10 minutes before I went to look for someone to come and give me a key. Room was set at 62, on a wintery NYC evening. Had to ask someone at reception to call a server after sitting at the "library" for 10 minutes waiting. And I had to listen to the reception agent speak on the phone with her mom and friends, while eating.

title: trendy hotel in the heart of soho
text: This hotel is superbly placed for the trendy soho shops and within easy walking distance of the fabulous village eateries.  It is extremely modern and minimalist but still manages to be welcoming.  The staff are great, top marks must go to Kevin on reception who seemed to be everywhere at once, everything to everyone and all with a smile on his face.  I didn't use the restaurant but the bar was wow!  super fashionable with a great vibe and a real must visit.  The library where breakfast was served was ok, if a little lacking in atmosphere.  Our room was tiny and the bathroom even tinier, but the bed was comfortable.  There is a very tiny gym, which was full first thing in the morning so I couldn't use it, however it's a nice touch to have.  I did find the public areas a little claustrophobic but all in all a well positioned very nice hotel in a great area.

title: Enjoy Soho at 11 Howard
text:
First and foremost, the staff at 11 Howard is fantastic.  Friendly, attentive, professional. Honestly cannot say enough good things about each and every staff member I encountered during my 5-night stay.  

The location is perfect.  Close to uptown subway lines and Soho is right outside your door.

Beds are super comfortable.  Bar and dining area are very pleasant and the food/drinks were very good.

Only drawback is that the rooms are very small (at least mine was).  The closet juts into the bathroom in a way that makes the bathroom door a tight squeeze for entry and exit.  However, the bathroom itself is lovely, great toiletries, etc.  

I highly recommend 11 Howard and look forward to visiting again.

title: Highly recommend
text: I can't fault this hotel. Fabulous soho location, trendy and cool but understated. The service was top notch and every request was seen to. We loved that it was a trendy hotel yet quiet.. away from the noise, bustle and scene that comes with the Standard or the Dream hotels. It's discrete and cool. Unless you're after the touristy vibe of midtown or Times Square, or the ultra party vibe of Meatpacking, this soho hotel is definitely recommended for a fun yet sophisticated stay in NYC. We will be back! Thank you so much 11 Howard.

title: A new "IT" hotel with actually Great Service
text: Looking for the new cool spot where all the cool people are hanging out? Then, look no further than 11Howard.  The best news is you will actually get a beautiful room and great service too.  Everyone from the General Manager to the Bellman made an effort to get to know my name and greet me with a smile.  The rooms are understated, clean and have all the newest tech essentials.  Plus, the bathrooms are beautiful.  Finally, grab a drink at their cool bar, The Blond, and see everyone from designers, models, to celebs.  Definitely a Fabulous new Spot in downtown New York.

title: A new Oasis right next to Chinatown
text: The lobby is somewhat cold and off-putting, but the staff are so warm and helpful that you overlook that. The rooms are cosy, clean and incredibly efficient. With each additional night (we stayed 4), we liked it more. The bed and bedding are top-end and very comfortable. The shower: impeccable. The TV screen took an entire wall. And it was quiet, incredibly quiet for downtown New York City.

title: Starwood App Surprise Find
text: Our offices are in Soho and a few colleagues wanted their points so we tried this new hotel. We had a great stay, enjoying the room and service plus the free wine at night in the Library. The fresh restaurant was also great for breakfast in the AM. I recommend this hotel for work or pleasure.

title: An Excellent Spot for Business and Pleasure Travel
text: I was in NYC for a (longer than usual) business trip and was instantly thrilled with my experience at 11 Howard. Neffatari and her team were incredibly accommodating and made me feel very welcome from the moment I stepped into the hotel. I travel a lot for work and this hotel had all the amenities I needed such as excellent wifi, nice work spaces, good food, attentive staff..all in a central NYC location. I would highly recommend staying at this hotel again and I can't wait to be back.

title: Hipster hell
text: No clue how they got 5 stars.  Rooms are tiny. Bathrooms are tinier.  You can't move around in room without bumping into something.  There is no real front desk area.  Room was not ready at check in time.  The bellmen are forced to where short pants.    Reminds me of people who spend all day on their look to seem as if just got out of bed.   Fake.   Back to midtown I go..

title: Casual & luxurious, prime location - awesome spot
text: Stayed here with my sister for one night and reaped the full benefits of all amenities, from timely & seamless room and customer service, to delicious food, incredible art and cozy & chic room décor - the place is exquisite. The staff is also incredibly friendly, helpful and attentive - they made our stay great. Be sure to pay special attention to all of the art - the hotel is a work of art!

title: Thumbs up but a few improvements still possible...
text:
I am in NY quite often, mostly for business and thus would tend to stay Midtown. For once i stayed over weekend and my GF joined me so decided to stay in Soho/Village, which is definitely the part of the city i would recommend for hip/trendy restaurant and shopping (in particular now that mid-firth avenue is locked around Trump tower!). 

We were recommended a few Boutique/Style new Hotels in the area by a local, 11Howard was one of the two available in crowded pre Xmas times and seemed to have best quality/price ratio, which just to be clear means not-so-cheap $500 per night and not outrageous $700-$900. 

For that price you get a great location spot on between Soho-Chinatown-Little Italy (or what is left of it...not much really expect a few street of touristy southern Italian dubious restaurants...with very few Italians around..), a modern style, a great young/hip super nice staff (special mention to Neff Davis who went the extra mile to help us with restaurants!) and good service. Rooms are quite small and nice, but not as stylish as the lobby slick design would suggest. The Minibar service is supposed to be via an Ipad system..honestly i would still prefer the old fashion way. Also the fact that to get to a gymn you need to get around the block and train in a boying/fighting club is a bit of a put off.

The restaurant Coucou (if you are lucky enough to get table...) is worth an extra and separate review, the B'fast/Brunch though is definitely a thumbs up.

title: Nice hotel with a few quirks, great location!
text:
The 11 Howard was a very nice hotel with friendly and helpful staff.  The location was  convenient to many shops and restaurants and you can easily walk to many of the other surrounding neighborhoods.  One semi negative thing would be that the hotel bar closes around 9 to hotel patrons as it turns into a night club.  It's not a deal breaker as there are many other places to have a drink, but it was very cold while we were there and it would have been nice to be able to stay in the hotel and not brave the elements.  

My only complaint about the hotel, and this is for any light sleepers, is it sits very close to a subway and beginning around 5-6 am the room sounds like you're in the middle of a mild earthquake.  It roars for about 10 seconds and then stops, but then repeats every 10ish minutes or so.  Needless to say I was up early most days, but it didn't seem to bother my boyfriend as he can sleep through most anything!  Overall, it was a nice stay.

title: Outstanding stay at 11 Howard!
text:
My sister and I just spend 5 days in New York. We stayed all 5 nights at 11 Howard in Soho. 
It´s was a very nice experience. 
From the welcome from the people in the reception to the beds.... everthing was really luxury. 
The styling of interior and furniture at the hotel must be an inspiration for every visitor who just have a little interest in design and esthetic.
The area around 11 Howard seems to develop even more with a lot of exciting studios and stores. 
Thank you 11 Howard. We will be back.

title: Nice New York Experience
text: My partner and I thoroughly enjoyed our short stay at 11 Howard. Everything about the hotel was very good. The rooms though not huge, are very comfortable.  The modern Swedish decor was excellent but sometimes a bit surprising, especially the lobby which is very minimalist. The heating system was super quiet  and effective. Probably the best thing of all was the staff who all provided a great friendly service. I have nothing negative to say about this hotel. It would be nice if I could also say that about Manhattan.

title: 3 Jours à NYC
text: Dans le quartier hype de NYC toujours en activité ! C'est tout à la fois moderne et agréable. Les chambres pourraient bénéficier de plus d'espace et de rangement mais sur une période de qq jours c'est parfait !

title: Exceeded Expectations!
text: We had the most pleasurable experience at the 11Howard. The staff is amazing-remembered our names, super friendly, gave dinner suggestions. The rooms are very trendy, super clean and the bed was a dream. Impeccable service all around from check in to check out. Love the library so relaxing you don't want to leave. I will definitely make the Howard my go to hotel when staying in the city. Close to all shopping and fine dining. A+ service.

title: The Best: Customer Service & The Beds
text: Our stay at 11 Howard was just wonderful! We were greeted at the door and from that point forward the customer service was perfection. Every question we had was answered promptly. Our room was beautiful, and the bed was the most comfortable bed we have ever slept in, in a hotel. We had great drink service in the lounge and the library was a great place for that morning cup of coffee. Thank you to Marc and his staff for making this visit very memorable one.

title: Location + Luxury + Outstanding Service! Highly recommend!
text: My husband and I had a wonderful experience and look forward to staying at 11Howard again! The customer service was outstanding, as well as the overall upkeep of the hotel. It was beautiful and smelled incredible at all times.

title: The Best in NYC!
text:
The staff at 11 Howard were incredible as they literally ran to open the door or elevator as I came closer. They were beyond helpful when I needed something or the room or needed to print a few documents. 

The library on the 2nd floor was so relaxing as chill music played and the free coffee bar in the morning was a nice touch.

The room was so modern, chic and beautiful. Clean white walls and accents mixed with antique gold fixtures and hardwood floors - you will fall in love with the decor instantly. One of my favorite "little things" was the plethora of handing pegs on the back of the bathroom door for anything I needed to hang. I loved the use of the space and besides some counter space missing in the bathroom, it was perfect.

The beds were the most comfortable I have experienced on the road, which I don't know if that was a good or bad thing, because I could have stayed in them all day long :)

The hospitality was the best. The room was perfect. The location could not have been any better. It was a memorable experience in a city that I come to often.

title: Stunning.
text: Stayed in New York for the marathon & have been to new york many times. I won't be staying anywhere else from now on. A wonderful location, gorgeous rooms but the difference is the staff - nothing is too much trouble. If you're looking for a discreet, well appointed stay in pure understated luxury - you've found your home. Top marks.

title: I could live here!
text:
I want to tell you how much I LOVED this hotel. The beds maybe the best beds My friend and I have slept on. The rooms were clean and the views to the outside world were wide, you were not looking a a brick wall. The BEST part of this hotel is the people that work there. I was in contact with a woman named NEFFATARI who was amazing. I would ask for her if you have any needs at all. She is take care of you, and be happy to do so. Alex the manager was there to greet me at check in, and was so nice and helpful as well. It is Nice to go into a hotel, and feel right from the start that they care about you, and want to get to know. In a BIG CIty there is a place you can go and feel taking care of. 
I would live here.

title: Amazing boutique-style hotel in the heart of Soho
text: Just stayed one night at 11 Howard so I wasn't able to enjoy all the amenities; however, it was a great stay! The staff was very helpful and I loved the sleek / modern feel of the property. Overall the hotel was quite and very central to where I needed to be. Would definitely recommend staying here and will likely stay here again on my next trip.

title: Incredible hospitality
text:
I recently spent 5 straight days at this hotel for business. 

I was completely blown away by the quality of service we received. 
Plus the atmosphere was trendy and very relaxing.

I look forward to my next visit!

title: Stumbled upon this futuristic gem
text:
Wow, as a native of NY, it still comes as a surprise to me when people here display great  customer service, or hell, customer service at all! I was pleasantly surprised, having only hearing about this new "boutique" hotel 11 Howard, when I curiously decided to check it out on my lunch break. Although, a little confusing upon immediate entry (doorman didn't bother to give my noticeably wandering eyes directions); I locked eyes with the Ipads in the center of lobby and it clicked instantly, I had just stepped in to the future of hotels. 

I followed a couple onto the elevator and got off on the 2nd floor to reveal a verrryy dim lit posh ambience with neutral colored-minimalistic decor. "Thissss is the lobby". I was greeted by a very eager Neff and she was a joy from start to finish! She gave me a rundown on the very fancy pieces that I was super impressed by, recommended me to try a snack at the bar, insisted I book way in advance because of how popular the establishment was becoming and kept me laughing! Needless to say, I left very "full" and optimistic about my futuristic stay, in the future .

title: My favourite spot in New York
text: Always stay at the 11 Howard. Great atmosphere, fantastic staff and a nice, cosy, homely vibe! The Scandinavian design and feel really transcends everything. Highly recommend it for both business trips and a longer stay with the family.

title: Very friendly
text:
Just walking past the 11 Howard, this gentleman ( Jesus Rodriguez ) was holding the door open, we asked for directions, ( we couldn't find the street we needed on) &  he called  his friend (Rob) over to help put us in the right direction.  We weren't staying there, but they couldn't have been nicer to 3 ladies from PA, the General Manager, Anis offered us a complimentary drink, which we appreciated.
Just from our experience, this would be a great place to stay
Thanks for being so helpful
Ramona

title: Great Boutique Hotel with Very Unusual Service
text:
I arrived earlier than my son was going to, but had bundled his flight from Denver with our hotel so I called the Front Desk and spoke to Michael, who as incredibly helpful in ensuring my name was associated with the reservation so I could check in and wait for my son after my train ride from Providence, RI. I also asked Michael if he could order me an amenity basket or some fruit so we could grab it and go, with the odd hours we were going to be running around at. The parade requires a very early start to the day, as well as other things we had planned. Michael said he would take care of it, no problem.

Upon my arrival my check in was really seamless. I loved the vibe the hotel had and the unassuming round table instead of the normal Front Desk counter start you off on a very different experience than other hotels. Really did feel great. I did not remember the girl's name who helped me but she was very friendly, helpful, provided details about the bar, etc. and made check in seamless.

I had reserved a Deluxe King bed since there were no Double Doubles left in the city and I knew we would at least have a few upgrades to help with the bed issue. When I got to the room, it was simple, yet elegant. The fruit was a little odd, as there was only 1 pair, 1 orange, 1 tangerine and 3 strawberries. Usually you get 2 of each since he was aware that I was being joined by my son. And if you can put some plastic wrap around them, they stay fresh longer. We were staying 4 days so I knew we just needed to keep them covered. They came in very handy, though, and having worked in hospitality, I always found that was a very helpful thing to put in people's rooms. 

I always unpack everything and had no problem with the number of hangars or the one pull drawer for my stuff. I did have table, a bench seat and a single chair as well. There is a tablet that should be used for ordering things inside of the hotel as well as locator service, but the map would never render. We also were not in checked into that room so the tablet showed that we coudn't order food without calling down to the Front Desk (per the Tablet) and then they transferred me over to Room Service. I ordered the Angus burger with all of the fixings and french fries. It was delivered fast, hot and in a really cute box and in a handled bag, instead of on a tray. Again, this was a really great tough and very "folksie". 

I did go to the bar the first night and waited for my son to arrive. Frank was my bartender. He wasn't having the greatest night after his uncle became ill, but he rallied and was so helpful to us. He directed us where we could go have dinner (Blue Bonnett) and we made reservations there. The Manager of that restaurant waited on us personally and the food was incredibly good. Frank was really just a fun and helpful bartender. 

The next day I needed to print out tickets for the Knicks game. I think it was Kenny? who was at Concierge / Guest Services. He was also very helpful. Unfortunately we could not get the tickets to print and had to call in Mark from IT to help. Eventually he just had to print the tickets down in the General Manager's office. There was no disc space left on the computer and had multiple errors. The laptop definitely needed some TLC to reimage or remove some of the items from the laptop. Eventually we got it fixed and we were off on our travels. 

My son and I LOVED the bed as it was so soft and inviting. I liked that I could warm up the room with my own thermostat after freezing at the Macy's Day Parade. We definitely needed some warmth and a nap. The only other thing that was odd was the door man wasn't ever at the door, but eventually he would come running as we were already through the door. The other fun thing was we ran into Kenny? the last night, who was working the door for a private party and he gave us both a big hug like we were long lost friends. I love that kind of service and I felt like I was staying in my own building with Concierge in Providence. I really love good and personalized service. Mark also came to my aid and remembered my name and I just loved how different this hotel felt. Everyone was able to communicate via headsets and it seemed like you were able to do a lot with not as many people. It also helped if they were cross trained so they could fill in at multiple roles. All in all I would give them an A-plus on just about everything. I especially loved that housekeeping didn't pound on our door each morning. We were able to come and go as WE needed to without being woken up because of our strange hours. But our room was impeccably cleaned everytime we returned. They asked late in the day if there was anything else we needed. The only other recommendation I would make is you must have more electrical outlets in the room. If two people are staying in there the only charger is on one side of the bed. You need to have access for both sides of the bed to charge phones, computers, etc. without getting in each other's space. We ended up with piles of phone cases charging, charger boxes, computer, etc. all on one side of the bed, which was a pain if I didn't want to wake my son up in the morning. I would also move the outlet in the bathroom up 1/2" so you can plug in both the hair dryer and a curling iron at the same time. Lastly, the shower was very nice, but needed to be hotter. Also with the European style glass, if you use the hand held sprayer you run the risk of getting it outside of the shower and the floor mat soaked. The toiletries were amazing though and we loved the lava rocks/oil and smells that permeated in the halls of the hotel.

We truly cannot wait to go back!

title: Hip hotel with great service
text: Having lived in Manhattan for close to 15 years, but recently relocating to another city, my husband and I have been keen to find a good hotel for our frequent visits back.  We were pleasantly surprised to discover 11 Howard.  Not only is it in a great neighborhood, the rooms are more spacious than typical NYC hotels, the staff is extremely attentive, and the library/bar area are gorgeous. We come back to New York City often, and this hotel has definitely become our go-to place.

title: Very Sleek and Stylish,  great neighborhood area
text: Very stylish hotel in a minimalist sense.  Really enjoyed the neighborhood.  The breakfast nook is pretty cool as an all day hangout but regular breakfast is a bit complicated as all the table tops are really low or you have to sit on the communal table.  Fitness area is just so so, they are fitted out guest rooms.  However, the lobby and room feel overcome it all.  Very romantic.

title: Scandinavian Design hotel with small rooms
text:
I love the style of the hotel, very modern and minimalist. The informal check-in was a great new twist compare to a traditional hotel. The tablet in the room to request assistance is genius ! I engaged with the creators of guest experience in advance and I had quick and efficient replies to my questions. The concierge upstairs at check-out was friendly and helpful with directions.

With that said, I know it is New York, but the room is really small and especially the bathroom, for the price I was expecting something more special. Also, our room was on the 5th floor and we could hear the base from the nightclub downstairs in the room at night, if you need a quiet room to sleep, make sure you ask for a higher floor.

title: cool,  but is this enough  ?
text:
The hotel met my expectations in terms of location , decoration, and confortable bed . The employees are really helpful and polite and willing to resolve any inconvenience they can . 

But It has quite a few important weak points inappropriate for an expensive hotel as the Howard :

- lack of interior soundproofness: you hear every little noise from adjoining rooms and the corridor 
- Micro closed ,not even possible to store a small suitcase inside, because most of the space is occupied by the fridge and safe  
- room service : the food is delivered in small carton boxes with plastic cutlery like in a take away , but at restaurant prices

title: Chic vibe and wonderful service
text:
Immediately greeted at the curb by a lobby attendant (Michael) who was an extreme pleasure during the entire check-in process, all smiles, wonderful personality, easy going and efficient. The pad/device check-in was convenient and quick and more personable when compared to long front desk and staff behind it.

Being a hotel designer and having toured 9 hotels over 3 days just before my check-in to 11 Howard, I can say that I was thoroughly impressed with the chic vibe, the wonderful lobby aroma coming from the connected shop, beautiful minimalist decor and the room accommodations. The guestrooms were very quiet (only heard little clicking on wood floor next door) and the beds very comfortable. The room size was generous for NYC standards and had high ceilings and well sized bathrooms; however, hanging storage was limiting,

The concierge was very helpful with assisting us for dinner arrangements and our morning breakfast was lovely at the attached Le Coucou, french restaurant. The area of the hotel offered good shopping, great dining spots and felt safe for walking around solo. 

This hotel is one of my new faves and I look forward to staying again.

title: Long weekend in New York: probably the worst hotel in the world
text: Pretentious overpriced hotel in trendy location. The service is fakely friendly but there is nothing to serve. The rooms are ridiculously small cheaply furbished and... bare. The hotel bar is no longer accessible to guests after 10 as it is run separately as if this was the norm in the business. The staff spend their time apologising. Asked to see management. After 2 days no news. Embarrassing and expensive.

title: Good location, Too modern for a luxury traveler, Small rooms
text: The concept of this hotel is different from what a luxury traveller would imagine. The personnel is dressed casually but very nice mannered. I asked for some toothpaste and toothbrush and they brought it immediately to my room. the room was very very small but clean and with clean towels. the bathroom was spacious clean and modern. I would suggest this hotel to a young couple who prefers something modern. if the room was not as small I would definitely rate it with 5 stars. but on the other hand you cant find many hotels with spacious rooms in NYC. The price was very expensive for the room. I believe it should have been be between 260 - 300 usd.

title: Great stay, staff and location
text: Trendy hotel in a great location next to shops restaurants and bars. The hotel has a great common room to relax in. The staff are really friendly and helpful! Have to mention our favourite Nef, she is awesome, we love her :)

title: Nice Stay
text: Check-in was quick and simple.  Robert helped me, offered me a beverage and got me quickly up to my room.  The room was pleasantly comfy and I found the tablet with local deals and benefits very helpful.  I even stopped in a local tea shop (Harney & Sons) where 11 Howard guests receive a discount. So cool!

title: Mini Break
text:
We stayed at this hotel during a brief visit to New York, it's in the perfect location for exploring Manhattan and beyond.

 11 Howard is very young, vibrant hotel with although it did feel at times that it was trying a little too hard in creating it's own persona. The staff and level of customer service can not be faulted, the use of iPads in the rooms to access hotel services, request assistance etc really does work well. 

The room we stayed in is probably best described as 'bijou' but this wasn't a problem, just don't expect much space to spread out (although I understand this is common with New York hotels). One of the great indicators of a good hotel, for us, is the quality of the shower which was very average. 

Overall, we had a very pleasant stay, all things considered it's probably a little overpriced but worth it for a short stay.

title: Howard 11
text:
There was noisey at night there is a bar inside the building and every night loud beats are heard in the room. i like to party but even for me it was very uncomfortable. Hotel
is expansive, price is high
compare to its quality. location is very nice and bathroom
was large. but anyway it was like living in the club.

title: disappointing
text: very obvious it's a cheap refit of Chinatown Marriott. cheap hollow doors.  badly designed and  tiny bathroom.  no surfaces to put anything down - no thought for how you might want to use the rooms.  amateur hour (and touch of attitiude) at reception...  and nightly rate higher than comparable quality at other nearby hotels.  not be repeated for me...

title: My New Favorite Hotel in the City
text:
I recently had the chance to stay at 11 Howard twice in the span of 2 weeks. In addition to its prime location in Soho, the stay is young, energetic and supremely helpful. I was so impressed with the service they provided, how they remembered my name and there always seemed to be someone nearby when needed. The management team is also very responsive; any time I emailed, I heard back right away.

A few colleagues complained about the size of the room and indeed, they are as big as you need and nothing more. However, I appreciated the streamlined design and the beautiful finishes. The Library on the second floor is the perfect spot for a quick bite and a quite meeting while the French restaurant on the lobby level was fantastic for a nice breakfast. 

My only complaint is the fitness room: super tiny and ill equipped. It also needs a glass door. I felt very uncomfortable in such a small space with no one able to see what was happening in there.

I will stay at 11 Howard whenever I travel to the city!

title: Excellent Hotel
text: Beautiful hotel in a great location! The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. Loved the minimalism design in the rooms not to mention the niche brand bathroom amenities. Great choice for all!

title: The best hotel team
text: Spent 2 nights at 11 Howard. From the minute I arrived to when I left we were treated so well. The staff went out of their way to accommodate me. The Bar at the hotel "The Blond" was super fun. Amazing food, amazing decor and really polite and helpful staff. Highly recommended.

title: Good Stay
text: Stayed at the Hotel for two weeks due to work and couldn't of been happier with the time that i was there.  Staff was always friendly and attentive.  Vibe of the hotel was very relaxed,  rooms were clean and updated. I would definitely recommend 11 Howard.

title: Trendy, Small rooms, Not particularly special
text: Another conversion that seems to miss it for me. Expensive for what what you get and what is offered by other small properties in New York in same category. Good area but service minimal, focus on bar crowd.

title: Great hotel, location and design but...
text: Loved staying in 11 Howard,  apart from the fact that during our 4 night stay we were unable to use 'The Blond'  bar,  which we thought was the hotel bar.  It was used for private functions 3 out of the 4 nights and on sunday it is closed.  We chose the hotel due to its location and design/decor features and the hotel bar was a factor as we were 2 ladies travelling and wanted to just have a few nights in hotel bar rather than other establishments.  I would say the website mislead us to thinking that this was a suitable venue.  Saying that the staff were excellent , rooms small but stylish  and it is quiet.

title: Great Weekend
text: Beautiful new hotel located in Soho. Great staff and service. Everyone was so happy to help us all weekend. Very cool vibe. The rooms are so modern and clean. Would definitely return for another stay.

title: Excelente ubicación en el Soho y buena relación calidad/precio
text: El hotel esta ubicado en una tranquila esquina del Soho. El edificio ha sido reformado con buen gusto, y la decoración es muy linda.
