Los cuartos son chicos, pero acorde con el tamaño promedio de los hoteles de Nueva York. La relación calidad precio es muy buena y el hotel realmente vale la pena. Una buena opción para hospedarse en el Soho

title: Hipster Mecca
text:
Upon entering to hotel you won't find a reception desk, but you will find two iPads where the bellboy will check you in.  

Relatively fast, you then head to the three elevators up to your room. 

Room 809 was spacious with a small couch and table. A Nexus tablet is available for room services. Bed is super comfortable with high thread count sheets. The curtains are thick for dark out shading. You will feel the rumble of the subway underneath, but it doesn't disturb. 

The second floor offers a trendy lounge bar and a library. Wifi is fast and free. 

Great location on a small quaint cobblestone street. Service is very friendly, though sometimes a little longwinded when answering basic questions about where to eat.

title: Espectacular
text: Es un hotel boutique nuevo, ofrece un concepto muy canchero y moderno, el personal es perfecto, las habitaciones son pequeñas pero decoradas muy cancheras y las camas son espectaculares, lo mejor la ubicación en el corazon del SOHO, tambien me parecio muy barato para ser un 5 estrellas, recomiendo absolutamente este hotel.

title: A great place to stay!
text: This is my second time at 11 Howard. The staff have always been helpful, friendly and accommodating, in particular Nef who is delightful. The hotel has a great vibe and I’d recommend it to everyone. The Blond and Restaurant below are fantastic… All in all a great place to stay.

title: SUPER LOCATION AND PERSONAL SERVICE
text: We stayed 4 days and the location was perfect to go shopping in some special boutiques, the food was great for breakfast and the people who works there pay a lot of attention to us and our needs. So I really recommend this hotel, because was very cool.

title: Interesting location, convenient, great hotel
text:
The staff was excellent, hip hotel in super convenient place. Different from the first time you step into the lobby-trust me.

My room was adequate, very clean but a bit on the small side (I reserved the smallest room they had)-but hey you're in NYC you should spend very little time in the hotel room anyway.

title: Great location and lovely hotel
text:
We stayed 5 nights at 11howard. All in all a great hotel, room was as described by others, small, but I'd expect that with a central NYC location. 

Room was beautiful furnished and the bed and pillow sooo comfy. Thought they'd notice if we took them home, so sadly had to leave them behind. 

Staff were fabulous, very helpful the whole stay. We loved the bar and library area. 

The only downs sides - the water temperature changed quite a lot in the shower and there was quite a bit of noise carry from other rooms. Nothing that really bothered us, but for the price I'd expect little like that to have been thought about in the design. 

Location however was fab. Walking distance to everywhere we wanted to go.

title: Cool even by NYC standards
text:
Everything about 11 Howard was cool. The check in process, the staff that work there, the rooms, the bar, the restaurant. 

And the service was exceptional. We were graciously offered an upgrade when there was a miscommunication about which room we were staying in and it had an amazing terrace. The rooms were small, which is to be expected - but each and every detail was thought about. 

The hotel seemed to attract rather 'cold' guests, but I cannot blame the hotel itself for that. 

Look forward to returning to 11 Howard sometime again in the future.

title: Impressive would be putting it lightly.
text:
I've stayed in almost every hotel in the Soho/Village area, I've never been as pleased as I was with 11 Howard

The staff is impeccable - a very unique blend of exceptionally helpful, while still warm, approachable, and not snotty. It almost felt like everyone throughout the process - check-in, the doormen, luggage/coat check, front desk - were just super cool people that you'd want to hang out and be best friends with, but who would do absolutely anything for you without a second's hesitation. Very rare to find that in a NYC hotel, or anywhere really.

Unbeatable location. We only took one cab the entire weekend. We walked everywhere from the hotel, Nolita, Soho, Chinatown, West Village, NoHo, Tribeca all felt within an easy distance.

Also - the Terrace King Room - killer. A very reasonably priced way to have the baller penthouse/terrace experience. I would say that's the hidden gem of the whole building. 

It speaks VOLUMES considering how new the property is that everything went off without a hitch. Rarely does every little thing work perfectly, but especially in a newer hotel is still working out kinks. 11 Howard didn't have one kink during our stay. Cannot wait to stay there again.

title: Spot on for all couples and shoppers
text: ALL staff were fab - helpful, polite, knowledgeable and personable.  Beds, pillows and towels were super comfy. Good size shower. Lovely products. Decent hairdryer. Very clean. Great location if you've done all the touristy stuff before. Trendy bar, trendy area with great local restaurants and shopping! Nice chill out library too with coffee station. Very safe. Perfect for all age couples however I wouldn't stay here with children.

title: Best Hotel in NYC!
text:
My wife and I recently stayed at 11 Howard for our first anniversary. What a fantastic experience it was. This hotel will from now on be out location of choice when visiting NYC for pleasure. I had emailed the hotel in advance advising of the occasion and received immediate responses that the hotel would go to their utmost effort to ensure a memorable stay. We arrived at the hotel Friday night to the surprise of a hand written letter by the hotel staff, as well as a bottle of bubbles and two glasses to help celebrate. 

The attentive hotel staff is friendly, helpful, eager to please and assist you with any and all needs. There is a very hands on approach by the hotel staff as well as the GM who sent me a personal email following our stay to ensure it was up to our expectations. 

Fantastic location in SOHO, beautiful property, highly detailed and designed, fine attention to detail. A real gem in the heart of the city.

title: Ótima localização e serviço!
text: O Staff é diferenciado - fazem literalmente de tudo para vc se sentir em casa. A localização é excelente, no Soho, perto de todos os melhores restaurantes e lojas. A meu ver muito melhor do que ficar próxima ao Central Park! A nota só não foi 5 porque o quarto não é dos maiores (NY é sempre assim).

title: Disappointing especially with a 13 year old daughter in tow
text:
A well marketed cleverly photographed hotel in a great location with excellent staff whom I can not fault however totally impractical to visit with a young teenager.
We had to change rooms from the 5th floor as the subway rattles beneath the room & the walls are paper thin. 
There is not enough room for 2 suitcases unless you use the dresser as the twin bedded room is tiny & the bathroom is a broom cupboard! Breakfast is served in a paper bag delistyle & they're are no tea & coffee facilities in room. Come on guys for the price where is the nespresso machine! We tried 3 times to eat or have a drink in The Library but there was nowhere to sit so no communal area to relax & therefore had to either go out or return to a claustrophobic bedroom. A really expensive disappointing experience.

title: Home away from Home
text:
I cant say enough wonderful things about 11 Howard. They have truly nailed the essence of downtown luxury with seamless service and design. The rooms are elegantly designed baring all the necessary essentials (comfy beds, spacious and great showers) The in-room amenities are great and the tablet interface is an amazing way to put in request (especially for late night room service)  , the staff is engaging and attentive. Special shoutout's to Jessica, Alex, Brian, Cristian and Adan for always making me feel like 11 Howard is my home away from home. Marc Rafeld has done an amazing job with his team. 

Till next time 11H.

-PS

title: Clean, Professional, Stylish
text: I would highly suggest staying at the 11Howard for anyone that is involved in the creative industry (art, music, fashion). It's placed in the middle of SoHo next to exceptional shops like Opening Ceremony, Saturdays NYC, Mainsai etc. right in the middle of China town. The staff was speedy and helpful while also being personable and remembering my name (not expected), it felt like I had a friend working at the hotel. I will be staying at the 11Howard my next stay in NYC.

title: Avg at best with poorly trained staff
text: "Minimalist" means poorly organized, trained staff, with lack of effort and attention to detail. No bell staff to be found when hailing taxis or assistance with luggage from room. East facing rooms rattle from subway. No in-room coffee. Room service offers shoddy to go cup coffee. With all that said, design is nice. If you're into no frills trendy with attitude then this is the spot.

title: Immaculate, minimal, luxury
text:
11 Howard checks all my boxes. The room was EXTREMELY clean. Design elements minimal and soothing. On the 6th floor, noise was a non-issue. Handy social spaces (bar and Library breakfast area) very warm and inviting. Staff seemed genuinely happy and eager to help. Easy walk to some to good food and drink.

And here's a rare one - extremely comfortable, feather-top beds. Usually luxury hotels opt for really soft mattresses which cause me some back issues. 11 Howard was just right!

My only knock is on other reviews that said the room is more spacious than most in NY. Our double queen, maybe because of the two beds, only had enough floor space to circumnavigate said beds. And the bed frames have those low-hanging decorative hard platform edges that look great in catalogues but do nothing for your ankles.
But, we took note of the footpaths in the room and proceeded to really enjoy ourselves. I would return. Especially at the currently competitive price point.

title: Great for events!
text:
Clean, simple, comfortable rooms. The bed and pillows were amazing! Let me repeat. AMAZING! We hosted an event in the Terrace Suite and the staff was super helpful and friendly. Love the location - an easy walk to shops on Broadway, Little Italy, and Chinatown. The second floor common space and bar were relaxing areas to lounge with colleagues. I hope to be back soon!

PS. Oh yes, and Christian, went above and beyond to snag a cab for me during rush hour. The concierge - wish I could remember his name - provided excellent dinner recommendations!

title: Where the cool kids are...and us!
text:
Never mind the ebbing and flowing of the shower pressure... never mind the low flow toilet that never seems to flush all the way...never mind the absolute lack of storage space save for the closet hanging rod, the small shelf on top of the empty mini fridge/bar, and the back of the toilet...this very green hotel is a keeper!  

The location is great, the staff is friendly (note to staff...when the "Do Not Disturb" is on, do not disturb us to see if we want our room made up-we Do Not want to be Disturbed).

The shoe box of a room (we had the Howard King) is bright and comfy.  As I already stated, storage of any kind is a huge challenge. The bed and linens are killer.  The bedside tablet is terrific and makes getting and ordering anything super easy.  Foam pillows were exchanged for feather within 5 minutes of the window timeframe I had requested.  I couldn't find the ice machine (for reference, it's on 10, we were on 15) and it showed up within 15 minutes of ordering it on the tablet.  You forgot the hallways that are either hip, dark and romantic or dark, shadowy, and straight out of The Shining, depending on your outlook.

The Library Bar is fun.  We ordered drinks in there several times.  The library itself is mostly wine and beer, but it connects to a bar/club called The Blond and mixed drinks come from there.  This bar is evidently the place to be and had a roped off-guestl-list only nightly line in front of it all weekend.  It is on the second floor with the concierge and the Library, and gets really loud at night.  Any rooms on floors 3-5 heard it until around 3am.

As expected in NYC, traffic noise and sirens are hard to escape at night.  Higher floors always get less.  This hotel has no more than any other we've stayed in in NYC.

The location is fantastic.  Very close to Chinatown and Little Italy.  

They gave us (there were 6 of us) an excellent dinner suggestion for one night and we loved it.  They sent us to Acme and it was delicious.

Overall, this hotel is really great and the staff is well informed and friendly.  I just wonder whose idea it was to dress them in clam digger pants "a la 1850's whaling ship" or "Capt. Kirk on a mission".  Poor guys getting to work on the subway must be brutal!

title: 16 Rooms for my daughters wedding
text: We had many of our out of town guests at the hotel last weekend. Everyone was incredibly pleased with the property. If you agree that the people make the party then you also have to agree that the staff makes the hotel. And the 11 Howard staff is really great. The accommodations are tasteful, comfortable and chic and the location is great. Would like to see some better accommodation between the hotel and the incredibly popular "the blond" bar.  Lives up to the 5⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️experience!

title: Un grand plaisir
text:
Cet Hôtel est idéalement situé au coeur de lower Manhattan, à la lisière de Soho, little Italy, Chinatown, permettant  des escapades pédestre sur tous les points d'intérêt de cette partie de la ville
Décor design, chambre spacieuse, literie confortable.
Mais surtout félicitations à Joane et ses collègues de l'équipe de réception mobilisés, avec un évident plaisir pour vous donner les meilleurs conseils : restaurants, transports, points d'intérêt et faire de votre séjour un moment mémorable.
L'ensemble est très vivement recommandable.

title: Above and beyond
text:
The room was clean, lovely and updated and a nice size, especially for NY. I got in late and the night club was a little loud. Not only did Rob Piccaloro arrange to have me moved to a higher floor while I was at meetings but he personally brought me coffee. I would happily make this my GO TO for my many future trips to NY. The location is great as well. 
If Rob is not in management, he should be. It is rare these days to find someone go above and beyond their "expected duties" and he certainly shows leadership quality.

title: Great location - New and fresh - top service
text: We canged hotel just a few days before arriving, due to a recommandation. We arrived at two in the morning and found the reseption very special, but very efficient, only two small tables and check in staff with ipad's. Small rooms but large lovely beds. The hotel has a perfect location in Soho/Chinatown. Close to financial district. Perfect staring point for shopping. Many good restaurants and cafes in the area. Hotel brakfast was perfect. We will be back.

title: Very Chic. Very New York.
text: After living in New York, I always look for a different hotel experience when I return.  Not the same old chain, but something with some flavor.  11 Howard was incredibly chic and definitely embraced the boutique hotel feel.  The upstairs bar is very trendy and the drinks were delicious.  The rooms a perfect size and well decorated.  Best of all, the customer service was unbeatable.  The staff really made the trip special.  I would highly recommend this hotel if you are looking to explore Soho or Tribeca.

title: New York
text:
By far the best hotel experience in NY! 
The service is impeccable! The staff is great! Food, mood, design, ... perfect! 
The location is also great in the upcoming and trendy area of lower Soho.
Highly recommended! Enjoy!

title: It lives up to its promise of Conscious Hospitality
text: The location is discrete, just outside the hectic center of SoHo, on a quiet street. The lobby, the décor, the rooms, are all tastefully furnished and well considered.  The service is wonderful.  They are really in the hospitality business.   Cristian welcomed me and was so gracious... I felt as if I had come to this place before, except they had just opened this spring.  The Library is perfect for working and meeting your colleagues.  I had drinks at the exquisite blond bar, and had meals at Le CouCou, by one of my favorite chefs from Paris who now mans this wonderful restaurant.  And then, when you least expect it, Anis, the GM of the Hotel, sends me a thank you note and a nice send off.  I frequent many hotels and travel much.  11 Howard is special.  They do really live up to Conscious Hospitality.

title: Very chic and sleek
text: The property is in a great out of the way location in Soho.  The staff is friendly and capable.  The check in area is a round table in the lobby - very unusual common area for a check in and elevator bank area.  The rooms are stylish, well appointed, and minimalist.  Bathrooms are modern and efficient.

title: Designer hotel in the heart of wonderful Soho
text: We recently stayed at 11 Howard with our daughter. Its hard to beat the location in Soho with so much within walking distance of the hotel! We loved the modern Scandinavian feel of the hotel, the service was great, the room was pretty small for the three of us but we expect that in NY. The beds were so comfortable! There really isn't a lobby which I missed so it felt a little uncomfortable to have people meet us at the hotel. But the upstairs "library" was a nice area to spend time in. We liked having the mini fridge in the room but it would have been nice to have a coffee maker as well. We were told that there was coffee in the library but every morning when we looked it was gone. We ordered room service one night which was expensive and we were pretty disappointed when it came in a box.  Overall we really liked 11 Howard. With a few improvements it would be a great hotel!

title: My new favorite NY hotel
text:
I travel constantly for work and have become very picky about my choices in hotels.  I basically live in hotels more than at home, so when I find a spot I like, I tend to leap w/ joy. 11 Howard is on one of my favorite NYC streets, tons of shops, great food and easy access to the rest of the city and Brooklyn. 
I dream of redesigning my house to look like the hotel, the colors, textures and design are both welcoming and sheik. All of my New Yorker friends are quick to join me for a drink at the bar, The Blond which is located on the second floor. When someone who has lived in NY for 20 years is impressed by my selection of a bar, I know I'm in the right spot. 
If you don't have the chance to stay at the hotel, it is a great recommend to impress anyone w/ your knowledge of a city that is always changing and even its denizens struggle to keep up w/ what is new and cool. However, unlike some other city hotels, there isn't fear of pretension as the staff are warm/ welcoming and will make anyone feel at home as I do.

title: Cool Sophisticated Elegance
text: The atmosphere and service at this hotel is simply cool sophisticated elegance. Very unique areas in the hotel all with modern appointed furniture and technology. There is a museum art gallery feel all over. Rooms have a mini fridge and while there is no coffee maker, coffee/tea are available free in the "Library" - a place worth checking out. Location is ideal to visit Ground Zero, China Town, Little Italy and SoHo. Best of all is the staff. They too are cool, young and awesome. Many thanks to all especially Cristain, and Michael. They could not do enough to please!

title: Lindo hotel boutique
text:
Quando vc entra no hall e sente o cheiro gostoso do ambiente, é reconfortante. Bem localizado, com as melhores lojas e os melhores restaurante em volta.
A biblioteca é ótima pro café ou drink, super bom depois de bater perna o dia todo.

title: Excellent Hotel and location
text: Rooms are nice and modern although a touch small (but I guess that's why you are in this price range). The bar is excellent and very trandy. Sercive is smooth, the staff is very friendly, and the hotel manager is top notch looking at every detail.

title: I want to love this place but it makes it hard to.
text: Stayed here since it was a new SPG hotel in the city and the idea of staying at a newly minted hotel was interesting. Overall the design is fantastic with an ultra mod feeling. Good use of tech in the rooms with basically a tablet to order anything without having to talk to anyone. Lobby folks were very helpful and pleasant with one gentleman remembering my name every time. A far difference for some reason with the morning staff on the second floor who seemed to be a little pretentious/un welcoming. Just a guy and gal at a desk and the guy mumbled good morning while the gal just gave me a dismissive death stare with no greeting. Service in the lounge area was pretty decent but the hotel does lack a lot with no spa, no access to the blonde bar in the evening (because it turns into some b level euro dance scene-which you get no access to even as a guest) and there is no gym which was something I use while on business travel. Here's the catch, rooms are really small and the room service menu is limited with food coming to your room in cardboard to go bags. I love design and modern style but come now, all your food in paper bags/boxes like you have left overs? Lastly I must say the beds are fantastic though but the walls are super thin. My last night I struggled to sleep because I could hear the train run under the building which shook my room every 15 mins and the walls to the hallway/ btwn rooms are paper thin.  You could hear everything from people cozying up next door to people walking and simply talking while heading into their rooms. Sadly a very unkind night before early meetings.  Overall not terrible but not what was expected falling short. I WANT to love this hotel SO much but its just making it really hard to do so but may/may not be worth another try?

title: Gorgeous design, impeccable service.
text: I absolutely loved my stay at 11 Howard.  The staff was incredibly welcoming, the room was beautiful, and the bed was more comfortable than my bed at home!  I would absolutely stay there again and would absolutely recommend it!

title: Better options elsewhere
text: There are some good things about this hotel: cool design, friendly staff and good location.  However the rooms are small, noisy (subway trains under the hotel, ventilation) and the bar is not accessible after 10 pm.  At night, the bar becomes a third-party operated night club and not accessible to hotel guests (no matter how much you've paid for the room). So for the price, I feel there are better alternatives.

title: Small Dark Rooms, but lovely service
text:
I stayed 2 nights but could not have stayed longer because the rooms are small and dark. Service was very good, food excellent. Personnel good. My room was noisy. I have stayed in hotels in New York City hotels for 40 years and this hotel was just average overall.  Fitness center was inadequate. 
There was a device in the room which allows for ordering room service and requesting other services. I liked it very much.

title: Fashion wise super friendly hotel and staff
text: Indeed a (super) nice and friendly hotel. Location great. Decor great. For the hip people with good taste for interior and fashion. I like it. I forgot something and the 'door people' saved me. Thks! Thks! I think it is nicer than the Mercer... The beds are great, the shampoo and body cream smell great. I recommanded this hotel highly and will be back soon...

title: Отель
text: Останавливась в отеле на одну ночь.  Номер лаконичный, без изысканности).  Но все в номере имеется. Вполне приличный завтрак.  Понравилось так же расположение,  удобно добираться и до магазинов и до причала.  С персоналом практически не общалась, но нареканий не было.

title: 11 Howard made me feel at home and catered to my every need! I felt like a queen!
text: I have never stayed at a hotel in NYCl that properly allowed me to escape the madness of the city until now! I was able to relax and unwind in the most beautiful room I've ever seen! Not only were the room's nice, the staff was incredible and treated me like royalty! I also didn't even have to leave the hotel to have a drink or let loose, the blonde upstairs is the perfect bar to unwind at!

title: Exceeded Expectations
text: Beautiful, elegant boutique hotel.  Furnishings were very nice, room clean and comfortable, great bed and pillows.  The Library was a wonderful place to relax with a glass of wine.  Staff was incredibly accommodating, especially Rob.  Loved staying there.

title: Qualitative
text:
In the heart of soho, this hotel offers quite the best of all words. 
First the energies of the place whether it's the lobby or bedrooms are calming and welcoming.
Second, the staff is the best. Attentionate, kind and ready to help. 
The rooms are great, you feel like you are in your own little new york studio. 
Highly recommended!!!

title: Thank you 11Howard
text:
Whilst I was so impressed with this stylish, luxurious hotel, and loved everything about it, I think it was the staff that made the stay even more special. They were all so friendly and helpful and nothing was too much trouble.
The gorgeous, super friendly Neffatari greeted us when we arrived, very late at night, and set the tone for our stay. Aden was the last person who helped us, organising a large cab and helping pack all of our luggage. As we left, it actually felt like we were saying goodbye to family. 
Thank you to everyone at 11Howard, we loved our stay in this gorgeous hotel in a fabulous location in Soho, right next to Little Italy and would definitely recommend it to others. Amazing value for money for the high level of luxury in this super stylish hotel. 
Thank you very much.

title: Hip Hotel
text:
A great experience! Service is great and atmosphere even better.
Beautifully designed in a modern sophisticated way.  Comfortable, clean.... and perfect location. Love the library space on the 2nd floor.

title: Nuovo
text: Buon albergo, lo abbiamo scelto per la posizione a Soho. Camere pulite e personale simpatico e pronto ad aiutare e consigliare ristoranti in zona. Prezzo onesto. La camere che avevamo era un po' piccola e peccato per la vista sulla corte interna...nulla di bello da vedere. Bisogna dire che la classificazione delle stelle non è la stessa che in Europa...

title: Beautiful modern hotel in Soho
text: My wife and I stayed one night at 11 Howard. It was a beautiful hotel on the edge of Soho and Tribeca (on the corner of Howard and Lafayette). The check in process was novel, with the staff using iPads around a round table instead of standing behind a desk. The rooms were modern and well appointed. The only complaint I have regarding the room is that the toilet was very noisy with flushing and the door closing from next door rooms was very loud as well. Other than that, it was a wonderful stay. The staff including Michael and Anis were great. The location was also very nice as you could walk easily to all of Soho and Tribeca.

title: Amazing Hotel
text:
I have never met the nicest most accommodating hotel employees in my life.
It is a beautiful, quaint hotel in a great neighborhood.  Close to shopping and restaurants and a walk over the Brooklyn Bridge.

title: Highly Recommended
text: Great design and furniture, comfortable and clean rooms, good location and super friendly staff. The restaurants and bar in the hotel are amazing. This is was my second time here and I'll definitely come back. I highly recommend 11 Howard to all my friends visiting NYC.

title: Super luxury!
text:
Super room, so nice bed. 

Very clean and nice sheets on bed and nice towels. 

Location good. 

Feel super luxury and such pretty decorated room, modern and nice.

Thank you to reception team for your advice and help for New York was first timing in this city.

title: One of New York's best hotel
text: I did a one week residency at 11 Howard during fashion week, It's my second time staying here and recommend it to all of my friends. I love the location, staff, and decor.  It's close to some of my favorite restaurants ( La Esquina, Jacks wife freda, and the smile to go) and neighborhoods (Nolita, Soho, and Lower east side) Also home to one of Ny hottest nightclubs "The Blond"

title: A Wonderful Surprise!
text:
While I stayed here because I couldn't find another Starwood property in the city that wasn't either extremely expensive or inconveniently located, I checked out after 4 nights with a new MUST STAY place in NYC.  

I repeat, MUST STAY place in NY.

Literally every single staff member I interacted with during my stay smiled, said hello, was professional, and efficient.  

While I wish the rooms (or at least the bathroom!) were bigger, that's NY and not something I'd ever hold against them.   

The location doesn't get any better with easy walking access to great parts of the city and a subway right around the corner.

This IS my new home away from home when in NY,

Highly recommended

title: WORST hotel in nyc
text: 11Howard is 100% the worst customer experience I have ever experienced in NYC. The staff were extremely rude - and never in my life have I felt so unwelcomed or 'at home' than I have here. I am currently staying in one of their nicest rooms for 2 weeks (totally around $5K) and am willing to bite the bullet and loose the remainder of my money here just to get out ASAP. Awful staff. Bad service. Small rooms. Expensive. For anyone looking to spend 400+ a night DO NOT COME HERE. Worst experience in my life.

title: Luxury hotel but some rooms are very noisy
text: Great location in one of the side streets of lower Manhattan. A few minutes away from the main drags. Staff is helpful and rooms are impeccably decorated with great amenities, but the lower floors are VERY noisy for the proximity of the nightclub.The 11th floor was quiet enough.

title: Chic Hotel but Small Rooms
text: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights - the lobby, bar, and common areas are chic and definitely hip - seems to attract a sophisticated crowd.  The rooms, as is typical for New York, were small - not much room to walk around the bed and the bathroom was only big enough for one person at a time.  But the room was clean and again, very chic.

title: Small rooms, loud music
text:
I'm staying on the 7th floor, and there's a club on the 2nd. The music vibrates throughout the whole building, making you impossible to sleep. 

Not to mention the rooms are really small, with just the basic amenities. And employees are acting way too casually and lack of professionalism for a hotel at this price point.

title: balance of chic and cozy
text: the hotel hit every note: comfortable rooms, quick, friendly service, interesting/sexy ambiance, cool neighborhood, underspoken, great places to relax and work (library), good food options, etc etc. my room was quiet, cozy and had wonderful details (gauze throw on bed, beautiful fixtures in modern bathroom, sound cube for bluethooth, black out curtains, etc. I do think the lower floors might have been louder but i requested a higher room bc of my sensitivity to noise (they have a nightclub on the 2nd floor) and so had wonderful, quiet sleep. anyway, TOP choice in nyc now!!

title: Sexy hotel in a sexy part of town
text: Anis and his crew spent a considerable amount of time ensuring that I was well taken care of - kudos to the staff aka creators ! The rooms and hallway were artsy, the bed was super comfortable and most importantly the rooms were super clean. I highly recommend staying there if you are looking for an authentic New York experience in a sexy part of town. Excellent stay overall - most definitely coming back for a fall gateway!

title: Best service and location in the city!
text:
My second stay at this new hotel. The absolute best thing about this hotel is the super friendly, professional and personal service. The location is also perfect, close to everything but on a relatively quiet street with nice shops, great coffee spot etc. 

The rooms are cool but comfy, love the interactive room-service meny and the salmon bagels.

Cant wait to go back to this hotel, the only thing that is not good is that is hard to leave;)

title: Nice Spot in Chinatown
text:
+ Prompt staff
+ Room layout and décor
+ The Blond (the bar at level 2)

- No water in the gym (yes, really!)
- No system to track future stays or recurring needs (e.g. iron in room)
- Not a single upgrade in 5 stays despite SPG Platinum status (minor quibble)

title: New and Cute but they need improvements
text:
Love the location, Love the aesthetics, Love the idea of the hotel. But... there's a couple problems. The first they really can't do anything about: the rooms are VERY small. VERY small. I've stayed in a lot of NYC hotels and i'm used to small but there's barely room to shimmy past the bed in these rooms. But still... i could deal with that. 

The bigger problem is service. The hotel lobby feels understaffed. I usually see only one desk person there. And they are always busy with people. In the first few years of a hotel they should over staff to make guests' experience totally pleasurable. A few times i stopped at the front for help (not really a front but table and staff uses a tablet) and i had to wait while they helped a few people. i gave up once. 

Then in the library room they serve stuff in the morning. my business associate had to ask twice for tea. Just tea. It took forever and then they forgot the milk. She had to ask twice again. 

It just feels like it's lacking that aspect of where staff trips over themselves to make your stay pleasurable. Feeling ignored sucks. 

Tiny, understaffed and a weird air conditioning system in the rooms that makes too much noise... add up to an ok place. not amazing.

title: 11Howard makes the weekly business grind enjoyable
text:
I frequently stay 11H when I travel to NYC for work. My office is in Midtown, but the hospitality, minimalist Danish design, and incredible neighborhood justify the incremental time spent commuting. The property offers everything I look for as a weekly business traveler: elegant room with enough space and attention to details, attentive staff, lively bar, and quiet lounge if work dictates a late night. 

An incredibly small amenity that deserves recognition is the 11H personal wakeup call. The personal touch of an actual human making the wake-up call gets me into my morning workout routine (i.e., hitting Equinox, coffee, and sending early emails) more consistently than when I stay at other hotels. When you sum it up, there's really no other place to stay at if you're in NYC and SoHo.

title: "Træt af amerikanske hoteller, så vælg 11 Howard og prøv noget helt andet. "
text:
Indretningen var helt fantastisk. Den mørke reception og de mørke gange var cool og enkle. 
Værelset var roligt med gode senge og dyner (dem kan man godt savne, hvis man er lang tid undervejs!). Dejligt lyst og smukt indrettet med nordisk inspireret stil. 
Indbygget og temperaturreguleret aircondition (kunne sagtens sove for den). 
Styrkereguleret belysning på både værelse og toilet. Så afslappende og behageligt. 
Vidunderlige luksuriøse toiletartikler og "normal" toilethøjde. 
Personalet, der med sine fuldstændige charmerende og stilfuldendte uniformer, tog sig professionelt og venligt af gæsterne. Man følte sig tryg og imødekommet. Tak for det.
Lille køleskab på værelset. 
Tablet på sengebordet til roomservice mm. Sådan!
Rigtig god WIFI. 

Der manglede lidt ekstra som en kaffemaskine på værelset (som ofte er standard på andre hoteller i USA). 
En (tag)terrasse ville også have været vidunderligt at nyde det sidste af dagen på. 
Småt med gulvplads - som så mange andre hoteller på Manhattan. 
Næste gang er inkluderet morgenmad værd at foretrække, når man rejser som familie. Der går lang tid, fra man står op, til man sidder med dagens første kop kaffe ;-)

title: Great hotel in the middle of Soho
text: I always stay at 11 Howard when I am in New York. It's a quite oasis in the heart of Soho. I love everything about it: the service, the location and the Scandinavian design. Anis and his team is doing a great job making sure that all guests are feeling welcomed.

title: NY Fashion Week
text:
I've lived in NYC for the last 12 years and constantly searching for accommodations for clients, friends and visiting family. I was recently introduced to the 11 Howard property through one of Alyson Charles | The Rockstar Shaman's events. My friends and family gave me glowing reviews - from the luscious linens to the consciously curated shampoos and body lotions. 

5 stars for;
friendly + knowledgable staff
beautifully curated local artwork
ethically sourced bathroom products + consciously curated mini bar offerings (% of sales benefit awesome local non- profits)
fresh / clean + well appointed guest rooms 

Thanks to the 11 Howard team for taking such great care of my family. I highly recommend this SOHO oasis to anyone looking for a hidden gem with impeccable service and hospitality offerings in lower Manhattan.

title: Stylish and Modern Hotel
text:
11 Howard hotel is the epitome of New York cool and style. Location is right in the heart of Soho. Excellent neighborhood
Style and design are minimalist and simple, but very  luxurious. 
The staff is very personable and the service is excellent.
Rooms are very comfortable.
Very rarely will you find a fashionable Boutique hotel that truly runs like a 5 star establishment. 11 Howard does this, and does it well.
This is the place to stay in New york. You get what you pay for.

title: Fabulous small hotel in SOHO
text: We were on the top floor, room 1504 I think. It was definitely smallish, but comfortable. Really appreciated the bathroom, although there was no tub. The beds were very comfortable. I mean REALLY comfortable, with excellent sheets and pillows. The hotel brought up extra comforters with no problem. Service was excellent and friendly, and we really appreciated that the staff was not holding their hands out for tips. They were lovely, and friendly, and they made you feel safe. If you are looking to stay in SOHO, this place is excellent. If you don't mind taking the subway, you can hop on right there to get right up to the Upper East Side or Times Square quite easily. Cabs were readily available, too. Excellent concierge service as well. They offered outstanding green smoothies in the morning. The coffee was pretty good- but not great. One tiny complaint: we could not have almond milk without paying extra with our cereal. We could have regular milk, or coconut milk, but if we chose to have almond milk... that was extra. Kind of odd. We picked up some products at Whole Foods and stocked our tiny fridge. We especially loved the welcome, service, and good bye given by Michael (I think that was his name). Everyone was just lovely. The bar was pretty hip, too, but cozy. The hotel is chic but homey, if that makes sense. 11 Howard is a small gem!

title: A very nice hotel - but certainly not 5 stars
text:
This is a very nice hotel but should be ranked no higher than 4 stars max.  This hotel was a Holiday Inn in its past life, and was completely re-done in the beginning of 2016.  Thus, the rooms are all very new, but they are very, very, very small - which is not uncommon for Manhattan hotels.  The windows are very thin and you can hear loud noises coming from outside.  When the bars in the neighborhood close at 4am you can hear the drunken ones pouring into the streets.

The neighborhood is great - very chic with great shopping and restaurants, and unlike the uptown hotels, you can easily get a parking spot on the street - a huge plus considering overnight garages uptown can easily be $65 per night.   

Finally, all of the staff were incredibly warm and helpful - very noticeable in their desire to make sure you're happy.

title: Great service and uber cool design
text: was overall great experience.  all the staff i interacted with were exceptionally friendly and very capable (you'd never know the hotel was opened somewhat recently).  lobby and room design spot on.  second floor library was great place to chill/work waiting for room.  breakfast in restaurant was great.  extra points for integrity - left my iPad and retrieved from security a couple hours later no problem.

title: Disappointing
text:
Contrary to most reviews here, I was overall disappointed with my experience here.
- The walls were paper thin. Not only did I wake to doors closing and people talking in the hallway in the morning but I could tell which channel my next door neighbor was watching on TV... until midnight...
- There was sand in my bed... what?!
- I requested a comb on the hotel iPad. My request was cancelled without an explanation. When I called the front desk they informed me they didn't know what had happened as another department was in charge of such requests. They eventually brought me a comb, which furthered my lack of understanding...
- I ordered breakfast in the room, again through the hotel iPad (which is the only way you can do it). An hour later, it still hadn't arrived. When I called to inquire, they informed me they never got the order and that they were no longer serving breakfast (it was 10:30 AM) but that they could send coffee over. Which I still had to pay 7 USD for.

The one saving grace was the manager who was very accommodating upon learning about the details of my stay. The staff here are extremely helpful and empathetic. I'm only hoping since the hotel is new, this is just an adaptation period and they will adjust the logistics of it all as the rooms are very pleasant overall.

title: Upscale experience, simply elegant, great value.
text:
11Howard leads a class of elegant boutique hotels in New York. Located in the beautiful area of Manhattan, 11Howard provides the optimal blend of features and attentive service that will satisfy both business and pleasure travellers alike. Drinks and dinner at The Blond is not to be overlooked!

I had reserved the recent stay at 11Howard for the owner of the company I am working for, and he would like to add the following comment:

“My wife and I loved this hotel, specially it's second floor. Special mention to the devoted magicians working at the welcome area.”

title: Hip surroundings, helpful staff, and clean rooms
text:
My wife and I did a "staycation" here last weekend (we live uptown in Washington Heights and with a young toddler at home don't get downtown as much as we'd like). 11 Howard is in a great, central location in SoHo. Hard to ask for a better location than this. Check-in is a little unorthodox, with staff walking around the lobby with Android tablets and no "front desk" to speak of - but it was very quick check-in. In every room, there's a Nexus 7 tablet with your name and a few apps pre-installed to help orient you to the hotel and surrounding neighborhood. Very nice touch. Although it's perhaps trivial, can tell a lot about a place by small things like the quality of light switches and fixtures. 11Howard has really high quality Lutron switches, for example, which are many times what they need to spend on a light switch, but indicate the care to detail and quality.

The hotel bar is very nice and chic, and you get a free drink per person with your stay. Drinks are hilariously overpriced (e.g., over $10 for a boring mainstream beer, $25 for a glass of wine from a $10 store-bought bottle), but with the freebie it's not so bad. And it's worth it for the atmosphere and location.

During our stay, someone in a nearby room was smoking pot and it was smelling up our room - like full-on in-your-face smoke smell. My wife is pregnant so we called the "front desk" (wherever that is) to see what they could do. They weren't able to find the source of the smoke so instead moved us to another room, which turned out to be nicer and on a higher floor. They also gave us a free breakfast in the morning as a sort of apology.

title: Great new hotel in SOHO
text: My wife and I liked everything about 11 Howard. Check-in was easy and different than most hotels. The room was good size for NYC, bathroom amenities were great. The library/bar/concierge floor were very cool. And the location is FANTASTIC

title: Weird Experience for the luxury category
text: This hotel does not have a front desk.  I mean, they have a table in the lobby with an ipad and key cards but that's about it.  There is a second floor "library" (I think they called it) which is another odd space where you can order bar items or breakfast - but it is nothing like a typical bar or restaurant.  The entire hotel is overly electronic which could work for young travelers.  Personally I didn't like the fact that when I asked for a wake up call, that they said to program the iPad in my room.  When I asked for a bar menu - they said to review what is shown on the ipad in my room.  The employees who worked there were all very young, but like a previous reviewer states - they are eager to please.  At 5am on our departure date a young woman who was hanging out at the table in the lobby ran a few blocks to find us a cab.  It was nice but just odd - couldn't we just have called one?   The location is superb - one block from Little Italy and Chinatown.   The rooms were tiny, no view, but what we would expect in a downtown hotel.  The quality of the linens and towels were great.

title: One of the best hotel stays I have ever had!
text: Stayed here on Labor Day weekend.  Have never been to hotel that had such a good vibe.  The staff are the friendliest I have ever seen.  They treat you like a good friend would.  That is about the highest compliment I can give.  11 Howard is the only hotel I would consider staying at in Manhattan.

title: What an awesome hotel!
text: From the call ahead a few day prior to confirm an early check-in, to the moment we left it was one of the best experiences we've had staying in a hotel. I called to say we're getting in very early and could we check in early. They stated that they would do whatever possible to get us in early, since we took a red-eye flight. We arrived at 7:30am and they made a few changes and got us into our room right away. What a joy to be able to take a quick nap. Awesome first impression. After checking in everyone seemed delighted to assist us with any of our needs. The GM Anis Khoury was fantastic. He checked in several times with us during our stay to make sure our needs were being met. the rooms were super clean, the beds and sheets were so comfortable.  We can't wait to get back to NYC to visit with our daughter going to school so we can stay at 11 Howard again.

title: Excellent Experience
text:
My girlfriend and I were visiting on business and decided to try 11 Howard based on its location. Much to our surprise we fell in love with the hotel. The service is impeccable. 

Tyrone from the Library was remarkable. Completely helpful and attentive daily, as I enjoyed this area every morning before heading out to the UCF gym. By the way this was a great addition to the amenities provided at the hotel.

Zina at the front desk area was so courteous and welcoming, she always had warm inviting smile and provided us with all the information we needed. Upon our arrival and without hesitation, she immediately walked over to our cab and carried all of our luggage into the hotel. The service provided by the staff here is a class act! 

The rooms and all the other hotel areas were clean and always had a fresh fragrance throughout. 

All the other staff at the hotel from the door men/women, bartenders at the Blonde Bar, housekeeping, repairman etc. were exceptionally hospitable. 

We dined at the Cou Cou and enjoyed beverages at the Blonde Bar. Nothing fell short at this hotel!

We travel often, internationally and domestically and we can say this place by far surpassed our expectations. We will definitely stay here again and recommend to our friends and family. We can't say enough about our stay here.  

Thank you 11 Howard for a wonderful stay. See you all soon!

title: Amazing Stay in NYC
text:
Highly recommended hotel! Excellent location and exceptional service... Enjoyed the minimalistic design of the rooms and the lobby.
Front desk agents are friendly, professional and helpful.
Would definitely come back next time we are in New York!

title: Great wedding weekend!
text: Booked with a group for a friend's wedding weekend and had the best weekend! The room was beautiful, clean and brand new as they only opened in April. What really sets the 11 Howard apart though is the exceptional service. From the moment we checked in, everyone was so welcoming, helpful and full of great recommendations! Anis the GM and Mark the guest services director have done a great job with their team. Michael was the friendliest agent you could meet. The complimentary water in the lobby is greatly appreciated and the location can't be beat. Stepping out in the middle of great shopping and restaurants. We will surely return and wouldn't stay elsewhere.

title: Funcional y bien ubicado
text:
Un hotel funcional y muy especial. El trato exquisito y el servicio estupendo. La ubicación muy buena en pleno Soho. Un sitio muy cómodo para alojarse en NY. Debajo hay un night club con mucho ambiente, yo estuve alojada  en el piso 9 por lo que no tuvimos problemas de ruido no sé si en pisos más bajos será lo mismo.
Un hotel a tener muy en cuenta!!

title: Muy bueno, pero...
text: El lugar tiene toda la onda!! Y el bar del hotel es genial ( no económico). El personal es perfecto diría! Siempre con una sonrisa, amables, predispuestos a solucionar todo, te ofrecen agua a cada rato que entras al hotel sin cargo, paraguas los días de lluvia y tienen una onda increíble!! Los aromas ni bien entras te dan una sensación hermosa! Mi crítica es el tamaño de la habitación, muy pequeña y el lugar para guardar la ropa es diminuto! Las almohadas...no son las que me gustan a mi, y no tienen sabanas !!! Solo el acolchado muy agradable en invierno, pero en verano te da mucho calor!!! Y si dormís sin el acolchado, tenes frío por el aire! No es en el único hotel que te pasa esto! Igual el hotel esta súper, y en una linda zona!!!

title: Excellent new choice in SOHO
text: I have stayed in SOHO several times and it is hard to find a perfect combination of good bar sitting space and nice  rooms. This hotel has it all with a  very friendly staff, excellent amenities,  and great location. I will be staying here again when I come back to NYC

title: William, Best Front Desk Manager!!!
text: When is comes to a warm and friendly Manager with an EXCEPTIONAL customer service gift, look for WILLIAM at 11 Howard. This man is not only sharp, brilliant, ,gracious  and kind he's "THE REAL DEAL"  Seriously a real show stopper of the rarest form of exceptional Hospitality!!! William, you made the stay GRAND!!! PS, Yes you are so right, You do have an outstanding team, Mr. Humble!!!

title: Excelente opción!!!
text: Habitaciones MUY amplias (poco habitual en los hoteles de NYC). Mucho personal y siempre muy servicial. Facilidades en el check out (ducha en el gimnasio para cambiarse si sales por la tarde). Merece la pena el diferencial de precio con otros hoteles. La zona estupenda y con Conexión metro de 5 líneas. El barrio entre Chinatown, Soho, Little Italy...

title: Highly recommended downtown hotel.
text: Good downtown location.  The rooms aren't spacious, but use the space well. There is free WIFI (and outlets), bedding and amenities are great, the room is immaculate. Our room was quiet which is rare in NYC. The staff is eager to help - overall, highly recommended.

title: Best hotel experience!
text:
My husband and I had the marvelous pleasure of staying in New York at the 11 Howard Hotel. Right when you walk in you feel at home, excellent customer service. I highly recommend checking out the library it's comfortable and theirs a host that will bring you drinks. The rooms are clean, the beds are so comfortable and through out the hotel it smells wonderful. Great location for food, art, music, shopping and more. We will definitely be back.

Thank you for the beautiful experience!

Angelina Cedeno

title: My Second Home! Beyond LOVE
text: I honestly cannot say enough about how much I love 11 Howard. My many experiences with them have all been FILLED with amazing vibes, the utmost care, attention to detail, professionalism, smiles and total gorgeousness everywhere I turn. Because the entire space and the entire staff raise my vibration every time I'm there, 11Howard has become my second home. I dine and conduct my business meetings in the Library, spend the night to recharge my battery & honor myself, have done photo & video shoots for my work in their terrace suite and simply completely love it here. It is my TOP recommendation for accommodation. I personally can't get enough. #1.

title: JUSTE PARFAIT !!
text: Un séjour parfait, dans un hôtel  à la décoration très raffinée , avec un super service , un personnel à l'écoute et tellement agréable.Son emplacement est idéal . Nous sommes décorateurs et voyageons beaucoup. Nous avons souvent un oeil très critique sur les établissements oû nous séjournons, et je dois vraiment avouer que c'est une très jolie surprise que l'ouverture récente du 11 Howard dans une ville comme NY. Rien à redire sinon que d'y retourner très vite....

title: Amazing Stay!
text:
As a business traveler, I spend much of my time in hotels and I can say that the 11 Howard is by far the best NY hotel I've stayed in.  From the location in Soho to the incredible service from the staff and management, they have made the travel away from home as painless as possible.  I have literally stayed here every week for the past 3 months and there has been no slip in service at all.

The hotel gets a 10/10 for service absolutely, and the rooms are great!  Scandanavien chic with great beds, fantastic showers and an overall excellent experience.

The "Library" on the 3rd floor is a great place to sit down and work with a change of scenery and "The Blond" bar is a scene for sure.

This is definitely my hotel of choice for both business and personal travel.

Special shout out to Anis and Chris on the management team for assembling an amazing front desk and service staff and to the whole team here for making it feel like a home away from home.

title: New Hotel with Great Location and Professional Staff
text: 11 Howard (a completely rehabbed Holiday Inn) has been open only since April in this rapidly transitioning neighborhood that has gone from gritty to super trendy in the last few years. The standard room is reasonably sized for NY and well-appointed. The personal service device had lots of good stuff loaded on it. The tub-less bathroom was grown-up sized.  We appreciated the serene décor of the room and common areas and the capable, courteous staff. We did have some minor glitches (a jammed closet door) and AC that lurched on and off noisily that staff responded to quickly.  The downside is that if you catch the subway (the 6 train) the closest entrance is on Canal - a horrid street unless you are here for fake bags and watches. There is a gym which we didn't use - since there are great running options - take a right down Lafayette to zoom  across the Brooklyn Bridge or go West to enjoy the parks along the waterfront. You can walk  to Little Italy, China town, SoHo, NoHo and Tribeca and the 6 takes you all the way up the East side. You may hear the subway at night - but this noise gets less frequent later in the evening and didn't bother us  as we are ex-New Yorkers. Not everyone may feel the same. We came for business, but 11 Howard made it a pleasure as well.

title: Amazing for stealing a night away
text:
Love this property. The staff, called Creators, will make you feel right at home. Great service and style throughout the hotel. In-room breakfast included in the price on Sunday AM was a great way to make sure we lingered a bit longer. Just wish they had an option for the NY Times!

Looking forward to coming back soon!

title: Exceeds all expectations!!
text:
My husband and I stayed here for a "staycation" this past weekend.  We were blown away by this new gem of a hotel.  We were welcomed right away by the lobby ambassador--and checked in quickly via a wireless tablet.  Our room was so clean, smelled amazing (the whole hotel smells amazing!) and our bed was uber comfy.  Do yourself a favor and book into the Terrace King Room.  We had unobstructed view of most of NYC, including Empire State and the whole skyline.  Terrace is large enough to really sit out and enjoy--we had our complimentary breakfast out there on Sunday.

The location of the hotel is ideal---steps to Soho, LES and Tribeca.  So tons to do-shopping, dining, nightlife etc.... 

We couldn't recommend this hotel more highly--oh and grab an early cocktail in The Blonde (bar)....great atmosphere and strong drink!

title: Love this hotel
text: 11 Howard is an incredible hotel. I plan to stay here every time I am in New York. Their bar, The Blond, makes an great cocktail. The rooms are well designed. The  maintenance is great, very clean.  The fitness rooms are ideal and I am very happy with the staff.  I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a luxe stay.  By the way, it is centrally located so it is super easy to pop across town to go to other parts of town.

title: Great Hotel!!!
text: For sure coming back on my next trip to this amazing hotel in NY city! it is a Hotel with over 200 rooms but they make you feel like you are in a cozy beautiful  personalize boutique Hotel. the service, the people, the room, the breakfast restaurant and the library on the second floor.... everything is over the top. the bed super confortable  and the bathroom with big size and amazing shower and very nice towels.

title: Fantastic hotel and great, personal service
text: Great hotel in a great, central location. Cool, contemporary rooms. Great people and staff making you feel like home. The restaurant offering great food. The nightclub definitely also worth a visit, cool atmosphere, good cocktails. All in all, one of the best places in SoHo and NYC in general.

title: Great Hotel In The City
text: This is a great hotel!  The rooms are very clean,comfortable and the staff is amazing.  They tried to accommodate whatever we needed and even served breakfast to us after the serving hours.  Thank you 11 Howard, we will definitely stay here each time we visit NY.

title: excellent hotel for honeymoon
text: We spent a week on 11 Howard for our honeymoon and the hotel stay was as good as it could get. Really comfortable bed, nice and clean rooms, convenient location and genuinely friendly staff. Only thing we missed was a hotel breakfast, but there are plenty of good breakfast places nearby. I would absolutely recommend this hotel!

title: Schickes Design-Hotel in Top-Lage
text:
Für unseren zweiten Urlaub in New York City wollten wir kein Hotel im trubeligen Uptown Manhatten mehr. So sind wir auf das 11Howard gestoßen, das bei unserer Buchung noch gar nicht eröffnet war. 
Gespannt verfolgten wir die ersten Bewertungen, die uns mit ziemlich hohen Erwartungen nach New York haben fahren lassen. Wir wurden nicht enttäuscht:
Das 11Howard ist ein stylisches Design-Hotel, in dem das Wohl der Gäste an erster Stelle steht. 
Zwar sind die Zimmer klein, wie auch in anderen Hotels in New York City üblich, aber ein Zimmer mit 2 Betten bot in unserem Fall selbst einer Familie mit 2 erwachsenen Kindern Platz. 
Alles war extrem sauber, das Personal war unglaublich freundlich und bemüht, jede einzelen Frage zu beantworten. 
Direkt an der Subwaystation Canal Street gelegen, ist das Hotel ein optimaler Ausgangspunkt, die Stadt zu erkunden. Wer abends noch Lust auf einen Workout hatte, konnte die Übungsräume benutzen oder aber in der Bar einen Drink zu sich nehmen. 

Einziger Wermutstropfen ist, dass der Lärm der Subway auch im Hotel zu hören ist. Ob dies bei Zimmern, die zur Howard Street hinausgehen, genauso ist, können wir nicht beurteilen. Bei dem empfindlichen Teil unserer Familie haben Ohrstöpsel für einen erholsamen Schlaf gesorgt. 

Wir können das Hotel guten Gewissens weiterempfehlen und werden bei unserem nächsten Besuch in New York City sicherlich wieder dort übernachten.

title: Wedding Celebration!
text:
This is my second time staying here and if it is at all possible, I think it was even more amazing than the first time.

I had previously met someone working at the hotel the first time I stayed there. He was an incredibly nice guy named Marc and gave me his card.

When my fiance and I made a date to get city hall married I instantly wanted to stay here again.

I reached out to Marc just let him know that it would be for a wedding celebration. That was all I needed to say and more on that segment later.

I walked into the hotel and was greeted by a really nice personable guy named Brian. We spoke for a few minutes and laughed a bit before he gave us the key to our room. Super nice guy.

When my wife walked into the room, there were rose petals on the floor making their way to the bed where there was a heart made out of the petals!

She was stunned! Perfect execution (thank you Marc)!

If that wasn't enough, there were some chocolate covered strawberries as well which she loved.

The room itself, had a massive terrace with great views. All the finishes were as beautiful as I remembered the first time.

The bed and pillows were super comfortable. This is actually something really important to me because I have neck issues. Everything was so plush.

On the way out to dinner we saw Marc and he asked how everything was and if things were set up as I imagined. I told him it was actually perfect!!! He then said that if there is anything else we need just to let him know. You can tell how genuine this guy is and how he really wants his guests to be happy. 

We were given a cake elsewhere by some friends and when I got to the hotel I asked Nef, if they had cold storage. She said absolutely and quickly shuttled the cake for me.

When I got back from dinner I asked Nef if we can grab the cake and she said "definitely, just head to your room and I'll bring it up." Within five minutes we had the cake at the door. Amazing!

The next day while waiting for my wife to come down, I started speaking with another person who worked there named Jessica. We had a nice conversation which was really an enjoyable way to pass the time instead of being on my phone.

Last but not least, we met a good guy named Adan I believe. I was telling him how much we like this hotel and he clearly felt the same way working there. It's clear that the employees are happy here which always transfers to the guests.

Marc, and everyone else we met 11 Howard, thank you very much for such an amazing stay. Everything was incredible and very memorable. We will definitely be back!

title: Great hotel for every type of traveler
text:
This hotel is ideal for people visiting NYC for the weekend or staying for business. The staff is incredible, and they genuinely care about their guests. The location is fantastic for checking out Manhattan and Brooklyn as it's in SOHO right across from Tribeca and Chinatown and a train or Uber away from most of the touristy locations. The rooms follow a beautiful Scandinavian design that brings simplicity but a nice home like feeling. The bathrooms provide plenty of space, especially for a hotel in the city. 

The Blonde which is on the 2nd floor is a great bar to relax during the mid afternoon / early evening and during the later hours has a good mixed crowd. The Library is a great space to kick back and enjoy a coffee or two before your morning. 

The hotel is a mix of traditional hospitality and modern touches. Each room has a tablet and a phone. If you prefer, you can use the tablet to interact with the room service and housekeeping or use a more traditional method and use the phone. 

The 11 Howard is my go to hotel for my regular stays in Manhattan, and I always recommend this hotel to my family and friends. I always have a great experience and never a complaint. The hotel staff is very accommodating to any request, and I very much appreciate that.  

The lower floors do get small vibrations from the subway that runs under the hotel, and so I always request a room on a high floor. 

The hotel has opened a lovely restaurant, Le Coucou. I hope to try it out during my next stay.

title: Excellent Stay at This Chic Design Hotel!
text: My husband and I stayed here for our wedding anniversary and LOVED it! Walking distance to everything, chic design and the staff were wonderful! The entire team was so accommodating and gave great recommendations (special thanks to Indigo at the concierge desk!). I highly recommend this hotel!

title: So welcoming!!
text: I did a good research of where to stay in NY. The hotels in NY are expensive with small rooms and not very kind personnel. But not in this hotel! From the very start we were so well treated, my whole family loved it. We made contact through facebook and were offered an upgrade to both rooms. The check in was super quick and easy. The concierge Jessica gave us some nice tips regarding a wonderful theater that was really good! We were offered free drinks at the bar- the Blonde, which has a great atmosphere and the nicest waitress, Natascha. The rooms are comfortable and the AC worked amazingly, had everything we needed and our stay was wonderful! Have to mention Brian that always greeted us with a smile and helped us in every possible way! The location is perfect, near everything that is worth seeing in the area!! Can't recommend enough, its just great!!!

title: Home in New York
text:
Congratulations on a fine establishment. This was my second stay and it was amazing. The decor is beautiful and modern . The staff is friendly and helpful not to mention their uniform is impeccable. The hotel bar and restaurant are first class.
Will without a doubt be back.

title: Clean, elegant hotel right in NYC
text: I really enjoyed my stay at 11 Howard. It is a beautiful, clean property and an attentive, friendly staff. Very comfortable bed, elegant rooms, great toiletries. I look forward to staying there again the next time I'm in NYC!

title: Great stay!
text:
Had a great stay at 11 Howard.  Great location in Soho on the edge of China Town and Little Italy.  Fantastic staff.  Cool, trendy without the attitude.  
Rooms were great.  Fantastic bathroom products.  Fun bar in the hotel and a beautiful library area to relax.  Only good things to say.
Highly recommend!

title: Hotel is very modern with great service
text: The rooms were very nice and sleek, the staff is so friendly and helpful, especially the concierge who were very helpful in all sorts of reservations and suggestions. The location was perfect, we walked everywhere we wanted. It is highly recommended for people who enjoy a modern take on hospitality, everything in the room is controlled by a tablet, which is quite easy to manage.

title: Mixed feeling: Unique hotel with modern feel, but tiny rooms and no recognition for starwood members
text:
I have stayed at this hotel several times. It is in the middle of SOHO/Chinatown - great if you like Chinese food. The hotel setup is interesting. There is no front desk - you will be checked by someone who will stand right next to you rather than before a desk. 

The hotel rooms are filled with mid-century furniture. Overall it looks nice and modern - it also feels new. The bathroom is very functional. However, the rooms are very small. 

In spite of being a starwood platinum member, I was assigned one of the smallest rooms on the entire floor tucked away at an awkward of the building one time. Another time I was put into a room on the 3rd floor right above the club which blasted loud base music like there was no tomorrow. At 2am, it was still going strong. The entire room was shaking. After complaining, the hotel staff was finally willing to move me. Then I was told by someone that the hotel tried to avoid putting people in that room. However, they decided to pay a loyal customer in that room? Very strange.

title: Excellent boutique hotel
text: I travel often to NYC for business, I have been staying in 11howard since the first week they opened, I got to know them as I am an spg loyal. The rooms are good size compared to what you get in NYC, the rooms are spotless, service is excellent, and bed is very very comfortable, the staff always makes me feel as if I am home away from home, i travel a lot so i am looking for hotel where i can rejuvenate for my next day. Even though most of my meetings are midtown, the hotel is steps away from canal subway station which takes me 10-15 minutes to reach midtown. They also have excellent library on the second floor serving breakfast and relaxation/meeting place. I always prefer to stay in SOHO when in NYC away from the hustle and bustle for my evening and when i start my day.

title: The Best Staff EVER!!!!
text:
My friend and I left another hotel to stay at 11 Howard and that was the best decision we made. The location is perfect, with lots to do!  We had great experiences with all the staff from beginning to end!  The rooms are beautiful and airy!  My only issue was that there was no ventilation in the washrooms.  It was basically a steam room/sauna after a hot shower.  
Rob, Dominick, Mike, Alex and Will are ALL such amazing people and helped make our stay memorable and most of all fun!  Great concierge service!  You guys are simply the BEST!!!!!  Thank you So much!!!  

We are coming back FOR SURE!!!!
Allison & Iva

title: Not Quite A 5 But On its Way
text:
I, like a previous reviewer, have stayed at a number of different hotels while visiting New York City.  11 Howard was the first time I've stayed in this area -- which is at the intersections of Soho, Nolita, and Chinatown.  While probably not an ideal location for the first time visitor to New York, it feels very non touristy (a plus in my book) and provided easy access to a number of different places we wanted to visit.  
My adult daughter and I stayed 3 nights in a double room.  Yes, the rooms are small, but are well appointed and cleverly designed.  There's a large flat screen TV that seems almost too big for the space; requests for services are made through a tablet in the room which is also loaded with information about stores, restaurants, and other businesses in the area.   We both loved the beds and the bedding; with the black out curtains drawn it was easy to sleep later into the morning than we planned.  I appreciated that the hotel honored a request for a higher floor (we were on 10) away from the elevator (good call since the elevator announces its arrival on the floor while opening the door).  We heard no noise from adjoining rooms nor in the hallway and since our room faced the rear the street noise was minimal.  The only problematic noise was from the air conditioning which cycled on and off at pretty continuous intervals.
The staff were young, friendly, and helpful though the one time I needed assistance getting a cab no one was to be found.  The first level is where you check-in which involves a quick process on an tablet device.  The second level houses what would be considered the lobby though it also serves as a dining spot and a business gathering place.  Complimentary coffee is served in the morning and  "grab and go breakfasts" (really a misnomer since they are served by a waiter) are available at a reasonable cost though it would be nice to see a gluten free bakery option added to the small menu.  The lobby is thoughtfully set up in a number of different conversation areas with small tables.  There's also a larger conference table in one area which seemed to be used by business people for meetings or in one case a loud conference call that could be heard by everyone in the room.
I would definitely stay here again, particularly in light of the high level of friendly service, the quietness of the room, the quality and cleanliness of the room, and the interesting surrounding neighborhood.

title: Pre-baby Weekend in NYC
text:
I'm not normally a review writer... but felt compelled to share our experience...

From the moment we walked in we were treated like gold.

Once we checked in, we realized that our room was located across from elevators.  After a simple discussion with the front desk, they went out of their way to find us a room more to our liking.  All the while, not making us feel like our change request was an inconvenience and making sure we were happy.  The rooms themselves are very modern and clean.  More space than we're used to for an NYC hotel room. The bed was sooooo comfortable as well.  This is a VERY chic new hotel.  As amazing as the hotel itself was, the service was beyond any expectation.  We felt looked after during our entire stay.  Smiles on each of the staff members faces any time we walked by.  We didn't get a chance to try the bar or restaurant - but heard very good things.  This is our new go to hotel in NYC.  Loved the location too.  HIGHLY recommended!

title: What a breath of fresh air!
text: I've stayed in over a dozen hotels all across Manhattan and never have I felt a feeling of being at home as I did in 11 Howard. Located in soho, while not in the heart of Soho it was still footsteps away from all the action. The decor is chic, serene, warm yet modern. If I typed all day I couldn't express the high efficiency and friendliness of the respectful staff. Seamless and professional as well. The rooms were clean cozy and the bedding was superb. Room service in under 15 minutes. Would absolutly return! Restaurant and lounge also a must visit.

title: Chic design, great location
text:
First time at this property and I only stayed one night. The check-in was by far the quickest and most seamless that I've experienced. Staff was lovely. I did not have a chance to try to the restaurants/bar but will do so when I stay here again in the fall.

Rooms are small which is not unusual in the area, but they are well-appointed. The bed was comfortable and the linens appeared to be good quality. I loved the standalone charger/outlet on the desk beside the bed (nothing is more irritating than having to move hotel furniture to find an outlet) and was appreciative of the bottled water available in the room and lobby. 

Can't wait to return!

title: Design hotel in the heart of Soho!
text:
I spent 3 nights at 11 Howard, and from the minute I walked in the staff greeting was amazing! Friendly and very helpful. 
I love its scandinavian design of it. And its location is just a walking distance from everything in Soho. 
Great experience!

title: Designer's Dream Hotel
text:
The level of attention put to the details of the hotel make it a designer's dream.  It's minimalist chic, with a hint of luxury in the copper effects of the lampshades, sprinklers, etc.  When we saw the rooms online we immediately decided we wanted to stay here, and we were not disappointed.  The staff gave us a quick check-in, and there was even a handwritten note from the team as well as chocolate and gummy bears, which we didn't expect.  We were there during my birthday and my husband must have informed them, so they also sent us a cake with a birthday greeting which we thought was nice. 

The location is great since it's in the Soho area where you're surrounded by designer interior furniture boutiques and the like.  It's also very close to Little Italy and Chinatown, and a few other streets where you can find great restaurants.

title: What a delight!
text:
This hotel is fantastic in all regards.  We can't say enough good things about the staff, who are engaging and delightful.  The location is terrific, there are numerous great restaurants and bars nearby, and the rooms and public area, esp. the lounge, are welcoming and comfortable.

This is a gem!

title: Potentially great...
text:
New trendy hotel, nice decor, friendly staff, fantastic restaurant & in a very good location, 11 Howard has so much potential to be a great hotel but here are the downfalls:

The housekeeping service is just not satisfactory. We came back to a room with dirty rags left on the TV shelf, the floor clearly had not been vacuumed, everything was left untouched, only our bed was made & toiletries were replenished. 

The staff arranged for a janitor to collect the dirty rags & offered us free drinks at the bar while they cleaned the room again but it was late & we were tired. 2 minutes later we could hear the TV blasting in the room next door (our room was connected to another room separated by a thin door) so we requested to change rooms.

We were moved to a smaller room on the Penthouse floor. Just as we closed the door we realised the AC unit was really loud. We turned it off but there was still a continuous rumbling noise. We tried to ignore it but we really couldn't stand it. We could hear a woman opposite our room complaining about the same thing. She soon moved out so we called reception again. They sent an engineer up to teach us how to switch off the AC unit. When we told him it's not that he quickly said Oh you mean that rumbling sound? Nothing can be done, all the central AC units are operating above this floor. Why don't I tell reception to move you to another floor?

So off we went AGAIN 3rd time lucky! We were given a disable friendly room with super low bath tub but it was past mid night by then, we were so exhausted we just thought whatever! Please just give us a quiet clean room!

We could see the staff tried their best to remediate the problems but the sound proofing of the rooms is literally non existent. The staff also told us they try to keep the bottom few floors unoccupied because the bar/club on the 2nd floor is really loud & they often have complaints from guests staying on those floors?! 

Besides that no slippers or toothbrushes were provided. No kettle, no coffee or tea. Water is provided but you had to help yourself at reception downstairs.

So our stay wasn't the most relaxing or comfortable but we did enjoy our dinner at Le Cou Cou. The atmosphere is a bit too posh for our liking but the food was amazing. We also enjoyed having drinks at their bar, great music selection!

Overall 11 Howard is an ok if you're not going to spend much time in the hotel. Just make sure you get a quiet room not on lower floors or the top floor! Its location really is a winner. Super close to so many great cafes & restaurants in Soho & Nolita.

title: Fantastic
text: Overall an extremely positive experience at the 11 Howard. Fantastic hotel - very comfortable and in a great location in the heart of SoHo. This was the second time I have stayed here recently with business and looking forward to returning later this week with my wife and daughter.

title: Great New Find in Lower Manhattan
text: Lovely property. The staff always greets you with a smile and will go to any length to meet your every need.  There is a spacious lounge on the second floor with food and drink service available all day long.
