In addition to the lounge, the popular club Blonde,(attached to the hotel) is available to all guests until 5:00pm daily.  The rooms are new, clean and contemporary with a a lot of natural light.  What will make this hotel my new go to property in NYC is the warmness of the staff, the personal amenities at the hotel and the fantastic location.  Around the corner from Canal St and the 6 line.  A 15 minute walk to WTC and steps away from SoHo, Nolitan, Chinatown

title: The perfect NYC hotel!
text: I stayed her for 4 nights with my wife and baby and must say we had a great time! The staff always go out of their way to help you out and the General Manager Mr. Anis Khoury really goes all out to make you feel at home! I will be recommending this place to everyone I know and look forward to staying here again next time I'm in NYC!

title: Clean, chic and warm
text:
I stayed at 11 Howard for the last 2 weeks for business, and have had a very pleasant experience thus far. The rooms are very clean, pretty and with a light Scandinavian feel to it. Even the bathrooms are pretty. I do love the quality of the bedding as well as the nice toiletries. I stayed at the King Room and it has plenty of daylight and is a good size. 

 Almost everyone I have encountered at 11 Howard has been warm and hospitable, from the doormen to the people helping with check-in to their General Manager. The Blonde (their bar on the second floor) also serves delicious drinks and light bites. Have not tried their restaurant, Le Coucou but it does look beautiful.  My one bug bear about the hotel is that their room service is served in a takeout box, rather than in proper silverware and plates. On the other hand, there is no room service charge, so I suppose that the hotel has thought the concept through and this probably works best for the majority of these guests. I personally prefer a full-service room service, but given the warm and professional service I have been getting, I would continue to stay at 11 Howard.

title: Excellent Hotel and Staff
text: I stayed at the hotel for the first time last month.  The rooms were very nice and the staff was very attentive.  The hotel bar had great cocktails and a great crowd.  Didn't want to leave the hotel while I was here.  As a bonus, I left some head phones in my room and the hotel found them and shipped them back to me.  Will definitely stay again and recommend it to friends and colleagues.

title: Amazing hotel and staff!
text:
I was fortunate enough to be able to stay at the 11 Howard hotel for almost a week, if only I could move into this property. The location was fantastic all within walking distance of the shops in soho. 
Check in was quick, no hanging round while the staff were very attentive to everyone who came into the lobby. Have to give a big shout out to rob who looked after me during my stay. 
Rooms and bathrooms were a good size. Very happy with my stay will be back!

title: MY HOME AWAY FROM HOME
text:
11 Howard is Hands down my favorite Hotel in NYC! I travel to NYC nearly every month and recently stayed at their hotel. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. The rooms were spacious and I was upgraded due to my stay being just over a week long. 

I love that they keep the mini bar empty and you can fill it as needed. I was able to cool my own bottle of wine and my face mask too :)

The location is ideal! 

Nothing but amazing things to say about this hotel! I look forward to making this my home away from home!

title: A home away from home
text:
My brother and I came here to study for the summer so it meant we were staying here for 20 nights. We called in advance to inform them of this, asking for a their biggest double room which they kindly reserved for us. It's never easy staying in a hotel for such long periods but it didn't feel nearly as bad at 11 Howard.

Upon arrival the staff were friendly and accommodating making us feel as though we could ask them about anything the entire time we were there and the check in process was efficient and pain free. 

The room though slightly on the smaller side was lovely, modern and minimalist, perfect for the purpose of our visit. The bathroom in particular was beautiful and spacious, well equipped with towels and toiletries. There was also a fridge in our room which was vital considering the length of time we were staying there as well as a tablet designed to order room service and contact the front desk via notification adding to the efficiency aspects of the hotel. 

However the real pleasure of staying at this hotel was the staff, Mike, Adan, Brian, Rob, Rita and Kenya in particular. They always offered great advice on the best places to eat, visit, walk and shop and made it their goal to make guests feel comfortable especially in our case. They are a real credit to the hotel which is rare especially in New York. They call to make reservations on your behalf and also advise on the best way to get to where you're going, something that is invaluable in the city.

The bar the Blonde is lovely and easy to access from the hotel as well as Le Coucou. The location is also wonderful on the border of soho and TriBeCa.

In all I can't recommend 11 Howard enough,  from the decor to the location and to the staff it really is a must.

title: Very nice hotel in Soho
text:
New hotel in soho, easy check in, iPad in room along with big flat screen & clock radio for you iPod.
Large bed only 3 mos old. Paid for by a business I was in NY for. I think around $300. Über access close to new world tower & Tribeca. Local eateries and bars.

title: Amazing hotel and staff!
text:
I was at 11 Howard on business.  This hotel is trendy with a modern chic atmosphere. 
What impressed me the most was the friendly, efficient staff.  Check-in was a breeze even thought there were several guest arriving at the same time.  Personal service was at it's best every time I was coming or going.   The room was spacious and quiet.  The location was convenient to many restaurants and shopping.  I would absolutely stay here again.

title: Scandinavian sensibility
text:
Couldn't of asked for a better location, staff, food and hospitality during our stay.
Beautiful hotel with a slick blend of Scandinavian design sensibility, and a distinctly New York personality. We had a twin room, with ample space, comfortable beds, and all the amenities you could ask for.

title: Fantastic hotel! Staff was amazing
text: I was at 11 Howard for business. The staff was extremely efficient when checking us in and out, giving us wonderful dining suggestions and just over all made us feel at home. The hotel itself was very modern and uptown. The Blond had wonderful drinks and was a nice lodge to relax in. When I come back .. I will definitely use 11 Howard!! It was a GREAT experience.

title: great customer service
text: Have booked at 11 Howard several times, sometimes last minute - they're great with being accommodating and helpful, especially over the phone! would definitely recommend to people traveling to NY. Will stay there again

title: Best place to stay in Manhattan
text:
5 stars.
I travel to NY a lot and 11 Howard is the best by far. The place is amazing, the lobby is completely different at what you're used to and they even provide Boosted Boards (electric long boards) to explore the city if you want to.
The rooms are modern, clean and really cool. The staff is really friendly and food is great. The location is another great feature and the work place/lounge/snack bar is another thing that makes this hotel the place you need for your stay in Manhattan.

J. Jácome

title: Really cool hotel in a great location
text: I loved this hotel and 100% stay here next time I visit NYC. It was really cool in terms of design and felt like super luxury without the extortionate price tag. The 24 hour room service was delicious, the rooms were a good size and very comfy with all the amenities you could need. The service from staff was excellent and you felt a million dollars as soon as you walked through the door, the staff were very attentive and friendly. Staying here is a bit of a no brainer really!

title: Amazing Hotel - artsy, cool, and amazing staff
text: I absolutely love 11 Howard. I travel to nyc a couple times a month and have stayed in many hotels all over the city. 11 Howard is by far my favourite. It is clean, artsy, and beautifully designed. The rooms are bigger than typical nyc hotel rooms and the staff are friendly and helpful. And it is located in the coolest part of Soho. I loved my stay there and will keep going back.

title: Best hotel in Soho!
text: 11 Howard is our new hotel of choice for monthly business! Great price! Nice size rooms that are clean and comfy. Room service is yummy! The staff is extraordinary, very friendly and accommodating. Kate and Anis have taken care of every need. Love the 11 Howard!

title: Soho living at its finest
text: Hands down one of the best hotel experiences I've ever had! From the moment you walk up to the doors of the 11 Howard, the staff is there to meet your every need. They were so friendly and attentive. The hotel itself is a beautiful modern design in the perfect Soho location. Walk in any direction out the hotel to fantastic shops and restaurants. You can't go wrong! My room was simply chic, with a minimalist touch. Designed to give you exactly what you need with no unnecessary elements. And "The Blond" (lounge/club) is a must see! Thanks again to the entire staff for an experience I'll be talking about for a long time to come.

title: Great Staff, Modern Chic, but ask for a high floor
text:
First time staying here, and I was very pleased. The hotel has a very different lobby setup than you're used to - there's a round table with free-floating staff to assist you with anything you need, including check-in/-out, bag storage, etc.

The hotel (and the staff) is very modern chic - it looks and feels new, and the rooms are great. If you're looking at the design, you can definitely see what they're referring to when the 11 Howard mentions their "Scandinavian design" influences - it's all very nice, and it's distinct from other hotels you've been to (not in a better or worse way - just a different design style way). I love the tablet in the rooms used to do everything from scheduling cleanings to room service to exploring the nearby area - it's very convenient!

If you're sensitive to sound, request a high floor or quiet room. Certain rooms in the hotel are subject to the "subway shakes" - think of those as subtle deep bass tones. You won't feel the room vibrate or anything, but you can hear the deep vibration of the subway trains passing somewhere underneath about every hour. It won't distract or bother a heavy sleeper, but some people might be more sensitive to it.

As for the staff, every single person I interacted with was excellent, friendly, and fun. Well above your stereotypical service. Note though that they can blend in with any normal person you would see staying at the hotel. There's no standard outfit per se, though you can see the uniform/pattern in the trendy style each of them sports. Just another unique feature of the 11 Howard.

title: Amazing Customer Service
text:
Anis Khoury (General Manager) is wonderful! If you have any concerns before booking, you should contact him. Checking In and Out was extremely easy. The hotel is in the middle of Soho and very convenient. 

Everyone was super nice and I have no complaints.

title: Fantastic stay
text: The team at 11 Howard are highly trained and anticipated our every need.  We have stayed at 5 star hotels around the world and this was on par with the big boys.  Thank you for your attention to detail and your every courtesy.  We really appreciate the service.

title: Great new hotel in soho
text:
I'm accustomed to Asian hotel standards, and when I'm in NY I'm often upset by the hotel offer. I'm usually staying in SOHO and I know almost all the hotels there. 
11 Howard is a new great addition and from now on will be my preferred choice for my frequent visits in NY. The staff is very friendly and helpful, the hotel room are a good size, luminous and I love the clear wood flooring and the pure design. The rooms are decorated in a neutral palettes of colours which is very relaxing. Everything is new and clean, which is very pleasant. The bathroom is fine and I appreciate to have a bath tube. The library (a lounge space where you can relax, and have a bite), is beautiful.
What I missed is a kettle in the room, or a place where to have some hot water on the floor (coming from Asia, with 12h jet lag, I usually wake up in the middle of the night and do not want to have a room service for a herbal infusion). I would have love to have a dinner at Le COUCOU, or a drink at Le Blond the trendy restaurant and bar annexed, but apparently is a totally different management, so the team could not find a place for me which is a pity. Book at the same time you are booking the hotel room if you are interested. 
As a side note, there is a reformer Pilates studio few steps away from the door of the hotel, where I went for a class. Very convenient. I did not tested the gym as I enjoyed running (I loved doing the Manhattan bridge which is only 15 min away).

title: Mens Fashion Week Stay
text: I wanted to stay in Soho for a trip during men's fashion week. This hotel was a great find!  Chic, comfortable beds, and a great location that allowed me to walk to a lot of the destinations and events I needed to go to.  Super pristine as it's new, and very well thought out. Staff was super accommodating and a great bar.  There's also a really good French restaurant on the ground floor.  If you want to stay in Soho, put this one on your list!  Chic without being pretentious!

title: Girls trip to NYC
text: From the moment we stepped in the door at 11 Howard, we felt right at home. The staff was extremely professional and accommodating. The rooms are immaculate and every one of our needs were met. This is a new hotel, which we didn't know at the time of booking. We were looking for a nice place where we would feel safe and comfortable. 11 Howard didn't disappoint. The lounge is a hip place to hang out to either begin or end your evening. We will definitely stay here again.

title: amazing!
text:
so fabulous, one of the best hotels I have stayed in - they absolutely could not do enough to make my stay amazing! 
the staff are friendly and nice! the rooms are small but beautifully decorated. everything was great

title: On a envi d'y retourner :-) MERCI 11 Howard team
text:
Belle hotel, propre, très bien situé ... 
Très belle chambre, services top
Équipe disponible, agréable ... A l'écoute des demandes ... 
Je le recommande vivement. Si je dois mettre un point négatif, un peu plus de cintres dans l'armoire :-) J'en avais pas assez pour mes vêtements . Tout cela pour dire qu'il n'y a pas grand chose à reprocher.

title: Top to bottom, this hotel hits on all cylinders
text: With their extra friendly, casually dressed staff, it seems they want you to think they are laid back and casual about running their hotel.  This made my wife and I feel relaxed and very much at home.  But after staying there 3 wonderful nights, you can see they take running their hotel very seriously.  They had thought through all the details to make a guest feel at home.  The rooms are tastefully decorated, with beds and pillows to die for. The library on the second floor is a great place for morning coffee and reading the paper, as I did, or if you are there on business, as many of the guests seemed to be, a relaxed setting to conduct business.  All the staff seemed to be well trained to answer all our questions and needs.  They also have a great restaurant called LeCooCoo, where the food is beyond good.  And all of this is located in the heart of SoHo district and just a short walk to Little Italy and China Town.  I keep thinking I should say something negative so I don't sound like a homer, but I can't think of anything off hand, so I'll leave it be.

title: best new hotel in NYC!!!!
text: had the best experience at the newest hotel in NY, howard 11, the art, the curation, the service was impeccable, makes you feel right at home, but at the same time super high end and luxurious, good vibes, and especially Anis was very hospitable, highly recommended!

title: Top notch service at this gem of a hotel
text:
I booked a room at the 11 Howard for my parents to celebrate their anniversary this past July. I'm a loyal Starwood hotels member, and when I have them visit me in New York I typically have them stay uptown at Le Parker Meridien. However since the recent tie-up with Design Hotels for SPG members to take further advantage of the loyalty program I decided to book a room at 11 Howard, about which I've heard good things (it also happens to be a mere few blocks from where I live in SoHo).

My parents expressed having a wonderful stay at 11 Howard, thanks in particular to Cristian on the 11 Howard "Creators" team who was able to get them on the penthouse floor away from any ground floor noise. I checked on my parents' behalf to inspect the room and make sure it was fit for them; upon doing so I mentioned to the attendant at check-in that they were celebrating their anniversary. When my parents finally got in, they found a bottle of Prosecco from the hotel for them to celebrate their special occasion. At the end of their stay they shared that all the staff they interacted with during their stay at 11 Howard were courteous, professional and always willing to offer their assistance.

Based on my own interactions at 11 Howard, the establishment appears to be a well-run hotel with decent sized rooms (for NY especially) whose sparse design and decor make it highly economical in space. The lack of a "front desk" was actually a surprisingly nice touch, removing the hassle and wait from the typical hotel check-in process. The staff - both the attendants on the ground floor and the custodial staff - were always welcoming and pleasant, always offering their service and assistance. The location is another great benefit of staying at 11 Howard: while fairly centrally located in SoHo, it still feels removed enough from the activity of Little Italy, the craziness of Broadway, and the bustle of Chinatown (but entirely accessible at the same time).

I've seen reviews here that call the hotel trendy, and while to a degree that may be true, I actually consider 11 Howard a very minimalistic boutique hotel. It's a no frills no fuss hotel that still maintains a higher level of sophistication and design. Couple that with the excellent service and you have a top notch hotel that's sure to cover all basic needs of a designer hotel while also exceeding expectations.

title: Staff were good, room was well equipped
text:
As stated elsewhere, trendy, SOHO, new, great Calder sculpture hanging in the lobby.  Library and the bar area were really attractive spaces.  Rooms are neutral greys, nicely appointed. Obviously VERY new.  

Only criticism I can offer is that the thermostat was incomprehensible. I thought maybe it was just me, but someone else in my party (young millennial) said she could not figure it out either. Wifi fast, location great, food fine. Room to room sound transmission was also an issue.  My alarm went off, and it obviously woke my neighbors (I Phone alarm on a medium to low setting) based upon the noise that came back from the other side.

Fitness area is three rooms adjoining, converted to fitness use.  Again, obviously brand brand new, and will refine in time.  

Did I mention the cool bar, and the Calder over reception?

title: Excellent Hotel
text: A great hotel in SoHo, right next to Chinatown and Little Italy. It just opened this year, so everything is brand new and shiny. The staff and management are welcoming, very professional and eager to help. The hotel has a distinctive design theme (minimalist, Nordic, ...) which might take a bit of getting used to, but does not affect things that really matter for comfort. Our room had two super-comfortable queen-size beds. Bathroom amenities and toiletries were excellent. We were on the 9th floor, there is some amount of noise coming in from the street and the subway line below, but not much by NYC standards (certainly much more quiet than most Midtown locations!) Wi-fi is free and fast. There's plenty of restaurants, cafes and bars within a few blocks of the hotel, and there's a subway station two blocks away. Highly recommended. My only suggestion would be to make espresso machine(s) available for guests inside the hotel.

title: Excellent staff and great location...perfect downtown stay
text:
The first thing that strikes you at this boutique hotel is the friendly welcoming staff, then you fall in love with the location which is walking distance from everything downtown, and  then lastly but very importantly the comfortable rooms win you over.  Clean, comfortable and convenient what else can one want in NYC.  
In fact during our three day stay there, the second day the AC conked out and within minutes, without us even asking they moved us to another room, sent us a care package accompanied with an apology note which was followed by an apology email.....wow!  
Complements to the management and thank you to Tekenya, 11 Howard has won me over with their service levels and will be my preferred choice in NYC.

title: Best Service I Have Experienced
text: I am still in awe of the service provided by all of the staff at the 11 Howard Hotel in Soho. Our small family reunion combined with our 34th wedding anniversary was a sincerely wonderful experience. The 10 of us had 5 rooms for the weekend. Everyone on staff went above and beyond to make us feel special, informed and comfortable. We were even surprised with a lovely happy anniversary note accompanied by a cold bottle of prosecco and 2 champagne glasses.  So much fun.

title: Fantastic Stay; Highly Recommended!
text: My wife and I just came back from a 10 night stay at 11 Howard. I have visited numerous hotels in the city (over the years) but can’t remember the last time I was as satisfied with my stay. Customer Service: Young energetic staff, with very “boutique-feel” personalized service (which, surprisingly, is rare in bustling cities these days). On-demand service via the in-room ipad was also very helpful. F&B: Great room service with fast turnaround and great quality food. We even tried the restaurant Le Coucou NYC which was excellent. Location: A++; doesn’t get any better. In the heart of Soho, but located on a cross-street, so much calmer, with great exit opps through Lafayette and Centre St. All the above at an affordable price relative to other hotels in the neighborhood. I highly recommend 11 Howard; we ended up cancelling our other hotel reservation and extending our stay for an extra 4 nights there.

title: Great stay
text: When we first arrived, we were thrown a bit by the lack of reception desk. We were greeted by a trendy looking person with an iPad that checked us in promptly and politely. When we expressed concern about street noise, immediately our room was switched to one of the highest floors. Very nice, clean rooms with all the right appointments. All in all, a perfect stay in our favorite part of NYC.

title: Decoración y atención exquisita
text: Muy bien situado en el corazón del soho pero en una zona tranquila. Un interiorismo maravillosa y cómodo. Las camas muy cómodas. Personal muy atento. Tranquilo, en ningún momento Oimos ruido de ninguna habitacion. La habitación cuádruple (familiar) las camas un poco justas.

title: Very
text: Minimalistic and modern hotel, fast and easy check in, rooms small but nice, since its a part of SPG and as a Platinum holder i did expect some recognition but they didnt recognize me as a Platinum member ...

title: Great hotel & service
text:
This hotel by far exceeded our expectations! The rooms were so clean and the staff (specifically Christian) is so helpful! They really go the extra mile to make your stay a pleasant experience. 

Great location!

*Note that the hotel bar closes to hotel guests at 11 and turns into a night club.

title: New York attitude destroyed a lovely family reunion...thanks for nothing 11 Howard
text:
I am originally from New York, and always look forward to returning on business since I don't live here anymore.  However, it is always a challenge looking for lodging here, as you never know what you;re going to get in the same hotel - and I continually try out new places as there are so many choices, 
This place looked promising as it came up at a fair price on a website and appears to be offering what appears to be a promotional rate.  
The location is nice, being near subways, Little Italy, and SoHo.  
The door people and staff are well trained and polite.
However, first bad thing - my brother is visiting me, and I requested two beds well in advance, but I didn't get what I asked for, and there are no rollaways, no couch, no way to not sleep in the same bed, and thus we are sharing a bed, something I haven't done since we were kids. 
Second bad thing is that I tried to check in early and I sat in the library, a second floor common room which is quite nice, and I asked them to inform me when my room was ready and.....they forgot.  So I sat around for three hours, one of them unnecessarily since my room was ready which I was sitting around.  
THe bump in the road after that was that they hadn't brought my luggage to the room either, so there's that. 
However, I was ready to forgive all that because everyone here is so nice but - there's an additional part to this narrative that is a failure of the hotel that ruined my trip.  Call me sensitive, but I guess I'm not used to being insulted my a hotel., 

Specifically, this evening, I  had a lovely meal outin the neighborhood with my brother, and part of the hotel experience that is advertised by 11 Howard in its promotional literature  is that there is a trendy bar attached, called "The Blond", and which I was looking forward to as part of closing out the evening visit with my brother. 
Except, when we waited at the velvet ropes, hello, the bouncers didn't even bother to look up at me. 
Now, I know I'm just a simple person from a small provincial town (San Francisco) and not trendy or important  (I manage money)  and was just looking for a night cap at a trendy new york bar that's attached to the hotel who was refused service but the bar is advertised in all of the hotel literature as being an amenity of the hotel, which makes it downright deceptive and fraudulent. Perhaps discriminatory too, since I'm an old person who is a member of a racial minority,
It's insulting to all guests if the hotel is good enough to take your money but not gracious enough to let you in for a drink. 
My company has offices in NYC and I'm responsible for a budget and a staff who does business here regularly, but this is on my "NOT RECOMMENDED" list - how can a hotel insult its guests in this manner?  It's inexcusable, embarrassed me in front of my brother, and ruined my stay,
I'm fuming as I write this but this place gets what it deserves. 
I'm being generous by giving it two stars, since the water in the shower is hot and the sheets are clean. 
Oh, and the gym?  A joke.  My home gym is better equipped.  Don't believe everything you read.
Lesson learned.
Thanks for the education in how NOT to treat your guests, 11 Howard.

title: Minimalist and disappointed
text:
On arrival the taxi stopped outside the hotel and we were met by a very large puddle and a smelly drain, and the area does not look as plush/upmarket which was a worry.

Now this hotel does not have a traditional reception desk and this can cause an issue, a round desk with tablets and this caused confusion.  On check in I was given the wrong room due to trying to check in customers too quickly, and not being able to clearly see who is with whom.  On check out they still had not cleared the account of the last gentlemen that had checked out, and had to make me wait whilst they ran after him. Water is available in reception to take on your days out. A tablet is ion the room to make calls and order room service etc.

Room 310 is a double bedded room and has very little space between the end of the beds and the table.  I bruised my legs 7 times in 3 days.  My very slim daughter also banged her knees due to lack of space. No tea facilities in the room, and although the hotel has room service expect high end 5 star prices.  The hotel bar closes early as it becomes a night club and in room 310 you could hear the music in the bathroom and the heavy vibration from the early subway trains which lessens but continues throughout the day.  Lovely robes and toiletries in the room and it was clean.  The room does not have enough electrical sockets, 2 only and these are located in the alarm clock. The room on arrival was quite dark and the staff member was not aware that all lights have a separate dimmer switch.

The hotel is located with an easy 10 minute walk to Little Italy that has some great Italian restaurants that have sensible and lower than average prices. 

The staff were friendly and helpful, but when I moved to another 5 star hotel I then realised how much work the Howard need to take on board to improve and provide value for money. as the Howard was more expensive and delivered less than some other great 5 star options. On the last day the fire alarm was on test for over 2 hours with flashing lights and we only got a letter to advise after it had happened and after a tanoy announcement. Hopefully the check in and other issues will be resolved as this is early days for a new hotel, and a reduction in prices due to lack of facilities.

title: Minimalist and a bit different
text: Booked with Starwood points for a wedding, this brand new hotel (April 1 opening) is not your typical hotel. For starters, there is no check-in desk, just a round table with a staff member holding a tablet. Very stark, hard look to the lobby, the chairs/stools are literally granite. But it's NYC, so it's cool. The staff at the door and check in were friendly, welcoming and attentive, so perfect on that score. The room was good, decent size with a nice bathroom. We had breakfast in the "Library" which was a bit strange, as it's more like a study and a wait staff takes your order. Took long to get the food, and it was hotel priced (a bit $$), but was very good. I don't mind overpriced hotel food when it's prepared as well as this breakfast was. The only beef I had was that the windows weren't soundproofed enough to block out the constant honking and sirens on Canal Street. But it is a "cool" look, the staff was outstanding and it was a great location for us. Oh, and the two fitness rooms are very small but top of the line Cybex machines and Hampton dumbbells. Plus a small yoga room. I was happy. Still, I was jealous of the view my son had at the Sheraton Tribeca where we booked him.

title: Elegantly minimalist with superb service
text: First impression when we arrived near midnight on a summer Tuesday: where's the lobby?  It's so minimalist, we didn't know we were in it:)  The very welcoming young hip valet checked us in on his iPad and we whisked up to our room.  It was modern, minimalist and nearly roomy.  The bathroom was larger then we expected and sported sleek brass fixtures - brass is back!  Rustic chic 'logs' served as side tables, however my side lacked an outlet so I either abandoned my phone waaay over on the desk or ran down the battery having it close to me.  The concierge level provides an elegant subdued retreat from the bustle of the city and it was always stocked with newspapers and lovely orange scented water.  Apparently they offer breakfast too, but I never partake.  The location is super if you're into SoHo/West Village like we are.  Down Lafayette a few blocks and you'll find some of NYC's best restaurants.  The real hit however, was the super service.  We aren't exactly chic: I'm 54 and my husband's disability lead us to use a scooter.  The hotel staff couldn't be more accommodating: helping us push the thing when its juice ran out and storing it plugged in overnight before we figured out we could actually fit it in our room.  All that from these young hip beautiful people who didn't make us feel old:)  We ended up extending our stay because we just couldn't leave NYC, in no small part to our fantastic experience at the hotel.

title: great atmosphere
text: loved the style and the atmosphere of the hotel. Rooms are extremely tastefully done, very bright and quite. The management and staff was excellent  always friendly and very helpful. Can't wait to go back!!

title: You should stay at 11 Howard!!
text:
My husband and I visited New York City for a dual purpose...my 40th birthday and a mutual work trip.  We found the property by way of our Starwood Ambassador.  
    I give 11 Howard the highest ranking for Hotels, especially in the City. There are many choices to stay in SoHo, but this is by far one of THE BEST!!  I normally have some kind of constructive criticism to offer as a suggestion, but in this case I find nothing to make better.  The Hotel fit our needs perfectly.  From the moment we checked in until after our stay, the staff went ABOVE AND BEYOND to make sure we were happy.  From remembering our name each time we walked through the Lobby or the Library, they certainly made us feel special; as if we were the only VIP's in the Hotel, even though I knew the Hotel was quite busy.   Brian at Reception is a STAR, hands down!!  Seamless, personable, and just plain kind, whether we saw him passing on the street or in the Reception area, he always had time for us.  Jessica and Will at Reception also handled our needs very well, and always had time to make sure our stay was going well.  Fannie was also quite fun...I looked forward to her dazzling smile every time I came through.  Michael was also a true professional, handling the staff up front with ease and kindness.  Quite an accommodating crew at Reception!!  There were also a few other faces that I didn't get their names, but it was a friendly team for sure.
   We had lunch and a quick drink at the Library, and were again impressed by their speed and professionalism.  Santiago took excellent care of us, and was always charming and pleasant, each day remembering our names effortlessly.  In the evening, we brought back a few work colleagues for a drink at Blond, and Roxy took great care our needy group as well.
   Last, but CERTAINLY not least, the General Manager Anis....OUTSTANDING does not even come close to articulating how well this man interacts and leads his staff.  A true and born leader, Anis was there to oversee it all, and you could feel and see the respect his team has for Anis and their property.  Since we travel so much for work and pleasure,  it was refreshing to see the sense of pride the 11 Howard staff had for their jobs and management.  Anis was kind, helpful, and made sure he personally interacted with as many employees and guests as he could while we visited.  We felt like royalty!! Other Executive Management should take a page (or three) from this man's book on Leadership.  Thank you, Anis.
    I will be recommending many future guests to stay at 11 Howard.  The staff and Anis are true assets to the Company and to the SPG program.  Future travelers will be amazed at the Service levels at the Hotel.  Do yourself a favor and let the staff give you a little History of the Hotel.  Thank you from the bottom of my heart for a fantastic week at 11 Howard!!  The service is extraordinary!! We will return and bring friends...

title: Snabb och hjälpsam personal, bra läge och fina rum!
text: Jag boode här endast 2 nätter men är ändå jättenöjd med dessa. Det blev någon miss när vi anlände då något namn hade missats, men det ordnade personalen snabbt medan vi fick oss ett glas i hotellbaren. De vägde helt klart upp för missen i början. Älskade rummet, frukosten (trots att jag är vegan) samt den fina baren!

title: 11 Howard - The VERY BEST of NYC!
text:
From the moment my niece and I walked into 11 Howard, we had a feeling it would be special! We were met with elegance, and were instantly greeted with kind, friendly faces. 

It was wonderful to be welcomed back each day by the beautiful people of 11 Howard - Rob, Will, Michael, and Zina. Michael was incredibly friendly and made us feel at home, Zina directed us to some of the most incredible culinary experiences, Rob searched tirelessly for a taxi for us, and Will was happy to help us at all times!

Everyone there - including the housekeeping and wait staff - was willing to go above and beyond - and was always beaming happiness. The food is marvelous and the library is a delightful retreat.  There is no other place to stay in New York except 11 Howard. New York City at its most beautiful, dynamic and inviting...

title: Dumb and dumber
text:
Toured the hotel today. The least appealing and coldest looking place I have booked. 
Called to cancel reservation. Instead, I received a confirmation of the res I wanted to cancel. Called back and woman on the line said it was "an honest mistake".this would have cost me more than $300.00 if I was not reacting carefully.

title: personalization
text: hard to believe that an x-Holiday Inn can be transformed into an oasis in NYC - but it has. Fantastic property, great room, the GM, Anis Khoury, is the BEST - frankly i feel is has a twin working here - he is every where. my new hotel in NYC.

title: First and last time
text: Where to start. Well, stayed in 413 and woke up at 1.30 am and realized that my room was just above a nightclub that went all out to 3 am. So very little sleep that night. Next day asked to move, and after threatening to cancel rest of the stay the suddenly were able to accommodate my request. Went to the acclaimed "state of the art" gym, which consisted of 3 cardio and some dumbbells in 2 hotel rooms, where you could not have 2 people training at the same time as we would not fit. The fridge contained no water, actually no water whatsoever in the gym. The alarm in my room went off in the middle of the nigh, and I was in three rooms and none of the clocks were set at the correct time. Funny example of the lack of detail at this hotel. Put my laundry bag on the bed, with filled out form, as I normally do during my 100 hotel night a year, but for the first time ever, they did not take the laundry, so it was still in the plastic bag when I got home late at night and really needed the clothes the next day. Rooms are super spartan and a bit hostel like in its feel with better quality. The most positive thing is the staff, they are really friendly and trying their best, but honestly - I spend 1/3 of my life in a hotel and this was a truly interesting experience that I will forever avoid and I chose this hotel as I love trying new ones and this is a bit like "the emperors new clothes" type of hotel. New York has so many great hotels, this is not one of them.

title: New minimalist hotel in great location
text:
PROS:
- Clean, new, minimalist rooms
- Excellent internet speed (complimentary), fast enough to download movies or stream audio
- Great location - lots of good places nearby to eat and visit
- Very friendly service - attendants were always smiling, Brian at the front desk was particularly helpful and provided some good recommendations on nearby places to eat and get coffee
- Modern tech in room (e.g., the tablet, big TV, fast internet)
- I REALLY liked that you can use the room tablet to schedule housekeeping whenever you want.  Can't believe more hotels aren't doing this.  Seems like a no-brainer.  
- Awesome charging dock (charges four devices at once) and doubles as an alarm clock. 
- Almost ZERO hallway noise
- The food/coffee options nearby were excellent (highly recommend a place across the street called Smile).  Unfortunately there is no coffeemaker in the room.
- Excellent water pressure in the shower

CONS:
- The A/C unit is loud.  Woke me up at night when it turned on; and when it's on you need to raise the TV volume
- Very small bathroom -- primarily because the door opens into the bathroom.  
- The shower leaks onto the floor because they have adopted one of those European "half a window to cover half the bath" things that only cover half the bathtub.  Less tacky and more sanitary than a curtain, but less effective.
- Poor views from the room, but that's the norm in NYC
- Shampoos and body washes were too small, which is consistent with the trend in most hotels now 
- No door stop on the wall next to the front door, so front door hits the wall when it opens
- Library is a little bit of a wasted opportunity.  Should be more pods/tables for individuals to work from.  Probably would be a good place to add a coffee shop, too.  

Overall, I really liked it and will definitely return.

title: Very quiet, well located SoHo Hotel
text:
We had some errands in SoHo so decided to forgo the midtown shuffle and instead stay at 11 Howard.  Very laid back staff, super friendly, with a very minimalist feel.  It lacks (thankfully) the thumping of the W Hotels.  Bed was very comfortable, great shower and product, with a very nice vibe.  

We were in a King Deluxe - slightly larger room with an odd table/sofa/chair setup.  Closets/storage is limited if you are staying for more than a couple of days.  We discovered the library on the second day -- quiet area with complementary coffee and a fair amount of seating.  

After the stay we received the now customary "thank you for staying with us".  The difference is that the response was from the hotel manager who was not just following form.  Nice outreach -- likely will return for a longer stay.  

BTW, lots to do in the area that is unique and not formulaic.

title: Modern Zen in Nolita
text: Wow - Anda Adrei has designed the perfect boutique hotel experience. From the moment I arrived at the 11 Howard, I knew I was in for a treat. The staff was eager to assist and ready before I realized I even needed any help :) The ambiance is totally modern zen and it made for one of the most pleasant hotel stays I have had in a while. The entire look and feel says "chill" but the furniture and fixtures are totally sophisticated luxury. I had a small room but hey, its NYC. The concierge floor makes up for it and is very accessible. The bar is a modernists dream. Incredible eats for my plant based diet abound in the area. An incredible stay. I will be back!

title: Best hotel in soho!!!
text: I was looking forward to the opening of this hotel ever since I heard about about a year ago. I've stayed there twice in the last 2 months and both times have not disappointed. I'm a hotel snob due extensive traveling and this hotel is comparable to some of the best. From the design (brass hardware) to the service (very attentive and quick) I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Amazing
text: Stayed at 11H for the fourth  time since the opening in April. Amazing as usual. The staff is wonderful and always friendly. The room service and maid service is always quick and responsive. The second floor library is a great spot to hang out for drinks or to catch up with friends.

title: Love 11 Howard!
text:
I got a chance to stay here with my fiancé during the opening month. An unexpected little treasure nicely situated between Chinatown/Little Italy and Soho. Also very close to lots of trains. I am from NYC so staying in the city is a treat usually saved for a special occasion. The staff here were super nice and we got a chance to meet one of the managers, Marc, I think, when we were checking in which was fast and easy. He looked like he was on his way somewhere, but he took the time to show us to our room and give us a mini tour before he was on his way. So nice!

The room was nice and intimate with fragrant organic amenities and a tablet to do (almost) everything! We were able to order snacks from room service and even get a chance to decide when we wanted it to be delivered! You can call housekeeping from there and request whatever you need! They also had a phone in the room so you could call direct just in case. We also found out there was a parking lot on Elizabeth street where you could park your car (for a fee), but if you do get to park there through the hotel, they can even pick it up for you! I'm also a sucker for robes so I loved the spa robes and they even had hoods! The bed was super comfy and the towels were plush.

One of the days we were there, it was a bit rainy so we were able to get an umbrella from the front desk before we went out. They also have their own private bar area which we didn't get to because we're not really drinkers, but it's nice to have access to something exclusive ;) 

Overall 11 Howard is in a great location with great staff and great rooms! I would definitely come back here! :)

title: NOW I KNOW WHAT CANNED SARDINES FEEL LIKE!
text: Not wanting to stay in a large hotel in uptown Manhattan, we decided to stay at this "boutique" hotel in Soho.  Big mistake.  Though it was bright and sunny outside when we arrived, we entered a dark lobby that was depressing as hell.  The staff was nice and courteous, but nothing could prepare us for our room.  The room was too small for one guest, let alone a couple.  What the hell were they thinking? I'm quite familiar with "New York small", but this was ridiculous! The space between the edge of our bed and the dresser would only fit our medium size suitcase ONLY if we turned it sideways.  The room was truly claustrophobic.  And though we were up on the 6th floor, forget about getting any sleep whatsoever.  Sirens blaring so loudly throughout the entire night.  I guess the hotel never heard of insulation.  I cannot warn you enough to stay away from this place.  While the location was good, this had to be one of the worst hotels I have EVER stayed.  This wasn't a trendy hip hotel, but a glorified can of sardines!!

title: Classy, chic and bang on trend
text:
Three Brits abroad....one 69 year old (about to turn 70!) and 2 x 40 somethings stayed in this rather classy hotel. The place is so trendy, they don't actually have a reception. The reception IS the staff carrying their mini ipads around with them!

The staff are very helpful and cheerful. The rooms are small but perfectly formed. Everything is clean and fresh. The towels, pillows, bedding are perfect. So comfortable. One of the best nights sleep I have had away from home. You have to request an ironing board and iron but that's OK. We did blow the electrics by drying hair and ironing at the same time but this was sorted out very quickly.

The breakfast is excellent. Not the massive heavy fry up but light and healthy. Granola, yoghurt, fresh fruit salad, pastries, selection of teas and coffee. Everything was very fresh and tasted sublime.

The location is brilliant- near Little Italy and China Town. Near the metro. A very trendy part of the New York.

When the staff found out we were celebrating a 70th, they were really sweet and put a few nibbles and drinks out in the room with a lovely little note- very thoughtful.

The only downside is that there is no where in the hotel to have a quiet drink in the evening if you don't want to go outside. The bar area in the hotel is used by the nightclub next door. (You can't hear it from your rooms.)

Our 69 year old found the staff uniform rather upsetting as their trousers did not meet the floor. Once we explained that this was the trendy thing to do (show your ankles off), she seemed a little more accepting.

On the whole, I would whole heartedly recommended this little bit of luxury in a beautiful clean and comfy and trendy hotel! Just hope we get to go back again some day.

title: Hip, Calm and Inviting Newcomer in Exciting area
text:
11 Howard is a very welcome addition to New York City's vibrant hotel scene.  11 Howard strives for its rightful place as an ultra hip anchor in NoLiTa but it delivers its modernity with warmth and calm. 

My room felt light and airy although by square feet it was not a large space   - full disclosure I used points from a hotel loyalty program to reserve this room - the sense of well used space is a testament both to the design and the color palette. The hotel's general decor runs toward minimalist, even Danish Modern, but it is very functional and integrated well with technology. The materials and color scheme evoke calm and tranquility and present a pleasant contest to the intense urban life all around. 

SoHo, the East Village, Chinatown, NoLiTa, Little Italy, the Lower East Side, Greenwich Village, city hall, are all within a short walk giving this hotel's location a great advantage over so many other downtown competitors. There are numerous worlds to explore just outside 11 Howard's door - from early morning to, well, early morning.  And if you enjoy a bit of extra sophistication for your occasion, 11 Howard's bar/club known as the blonde, has a very attractive crowd and ambiance. 

All in all, a very well conceived and well executed hotel in a modern and inviting style.

title: Very nice stay
text: Recently spent 2 nights here and enjoyed our stay. We booked the king senior and even though I thought the room size was a bit small, the room was very clean, bed very comfortable and the look modern and chic. The location was perfect as you can walk to all the Soho shops on Broadway/Prince/Broome, etc yet be on a quiet street away from the noise. Service was professional & friendly.

title: Absolute perfection
text:
11 Howard has to be the best hotel I have ever stayed in! I constantly get moved from hotel to hotel with work but I can safely say this was my favourite by far. 

The staff were very friendly, extremely helpful and a pleasure to be around. The Hotel itself is absolutely stunning, amazing rooms with beautiful interiors (this is coming from an interior designer) and have everything you could want including a very trendy bar (the blonde) below the hotel. 

Location is excellent, with short walks to everything you really need plus, being in Soho is a fab area to be in. 

I would HIGHLY recommend coming to 11 Howard and guarantee you will have a great stay. Will actually be going back on Wednesday and can't wait.

title: Отличный отель, очень удачное расположение
text: Отель оформлен со вкусом, лаконичный современный дизайн. Завтрак неплохой, хотя и без изысков (йогурт, фрукты, мюсли, выпечка). Номера небольшие, но есть все необходимое. Халаты и тапочки можно попросить на рецепшн, дают бесплатно. Мешает уличный шум (как и везде на Манхэттене - движение тут оживленное и днем и ночью, а про многослойные стеклопакеты никто и слыхом не слыхивал - все окна с обычными одинарными стеклами), поэтому сразу просите самый тихий номер, этажом повыше. Отель расположен идеально - на границе Чайнатауна и Маленькой Италии, колоритных районов с кучей ресторанчиков. Буквально в 100-200 метрах от отеля метро Canal Street, также рядом исторический район Сохо с интересной "чугунной" архитектурой. В то же время до Даунтауна и его многочисленных достопримечательностей можно дойти пешком минут за 20 - там и мемориал Ground Zero (на месте разрушенных башен-близнецов), и Уолл-стрит, и Баттери-парк, откуда отплывают кораблики к статуе Свободы. Персонал очень приветливый, есть русскоговорящие сотрудники. В отеле симпатичный бар, который после 10 вечера превращается в ночной клуб с фейс-контролем (правда, без танцев).

title: Perfection!
text: I've had the honor to spend a couple of nights on various occasions at the 11 Howard. It's reminiscent of a full-service apartment building without having to know your neighbours. The staff goes above and beyond from the moment you check-in. The timeless decor of the rooms will help this place stand the test of time. They have an unusual minibar program where you order snacks on demand. If you're a person like myself who snacks at odd hours, they will fill your room with any requested items before your arrival.

title: 'Everything you need - except plug sockets, unwanted entry at midnight to your room ....'
text:
Having recently stayed at and reviewed the much lauded, The Conservatorium in Amsterdam which is big on design but impractical as far as the hotel room experience is concerned, i should have known better than to book the recently reopened 11Howard, which I read about in the London Press shortly before booking a brief trip to New York City. 

On arrival, I was most disappointed to learn that the lady who welcomed me couldn't find my reservation, asking if perhaps if it had been booked ion another name??? I advised her, that i had pre checked in and as if by magic she found me and gave me my keys to my room on the 11th Floor.

The room is small, even by New York standards and considering that I had especially emailed the General Manager ahead of my arrival, I was, I must confess not impressed.  The decor is nice and clean and contemporary but is not amazing.  The bathroom is a decent size with lovely fittings and a good spacious shower, but i still have a problem with the toilet and shower being in the same room in a luxury hotel - at least at The Conservatorium they have got that right.

I couldn't be bothered to complain so after dinner locally, decided to have an early night.  Imagine then my horror when at 12:15 i was awoken twice by someone using a master key to enter my room, the first occasion allegedly a mistake and the second because my door was apparently open? Suffice to say, I didn't go back to sleep.

Despite being allocated a high floor the room was extremely badly sound proofed and i spent most of the night being woken by banging doors in adjacent rooms or the noise from the street below.  This is New York but a good nights sleep should be the least new hotels can offer in this day and age - comfort over design and all that. 

Whilst the interior of the Library is welcoming and in keeping with the Scandic theme, another thing that has been sorely overlooked by the design team is a lack of plug sockets for electric toothbrushes snd laptop computers, both of which i never leave home without.  You shouldn't have to hear the noise of fellow guests making out next door either.

The place is well situated but alas needs some serious work to address the basics and whilst i endorse the concept of conscious hospitality, there is no excuse for any of the shortcomings i experienced during my recent stay so it is highly unlikely that ai will return.

title: Great location!  Friendly, helpful staff
text: I stayed at 11 Howard two nights in May 2016.  Aside from one minor service gaff - which the hotel took care of - I highly recommend this beautiful and ideally situated hotel!  The physical space - rooms, library, entry lobby - are all beautiful with many subtle details that set this hotel apart from a W or a JW Marriott, such as the leather wrapped handles on the entry doors.  The staff was young, and eager to please, always there to open a door, hail a cab or ask if you were being helped. The rooms are small - but, hey, this is a NY hotel - but are attractive with clean lines and light wood interiors.  Bed was very comfortable!  The workout area is split it into three small rooms on the 3rd floor - one each for yoga, weights and aerobic exercise.  Each room is very small, so if you would like to get a real workout in, probably better to just go for a run outside.  Also, the aerobic room had two treadmills and one elliptical machine, but no stationery bike and the room barely has space for these three side-by-side.  The weight room was essentially a rack of dumbbells and one weight bench, nothing else.  The minor service gaff I mentioned was due to a recent change in policy from offering complimentary conti breakfast in the library to a "charge to your room" policy.  When I entered the library, I was told it was complimentary, only to have another employee rush up to me when I left to ask me my room number, so I could be charged.  The staff downstairs removed the breakfast charge from my bill, when I mentioned it to them.  Overall, I highly recommend this hotel!

title: Newly Opened Hotel - Great Spot
text: This is a gut renovation of a prior hotel. They did a beautiful job. Lobby and Common area "Library" are beautiful.  Staff is just great. New restaurant is about to open a great club called The Blond is attached.

title: beautiful design & friendly staff
text: The decor of the hotel is beautiful. Its very clean and complimentary breakfast is delicious. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Everything was great except for the subway running underneath and causing the building to tremble. The gym was a bit disappointing because of it's size and few machines.

title: Really Loved This Place
text: I'm going to keep this clean and to the point - just like the 11 Howard. The design and service are exceptional. The location works really well for me. You feel in the midst of everything downtown has to offer and yet even cooler.  Kind of like where the people in the know would go. One of my favorite elements was the dining area - not the main bar, but the place you'd go to have a glass of rose or the best coffee in NYC (La Colombe - I think) and some collective peace and quiet.  Truly the welcoming crew and the service at this little enclave were exceptional!

title: Great little Boutique Hotel!
text: Staying here for a couple of nights for work. 12 minutes from my favorite Chinese Restaurant!! The rooms are not a bit small but very nice. The bed and pillows slept great! The HVAC was very responsive and kept me comfortable. This is usually not the case in older or remodeled hotels. This one is very nice!! I recommend!

title: Excellent Boutique Hotel
text: Great location in Soho, outstanding design, very comfortable room and on top on it all, the friendliest staff.... I recommend 11 Howard you will definitely want to come back again and again. My new favourite hotel in NYC

title: Hip boutique hotel in a very cool area
text:
I stayed here for three nights along with my two nieces. We shared a double room , which to be honest was a tad small for three ladies, but was beautifully appointed, and the beds and the pillows were extremely comfortable. The wardrobe space was a little small, even if there are only two guests, but the condiments and the towels in the bathroom were excellent. The hotel is staffed by possibly the most pleasant and helpful people in New York, nothing was too much trouble. We were a little disappointed that the bar became part of the nightclub at night, as we would have liked a nightcap, but the receptionist recommended the Ship Bar which was just around the corner, and I too 
can recommend it highly. The hotel was convenient for the subway and within walking distance of lots of restaurants.
A big plus is the complimentary breakfast, fresh fruit and yoghurt, croissants and different breads, tea and coffee. We also discovered, on the last day, that we could have freshly squeezed juice and cappuccino on request. Maybe next time.

title: It is good to feel welcome
text:
What a great experience! The 11 Howard is one of the few hotels where you feel genuinely welcome. The staff is purely amazing, the ambiance is great (the breakfast in the lounge in the morning is perfect to remember the great time you had at the bar the night before :-)
The hotel is very well furnished and decorated, ideally located, Soho, Tribeca, China Town and Little Italy are just a few block away.
I find this hotel perfect for business, but I would not hesitate to come for leisure.

title: Excellent Experience! Highly Recommend!
text: From the moment we entered the lobby, we knew we were someplace special. The staff is exceptional. The rooms are beautifully appointed. The Library serves terrific food and drink. The location is central to shops and restaurants. I had a friend stay for a month while doing business in NYC -  he raved about the staff and amenities. So glad he recommended 11 Howard, we will be back on our next trip!

title: SPG Beware...
text:
I booked through the Starwood website and really didn't know what I was getting myself into, so if you're Platinum and expecting your typical upgrades and considerations you're out of luck. There was a corner suite available and they insisted on charging $200 for the upgrade. So I'm in a shoe box of a room that has the decor from Ikea. And the bathroom can't even fit 2 people. 
Service was real personable, but lacked a professionalism to deal with the upgrade dispute. And when I had to wait for the room to be ready (after 3pm guaranteed checkin) they (Mark or Mike) didn't even offer wine or champagne etc. Just basic courtesy that was a lost opportunity.
Anis, I know you're doing a good job reading and responding to reviews, but by the time you're reading this I'll be long gone and wouldn't return based on the small rooms, lack of luxury, and lack of SPG benefits. 
I even called the hotel before I booked the reservation to confirm privileges and was assured there were no limitations. Nor could I see any on your website.
Mark had every opportunity to make sure I'd be happy after escalating to him and rave about this place on social media, seems like an easy opportunity lost.
Stay at a W for less money, larger rooms, and VIP service.

title: Fantastic service and awesome staff
text: I have had the opportunity to stay a few times at this hotel. The staff could not be more helpful and make a sincere attempt to know their guests. Rooms are bright and have very light feel to them when combined with high ceilings it makes sometimes small rooms feel more spacious. The burger is fantastic and fries are over the top.

title: Modern and Chic
text:
We had a great sleep over on this new and edgy hotel, it has been open for one month and is getting known as one of the must go hotel when in New York. 

Has a very good library on the second floor, a comfy and well decorated place to have a coffee or simply take a seat.

title: Best New Place in Soho
text: 11Howard is not only the latest trendy soho hotel ... Is it also a peaceful and relaxing place to spend some good time (in the library or at the bar depending on your mood) after a crazy day in the city ! Accommodation is superb and staff is incredible.

title: Cool, Sophisticated new hotel in the best area of NYC
text:
11 howard is brand new, although you can clearly see they are run by people in the business for a longtime. From the understated entrance (no formal reception) to the amazing clean but luxurious aesthetics, the hotel is super cool.
Having breakfast at the Library feels like your weekend home in the country... not to mention the great art and books around. The staff as well is super friendly (I didn't get to open the entry door once) and very efficient.

title: Relaxed vibe, beautiful ambience, helpful and cool staff
text: Great location in Soho. Very cool ambience and beautiful decorated hotel. Sweet and helpful staff. Rooms are fairly spacious with beautiful interior. Roomservice is great and fast. The tablet in your room where you can order everything from is super. Breakfast is not overwhelming, but fine. The bar The Blond is amazing. And you can buy beautiful home decor in the boutique Studio Oliver Gustav inside the hotel. The Library room is a great room to work and enjoy a snack or coffee.

title: Emperor's new clothes
text:
I travel a lot and was very excited to stay here. But I have been very disappointed. Yes it's trendy and well appointed (yawn) , but honestly nothing special. And the culotte-clad staff were rubbish - they have sadly ruined what should have been a fantastic getaway. 

As for the TA 5* reviews...I'm glad - but totally flummoxed! - that other reviewers have had a better experience...(?!?)

title: Hip but Friendly
text: We stayed at 11 Howard after it had only been open for four weeks. The staff were incredibly friendly and accommodating. Some places like this try to be too cool, especially in that neighborhood. And sometimes, part of being cool is being cold or standoffish. Not at all here. Really nice bar where we had a very friendly waitress. Really nice staff all around. The rooms are small but nicely appointed, and the bed was very comfortable.

title: Must Stay Here!
text: This hotel has a new and fresh vibe.  Cool, hip, quiet, and comfortable.  The decor is stunningly minimilsitc with quality pops of detail.  The service was wonderful.  Loved the use of an iPad in the room to order everything from room service, to housekeeping etc.  Very easy to use.

title: chic boutique
text: Quite unexpectedly we found the nicest staff in new york city here.  it's a wonderful, chic boutique hotel -- rooms were small but loved the public spaces especially the breakfast room which was very well designed.

title: Suprised!
text:
As the title suggested, I was happily surprised at how much I enjoyed this hotel.

I stay in the city for special occasions and it's usually at a more typical luxury hotel.

That's why coming here for a new small hotel I wasn't really expecting much.

I was blown away by the finishes of the rooms and the fact that a tablet controls everything. You can schedule what time you want room service or turn down service. That was super convenient.

Everyone I met in the hotel was very nice and welcoming. 

The location was great for me being just down the block from the Q train.

I would definitely stay here again and I recommend it if you like brand new finishes and technology.

title: Expected more for a "5 Star"
text: Don't get me wrong, this is a nice hotel.  But expected more.  It's not luxury, but modern?  The rooms are small. Very small.  I was most disappointed with the lack of insulation in the walls between rooms.  I stay 100+ nights a year so I feel like I'm a good judge.  I could hear every word as I was in room 608 of the guests next to me.  Walking, conversation and even intimacy.  Again nice place, nice service, very nice staff.. Just not a fan of the room size and poor insulation.

title: Terrific new hotel with much style
text:
I had booked a week at the Nomo SoHo Hotel across the street but disliked it so much that I started looking for another hotel. Fortunately i didn't have to look ar at all, as right across the street was this new gem, 11 Howard. It's a very new hotel, having been opneed just a week when I checked in, but the rooms were all done and ready. 
Staff were in the ground floor lobby with iPads waiting to greet you and check you in, but oddly there are no seats so you all stand while they tap away and register you. It's  fast process though and you're then up to the room. 
The room is not large but well laid out—it actually is smaller than the room I had at NoMo SoHo, but that room could not even fit in an armchair, while the one in 11 Howard had a desk, chair and armchair. And more importantly, unlike the absurd design of Nomo SoHo where the sink is outside the bathroom (!!), the bathroom at 11 Howard is a proper one with a sink, lots of counter space, a beautiful spacious shower, etc. 
And they even provide bedroom slippers!
They have a small but well-equipped gym.

title: First Class
text: From the moment we walked in I knew it was going to be a memorable experience everything was on point ....From the reception in the lobby ...the house keeping crew ...my unbelievable coffee in the morning to an amazing cocktail in there gorgeous Bar area .....my experience was First Class

title: Can't wait to visit again!!
text: I stayed here for one night with my wife for our wedding anniversary. The staff were super friendly, welcoming and very informative. The space is amazing... from the oak wooden pillars and molding to the metal spiral staircase which will take you to the second floor where you will find the concierge desk and a relaxing lounge/library area... later we checked out the bar(The Blond) great for evening drinks, awesome design, atmosphere and great people watching. The room was top notch! tasteful brushed gold fixtures with easy earthly tones throughout. You can not beat the location! best restaurants and shopping in NYC!

title: Hotel pick of the month!
text:
I am traveling to New York on a regular basis for business and I recently decided to change my routine and give a try to this new boutique hotel in the city.. and I am so glad I did! 
+ Almost unnoticeable front desk, warm and welcoming staff make you feel you are going home more than anything else. Anis (General Manager) and his dream team are extremely helpful and truly care about giving you the best possible experience. 
+ The rooms are decorated with a casual chic Scandinavian touch,very comfortable and fully functional (incl. tablets and connected gadgets). Worth mentioning the plant-based body and bath products!
+ The lounge area (known as "The Library") is a great space to kick-off your day with a delicious breakfast, do some work or spend some time to read and relax.
+ The trendy, up-and-coming "Le Blond" is the perk of the hotel. Make sure you carve out some time to check this bar out, and enjoy some beats, drinks and light bites.
+ Last but not least, the hotel is perfectly located, in the heart of vibrant Soho, with several metro lines right around the corner.
Thank you 11 Howard - I'll be back!

title: I would live there !!!
text:
-Awesome Staff (super friendly, down to earth and gorgeaous uniforms !!!) 
-Amazing service
-Simple and timeless Scandinavian style design (I want my house to look like this hotel)
-Best location 
-The Blond @ The 11 Howard = Nicest bar I've been to in a while (Im in the bar business)
-Anis (The GM) + his staff redefined the word HOSPITALITY. Awesome work guys !!!
CANT WAIT TO BE BACK !!!

title: My dream home...!
text: I stayed with my girlfriend at 11H for a couple weeks and have the best experience ever. Where to start ? 11H is the quintessential trendy boutique hotel in NYC. Idealy located in Soho, the place is stunning, decorated with a lot of taste, feeling like it has been here for ever but at the same time like no other. The main entrance doesn't have the typical reception counter, you're greeted by the friendly staff in a modern space that makes you feel like you are entering your home building. The front desk is smartly located on the second floor in a very loungy space they call the library. The staff is the friendliest and coolest I even met, considering the place opened so recently, I wasn't expecting so much professionalism and reactivity to all our requests. I got the chance to meet the General Manager during breakfast, we was very nice to us and making sure we had everything we wanted. The rooms have everything we needed, very clean, bright, quiet and confortable (important detail: very accessible power plugs for charging phones next to beds). Last but not least, we enjoyed a few nights at le blond, the bar/club located on the second floor. The crowd and atmosphere was excellent.

title: Cool, stylish, and professional friendly staff
text: The staff was friendly and helpful. The room clean and minimal. The neighborhood feels like the old NYC...gritty and stylish. The best feature is the in-room concierge ipad with best recommendations on restaurants and bars!!! My new fav hotel!!

title: First impressions
text:
Loved the place. More smiles than the rest of NYC combined. And I'm a sucker for that sort of thing. My room was tight, but also affordable. Place was immaculate. Styling is extremely sexy, really well edited. Great uniforms, etc. 

Room service was fast and delicious. What else? Oh, bed was excellent. 

Clean, fast, accommodating, great design, awesome bed. What else is there? Oh it was worth the expense. Shopping nearby was ridiculous. C

title: Location, Location, Location!
text: Lovely new boutique hotel in fashionable and hot SoHo!.  Amazing location.  Rooms small but well designed, bathrooms nice size and good amenities.  Lovely arrival gift.  First room - bath tub wouldn't fill so moved to another room (accessible).  Only issue was that this room was close to the hot club "Blonde".  Lots of noise late at night.  Hotel allows access for guests to that club up until 11pm - then out you go!   It's invitation only and celeb sightings galore!  Nice place with lots of potential but ask for a room away from the club if you plan on getting any sleep!

title: Perfect location, friendly staff, clean, classy boutique hotel
text:
i came for a mother/daughter weekend. I'm 5 months pregnant and she's 4. I was a little worried that the hotel might not be right for us but I have to say we had the best stay!!!

The pros:
The ENTIRE staff is extremely friendly. They called my daughter by name the whole weekend and were so accommodating. They even sent us up a little treat and a sweet note wishing us well for the weekend which was so very sweet.
The hotel (is new.....) and extremely clean and very well kept. The decor is simple and calming. 
The beds are extremely comfy and the linens soft and plush
Location is AWESOME. It's on a quiet corner but just a block away in one direction to Chinatown and a block away in another direction to Soho! 
The Subway lines are RIGHT THERE. (NQR is the closest, and is about 15-20 mins to Herald Square/Times Square)
Good food options nearby
The 2nd floor "Library" space is really nice to hang out
Complimentary breakfast is tasty!
And - it is very quiet - meaning, i've stayed in many hotels in NY and i can always hear street noise - almost no matter what floor i'm on. I was on the top floor for our visit and could not hear a PEEP all night. It was SO peaceful.
We are SPG members -(Gold) they were very good about honoring SPG benefits (even though the website said it would be limited) but we got upgraded and an early check-in and late check-out - that was nice!

Cons:
The rooms are small - it's boutique! It didn't bother us, but if you're used to big hotel rooms, this is not it, the closet space is pretty tiny and not many drawers for your clothes.
The bathroom is really nice and tastefully decorated but it's a shower - no tub.

Prons (Pros or Cons depending on how you look at it!)
The staff was extremely fantastic to my kid, but... the guests are more of the soho-ish type. i.e. not that into kids...! Could have just been the weekend I was there, but a few shi-shi guests eyeballed us a bit (and i have an extremely well behaved child!) 

Overall:
I would definitely come back (and probably will). We were there 2nd week of opening, so... will be interesting to see if they can keep up appearances and friendliness in a years time - which I think everyone was extremely genuine so i have no doubt but you never know!
Being able to use points here was nice (we usually do the Westin or the W - this was a much more relaxing and quieter visit so a big plus). 

Thanks to the 11 Howard Staff for a great weekend! Good luck on your success!

title: Oasis in the heart of SoHo
text: My girlfriend and I stayed at the 11 Howard on its opening weekend. Our stay was truly great. The casual luxury vibe was comfortable, functional, and very chic. The rooms were cozy and well decorated. The tablets situated in each room allowed us to seamlessly order room service and extra pillows in late at night. The lounge (aka The Library) on the second floor is a great space to relax, do some work/ reading, and order delicious snacks like avocado toast. Anis (General Manager) and his staff at the front desk were also extremely helpful and truly cared about giving us the best possible experience. The location was perfect - in the heart of SoHo. Don't forget to have a drink at the blond, the trendy up-and-coming bar, situated in the hotel. We will definitely recommend this hotel to all of our friends and family!

title: The New Gramercy
text: If the Gramercy Park Hotel were built in 2016 it would be 11 Howard.  Rooms are crisp, service is warm, the bar is posh.  As with the original Gramercy, make sure to choose the largest room size.  Will stay again!

title: Our special place in New York
text:
11 Howard was an amazing discovery for us.. We arrived only to realize it was a matter of this hotel being open for a few days only. This stylish boutique hotel has been rediscovered and is located in a prime position which firmly encompasses the surrounding vibrancy of SOHOs little Italy and Chinatowns districts having every culinary option available within a short walk.Not to forget to mention being situated in prime shopping territory. 
The rooms are bright, fresh and our bed was probably has THE most comfortable bed I have ever slept in..
As for the staff.. I cannot overstate how impressed we were with every single staff member we had the pleasure of dealing with from their warm and engaging personalities to the excellent advice given on New York. Nothing was too much trouble! They left us with an definite WOW factor and hungry to return soon to our "Home away from home" at the other side of the planet again some time soon...

title: Absolutely Awesome!!
text:
Absolutely amazing new hotel in Soho - 11 Howard. Staying here for business for nine nights and so far, half way through I have to say I am super impressed. I feel like I have a team of people attending to every need I have with such special care and attention. The most fantastic hospitality, The service has been outstanding.

Scandinavian design with a modern twist- Rooms are nice and comfortable - Best pillows ever!! There's a nice calm atmosphere inside hotel!

I travel every week for business and I think this hotel I can safely say has been my favorite to date.
Location is also awesome!! Great Job 11 Howard! Thanks for making this trip extra special.

title: Supreme comfort, excellent and friendly staff, accessible location
text:
Never have I been so compelled to review my stay at a hotel until my experience at 11Howard (this is my first post on TripAdvisor). The only way to describe our weekend stay at 11Howard is "A+". Upon arrival, the staff immediately took care of our luggage and check-in in the hotel's simple yet elegant lobby. After our complimentary room upgrade to a King Howard, the friendly staff escorted us to our rooms. Shortly after, they delivered our bags along with complimentary bottled waters and artesian chocolates. 

On top of the absolutely stunning and comfortable room, the hotel's amenities including the "Library" which serves as the front desk/guest work area and lively bar, The Blond, were top notch. Note that The Blond is open to the public until 9/10pm when entrance becomes exclusively guest list only (hotel guests are not guaranteed).

Given that our stay happened to be over 11Howard's opening weekend, the service and overall quality of the hotel may have been at its peak. If the hotel management can continue to perform at this caliber, 11Howard will be a name to be reckoned with in the New York boutique hotel space. Definitely did not look forward to checking out.
